We were excited to have the cafe come to the neighborhood, and I think they will be a great new addition to the street. The waitstaff was nice and helpful. However, it was initially a little confusing to figure out how to place an order (the waiters bring your food out to your table after you order it at the counter). There is some room for improvement particularly with some of the dishes. Breakfast foods are either hit or miss. My husband's french toast was okay but not fantastic. I had an omelet, and was a bit disappointed that it wasn't more seasoned and flavorful. However, the home fries were good, and as others indicated I think that the food is something which will improve as they settle in (it just needs a little tweaking). I think we'll go back and maybe try out the lunch menu.

I've walked passed this place for so many months and on my last day in Philly I see someone unwrap a delicious looking wrap (can you see the shortage of words..haha!)...I just had to have it. So in the blistering cold, I walk a couple of blocks for my last lunch in Philly. WELL WORTH IT! I had the curry chicken Dosa with mango and curry chutney. It's much larger that one would expect but also extremely light...AND only $8. Highly recommend this place...must stop by if you're in philly.

Ambiance: painted in bold colors, cheery atmosphere with latin music as background. It is not too noisy, so you do not need to raise your voice. The ecuadorian ceviche  and grilled chorizo skewer were good. The main dish (grilled tilapia) was again, good, with enough herbs to make every tasty but not memorable. To be fair, I have only eaten there once and other dishes may be better Service was good, as expected. Not excellent though. I can't comment on beverages since we did not have any alcohol (it was lunch time)

The place looks great. The bucatini amatriciana was ok, but expensive for what you get. The spicy chicken was below average on presentation and taste. This was my third or fourth time here I think I will have to stop give it more chances.

Fagettaboutit! I love this pie. I tried the Sicilian first and then the regular. I loved them both but the Sicilian was my fav. The service was great and they accommodated 10 of us, 5 of whom where young children.

One of the best, if not the best halal cart I've ever had. Of course being so amazingly delicious comes with a price and in this case, it's a heart stopping, artery clogging, half a day's caloric intake per platter and that's not including the white sauce I usually drown it in! Now knowing that, you can't be eating it too often, maybe once every half a year haha. I love lamb so I usually go for that. I can't handle spicy so I don't put any on but as I said before, that white sauce is doused all over the platter! Because they have such high volumes of customers, they can't take time to put the exact amount of sauce (red or white) you want so they have a little station after you get your platter to put as little or as much of each condiment your soon to be hating you heart desires!

Had the opportunity to have a drink at Press and then dinner at Print on a very peaceful Sunday night in the city. The experience at Print was outstanding. The Farm to market concept is a huge hit, as the items on the menu were spectacular. My wife and I loved both our appetizers and entrée, and true to form the goat cheese gnocchi was amazing. The wine selection could have been a bit more impressive, but they did stick to sustainable selections.

Love Kefi. Their prices are so reasonable. They have a great vibe and their food is delicious. The mezze is a must. I could eat it all day. My only tiny complaint (and it's not even a complaint, more of a wish) is that there aren't enough vegetarian options. I love Kefi. Great neighborhood eat.
Food was kind of bland, I waited 15 minutes for my drinks. The bar and decor look amazing tho...maybe worth it if you are just going for a drink at the bar

Yesterday I went on quite a fun tour of Eataly, I wasn't quite sure what to expect but was stuffed afterwards and learned a few things.  I highly recommend if you have folks in town that you need to entertain or just want to take a few moments out of your day and pretend you're in Italy!  On the tour I found out that they have a "vegetable butcher."  You can have then chop up your vegetables, especially the ones that are a pain to cut and chop. A lot of times I visit many grocery stores in order to find the the right produce and ingredients, I've found that if I visit Eataly, I usually only have to make one store.  You can also drink a glass of wine while you grocery shop.
My husband and I drive in here regularly... from queens, just for these awesome falafels... truly one of a kind

Our favourite place in our area. Everything we've tried so far has been fantastic and the staff are always nice and responsive. Their portions are extremely good value ... try their "Nice Chicken Meatballs" sandwich! The only slight detractor is the wait time, but an average of 20minutes is always worth it.

My boyfriend and I came here for valentines day and tried Ethiopian food for the first time. The restaurant was a lot smaller than I expected but we didn't have to wait for a table. We really liked the beefless tibs and split peas. The soy tibs were a bit too spicy for me and the injera a tad bit too sour. All the food came on a big platter and we were served injera to eat with it. We were confused at how to eat it at first but we learned that Ethiopian food is eaten by taking pieces of injera and  up the food. The owner walked around and asked everyone how they were doing. All in all, it was a very good experience and we really enjoyed our dinner. Thank you!:)
They use simple ingredients to create surprisingly delicious dishes from the appetizers to the desserts. Very satisfying.

I have never felt the need to make a yelp account to write about my bad experience until my experience at this restaurant today. Every time i go, service and food gets worse. We ended up arriving at the restaurant earlier than the 45 minute wait that they told us for the pick up order.  we got to the the restaurant, the hostess asked us to wait at the bar. We go to the bar and ordered a drink and the bartender tells us to leave the bar because we are taking up space for people who are eating at the restaurant. Donald, the owner, did not care about what was going on. Worst experience ever at a restaurant.
Great pizza. Love a simple plain cheese pizza eaten fresh at the restaurant. Best in the area.
LOVE. great tea selection and lots of yummy treats!

Great to see a second authentic, modern Szechuan place (Han Dynasty being the pioneer) in Philly. More interesting ambience than Han. Nice cocktails. Haven't sampled enough of the food to say something too sweeping, but it is very good for sure! They are less open to veggie options than Han, which is a mistake!

Probably my favorite restaurant in New York.  Large, varied menu with lots of choices and everything (based on 8 years of experience ) is delicious.  I love their no reservation policy - the last few times I've been, I walked in without a wait (before 8).  Service is professional, not overly friendly.  Blue Ribbon delivers consistently.
Loved this place! The food was scrumptious, and the atmosphere had its cool going on, creative, unique and cozy. The staff was just lovely. Definitely pay a visit, it will quickly become a favorite.

Good food, fast delivery, nice staff, healthy choices, great beverages, very convenient when you're stuck at home and feel like having chinese take-out without the sickness of post chinese take-out! :-) I ordered the veggie spring rolls (very good) and the beef (seitan) fried brown rice - excellent with a carrot ginger fresh juice. My tummy was very happy! Will call again soon!
Just wanted to give this place a heads up. Ate here last night and really loved it. Friendly service  and spaghetti carbonara to die for.

took them over an hour to deliver a pannini four blocks away... im still waiting as I'm typing this... and took them about 7 to 10 mins to pick up the phone when I tried calling... I would walk right over... but I'm at work. I don't think I'll call them again. Their food is good I guess... EDIT: called at 12pm... it's now 1:20pm and I still havent eaten yet... ugh..
BEST (drunk) PIZZA EVER a late night delivery staple at trinity for 4 years. i miss it almost every time i drink a beer, which is often

Print never disappoints. The chef focuses on local produce, so the menu will change with the seasons. The bar menu needs some updates, but the selections on the restaurant menu are varied and include vegetarian options. The kale salad was great, with apples and toasted pine nuts. Also tried the duck and the pork chop, both were well seasoned and cooked perfectly.
amazing pizzaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa­aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!­!!!!!!

Fantastic service and great food! Our waitress and bus boy were extremely attentive. This restaurant definitely exceeded my expectations. The crème brulee was the best I ever had...creamy and delicious! It was a great deal as well.  Initially, the only reason why we went was because I purchased a groupon, however they won us over and we will be going back!

Came here for a friend's birthday--the staff is extremely friendly and definitely made the experience memorable.  Our waiter gave our entire table free shots of tequila (think it was 1800), and even gave a free drink to one of my friends whose meal lagged behind the others...not to mention the birthday girl, who got multiple freebies from the waiter and bartender. Ordered the chicken mole...the chicken was cooked perfectly and the mole was flavorful but in my opinion, lacked much needed spice. Would not order it again, but I would definitely go back to try something else.

Popped in early on a Saturday night and the place was already crowded. Got a table for 4, the last one available at 5:30! Service was friendly but a tad slow; we were looking for our server several times throughout the meal. One other small complaint, partially our fault, was bringing all the food we ordered (apps and entrees) out at the same time. I guess we should have specified bring the first round of food and then the second. The beer and bacon flight should be tried. The beers were a diverse tasty mix and the bacon was outstanding (peppercorn, maple, applewood smoked and jalapeno). It seems everyone gets a different experience with how the bacon is served, but ours at least was cooked perfectly (chewy-crisp - not burnt-crisp if you know what I mean). Burger sliders were delicious, as were special pork belly buns. Mussels were a special app and were kind of a miss (no bacon and they were cold when we finally got a chance to dig in). Not assertively seasoned enough. Thumbs up on the bacon, lobster mac n cheese (could have been a little more gooey for my tastes, but still solid). Corn arepa with bacon and guac was on point, as was the loaded bacon lobster roll. Bacon steak and sausage was not as much of a hit. The desserts were interesting -- a small sundae in a mason jar with bacon infused whipped cream and bread pudding with ice cream and bacon peanut brittle. I'll be back because it is a fun menu and a good overall vibe. If they can kick up the service a notch and maybe tighten up a couple of dishes, they'll move a star for sure. Definitely try it out and make up your own mind. Only 36 2 and 1 star reviews out of 221 - the odds are in your favor :)

The food here is great.  Very attentive service, sometimes I would bring a book and have lunch and would find the service a bit too attentive.  The space is small but it's not usually very busy. The lunch buffet is good and the prices are reasonable.

went there to celebrate a birthday. i ordered rack of lamb and wasn't big fan of it, so instead of sitting at the table with a sad face or complaining i start snicking food from my bf's plate, he had rodizio. oh boy, that meet was so good that i couldn't stop eating. would def recommend rodizio there!
food is very good, not so clouded, nice place to chatting. but desserts are not good.

Luzzo, thank god for you. I went in for lunch and the service was real prompt and friendly. Its a very cool little italian restaurant with a very expansive menu that I hope to continue to explore. I got the Bufala pizza and it was seriously the best Neapolitan style pie I have ever had.   Its a hole in the wall and easy to miss, I walked past it twice before I found it. If you're looking for the best, you can find it here. I cant wait to go back.

I really didn't know what to expect when I came in. I'm not a vegan or anything like that, but I was very, very impressed with what I experienced. The place is beautiful, the staff is super friendly, everyone is smiling and seems to be having a good time, and the food is delicious. I had the rotisserie chicken, mashed sweet potatoes, and kale salad and it was phenomenal. I also tried some samples of their chocolate chia pudding and their almond butter and puffed quinoa chocolate and they were both, well, to be honest, I've never had chocolate that tasted as good as that before. I swear to god they put crack in that chocolate. I will definitely be coming back next time I'm in the Union Square area. Actually, I think I might take the subway down right now and get more chocolate...
Great sevice! Excellent waiter

I LOVE this place!  I don't like the area it's in, but I love the food. Pizza is great!  Simple salad with chicken is awesome.  But my absolute favorite is their eggplant parm on a hard roll for $3!  FAT sandwich with just enough sauce to coat the bread without making it soggy and dripping wet..  Eggplant is fried to perfection and still a little crisp in the sand..excuse me sangwiche.  Wash it all down with some Foxon Park and you have got a home run. When in season, the fresh tomato pie with pesto is KILLER!  Best white clam in CT hands down.  Pane cotta is the way I like it, crisp not soggy. You all can wait in line on Wooster St, that's fine.  Not knocking their pies, but it hasn't been quite the same down there for some time...that's just my taste buds.  Judging by the long lines, there doing just fine without my $$.  All the best to them. Parking...to be honest, I pull in back and run in and out.  Never a problem unless Grand Ave is backed up or the bridge is up.

I've only eaten here twice, but this place is phenominal.  Definitely a place to bring a date.  The food is top notch and has to be eaten to be believed, the specialty cocktails are delish and the staff is always friendly and courteous.  You won't be let down.
Last night a stop in a new African food restaurant. , wow the fish tilapia was do delicious and juicy  plus is grill.. with a few lemon drops... I will go back

Tried Samba for the first time last night and it won't be the last!  It was terrific.  The setting is charming and the decoration creative and imaginative.  It's small so I would strongly recommend reservations, even during the week. The staff is attentive but not obtrusive -- a perfect middle ground. And the food -- YUM!  We tried a couple of different salads.  I had the special - spinach with fresh figs and goat cheese and it was amazing.  And they have such a light touch with salad dressing --  so great not to have a salad drowning but just enough to provide the right flavor.  We all had the shrimp and rice with yucca flour and it was really delicious.  I had read about the desserts and we loved the coconut pudding -- very flavorful. All in all, highly recommended!
The ramen is pretty good here. My main issue was that the soup was too salty for the shoyu ramen but the ramen was perfectly cooked and the gzoya were great. Nice place to eat, cash only.
SO great, have been there a few times. The staff is very friendly, the portions are big and healthy and the dessert is wonderful. Great atmosphere.

We just visited the place with my family and friends very excited to check the place which is suppose to be well known . Sorry people it is very disappointing !!! The menu is very limited for brunch like longsilog, tapsilog . the TAPA was burnt and bitter, the longanisa is not caramelized !! it is better to have the frozen one from the filipino store than what they served . Some food we order is also not recommended. The place is so small and loud but it was nice to see the design which remind us in the philippines. We would like to see a successful filipino restaurant that we can be proud of..........

Went for dinner with a group. Hands down one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. The waitress was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful. She provided recommendations that were fantastic. I had oysters and the Chilean bass. Best I've ever had. The place is pretty cool and casual. Will make sure to go back.

Let's keep this place a secret please... Awesome desserts and quaint atmosphere - meaning, not the IT place right now with $12 glass bottled waters.   Three Words:  Rose.  Petal.  Gelati.  YUM-O.   Yes, I do realize I just said the best ice cream I've had is florally flavored, but seriously, it was so delicious!  I never knew a "flower" can taste so good and refreshing!  I am contemplating of getting out of my Sunday night jammies right now just to go there for it.....

Went there last week been meaning to write this review but my account was blocked so I'm back again with newhaven insight When I walked in I was kinda disappointed  big bouncer no boos it's byob but the cover isn't bad I got there around 2-3 am some some thick but trashy looking girls then I saw wild child (Candy) I call her wild child cause the hands which she used so well she looked Hispanic from afar but I knew the second I saw her top drop I wanted a dance getting her attention was hard but finally convinced her to give me a dance first she wouldn't let me touch but after 2 songs she started getting into like I was the only guy there controlling my hands on her body over her moist thong she told me multiple times no to private dances but she finally broke paid an arm in a leg for her to go in that room with me but that's where I found her wild child side full nude vagina all in my face while her mouth did the dancing best 15 minutes ever will be coming back again late when she's there around 4 am just look for her hands you will see what I mean , it will cost you a pay check about $400 but her touch and lips make every cent worth it Will be coming back again every Friday/Saturday  she even offered some private out of club dances for frequent clients
great

The morning after a particularly rough evening out, immediate sustenance was heavily needed. Had I not been hungover or in heels, I would have run to Jimmy's Diner after my man showed me the menu. Eggy, cheesey, bacony cornbready goodness is all my body needed!! But alas, a 45 minute wait is not an option when you're on the verge of puking and/or death. So we brunched nearby, but I could not get visions of grits and tater tots out of my head. I was GOING to get Jimmy's Diner, and I was going to get it soon. As in, the following weekend. Last night I had fantasies of dragging my beau to Meatball Shop at 2AM, but NO. I stayed strong. And woke promptly at 9AM and tossed and turned until I was sure he was (slightly) awake and (somewhat) conscious before I asked, "Do youuuuu wanna go to Jimmy's Diner or get breakfast?" "Yeah," he muttered. VICTORY. I allowed about 30 minutes more of spoonage before announcing it was time to eat and rolled out of bed. Luckily, with the gross weather the wait was only five minutes, but now having experienced the gloriousness of their breakfast bowls, I will happily shrivel to death waiting for a table the next time I'm hungover. Once seated, after confirming with the waitress that the cornbread was not gluten-free, I opted for the grits and eggs bowl per the waitress's recommendation while my man went with chicken and waffles. We didn't have any issues with the server- she was as attentive as can be expected at a busy diner and perfectly pleasant. And then our food arrived, and angel's sang and then I realized I DIDN'T EVEN NEED TO ASK FOR HOT SAUCE, THERE WAS A BOTTLE OF FRANK'S SITTING ON THE TABLE ALREADY and there were rainbows and dolphins. Thank god I'm g-free, otherwise I would've pounded into those chicken and waffles because they were so goddamn beautiful. And delicious, apparently. Naturally, I subbed bacon for the sausage in my own breakfast bowl, and it was a bowl of heaven, a heaven I will dream of until I have it again. It didn't need Frank's, but I doused each bite and it was breakfast ecstasy. It was beautiful. It was magic. Next time, I'm going for the pulled pork hash. And if things go south with this man, it'll be a long, hard fight to the end because I am NOT giving up the convenience of his bed to Jimmy's Diner, not anytime soon. Obviously, I have my priorities straight.

pause: i don't know how proper food writers do it. seriously. i'm over here trying to write about a cheap dish that i'm overly familiar with, and i'm having real trouble keeping my focus. while there are other good items on the menu, i'm trying to highlight what in my opinion is super taste's best dish. the chinese style bacon (read: pork belly) and pickled cabbage pulled noodle soup (which at $5.25, can't be beat). here's the quality review i should be typing: "the erubescent broth is silky, almost unctuous in its character, and leaves a zesty spice lingering on the palate long after the bowl has been stripped clean..." here's what my first drafts looked like: "OMG YALL DIS DA BOMB!!! BEST GET U SUM!!!..." .......... on second thought, those first drafts were pretty accurate. chinese style bacon and pickled cabbage pulled noodle soup at super taste. best get u sum.
ramen is always so good. But desert is nothing special. Generally I think ippudo is one of the best ramen places in NYC, except the long line all the time.
Busy, but fun! Lots of variety!

One of the best burger places I've ever been to!  The staff is nice and the place is clean. Not only is the place clean but it looks great.  This place hasn't been here long but I hope it stays for long! I haven't tried all of the menu items but the ones I have tried taste great.  I highly recommend that you build your own burger! I would definitely come back and I hope you try it out and tell all your friends! In my opinion this is the best burger place in Clifton!

I have to admit, I go here more for the food than the beer. The burger is perfect and my mouth is watering just thinking about it. One of the best parts is the bun. The bun is highly underestimated when it comes to judging a burger. It's a little sweet just the way I like it. Overall, I would compare this burger to a better version of the oh so famous Spotted Pig burger (without all the bullshit crap on it). It tries hard to impress, but not too hard, which is a common mistake in NYC. I don't need a pound of cheese and fifty condiments on my burger. What are you trying to hide anyway? The burger at Sweet Afton is basic, straight forward and delicious. A side of pickle chips with that finger licking good sauce never hurts either. While I love the food here, I definitely think this meal is perfectly washed down with a good draft beer too. Yum!

The food was alright but I hated the service..the restaurant closing time was 9:30, and we arrived at 9:15. When we placed the order the waiter asked us to order all three courses because the kitchen was closing..ok that was understandable..but after 5 minutes it was like a flood on on our table ..all the dishes were served at the same time..to the point that we din't have any place left on ours..and had to put some on the side table...after a while they started vacuuming the place..if it was so bothersome for them then they should have told us beforehand that they could not entertain late orders..why ruin someone's evening? on top of all that they charged us $10.57 i.e. 15 % gratuity by default..all in all a very disappointing experience.

I like Fuji but I don't think the prices are justified. The chicken teriyaki is really large and has quite a bit of chicken (definitely very filling), but the serving of seaweed salad ($6.50, if I remember correctly) was probably half the size of my fist. Fresh fish, basic rolls were pretty small. I enjoyed their decorations though!

Hands down my favorite place to get a milkshake, even though I always get a plain vanilla milkshake it's just as good as the time before. I've also gotten some of the other flavors, too but always got back to just a vanilla milkshake. I love the sprinkles and the whip cream and also the cherry that makes it the best! The food is also very yummy. I have had the deep fried twinkie burger before and honestly it was the best. I also had the waffle fry sliders and they were good as well. The staff is friendly and it's a nice/cute atmosphere. Thank you for treating me right every time PYT!
Favorite place for us. The atmosphere is perfect, food is amazing and the service is impeccable. Try it for brunch!
Vegetarian Chili is awesome!!! Their challah is pretty banging too!

What a great place. As a resident of Hell's Kitchen I am so glad that finally, on a street filled with Thai restaurants, there is finally an authentic Thai restaurant that is amazing. The decor is plain, but go for the food. The papaya salad with seafood was excellent as well as the mock duck in a spicy pepper sauce. Ginger rice was a great thing I have never seen before. The food here is not like the average Thai 9th ave fair. Really impressive and I will go back again and again

Food is really really good!  We had fried wontons and salad rolls for appetizers. Salad rolls were so delicious! I had Laksa noodle pot for dinner and it was again absolutely delicious. Ginger Crust pie was perfect too. Watermelon Sangria was very refreshing. Customer service is 5 stars. Multiple servers asked us multiple times about food which shows that they really care about food quality. They use mostly organic products and most of the ingredients are made in their kitchen including the sriracha sauce. I look forward to going back and enjoy the food again!
This place is delicious! It has gorgeous decor, friendly service, and really great food. We were there for restaurant week and so got a set 3 course menu, and everything was great.

Delicious Mexican - yes, it's sort of out of the way, but the walk from the train just gives you time to work up an appetite. LOVE: - The nachos (with chorizo or dried beef) -the  fish ceviche - the sangria - the flan - the shrimp burrito (this is the size of my arm) One thing, nothing here seems particular spicy, so maybe that's why people are saying the food is bland? I find the food to be well seasoned, and if you want extra heat they have a delicious green hot sauce. The price here is EXCELLENT and the portions generous.

I love this place. Sure the service isn't perfect. The waitresses seem sorta aloof but that doesn't bother me. The food is great and my favorite time to come here is brunch. Their drinks are really tasty and strong. They offer a prixe fixe for brunch ($15). My favorite brunch meal is the steak and eggs. This is a favorite place of mine!

It could be because hurricane Irene was raging outside, and I was in the middle of a precarious drive from Montreal to Boston at the time, but I'm pretty sure that the burger I had at Our House Bistro was among the best I've ever had.  Cooked rare, as ordered (a not-so-frequent occurrence); wonderfully fatty and flavorful local beef; the ciabatta-like roll wasn't as dense or overwhelming to the texture as it looked on first impression; the frizzled leaks were a nice add-on; and the fries were perfectly crispy and golden.  I can't speak to the rest of their menu, but if I'm ever getting blown off the highway in northern Vermont again, I'll try and stop here.

There's always a wait but worth the wait! They said it was going to 20 mins but it was actually 2 mins which is very rare!!! The pork soup dumpling is beyond delicious! The eggplant with garlic sauce and white rice is a great combo. The rice cakes with chicken is really good. It's such a shame I forgot about their amazing salt and pepper fried pork!!! It's delicious!! The service is not that great but don't expect too much. At least the food comes out fast and great! They have hot pepper oil to dip all your food! This is a cash only place!
Very yummy, tasty and filling food. Only been here for Brunch and while I do love the heavy food, it would be nice if they put a salad or fruit salad on the menu.

I won't rate the coffee itself since my company roasts some but they brew it right, they really know how to pull a great shot of espresso! The food is exemplary, and the service is always with a smile. Great shop, i always stop in when I am in the neighborhood.

This place is pretty legit. I would be here all the time if I lived in NYC! The food:  I had the Camarones Cuzco which was good but pretty rich.  My boyfriend had the Lomo Saltado which looked good but I did not get a taste because he ate it too fast! I would definitely recommend the tres leches cake if you are in the mood for dessert.

The two stars for the rating doesn't reflect the quality of the food which was good, it reflects the rest of the experience. If you are going to charge $20 for a plate you need to at least not serve  your water at room temperature or serve seltzer flat ( that's the idea of seltzer it is fizzy not flat) and try serving bread instead of just rushing the food out.  Please don't suggest foie gras to vegetarians and your choice of music in the early afternoon needs to be a little more appropriate to a restaurant (you should resist the temptation to play gangster rap just because you are in Bed Stuy and have appropriated the locals motto as your name).

Simply amazing ---- Perfection. Not only was the food outstanding the staff were just as outstanding. I arrived in Philly starving and my dear friend and I were seeking a bite to eat with her daughter. As we left the airport and headed through South Philly trying to avoid traffic I whipped out my android phone tapped the YELP icon tapped the Monocle icon and presto --- there was L'Angolo 1.1 miles ahead. I ordered the special grilled Branzino, if you don't know -- it's basically sea bass from the Mediterranean region. Grilled with lemon and served on a bed of grilled, lightly charred asparagus along with grilled squid and shrimp. Drizzled with EVOO and kissed with cracked pepper I was totally excited for the first bite. My guests dinned on seafood pasta and the little one enjoyed a bowl of spaghetti and meatballs! This place is a BYOB, so we sipped water as we hardly spoke and scarfed down the food that was placed in front of us. The waiter with an accent checked in on us, the other waiter whom actually took the order -- cute as could be. If I lived in Philly still I would have asked him out for a drink! :)  Behind us sat two ladies drinking a bottle of Cab and chatting about the day, leaned over and began chatting to my friend and I. Amazing, the City of Brotherly Love does in fact have it's moments!! Not everyone is ANGRY in Filthadelphia. :0) Of course you cannot dine at a lovely little Italian restaurant that looks like something straight out of Venice, with the antique painted walls, rickets wood tables and chairs squeezed in to a petite dining space. So dessert it was! A chocolate, very rich and very delicious truffle cake served with a raspberry sauce the color of the red lipstick your grandma always wears. our second choice was something a bit lighter a lemon cream Italian cake, again speechless! Please whether you live in the area, are passing through, stop in and taste a bit of Italy tucked into the most unexpected location!

It's a cute little spot half a block up from cafe habana. the bartender originally said we couldn't take a table without ordering full meals but then allowed us when he saw the lay of the land at the bar. we ended up moving back over to the bar as other friends decided to join us. we had a few beers and he offered us some sort of anchovy bread. my pal ordered the calabreza which she said was delious I had the one of two veggie options on the appetizer menu, the bruschetta, it was also delious. we really only came here to drink, and it was well worth it. the bartender was really cool, the drinks were not weak and the bill was walle friendly. very cool crowd for the area it's in. will def return.

I came with co-worker on a Friday night and this is definitely a trendy place worth visiting.  It reminds me of lounges shown in the movie "Swingers".  The martini drinks are good but just expensive.  We didn't get anything to eat here but I remembered that it was packed that night.  We stayed for a while and then left to get breakfast elsewhere.

Dear New York City, Hi, Sarah here, just moved to the Big Apple from Southern California. I was hoping to find a good burrito joint to quench my desire for Mexican fare, and someone sent me here in good faith. But, alas, Dos Toros is nothing more than a tastier version of Chipotle. While Dos Toros is certainly cute and quick, it does not offer the spiciness of a border town that I'm used to. Fresh food, yes. A zingy salsa, certainly. And a line that moves faster than a high-speed policia chase? Si. But nowhere near Mexican perfection. One day I hope to find a burrito worthy of 5 stars on Yelp, but in the meantime I will have to simply dream of my long lost cilantro love. Besos, Sarah

We've been going to the Sahara for some years now, and with their new and improved setting and new menu things have only got better than they already were. Service has always been warm and friendly and reasonably prompt. Whatever combination of things you choose, the items are always fresh and neatly balanced, especially important for the baba, tahini, hummus and ful madams--and the falafels. The amounts served are always generous. And I am a dessert person, so I can only confirm what one other reviewer has said below: their baklava is 'to die for...'

I guess when you hear they have one of the best burgers in town, you walk in with some pretty high expectations.  Unfortunately, they were not met.   We started with their complimentary bread and butter, which were very fresh and tasty.   I ordered the burger because of their reputation.  It is more like a meatball, and not easy to eat.  I wouldn't even care about that if it tasted good.  The flavor was lacking and while the carmelized onions did help, it was not really that amazing.  It was cooked to perfection though. I was not able to eat the whole thing, but even still, for the rest of the day I felt like a boa constrictor trying to digest a small child.  It did not make me feel good for a long time after - sick almost. We also ordered the chocolate chip bread pudding and it was not great.  Maybe one of my top 3 least favorite that I have ever tried.  For a table of 5 people sharing, there was about half of it left, which shows that nobody else really liked it. The service was superb as I would have imagined.  It has been here for some time, so kudos to them for their success.  I just won't be back.

Tinto is my all time favorite restaurant. My go to place for all special occasions. There are only two words you need to know - tasting menu. You will not be sorry! The food is to die for! I also appreciate that they mix the tasting menu up a bit. The last two times I went it was completely different. I also recommend the wine pairing. The best thing about Tinto is it's more than a meal - it's an experience! Some highlights: Mussels and chorizo Sea bass All cheeses Thank you Jose Garces for bringing the best restaurants to Philly!
Good is pretty good but very pricey because it is a very trendy kind of place. More to be seen than actual food. Very loud place. Great for large groups. Too loud for any intimate date.

What a wonderful place! The space is intriguing, peaceful, and lovely - tables, chairs and art from Material Culture create a unique and charming room.  Combined with the high ceilings, there is an Old World feel. And the food is special, the kind that delights your palate while making your body happy with all the goodness it's getting.  I had the San Francisco Cobb salad once, and the Mezze Plate another time (so much more than just a hummus plate!), both of which I've tried all over, and these were probably the best ever. Their gluten-free bread is also the best I've tried. If you're doing lunch on a weekday and meeting a friend, leave a little extra time to find parking.  Weekends, parking is easy.  But just GO!

Love this place, have come here quite often and it's always awesome. Food never disappoints and wine is equally excellent. Sometimes things take a while to come out of e kitchen, but nothing crazy and would never prevent me from going back.

Don't really understand what all the hype is about this place. Stopped by here for dinner with the gf and that was my first mistake.  Definitely not a good place to go if you want to have a conversation over a meal.  The seating is cramped and the acoustics leave you shouting across the table.  The decor is interesting, as they have a whole chair, desk and lamp hanging on the ceiling as if the whole room had been turned upside down.  Usually that's a warning in my book when restaurants try to get clever with the atmosphere instead of focusing on the food.  Given the homey feel and word of mouth, I was hoping the food would change my mind.   First the appetizers.  We ordered Arancini Di Carne (Rice balls) and the Mozzarella Pizzaiola and my were they disappointing.  The Rice balls were flavorless and crumbled on impact - its impossible to pick them up with a fork.  There wasn't much meat inside and the sauce around it added nothing but an oily mess.  The mozzarella fared a tad better, but was ultimately nothing to write home about. On to the main course, I ordered the Michele pizza while the gf ordered the special seafood pasta entree of the day.  Since I don't eat much seafood I can't comment much on the dish, but the gf was unimpressed.  My pizza was similarly blah.  I'd gotten rave reviews from friends about the pizza and was excited to try it, but it was altogether ho-hum.  When it came out, the heat of pizza along with the toppings I chose left the center of the pie very moist and flimsy.  It tasted okay, but the mushy-ness of the first bite wasn't too pleasant. The place gets packed, so you need to continually flag down your waiter.  We had to wait for menus, utensils, the bill, etc. and my water glass was continually empty.  -1 star.  So much for the hype - there are better options out there!

The tacos are so authentic I forget I'm in NYC and revel in being South of the border on vacation .  I usually get chicken tacos with their home made medium salsa but the quesadillas are equally sublime.

When I called on Tuesday to make a reservation for Saturday night, I was told no reservations on the weekends as it was 'first come first served'. When I asked when is the best time to come without too much of a wait, he suggested 7pm. So, when my date and I arrived at 6:50p, it was quite a surprise to be given the time wait of '1 hr and 45 minutes'. We were shocked! They took my number & we decided to go somewhere else to have an appetizer while waiting for our reservation. As the time got closer, nobody called us.  I called the number on their website several times, it rang but went to an annoying fax machine. So we just decided to walk over & see about our table--almost two hours later. When we arrived, our table still wasn't ready, in fact, it the hostess quoted us an additional 25 minutes. And when I told her their business phone  number went straight to their fax machine, she chucked a little to herself and said 'really, I didn't know it did that....are you sure your calling the right number'. Finally, after all that, we decided to go somewhere else. I would love to try this place eventually.... a little more honesty would be appreciated though.
Great locally made coffee and vegan desserts

Loved it! I went with my family for brunch the other day and even though the selection was limited, the food was absolutely delicious! I got the Mekanek Egg Manouche (forgive me if I spelled it wrong) and it resembled a pizza but with lamb pieces and three eggs on top. It was pretty heavy and actually, out of the three dishes we got, it was my least favorite. I liked the taste at first but found it harder and harder to chew down as I ate. On the other hand, the lamb dip and lamb shank that my parents ordered felt easier on the mouth and stomach. They were delicious! The hummus and Batata Harra were pretty scrumptious as well but I couldn't handle the Rosti. It was too hard, which made it nearly impossible to eat. I wanted to get dessert, but after seeing how I couldn't even finish my entree I decided against it. Overall, ilili was great with beautiful decor, average service and delicious food.

one of my favorite restaurants in nyc. I have never been dissapointed with the food or service at this place.. and the wine.. ooohhhhh the fabulous wine. They have an amazing wine list, which comes in the form of a book! The only reason it gets 4 stars is because it gets pretty crowded and the tables can be pushed very close together.. sometimes i want to ask my 'neighbors' if i can try their food too. They are that close. Dessert Platter is a MUST have :)

The Double Windsor is no doubt, one of the best options (for bars) around the Bartel-Pritchard Square/The Pavilion/F/G-Train (15th Street/Prospect Park) Subway stop area. With having only Farrell's and Rhythm & Booze in the nabe as the only bars, many people like myself have been waiting on a good place to go out to. The Double Windsor has a great selection of draft beers that look like that they will rotate as the seasons change. They have been doing good business and everyone is definitely happy that there is finally a great bar in the neighborhood. I have only sampled their fries, but look forward to having some of their other food offerings soon.

This place is CROWDED on a Sunday.  MAKE A RESERVATION!  And even if you do, expect to stand around for at least 10-15 minutes crammed between other hungry folks and accidentally elbowing poor couples trying to eat at the bar behind you while waiting for a table. All that aside, it's honestly worth it for the buttery, flaky, oozy, savory and sweet items that this place concocts.  Yes, the Benedict Johnny lives up to the Yelp hype.  Try it!

Stone Street is always a good place to grab a bite with some friends from work and even better if you can share a pizza outside and enjoy the weather! We tried a old-style (I think that's what its called --- but brick oven otherwise) pizza which was adequate for the three of us dining together. We got mushrooms, sundried tomatos, and sausage if memory serves correct and it was quite good. We did order a salad (forget the name but it came with red peppers) and it was just so-so. Service was a little slow and the outdoor seating is not very comfortable (picnic tables --- but you can wait to eat inside; this is typical of Stone Street in general). Price-wise this was a decent place. I would check it out again.

I recommend this place! I usually never eat Italian but after having eaten at this place I changed my mind. Their bread is just amazing and it makes you forget about the carbs. The portions are not too small, just large enough for you to try different dishes and not be too full. The waiter was not the best as he would forget what we ordered. Overall was great

Given everything I've read, I expected to like this place, but umm... no.  Okay, I expected it to be expensive, given the ambience they're aiming for and the location, but the food was mediocre for the price.  Service for the price and atmosphere they're trying to achieve was abysmal.  Top to bottom for our meal: - I was very thirsty, so I drank the water within 5 minutes of sitting down (in addition to ordering an alcoholic drink).  The water was NEVER refilled for me or for my dining partner. - Each ordered a cup of chowder as an appetizer.  Cups were served with a plastic baggie of those miserable hexagonal "oyster crackers" that are like saltines.  Oh well, I figured that you have to go to Sansom Street Oyster House or the shore to get the substantial "Old Trenton Crackers" that I like.  Except that I later noticed that the table next to us had ordered "shots" of chowder, and got a small bowl of "OTCs" to share!  What??  A $1 shot of chowder rates real crackers, but a cup of it doesn't??  (By the way, the menu says it's $1 for a 4 ounce shot of chowder - I handle a lot of glassware, and they aren't 4-ounce shots!) - Okay, I ate the miserable hexagonal crackers.  But when the busboy came to clear the soup, he never took the empty plastic.   - The bread was either stale or spent too long in a dry oven, because it was crispy all the way through.   - The bread came wrapped in a napkin, so the busboy couldn't see whether it was empty or not.  When he cleared the soup, he asked if we wanted more bread.  Thinking he was asking if he should bring us more bread, I said, "No thank you - this is fine".  So he TOOK the bread basket away!  Left the butter behind for the entire rest of the meal, too. - When we finished one beverage and each ordered a second, the glasses from the first beverage were left on the table.  It was like it was a contest between the waiter and the busboy to see who would flinch first and clear the plastic from the crackers, the butter, and the empty glasses.   - Chowder was okay, not great.  Entrees were both bland, and lobster in the Lobster Roll was over-cooked. - Signage was inconsistent.  You can get buck-a-shuck oysters anywhere in the restaurant, but other happy hour specials only in the bar.  Signs / advertising didn't indicate any difference.  Also, signboard outside says All You Can Eat Crab Legs on Sundays for $19.95.  Printed flyer on every table says $19.95 for the first pound, and just $9.95 for each additional pound.  So which is it?  That could be a big difference!  Sorry to say, I don't think I'll be back to find out.  Honestly, Red Lobster is a better deal - yes, it's inferior food, but it's food and service in line with its prices.

If you want Japanese ramen, you MUST come here. QUALITY: 5 stars Meal: akumara modern ramen, pork belly buns, samurai ribs. -ramen: extremely tasty broth, salty and milky/creamy. Noodles a great texture, al dente. -pork belly: (2 buns) fatty and delicious -ribs: even better than buns, comes with BBQ sauce, orange derived sauce and peppers. PRICE: 4 stars -get full for about $20 -2 ramens, 2 appetizers, 1 beer about $70 with tip -there are other cheaper options for ramen elsewhere but the quality here is def worth the money. SERVICE: 5 stars -Above average friendly and exciting atmosphere. -a bit loud but very fun -open kitchen to watch the chefs -crazy efficient and fast OVERALL: just go here plain and simple. But plan on waiting about 15 min before opening to get a fast table. Or leave your number with the host.

I have been to Cantina several times before, strictly for some beers and that has always been average at best, the bar tends to get crowded and finding a place to stand can be challenging.  However, I recently went there for brunch and was pretty impressed, the food was good, it's not going to beat Sabrina's in a brunch contest, but the portions were huge and brunch with a mexican twist is different, the wait staff was very patient and friendly despite our late arriving party - which also had some quirky requests.  I also had a bloody mary, which was spicy and flavorful, I would have had 2 if the night before wasn't so rough.  A few days after brunch I placed a take out order for a few burrittos and sides, once again the portions and taste did not disappoint.

Got custard cups and nutella cups from here not impressed..have eaten name custard cups before..these looked pale on top..burnt on bottom..nutella ones were burning to brag about..thought I give it another try..asked for the toasted ones on top..again not impressed..Jane had better custard cups in the irounbound bakeries

7 items on the menu were not available! A Saturday night - even the items we ordered had to be modified because they didn't have all the ingredients.  There was a 2 page article in 7 Days newspaper on the revival of fondue.  Skinny Pancake had an ad on the page stating it was available on Fri and Sat.. But no such luck - the staff even had to look for the fondue pots and then came back and said 'no go'.  Very disappointed - felt sorry for the staff as they had to keep apologizing.  This is definitely a poor management issue.  Won't go here again.

It took me a while to write this...well simply because (finally) there was little to write about. Went here (we live in Manhattan) because our friends live near-bye, and they always try to suggest new and interesting places. There was nothing wrong with the meal, the service was efficient, the space sparse and calculated. As was our experience. Efficient and cold. This restaurant is a perfect example of how you can do everything right and yet, still, be just ok if not so-so. This area is certainly in dyer need for upscale dining, but a bit of personality wouldn't hurt. Would not be back.
good noodles and the their pork buns are way better than momofuku's.  the service is dizzying but.. who cares.

Okay, I've been going here since they were just called "Dumpling House" and they used to do 6 pot-stickers for a dollar.  Back then, you couldn't get a seat (there weren't any) and you had to yell over everyone else just to put an order in.  Lines were irrelevant.  Tons of (mostly Asian) people were clamored in there and it was easy to feel as if you were being discriminated against, until you realize that it was the most aggressive that got to eat first.  But the dumplings with their juicy pork insides and the sesame pancakes were worth the trouble and feelings of inadequacy. Nowadays, the place is run like a normal restaurant, with seating (always full) and a register with tickets and all that.  Most of the women working there are the same, and the food is still good, but now you only get 4 dumplings for a dollar.  I suppose a good thing can't stay cheap forever, so i accept this inflation as par for the course.  I still love this place. But I can't help remembering the days when this place was wild and unruly and even cheaper than it is today.

Here's the skinny on Reservoir: The pizza is good, but the entrees - not so much. Stick with the pizza and you'll be happy. The pies are small, but good. DO NOT order delivery. Eat in or (even better) pick up - for some reason, the pizza does not travel well in the delivery person's car. If you live in or near South Orange and don't want to travel to Arturos for pizza (and also want to save a bit of money), this is a solid choice.

I have had delivery from Volcano about 7 times. Food is usually good. A few times I was not happy with the quality. They used to deliver and separate the cold items from the hot items. They no longer do this. So your hot soup will be sitting next to the cold sushi. Decent stuff, not exceptional.
HIDDEN GEM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the staff is great the food is to die for and the atmosphere makes me feel at home

There are many dumpling-specialzed shops in Chinatown. They sell steamed, fried and frozen, I decided to take fried dumplings. I pay $4 for a half dozen. It is savory and bursting more with juice. Importantly, these dumplings crisp, It's crust is golden brown. yummm.......... I love it's seasoned filling.

Fresh, creative, delicious.  This is easily my favorite restaurant in a neighborhood with a lot of good options.  The best part is they have a really well balanced menu with options for everyone, even people who aren't usually drawn to health restaurants.   I can't say enough nice things. I do echo other's comments about the uncomfortable chairs, but I would sit on the floor of this place if I had do. I also had a really nice experience with the owner last year when I reached out to solicit a donation for a charity event I was working on.  Even though we didn't end up partnering on that event, she couldn't have been nicer and seemed generally interested in the event and cause.   It's so nice to see a restaurant that not only takes interest in the customers' experiences, but also wants to form a connection with the local community.
Amazing sushi! Very fresh, beautiful atmosphere. GM was very nice, introduced himself and even gave us 2 complimentary desserts just because. Highly recommended!

Love this restaurant the food is excellent the service is the best, I always get treated like I just went there for the first time, love every single dish I think I tried them all!!! you guys have to go Vinny and the chef are the best!!

Korean taste is such a choice that I would never dare to avoid. They are so up to the mark for which I am really happy and keep them as my choice of visit every now and then when I come to New York. Everything is reasonably-priced which can easily be afforded by those who love to have only low price food. If I could describe Woorijip in one analogy, that would be the same thing which forces me to come here, their service and catering. There are a lot many reasons people would get mad to come are and most of them are well illustrated by the YELPERS. Furthermore, Woorijip is the manifestation of your mother waiting by the kitchen table when most of the college going kids visits home during college

This was the highlight of my visit to New York this past weekend! I came here with a friend and we both got the Chef's Dessert Assortment. I got the Twelve Trees Oolong tea and it was amazing! It was a flavorful yet light tea and possibly the best tea I've had! The ice cream was great (green tea) + macaron + an amazing black sesame creme brulee. Absolutely great atmosphere (very relaxing), plus amazing tea, dessert and best of all, amazingly attentive service! I would absolutely go back!
You are better off going across the street for a steak. There is just something that Geno's does better. The steaks are as plain as the the place looks. Average steaks at tourist trap rates.

I love the South Philly location (on a normal day). Yes, it does get way overcrowded during football games, but that's expected.  You cannot go wrong with mussels and crab fries.  I personally think their seafood is much better than the sandwiches. Wings are good too. Get the mussels in red, crab legs, or hot shrimp. And of course, baskets of crab fries! the beer towers are great for groups, also. I do have to say, went before the last Eagles playoff game (vs. NO) and we had to pay $25 at the door and received vouchers. I will never go again during a playoff game. We didn't even spend $25/person.

More like 0 stars UGH SCARRED FOR LIFE. This place is probably cool, at least it looked cool when we walked in on Saturday night. BUT THEN we walked further in and saw a girl giving a guy a lap dance on the right and a bunch of girls strip dancing for a group of guys in the back... Ain't even writing more details. IT WAS SO WEIRD WHY WAS THIS HAPPENING AT A BAR. Bye, Felicia.

Personally I find Murphy's to be the most enjoyable of the Main St. restaurants in Hanover.  The food is typically enjoyable though occasionally leaves something to be desired.  I really like the bourbon steak tips and beet salad appetizer, which are consistently top notch. The atmosphere is very pubbish and the recent renovations have made it very comfortable.  My experience with the staff has always been fantastic.

The food here was delicious once we were finally served. It is rare that I write a bad review but the service was so bad it has to be said. Our apps and yummy sangria came to the table right away which was great. We asked the waitress about some of our dietary needs and she had zero suggestions. We waited at least an hour for our dinner to arrive and we had to keep asking then they finally told us that they were out of something we ordered and we had to order something else-due to the inconvenience they offered us 1 free side on the house, "wow thanks". We were not offered desert and they barely apologized. Maybe this is something that only happened once, lets hope but it will awhile before I go there again. But if you have the time to risk the wait and terrible service the food is worth it.

I love the food here, but the wait staff and host are ALWAYS  incredibly rude.  Have eaten there many times, but don't think I can stomach it anymore because of the rude staff- bunch of miserable people!

I got 4 different price quotes for each of the 4 times I asked for a price for a tray of only 6 grilled chicken breasts.   Was quoted a price and was told I could call in my order.  Couple of days later, called in the order and was quoted a higher price.  When I questioned the increase, someone else came on the phone and didn't know the price.  Called the first person back a couple of days later who told me they would be "about $1.50 per piece".    Called my order in, went to pick it up and was told the highest price yet!  When I questioned yet another increase, I was yelled at and told the first guy was "only a kid and didn't know"!   When he started to tell me all about how much he had to pay for chicken breasts I knew this place didn't have much control and decided to go elsewhere for better service.

Wow, I thought this is suppose to be the spot. I guess the media does have an influence on peoples opinion. Bread was dry, meat lacked flavor, and I think I had to drown it with ketchup to give it some moisture. Was definitely not worth the 4 mile walk to get here.

Must have been amateur week in Chelsea last evening. the 1st of 2 restaurants with indifferent , bored hots/hostesses. when we asked for a table for 3, we were met with an indifferent shrug, and told ' maybe in 45 minutes' . i see more hospitality from the homeless. Any place that doesn't appear to care. is a place i prefer not to eat at. I always feel that the professionalism of the front of the house is a reflection of the ownership and chef. Until they trade the kids looking to find themselves for people who care - pick some where else to dine
Best pizza in the neighborhood. Paulie treats you like royalty and the pizza is amazing!

I don't want to sound like a snob, but for some reason, every time I walk in here, the water gives me phlegm and tastes like dishwater. And it's pretty metaphorical for the restaurant. We live right around the corner, and gave it multiple chances, and quite literally EVERY time the wait staff has messed something up. Made fun of us for not being able to pronounce something, brought us the wrong food, took way too long, eventually climaxing into the most recent time where they screwed up our check, but could not fix it and eventually had to just say that my card would be refunded in a few days. There is better Italian pretty much everywhere in Philadelphia.

Trios is my go-to pizza place, and I feel really fortunate to have such a great option in the neighborhood. It's a definitely step up from your average pizza shop. My favorite is the Villa's, but I also really enjoy the Invernale, which is like white pizza with a fresh arugula salad on top. Both the round and square options are delicious, with great thin crusts. I've also had some panini and appetizers, all of which were solid. The fried mozzarella stood out, as it was discs of fresh cheese breaded in house and not prefab mozzarella sticks. Trios consistently beats their own delivery estimates, telling me 40 minutes and arriving in 20-25 (I live about 4 blocks away). When dining in, I've always found the service to be friendly and helpful.

The food was really wonderful. I had char and my guest had chicken over a pea risotto. Service was attentive but not over bearing. I did think it was weird that they served soda and beer in cans. Looked a little too casual for the atmosphere of the space. I also thought it was a bit pricey. the chicken dish was $25, $18 would have been a better price point

summed up in one word, amazing. This place has long lines for a reason, but the line honestly moved fairly quickly. Best piece of advice I can give you, should you want to try the spicy red sauce, order mango lassi or that milk/yogurt milk pre-hand, or cry trying.

I visited this restaurant to place a to-go order and encountered a problem that shook me to my bones. The staff at the door were nice and polite and directed me to the bar where I ordered a Margarita while waiting for my order.  I received my drink and it wasn't bad. In fact, my food came out rather quickly and I decided to have another margarita -- that's when things took a turn for the worst. One of 2 bartenders - her name was "Jaz" made my drink, and after having finished my drink-- at least 10 minutes passed and no one bothered to come by to ask how was my drink, suggest another, or offer desert.  Neither bartender did.  If you're sitting at the bar, one would think, they would be more attentive to ensure drinks were filled. -- Boy was I wrong for thinking such a thing! So I waited until I could catch "jaz" walking by, and I sated,,, "Miss, I I've been waiting here for at least 10-15 minutes after my drink was finished, and no one came by to ask me if I wanted another or anything."  "Jaz" didn't say a word, she reached over, grabbed my signed check, balled it up and stormed away. I mean, she actually STORMED away, WITHOUT SAYING A WORD!  She moved from behind the bar and as she went through the kitchen door,,, stated to me, "I don't like how you're treating me!"  (Since when did wanting a bartender to ask a patron for another drink equal mistreatment?) It gets better -- I asked for the manager.  Her name is Erin and , I explained what happened and simply asked for an apology from her bartender....  Her reply to me was,,, "let's just call it a draw."  What??  Erin attempted to apologize and I interjected... "it was not your fault, and the apology should come from her (Jaz)". I have never seen a bartender or server IN ANY RESTAURANT act like that, when a request for a  second drink was overlooked. Erin stated that she didn't feel comfortable asking "jaz" to apologize.  I'm thinking, WHAT??!! After I mentioned to her, that's a manager, she must know that she has an obligation to try to find out what happened, by getting both sides of the story -- But that was not an option with Erin. I then  asked Erin, what would she have done if "Jaz" threw a glass and hit me with it?" Erin told me, she would only reprimand her.  That was a very good indication to me that ,,customers visiting and having a small problem at the Mexicali, should not feel confident that management will at least attempt to get both sides of a conflict... and settle the matter professionally and equitably.  Poor training of employees and and even worse managerial skills are running rampat from these two employees at the Mexicali. Bottom Line, I returned my  food, asked for my money back ,and recommend that patrons choose another place that knows how to treat their customers. The bartender, could have simply said" I didn't realize you needed another drink, what can I get you?" Instead of making a dramatic scene like a SPOILED BRAT and having her manager "friend" protect her when she was clearly out of order and overreacted to a simple customer comment/request. To make matters worst, I asked for the restaurant's website to provide some feedback..  They have the small "contact us" envelope on the main page, but if you "click" on it, it won't forward you to any page to leave comments. In fact, it says, the email function doesn't work.  (I'm not surprised) If the owner Nick reads this.... I hear you only come in on Thursdays.... Nick, you may want to read Yelp more often -- Or why not drive by or visit sometime to see in-person your restaurant staff chase customers away. Mexicali Grill and Cantina -- NEVER AGAIN!

It was Halloween night, and I just got done walking the grand kids around for massive collections of treats.  With all that walking, me and my wife decided to stop into Papa's for dinner.  We both did not want pizza, but instead opted for other items on the dinner menu.  Well that was a tragic mistake. I ordered the sausage, pasta and broccoli rabe.  My wife ordered the Vodka rigatoni. Prior to the "food" being delivered, "bread" was placed before us.  In all my days of dining out I have never been presented with such an  carb loaded abomination, referred to as "bread"  A stale hamburger bun would be far superior.  I asked my wife, is it me or does this "bread" have the texture and taste of 6 week old manure? She agreed and we shoved the "bread" to the far end of the table.   After about 15 minutes the food arrived.  After tasting the tasteless broccoli rabe, combined with what appeared to be steamed sausage of the lowest caliber, I began to eat the over done pasta.  All and all a total waste of time.  I reached over to sample what my wife had before her.  I looked like vodka rigatoni but tasted like Campbell's tomato soup with milk added instead of water.  I could not believe my eyes and taste buds.  It tasted EXACTLY like campbell's soup poured over pasta.  And I thought Honey Boo Boo's ketchup over pasta was insane. Papa should have his nationality taken away for serving such trash under the guise of being Italian food.  I will never return to that dump again.  If the ability existed to give this joint a "0", I would have.
My wife and I enjoyed our lunch on Sunday afternoon. The burgers were terrfic.
I ordered their "famous" hot wings and when they came out I took a bite, then quickly realized they were cold in the middle! Gross, NEVER AGAIN.

I used to go to Bubby's a lot and at first it was charming and though the food was just okay - I could deal.  But then the service got really spotty - it would take forever to just get and pay for the check nevermind getting another beer.  And then sometimes the food wasn't even good.  The final nail in the coffin was that one night a small mouse (not a rat) was in the dining room - I informed one of the waitresses and some of the staff tried to get it out as quietly as possible.  I was not apologized to - nothing was taken off the check - it was like IT ALWAYS HAPPENS or something (this mind you was a week before the DOH shutdown).  Recently a friend of mine said she was in there and a huge roach was crawling right by her foot as she ate dinner.  Never again.

The drinks get 5 stars and the food gets 4 to 4.5. If you want a great place to hang out with a bunch of friends on a nice day look no further.  This is the place.  Head to the rooftop and order some of the tasty cocktails.  They have this lemon lime drink that does not taste alcoholic and can get you into trouble if you believe that it doesn't have much alcohol.  The shoestring fries are perfect and the cheesesteak egg roll is exactly what you'd think it is and tasted okay if you're ready for heart disease. The pad thai was ok as well.  There was a grilled beef dish that was succulent and melted in your mouth but I forgot what it was called. Enjoy the meal.  This place was about $50 per peson.

I love coming to White Dog for brunch. This place uses organic, local ingredients and on top of that, every meal I've ever had there was stellar. Its one of those places where you can't decide what to order cause everything looks so good (and it is). White Dog definitely has its own style, because the menu is so unique. if you want something new and guaranteed to be good, check it out!
This place has awesome food. I personally like the Chicken Mango, veggie samosas and the aloo pratha. It is all delicious and service is always great.

NYC's BEST BBQ! I've tried almost every spot, outside of Fette Sau. Morgan's tops my list hands down... I've been to Franklin BBQ in Austin and this is comparable for sure. Can't wait to go back and try the pork ribs (which they were out of last time)

This particular restaurant came up in many conversations with my friends but we never seemed to come around to plan a day in which to come have lunch until we finally decided to make it happen. One single word, "Fantastic", wonderful atmosphere, amazing menu with lots to choose from and everything we had was perfect, the food came on time, the staff, although a little slow, made up at the end by giving us free dessert, and the drinks never stopped coming, ALMOST!! what a wonderful time and like this one, my girlfriends and I will have many more at this shiek establishment, which we promised to make our regular hangout.

One of the worst experiences in my trip to New York. An ultra crowded place full of all kind of italian food merchandise that is not organize in order to serve food or coffee or pastries that you can eat comfortably. On the contrary you have to wait long line and there are not enough seating place to enjoy the over expensive food you just bought them. The management was rude and not accomodating I think New York offer excellent italian restaurants, delis and markets that are not as expensive, you can eat and share comfortably with your companions good food serve without a long wait and in a nice table and chair. This place is completely overated. Will never visit it again. Visited July 2014

The sole reason I've heard of/tried this place is because of my $50 eversave certificate that I got for a pretty small amount of money. By reading the other reviews for this place it seems to be a trend. Even though the certificate said you couldn't use it with any other specials like happy hour, it seemed that other people had done it so I decided to give it a try. I took a friend out for a birthday/new job celebration and we arrived around 6 to sit outside. The booths are deep as other people pointed out. This was awkward bc you feel very far away from the table and if you scooch closer then it's hard to get out. We ordered two glasses of wine to start (they have a red, white, rose and sparkling for $5 during hh) and the pork nachos off the $5 snack menu. The wine was delicious  but the nachos not so much. When it came out, it was three separate chips, each with some pulled pork and sour cream on top, but no cheese! What kind of nachos don't have cheese?! They also listed sriracha, which was decoratively swiped onto the plate, but it was very difficult to get this on the nacho itself.  They were just ok and for $5 I expected more. Since our cheese craving was not satisfied we ordered the cheese plate (5 cheeses for $20). I thought the price was once again a little steep for the amount of cheese you got, but it was served with candied cashews, sliced apple, toasted bread, and this amazing (strawberry rhubarb?) jam. We ordered two glasses of sparking to go with the cheese and it was once again very good for the price. For dessert we got the fried oreos (3)  with cookies n cream ice cream. I thought they were ok, and my friend really liked them. I think I just prefer my oreos plain. Even though the food was just so so, our waitress was wonderful and attentive. My total bill came to about $51, so I only owed $1 plus tip! Not bad.  From my sampling, and from other people's reviews, I might return here for hh if I was in the area but prob not for dinner.

Went in again with the new menu.  Prices look like they creeped up a little, but still reasonable for the type of food.  I ordered the vegetable sandwich, and it was so delicious.  Light amount of balsamic, lots of grilled vegetables, on good bread.   One thing I did not like was the twice-baked potato. For one, they charged me extra for changing my side.  For two, the "twice-baked" portion was only about 1/3 of the potato. The rest was just plain baked potato. I barely touched it.   I wish you could get a side salad instead of french fries as an option.  But all in all I like this place, it is a good place with a new menu that has more variety.   This place still is not getting very busy, which means even on a Saturday night you can get seated immediately.  Hopefully more people will check it out and it will get more busy :)

The atmosphere is great.. It is always busy so you like to be there.. Their stake platters are so so..I love the appetizers - my favorite is pumpkin ravioli! From deserts I Iove Crème brûlée. Generally staff is helpful, but if you have a good looking boyfriend next to you becareful one -the shortest hostess lady can hit on your boyfriend in front of your eyes and both of you can be very surprised! It was really stange.. she tried 5 times to disturb our dinner to talk to him and he was still trying his best to keep his politness.. I think restaurants should becareful when they choose employees for reception desk.

It was a surprise as I ate in this location before.  The outside looks a little different from the previous Japanese restaurant that was there last time I visited 3 months ago.  The menu has changed a bit.  I ordered the grilled squid & tonkotsu ramen.  Both are just great.   I ate grilled squid before but this is the best I ever have & I strongly recommend this to anyone who are going to eat there.  Hope this info helps.

absolutely love the food.  the Filet Mignon and Mussels are must-haves.  One of my favorite restaurants in NYC.  Hands down, the best tasting French restaurant I've ever been to.  Can't say much about the decor, but who cares.   The food makes you forget everything.   Did I mention this is a BYOB?

Pretty bad experience here. The place is packed and noisy. Service is incredibly slow taking around 10-15 minutes to get a drink. There are no dedicated servers that check in on the orders. For anyone who actually has sprang more than $25 on a steak ... THE MEAT IS HORRIFIC. You are offered bad tenderloin, chuck steak, trnderloin, short ribs and a skirt steak. All except the skirt came out medium-well to plain dry. Also, when patrons are spending $550 a table (8 people) its in poor taste to charge $6.99 for a bowl of pudding for a birthday. Oh and don't forget that you are CONSTANTLY harassed by people trying to sell you flowers, and homeless pan handlers oustide. I've been to at least 6 rodezios including living in Brazil. Horrible. Bathrooms also unclean- doesn't help patrons are vomitting post meal.

Been coming here since *before* it was a tourist trap (it's really only been one for about the last 10 years). Back then they had one small room with a door that let all the elements in. You could get a table any night of the week with no wait. And their pizzas cost about ten bucks. Today it's always jam packed in all of their many rooms and a pizza with one or two toppings on it is going to cost more like $35. But the pizza itself tastes the same. This is the real thing, folks - don't let anyone tell you different. If you don't like Lombardi's, you don't like New York pizza - simple as that. Lombardi's defined it in the first place. Coal oven for that crispy yet soft mouth feel and charcoal flavor, sliced mozzarella (never accept grated mozzarella!), fresh ingredients, and a sauce that's to die for. Seriously, it is the sauce that really sets Lombardi's apart, because it's the one part of a pizza most pizzerias completely ignore. It's Grimaldi's' biggest failing, for example - lots of people swear Grimaldi's is better but their sauce is like water. Lombardi's' sauce is just bursting with fresh tomato flavor. I'm dinging them one star because no way any pizza should ever cost $35, and the price increase from just a few years ago cannot be justified. It makes it basically impossible for real New Yorkers to consider Lombardi's their go-to pizzeria. There are so many pizza places at less than half the price that are 80% as good, the value proposition just isn't there. But I still go once in a while for a real treat.

pretty good for brunch, but better deals around. Of course, had high expectations so that's probably part of it. I am obsessed with spaghetti carbonara, and HAD to get that the particular day we went. So yummy, and totally hit the spot. My friend got the raviolo al uovo--he's obsessed with eggs, but while this dish tasted delish, it was a small portion and not very satisfying. We also tried the suckling pig ragu which was rich and complex and so delicious. The frittata blanca which my cousin got was pretty disappointing and unexciting. so overall, 2 for 4, which is not a great average. But the whole ambiance was comforting and inviting, and I have a feeling I'll be coming back to try other things on the menu

My first impression here was great. I came here for lunch with my dad after the lunch rush and the service was fast. The atmosphere is rich with indian culture, you can smell the spices in the air. There are many indian movie posters hanging on the wall that give a nice feel. I ordered a chicken roll for $5 (you can get 2 for $9) marinated in spices with onions. It was made quickly and served on a neat looking tray. We sat in the back in nice looking tables. The roll was delicious, spicy, and tasty. If you like spicy indian food and need a quick lunch this is the perfect place for you. It will make you very thirsty though so make sure you get a drink!

We waited over 45 mins to get  our food. We also had to ask for bread while everyone around us was getting baskets of it without asking. The food was just meh, and my husband and I ended up having some stomach issues after we ate.

I have been coming here many times, by myself or with friends when I'm in town. I'm sad to say that I am not coming back here. I'm still at the restaurant and this waiter is the waiter from hell. I asked for another glass of water because it had something in the water and he didn't even say sorry or cared like nothing happened. That's gross! Just looked away and gave me another water. I spend at least $60 all by myself. I hardly have Filipino food so I always get excited when I'm at a Filipino restaurant and tend to order for more than one person. He took forever to give the menu and then take my order. I had to ask him to take my order. The food is good but service sucks here and this by far tops today. I'm disappointed because I visit here often when I'm in town. He is not a waiter. He basically take your order, bring your food and that's it. You will have to flag him if you need anything. I guess he is not getting a tip today LOL! Don't deserve it! I took a picture of him so you guys know who it is. Grill 21 Unfriendly Waiter!!!
Great spot! Loved the food. Service was good too:) would def go back!
this place has the best halal food I have ever tasted.. will be back for sure

So many portions! I guess that can be a blessing or a curse. The thai iced tea tasted so good and the calamari was still hot when delivered to us. I know there are probably lots of choices for Thai food in Brooklyn but this place is really worth a visit. I had chicken Pad Thai and the generous portion just made me happy that day.

That increasingly Rare feeling you get when eat somewhere with a high level of hype surrounding it and your realize "wow this is not overrated". Yeah I'm high off that right now. Pies n thighs is a no frills kinda spot, there's absolutely nothing fancy or pretentious about it.
