It Has a cafeteria/residential home type of vibe, when you walk in you see the kitchen right in the middle of the dining area.  CLEARLY the ownership has maximized on the space avail in the building. The focus in this place is on food and nothing else. The Food: I ordered the fried chicken box and chose the collard greens as my side. I was amazed at how fast my food came out, seemed like it was less than 5 minutes. Not only was it served fast but it was fresh out of the fryer. - The collard Greens were surprisingly solid. They were cooked perfectly.. Not under or over cooked. The flavor was good, could have used a little more salt or perhaps more pork in the pot when they boil it but they are defiantly working with something when it comes to their greens. - The Chicken exceeded every expectation I had. Simply put, PERFECTION. I repeat, this chicken was perfect. The skin was so crisp you can hear the crunch from 3 tables away and the inside was surprisingly moist. Taste wise it was like the skin and the inside of the chicken had two unique flavors. The skin was perfectly seasoned, the salt was JUST right. This chicken is a 10 in the flavor and texture department.  Arguably the best fried chicken I've had in any restaurant, Samantha's in bed stuy is the only competition. -The biscuit was also good. The honey butter they offer goes perfectly with it. I Probably wouldn't come here with out getting a biscuit. Overall Pies n thighs is a solid 4 to 4.5. I can't give them the 5 because Samantha's southern holds the crown in Brooklyn as far as the entire soul food meal goes. But none the less pies n thighs is on point and I'll Probably be there more often than Samantha's because the location is more conducive to other things I do in manhattan.

Being Hungarian their langos are almost as good as my grandmothers, which is a hard thing to accomplish. Bloody Mary's have significantly improved and are amazing now. Their fried hamburgers are also a specialty. Staff are friendly and helpful, especially Mike is great. Worth the trek to Brooklyn unless you already live in the neighborhood.

Did a take out lunch here today.  The order was ready in a timely fashion and the people at the counter seems pretty nice (we didn't do much talking).  My eggplant parm sub was tasty, but was wrapped in such a way that the paper took all the cheese off the top ... so it was more of an eggplant and sauce sandwich.  The sauce was yummy, the eggplant nice and thin and everything as I would expect.

Difficult to find, needed to go into an office building and get directions from the desk manned by security guard. Only a small external sign. First time drinking sake, waitress walked us through a recommendation based on our wine tastes, was so good had to track down 2 more bottles. Food is generally excellent, somewhat unique and well-presented.

Recently went back as a guest of the owner. Needless to say,  things went much more smoothly this time. The staff was friendly, and seems to have found its groove. My chicken burrito was seasoned well, with a nice serving of rice, black beans, guac and all the fixings. Made for a quick burrito fix. Welcome to the neighborhood.

From the moment we arrived at this beautiful gem of a restaurant we knew we were in for a treat, not just the meal, but the ambiance.  The owner has perfectly appointed the restaurant with flowers, trees, candles, copper amber lighting, a gorgeous bar, to immediately exude a feeling that you are somewhere other than a street in Manhattan. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Oh and the meal? Superb from start to finish, from the mussels, with broth my husband had to finish to the last drop, to my endive salad with just the right amount of sharp roquefert cheese, to the main courses.   I can't say enough about this wonderful find. I can't wait to return!

I order delivery from Del Rossi's all the time with my roommate. We always get the buffalo chicken pizza for delivery. Awesome pizza. The sauce is great and they really load it up with chicken. If you can stop in, we always get their cheesesteaks. Obviously not as good as a Jim's or Steve's or Pat's, but still really awesome.
Best. Burger. Ever.

this is the BEST drunken meal/snack whatever you call it when you are in the village! :D I had it two nights in a row. The hot sauce ..............literary the spiciest sauce I had in my life. It was more like red chilli powder mixed w/ water..but still so spicy. The cashier was friendly and kept calling me Chutney! haha later on, he came over to offered me a Baklava to try (awww!) :) Definitely coming back here. There are other places nearby that are a little cheaper than here. But I felt that these people make their food faster and mix the sauces and stuff for us so we don't have to get our hands dirty.
Best Sicilian pizza and great salad.

This place sucks!!!  They should not even adverise they sell sushi because it has to be hands down the worst SUSHI ever and the most over priced. You think the price looks good $4 for a roll.  However, a normal roll would have 6pcs theres have 4.  its not Fresh. The Soy Sauce----WAS DISGUSTING.  It had to be the saltiest soy sauce I ever tasted.  Me and the group I was with--then requested the Low Sodium soy sauce they had-----not much better. It was almost impossible to eat my TERRIBLE sushi due to the fact of the SALTIEST SOY SAUCE in AMERICA! I would never ever go back!

I don't understand all the haters! This has consistently been one of my favorite brunch places in Philadelphia.  When I go for brunch, I am not necessarily looking for "innovation", just the classics done well and a good ambiance- and this place nails it.  The service has always seemed perfectly friendly to me, very attentive, and they keep your coffee cup filled.  They use good, high quality ingredients, and it feels really one-of-a-kind, which is unfortunately not true of any of the other brunch standbys- Sabrina's, green eggs, and honeys all have multiple locations! Which is fine, but Morning Glory is a special spot!

What a great new place!  I loved the service, the decor and the food was just AMAZING! A really really cool place, with delicious, flavorful food. I was especially enamored with the creamy corn soup with curry popcorn. Slightly frustrating that they use honey in some of their food. My friend and I were going to try one of the desserts, until our server informed us that it contained honey. What a strange ingredient to cling to in an otherwise vegan restaurant! The lemon cheesecake we opted for instead was delicious. Nevertheless, I had an awesome meal and will definitely be back!

Luckily, when I moved away from home, I happened to move right next door to Pies and Thighs. Food is good, richhhh so only on a special occasion. Hip yes, but I would probably sell my ironic sweaters and fixie for a single doughnut hole. (Also Pies and Thighs staff, I luh ya, ya so cute.)

I am not sure what all the hype is about this place.  The first time I went, I had an OK experience, but nothing exceptional.  The food was decent, the service was mediocre and the decor/location was excellent.  I came back a second time hoping to be pleasantly surprised and it was worse than the first. The duck was overcooked and almost inedible.  The three spreads (apart from the tuna spread) were actually worse than you get at the supermarket.  Especially given the cost, I definitely do not recommend this place.

Waited for over an hour for food.  when we finally sat, everything we attempted to order was no longer available or they were out of it.  The food was ok...but like another reviewer... there are better, more authentic cuban restaurants. very quick service once we were seated.

Been here a couple of times. First off whats the deal with no vegetarian options? The Pici is quite uninspired for an option. Tartare was fine. Sweetbreads tasted alittle off. Chicken good but over priced. The soup was great. The decor needs alittle help. And the couple times we went it was virtually empty and had to flag down the waiter. The Chef/owner (Walker?) seems to be working his butt off so I hope they work out the kinks
love the chips salsa guac and margaritas.  el pueblo is my favorite- food is always so good, hate the wait but that because everyone knows food is on point.

Perhaps I should preface this lofty review by noting that every meal, whether brunch or breakfast, be laden with a side of fruit. One might think, yum, fruit. But this is a cop out. Regardless of the dish, you will get, doubt it not, grapes, cantaloupe, and pineapple. And probably like one piece of cantaloupe. Like an entire, well proportioned third of your plate is going to have the same three fruit that everybody else in the whole entire restaurant has, Maybe this wouldn't be such a bad idea if the food was even decent. But how could this unasked for and I suspect mandatory side add to my dining experience? Perhaps grapes, cantaloupe, and pineapples complement everything on N. 3rd's enticing and varied menu. The food itself is meager and bland. And boring.

I don't know what all the hype is on this place, it's just average pizza. You select your own toppings, they don't have any special pizza's that they've created that'll blow your mind, you just pick your own toppings and order. No appetizers, only a bowl of olives or something like that. I've experience way better. Also one time I went and we walked into the store to get a table since there was no line outside and this old guy, maybe the owner?, literally shoved us out...like put his hand on my shoulder and pushed me and told us to wait outside.  We were out there like a minute and he brought us in....really?  Was that really neccessary?? They serve their sodas out of bottles, not even the full size bottles, they're a little shorter.  They're also not very good with their water refills.

totally amazing. i really had one of the best meals ever here. cauliflower gratin!!! it is small and can be busy but bar jamon is a great place to sit out the wait and grab a drink. it is worth the wait!

Every city and college town needs one of these sushi places, where they mix sushi with the divvy atmosphere. Decent quality, fresh and reliable! They are usually pretty quick and I love both salad dressings. And the radish/carrot pickle is a wonderful combination with the rolls. I enjoy the following rolls: spicy salmon roll, spicy tuna roll, eel and avocado roll and philly roll. Two of any of these and I'm good! I am sure I would love others too but I haven't tried them much. My friend ordered the chicken teriyaki the other day and I was pleasantly surprised that it was pretty good!
One of the best restaurants in New Haven.  A bit pricey but totally worth it.  An excellent dining experience.

I love this place and used to go there a lot years ago for brunch before it got so popular. It is small but cozy and excellent food. I love the grilled corns. my absolute favorite and such a deal -  two corns under $4. I tried to make it myself but not the same. good cuban sandwich. Since the place is pretty small you need to wait until someone leaves and can hear next table's conversations but well, that's also a part of the fun(!??!!).

A bit pricey but the lunch special is reasonable and changes day by day. "Today's Toast" is $10 but has a wonderful topping that also changes depending on the day (salmon is my favorite!) Their various choices for tea sets (choice of tea, meal and dessert) are fun! I've had the chrysanthemum, jasmine, matcha and orange pekoe tea (all recommended.) For dessert, try the black sesame creme brulee. The bidet toilet in the restroom is wonderful! There is a soft incense scent in the bathroom.

I will give it three stars because I remember going there on my first meal with my now-best friend.  Otherwise, it would be two.  I can remember sitting across the table (he was eating eggs of some sort (no ketchup)) and I believe that I was eating an apple pie of some sort.  It was our refuge from the Spigot (see my other review) and it was our slice of paradise in Hartford.

You absolutely can't deny that their food is great.  Their corned beef was probably the best I have ever had.  Great pickles too.  However, it is very expensive, slow, and watch out when you try to use the yelp coupon, you'd think you asked them for the keys to the front door.  They were running around looking for a manager to see if we could have a free cookie.  Overall food is great but a little to expensive for a deli and a little slow.  Would definitely go back but not an every day place for me.

Hello folks! I'm sorry to report that this was a very mixed experience for me. I guess the large, wide bread (tasty) that is barely filled with meat (pastrami) left me guessing what all the rage was about?!? I expect raves when the filling is equal to or exceeds the width of the bread. I have had many sandwiches all over the USA that significantly exceeded my experience here. I would recommend looking elsewhere.

One of the bars that make Philly the best beer city.  Unpretentious, curated list, friendly bartenders and servers.  The food that comes out is exactly how it is described.  Neat bottle shop next door that has a wonderful decor and dedicated staff.  I typically hate the stoner type set, but the guys that are working there know there stuff and are as friendly as can be.  Perfect West Philly spot without the bleeding heart liberal agenda that typically goes with this neighborhood.
overrated.  suckling pig had crispy skin but the meat just wasn't t hat good to me. ocotopus was ok. tripe ok. uvo egg...had better at sd26 where they shaved a lot of white truffle on it.

As a sales professional, I spend a lot of time on the road looking for a place get some work done. I have three requirements; good coffee (read: not burnt tasting), nice food selection, and comfortable atmosphere where cellphone use is tolerable. They receive check marks for all three. But they actually go above and beyond. They serve La Colombe coffee, a delicious selection of Israeli/Mediterranean food, and a great menu offering both sweet and savory items. I'm happy to see their policy about limited time on the internet when they are busy. The only people who criticize that policy are probably those that couldn't even imagine what it is like to own a cafe. The goal is to make money...it's a business! People who go to sit in coffee shops for internet and not spend money are very rude. I like this place so much that I have no problem buying a gift card for $10 or more so that I can purchase smaller $$ items whenever I am in the neighborhood. Every neighborhood should have a place like this...they break the mold and set a very high standard! If you haven't been there yet, you should check it out.

The food here is incredible - this pizza isn't like anything you've probably eaten before. It's not Brooklyn or Sicilian style, it is LEGIT Italian pizza. When I visited from San Diego a few weeks ago, my family and I got the margherita pie and something similar...the owner made everything fresh to order and I wish I could articulate how amazing it was. Everything from bruschetta to pies to the unbelievably delicious Nutella-berry pie was brilliantly fresh. Even their cappuccino was beyond compare - smooth, not bitter at all. All of the gelato desserts we tried were out of this world. The four of us just ate and ate til we could eat no more. The only tiny drawback was that the waitress was more interested in comparing cell phone features with another waitress than bringing things like straws and sugar, which we had to ask for twice. But if you go for the food and not the less-than-stellar waitstaff, you will be duly impressed. I can't wait to get back east just so I can dine at Osteria Procaccini again.
Soft opening, well done. Unique and interesting menu... Everything from the Burger to the Fried Green Tomatoes. Friendly staff, cool vibe. Looking forward to coming back...

I'm sad to be the first one with out a perfect score for this coffee shop. Let me first start off by saying the coffee here is phenomenal. The music was awesome too. I even asked who was playing and have checked them out since on spotify. The wallpaper is a bit strange but in a cool down south moms house kind of way.   The only thing I was disappointed with was the lack of food options. There were just 2 different kinds of pastries and nothing else. That being said I would definitely go back for the coffee and hopefully some more food options soon!

This place is not just a great Woodbridge bar, but I'd put it up against other nearby towns, even. Fanastic space, great night crowd, good selection of beers, one-of-a-kind modern, yet very Irish atmosphere, and great burgers! Service is great, bartenders are great, and the menu has something for everyone. Some Irish dishes, but mostly American style food. And believe it or not, their penne vodka is pretty good. I know, random, but true. If you want to go for dinner, get out of there by 9, it starts becoming a bar after that. If you want to go for some nighttime shenanigans, get there after 10, when it picks up. Dress nicely, the girls are beautiful, and you're just one of many looking at them. Bring your A game.

I went to Rye with a lady friend of mine who is a vegetarian. Amazing that I come to New York-- a paradise for carnivores-- and all my friends abstain from flesh. Still, she's cute and she knew what she was getting herself into by coming to this Williamsburg eatery near an apartment I had when I was 24. So we went. This neighborhood has come up in the world in the past eight years, though I kind of miss the crack dealers. There's no sign on the door, so when you walk into Rye and see the speakeasy design that is out-of-control in New York City now, you breathe a bored sigh. Then you look at the drink list and its a carbon copy of every other signless speakeasy style bar in Williamsburg and you wonder why you braved the L train-- and the hairstyles and attitude found on it-- to come to Rye. The beet salad was tasty, the endive salad was original and refreshing (even if the server pronounced it en-dive rather than ahn-deev as they would across the river and wide cultural divide), and the mushroom lasagna was quite filling, though they could have lightened up on the ricotta. We may have ordered more, but that was the extent of every vegetarian dish on the menu. My companion's "Old Fashioned" was a smokey/citrusy whiskey beverage, much like many other similarly named drinks I've had in Brooklyn in the past 5 years. My Sangiovese was quite tasty, though any wine snob with a half a brain knows to air out the red before serving it. Duh, guys. Where do you think we are, Queens?

I hadn't been to Calle Ocho in years (before it moved to the Excelsior Hotel). I have a very hard time believing this is the same restaurant. First off, our food arrived about 6 minutes after placing the order. NOTHING takes only 6 minutes to prepare, unless it's not actually being prepared to order. Furthermore, when one of the dishes is paella, then 6 minutes is entirely unacceptable. The "sweet & green plantains" were fried plantain chips that were neither sweet or even warm. The Camarones were sweet shrimp on top of a nasty tasting, seemingly asian inspired avocado "salad." I love avocado, but this was bordering on disgusting. The Paella tasted like Uncle Ben's rice that seafood was thrown on top of at the end. The rice had no flavor at all from the seafood, no toasted bottom, and THE SEAFOOD WAS COLD. You can't even pretend the seafood was cooked in the rice if it's COLD! The stuffed chicken was acceptable, but it's supposed to come with sausage and I got 1 tiny half inch diameter sliver of sausage. The only things I can recommend from Calle Ocho are the rolls. Stay away. This place is one of the worst places I've eaten at in years.

had the pleasure of dining here on Thursday.  Servers were extremely attentive and the meal was divine.   great spot for a date.  we shared the farro cauliflower cake and the fried artichokes to start, followed by filet of blackfish in parchment paper and the duck.  Make sure that you save room for desert.   decor wise-- simple and elegant.  the focus here is the food!!

Amazing! Checked out this spot with Mr. Wilder and WOW!!! Seriously, I wanted to try everything on the menu; it all looked so good! Finally decided on the waffles with so many toppings, I was salivating just reading the description. I added jalapeño sausage and eggs (because I'm greedy:-) Exceptional. Highly recommend dining at this place.

EAT HERE IF YOU'RE A VEGETARIAN AND WANT TO BE SERVED BACON WITH A 'MARKET SIDE' OF METAL! I had high hopes for Westville as it seemed like they had a lot of veggie options,  but I had such an awful eating experience when i ordered two weekends ago.  They disappointed in so many way. I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich (I said no bacon, as it's an option available for add-on) and also ordered 4 market sides.   The food arrived.  I bit into the grilled cheese sandwich and immediately knew something was wrong.  I tasted bacon.  I took a closer look, opened the sandwich and found pink pieces of meat in my sandwich.   At this point, I called Westville and told the person on the phone what had happened.  He tried to convince me that what i was tasting was gouda and that it was impossible for their to be smaller pieces of bacon in my sandwich because they only used GIANT pieces.  I told him that i knew what gouda tasted like and that what i was tasting was definitely pork and that i could see it!  He then passed the phone to a haughty English man who continued to try to make excuses as to why there couldn't possibly be bacon in my sandwich.  He asked me to describe what i saw in my sandwich in as much detail as possible.  I was becomingly increasingly irked, but described it to him. "Pink, brown, wavy lines, used to have a snout."  He asked if he could send someone to pick up the sandwich so that his chef could inspect it (seriously?).  But i was in a rush (which was why i ordered in the first place), was heading out of my apartment and did not have time to partake in a sandwich autopsy.  He asked me what i wanted to do then.  I said that I didn't want to pay for the grilled cheese since I couldn't eat it.  He said he "would discount it."  I wasn't sure exactly what the meant, but as i was in a rush, i didn't have time to argue. I chucked the sandwich and left. When i got back to my apartment later in the evening, I decided to try the sides.  They were ok pretty bland but eatable...until i bit into something hard! I pulled this weird thing out of my mouth and "ta-da" it was a PIECE OF METAL!  It was in the kale and i looked like it had melted plastic around it.  Maybe metal adds a certain je nais se quoi to the preparation of kale.  As a commoner, I am unacquainted with this exotic practice.  I did not call them again for fear of being told that I must be mistaken -  "Oh no, madam, what you thought was metal was actually the Kale's penis." The last insult came today when i looked at my credit card bill.  The English man did not, as promised, "discount" my grilled cheese sandwich.  There was no refund from Westville - which, ladies and gents, shall now be referred to across the land as FAILVILLE!

wafey small bagels.  They need to figure something out.  Go try the bagels that Muddy Waters gets.... those are the real deal.  Tried this new place twice because its in my neighborhood,  the second time was worse then the first.  The eggs tasted rubbery and strange and upon inspection, they were grey.  The bacon was not fresh either and after about 5 minutes the cheese sorta turned into a plastic layer.  The entire thing was a waste.   I am truly disappointed because their sign is amazing and it could be prime for the right restaurant.   sorry.  Look on the bright side, you hired some really friendly employees, they were great both times.

Very good Thai restaurant at a really great bargain. The Pho is some of the best I've had in the city and the dinner plates are great too. Try the beef briscuit pho with meat balls...fantastic. You get some great dinner combos at a very cheap price. The service is usually a bit unfriendly, but I've never felt unwelcome or out of place. It's not a BYO, but they have cheap Tsing Lao beer and some good cocktails if you're interested.
Everything is great on the menu.......  Even the salads are addictive.  I love eating here often.

Awesome food! Great service. Had an issue tonight with my delivery, my boyfriend called to talk about what happened and things were taken care of, no questions asked. We love this neighborhood and we were super happy to find this place a few weeks ago. I recommend the Cubano, fried brussel sprouts and the tomato soup!

It's by far the best Thai place in Queens.  The garden in summer is very nice. I've been fan for almost 4 years now, and every time I recommend this place, always it pays the favor.  I love the ground beef with mint leaves, It's out of the world. The coconut ice cream served in the shell is super good.

Fast, cheap, fresh Italian.  Fantastic for a quick lunch time drop-by.  The bolognese sauce is good on anything....if you have extra sauce (you probably will) when you're done, you can dip the breadbasket bread in it and continue enjoying. downsides are that its cramped quarters (only seats about 6, 10 if its sunny).  during good weather, it is one of my favorite lunch spots - no hassles, no pomp, no circumstance.  just food.

City Tap house has a great selection of beers and plenty of seating in a roomy and relaxed atmosphere. They have booth seating that can fit over ten people. I also like the fire pits they have outside - for fireside chats with friends while overlooking the edge of Penn campus. I've ordered food here several times. For the price they charge, the food could be better. I've ordered both the Tap Burger and the free range Turkey burger - and both had good burger patties, but the brioche buns they used were very stale and dry, and I ended up leaving them aside every time. The appetizers I've had were also just OK. I guess I'd be better off coming here with a greater focus on beer than anything else.

I sort of don't get all of the great reviews.  As far as sushi goes, its just OK.  It used to be better years ago but I feel it has gone down a notch in quality.  Plus the pieces of sushi and sashimi are small.  Its fine but as far as high end sushi goes there are better places with better atmosphere.

A mixed meal experience. Most of my visits to M&S has been after Peter Luger's to get a Fernet. Damn Luger's and not having a digestif. Now that just doesn't make sense. So yeah the wife and I finally actually wanted to have a meal there, and food-wise it did not disappoint. Really nice briny oysters, a salad and then the roasted fish (forget which one!) Fun atmosphere. Unfortunately we sat right after a large table of 23 year olds having their group internship dinner. It took so long to actually get our food we were starting to get a bit antsy, which the waitstaff noticed and kept us placated. Luckily the meal was superb enough to make us overlook the wait. We assumed though that the placation would entail a dessert on the house (which was great, berry cobbler or some such thing) but they didn't comp which left a bit of a bad taste in our mouth. Overall, food is great but can be crowded and it is a tiny space. Don't bring your Midwestern relatives.

I didn't want to review this place because I didn't think another one saying how awesome it is, but this morning, I woke up craving for some street food from 53rd and 6th. Let me get straight to the point. You'd be crazy not to go here when you visit NYC. Put it this way, on our last trip to NYC, we had lunch here three times out of the 6 days we were there. That's how good it is. How I wish they'd open up a cart here in San Diego.
Alright food just wasn't impressed. Go to either beso or bayou, they are amazing

I have been getting coffee from the genius to go window since they opened and finally went for brunch here yesterday. The place was absolutely slammed but we didn't have to wait too long for a table. I had the pancakes with ricotta and my friend had the chicken sand which she def loved. The server I had was super nice considering how busy the place was. Iam a huge fan of their coffee & think this place is such an awesome cafe to have in greenpoint. Oh and I love the park location.

Love this place. Came here and had such a good time that I took another friend with me the very next day. It is very cozy, quiet and not your typical drunken slop of a bar. The game plays, the patrons seem to know the customers, conversation is quiet and friendly, and the atmosphere is more than welcoming. The food is very diversified. I had an Edamame Burger with Tzatziki sauce, Chicken Masala Flatbread, Smoked Salmon with Creme Fraiche, Chicken Quesadillas, and Fried Alligator Tail all in two meals here. Great place to get a couple of things and split 'em all with friends. The food was very good. Was really excited to get to try alligator. It was a special so may not be on the menu every day. Definitely do it if you get the chance. You will not regret it! First time having gator but won't be my last. The smokes salmon flatbread is amazing as well. Edamame burger was very Mediterranean-inspired so if you are in the mood for a large falafel of sorts, it will do the trick. Sunday night is board game night and with the crowd that I experienced the first two times there, I definitely am eager to come see how board game night is.

The atmosphere was sort of like a cafe you might find in a foreign country. There was a TV playing a Lebanese soap opera. The food is all prepared fresh and the young lady who served us was attentive and pleasant. My daughter got the hummus which was an amazing serving with pita and olives for just $4. She told me it tasted very good. I got a Kefta kabob which came with flat bread, grilled vegetables and a tasty rice pilaf. The serving size was large enough for dinner tonight and lunch tomorrow. I am a fan of good Mediterranean food and I will definitely be coming back and bringing my wife with me.

This is, so far, my favorite restaurant in Williamsburg. The Scotch eggs were one of those dishes that I can honestly say impacted my worldview. Incredible. Also shared the lamb shank (awesome) and had some sort of chocolate dessert that was transcendant. It was far from light fare, to be sure, but worth every calorie. Service was polite and informed - none of this too-cool-for-school crap that gives the w-burg restaurant scene a bad rap. My friend had what seemed to be a perfect whiskey drink. Rye's ambiance and decor are Prohibition-era, much like other restaurants of its ilk, but overall it was cozy without being pointedly romantic. The type of place fit for a date or a night out with parents. I think with reservations, even a larger-ish group could have a good time. Really, though, it's all about the food. And the food is very, very good.

Extra Virgin is a super cosy, intimate place tucked away  in the West Village. Went for dinner one friday night with two friends. We started with the special (baked artichoke) and fries with Gorgonzola. For mains we had monkfish, sea bass and lobster tortellini. All of the food, save perhaps the fries, was sublime. The service was good, but not outstanding. Overall, I loved this place? Highly Recommended.

homey French cooking, been here twice and shall return again & again; there are restaurants where you genuinely feel the veggies and animals have not sacrificed in vain, here is one Food (5/5) sample as many as you can and get a home made apple cider on wintry days; Star dishes: a. French onion soup - delicious and burning hot with a crispy pretty gratin top b. escargot in herb butter - the juicy chewy texture of the snails is retained with respect, generous serving c. Crêpes, crêpes, crêpes - soft, organic buckwheat, wrap mushrooms, seared scallops or seasonal veggies or ham or banana & toasted almonds (honey on the side)       d. Others: Mussels à la Nage and seared duck breast bring back such sensations Ambience (3.5/5) small but cozy, near subway station, sit out in nice weather Service (5/5) homey and surprisingly fast

wow, what a place to eat, food off the hook. you must go there selection is great, service is fast and wonderful. i met mike and chef tommy the owners they are there working and making sure everyone is enjoying there meal. and fyi they cater all affairs. i am telling you its a must see and eat.

They are one of the very few places I've been to nearby that make their own soy sauce = awesome
75648	932	2015-01-09	I've ordered from here twice now and both times I've been extremely happy. The inside looks nice for dining in, I just haven't yet. They are super nice and accommodating. The sushi is fresh, unique and just awesome. I would highly recommend to anyone.
75649	932	2015-01-08	Back again!  I can't get enough of this place. Everyone so nice and the tea is to die for!(I'm a convert!) the people are so nice!  The sushi is 5 star!
75650	932	2015-01-01	Great sushi.  Very fresh and the service is very fast.  The place is clean and they have a great variety
75651	932	2014-12-09	Ok people of Lincoln park and beyond...get your bodies over to this new Sushi place..Helen is the person who usually greets you...and she is great... The two sushi guys are FAST and smooth...the tea is amazing....they need containers to take it home...love it...I am a creature of habit and these guys got me to eat New rolls....love it...please support...btw.,very clean...
75652	932	2014-12-05	Their service and sushi are awesome! They have healthy options like Naruto for the carb conscious. Their blue hill sushi is the best though, highly recommend!
22755	932	2014-12-01	I was weary of a spot which gets so many good reviews. I was also scared to try a new sushi place since I've been repeatedly disappointed lately by Sushi in North Jersey. But this is something else. I have ordered here three times already and the quality is consistent. Although I do not like their Blue Hill roll, Everything Salmon that I have tried has been phenomenal. Will post updates, as I have made this place my staple.
75653	932	2014-11-25	Came across this establishment while visiting friends in NJ. Exceptional sushi with personable chefs who truly provide a great overall dining experience. Ask them to recommend you a flavorful tea to complement your sushi selection! I would definitely recommend the Sushi&Sashimi set, Tempura box, and teriyaki options. Family friendly menu as well. Can't wait to visit again to try the Donburi and Yaki noodle menu!
75654	932	2014-11-15	I've never had better service anywhere. Plus they had good prices and good food.  I definitely plan on coming back here frequently.
75655	932	2014-11-07	So I need to start this review with one premise...I've never reviewed anything on Yelp. Frankly...no one is deserving of my time unless they wow me. Well, I've been wow'ed!! Kenko just opened a week ago from what the hostess told me.  It's a darn shame they didn't open sooner. This place has fantastic food, a great decor and amazing service. Thanks to Kenko I've found a regular sushi place.
75656	933	2011-12-18	We used to go there weekly (weekends) for years and were very generous tippers.  All for naught, should you want your omlet well done.  The cook burned it and the owner told us we were too fussy.  Fuggetaboutit!  Plenty of other places that appreviate our business.
75657	933	2011-02-24	Char-Broil is where you go for pancakes after church, breakfast after the kids are in school, lunch when you don't feel like bothering with fancy places, or just where you want to go for comfort food." It's not open late, so the atmosphere is pretty much always family-oriented. If you can get the booth by the front plate glass window, you can watch Montclair go by and likely see someone you know every few minutes. Gus, the owner, and his crew are attentive without being up your butt and around the corner, the food is good, and the ambience is "Jersey diner." The fare is American with a strong Greek accent. You can get a cheeseburger (with Pepsi, of course, no Coke), or gyro, eggs over easy or baklava. I don't think any of the wait staff aren't related somehow to Gus and his family, but the result is solid service. What would I recommend? Hearty fare. The soups of the day are usually chicken noodle and something else, and the waitress will likely refill your soda if she knows you. Don't go here to cut calories-- you definitely want fries with that.

Love their corn! If it's crowded, as it always is, and you're in a rush, grab the corn at their take out counter next door (around the corner). Last time I was visiting NYC I went there 3 times in 5 days. Their website mentioned that they are opening a location in Malibu, CA. I can't wait!

I went on a jouney to find this place after 3 different Rock bands from NYC during SXSW tould me this is the spot to eat in NYC. I had my girlfriend mad at me and 7 people dragging feet following me. It was a smash hit this place is one of a kind and def worth a trip to the lower east side. I tried Everyones meal as

Unfortunately, this restaurant gets no stars from me as the most essential issue here is food cleanliness and cleanliness habits of its workers. I ordered a breakfast food that comes with toast - As I was waiting for the food order to be ready I observed one of the people behind the counter who prepares food lift up the rubber floor mat with her bare hands ( the one that everyone stands on while cooking) and move it over to another spot on the floor. I continued to watch her carefully as she walked doen the aisle, picked up 2 pieces of bread with bare hands and then proceeded to place them in the toaster. She failed to wash her hands and wear gloves before touching the bread. I recognized that this was my toast and I brought  the whole issue and breach to the manager's attention - no apologies at all but someone else handled the toast properly - so if you would like bacteria and god knows what else on your food you are welcome to take a chance at Munchies -  good luck

Nothing to crazy just pizza. Nothing that jumps in your face. Just a regular experience. I did like the tomato sauce. the fountain drinks were a bit flat. I would give them another shot because the staff was very kind.
Fantastic food, service and ambiance--and Brittany Spears a few tables away.

Came with foodie friends. The meatloaf and Mac and cheese were very tasty. The drinks, at least my Moscow mule, not so much. People liked the bloody Mary's. Pretty big, but had a brief wait even at a sort of random time. Friendly waitstaff.
Blossom has become my go to.  Great food, VG friendly service, clean, inviting decor.  The menu has standards,  but also a good deal of creativity. Give it a try.  You won 't be disappointed.

Had a mishap twice with the food that I ordered, once wait staffs mistake which they then sent a app to the table which was very well appreciated. Second time due to ingredients in dish that were not listed on the menu that I was allergic to. Found the concept of a communal drink odd. Ended up Sharing what my friend ordered schezuan chicken which was so good I can't wait to go back to order it again and have left overs the next day.

I've eaten a lot of falafel in my life on four different continents. Mamoun's is NOT the best falafel I've ever had, and I suspect it's also not the best available in New York City, despite the high praise you see on Yelp. For $2.50 you get a decent-sized late night snack. I don't like that they only have white flour pita, and I think the falafel pieces themselves were too salty, but you can't expect much at such a low price. There's no space in this location; there's seating for about 4 people at most, and the interior is pretty depressing, with drab and decaying wood paneling and fluorescent lights. Then again, this is a grab-and-go joint, so maybe that doesn't matter. It's a cheap option at 3 a.m. and I'm glad it's around. But I wouldn't go out of my way to eat at Mamoun's and I would suggest trying some other falafel places (I hear good things about Taim and Azuri's).

Everything was delicious especially the roasted brussels sprouts with apples, creme freche and pistachios. This is a tapas bar so the plates are small but just enough for each of the 4 of us to have a taste. We ordered quite a few different items and thoroughly enjoyed them all. The best surprise was the bill which came in at about $20 each not including wine! What a lovely evening!!

I went there with a friend from school for a late dinner. ranan noodle- I think they put too much fish sauce in it. shoe strings with wasabi mayo- it's ok cheese steak with spicy ketchup- yummy the duck and the filet - average Love the overpriced drinks here. wooo hooo

We had a lovely dinner here. The owners stopped by each table to check on everyone and they were warm and kind and approachable, we felt very taken care of. There was an unfortunate thing with some Tanguy C. from Cambridge who walked in doing that entitled thing, awkwardly bewildered that as a walk in he has to wait for a table. In New York City. On Saturday night. At 8. With 12 people. But they handled it gracefully. Oh and the cocktails are muy good. And the atmosphere makes you feel like, "yea its saturday night and i'm out." so that was good too.

I like this place a lot and the pizza lives up to all of the reviews. Simple and superior ingredients. The ambiance is great too. We live close and are glad to have this. But, The simplicity of the menu has grown to annoy me and it's chic ness has wore off. The menu is only pizza and calzones. A couple salads and pasta choices would go a long way. Cash only is also a pain. 3.5 stars if I could.

I ordered the Szechuan chili sauce with chicken. This is the real Szechuan deal and is very affordable for excellent Chinese food. The dish was delicious and super spicy. I highly recommend anyone who like this style of Chinese to check this place out.

These are without a doubt the best french fries I have ever had. I have become severely addicted to the fries and the nutella and strawberry cream cheese. The curry ketchup and the pesto mayo are a must try!

So for the price we paid, I didn't think this was THAT great.  This is not a cheap place, although the staff is super friendly and helpful and attentive.  We waited for an hour for a table for 6, the place was packed.  They were out of pork chops and mussels, both which we came specifically for!  The pork kebabs were suggested in place of the pork chops and they were OK.  The grilled calamari was recommended and it was overcooked and chewy.  The free dessert was nice and just being able to talk as a group, however it gets so loud in there we had to shout!

Incredible everything with 1981 prices and the family is the best.  Name any other bakery where the police set up traffic cones at least 2x per year, Easter and Christmas, to deal with the pickups...NAME ONE! I've been a lunch regular for 7 years, the best.
We stopped in one day for something sweet while walking around.  The place was busy, and the sandwiches looked awesome.  We grabbed a cookie and took it to go... Delicious.
The food was g8 but the guy working on july 22 2010 after 10pm was just plain nasty!!!!

We were leaving Princeton on our way to scenic York, Pa and needed a quick and tasty lunch... Pho 99 to the rescue! Here is what I noticed about Pho 99: They are a cash only establishment.  If you do not understand that by the time that you open the menu, it is your own fault and you deserve whatever kind of mocking and ridicule you receive.  Seriously, not understanding that this is a cash only establishment will make Darwin cry. For some reason it was really smokey inside.  It was a pleasant meat smoke, so that was nice, but it made for an interesting ambiance. The place did a steady business.  We were there from 1:30 until about 3, and they were doing serious table turns. That said, the pork and shrimp spring rolls?  A.MAZ.ING.  Really... they were that good.  Just get them. I got the first combination Pho... beef tendon, tripe, well-done beef, and the slice of raw meat.  I really enjoyed it.  The broth was tasty, the add ins were delightful, and the noodles were excellent.  Pile on the bean sprouts, thai basil, and limes, a touch of hosin, and a load of sriracha... and BAM! I was in heaven.   My wife had the chicken pho... and was quite pleased.  She also got an avacado shake that she has been raving about ever since.  Seriously, last night she was talking about it in her sleep. She is my gauge when it comes to Pho... we try and get our fix every few weeks, and if this place were closer it would be in the rotation. Ok, two big ole steaming bowls of Pho, shrimp and pork spring rolls, two diet cokes, and an avacado shake: $30 before tip.   I am a fan!

Wedding Reception Catered with Spot Burgers The SpOt truck (along with Pitruco Pizza) catered my wife and my wedding party at our home near Media, PA last weekend.  We and our 150 or so guests could not have been happier with SpOt.  Josh's gourmet burgers and hand made hotdogs were simply amazing and most guests went back for two, if only to try a different kind.  There are plenty of reviews on here about how great the burgers and hotdogs are. My purpose is to recommend SpOt for private events.     My wife and I first joked about having food trucks cater our wedding after looking at all sorts of caterers, food ideas, and prices and not liking any of them.  We didn't even know if Philly trucks would do private events when we googled "food truck catering Philadelphia."  We quickly found Josh at SpOt and came to a price (very reasonable), time, and options for burgers, hotdogs and sides over a few easy emails.  SpOt was incredibly accommodating and helpful.  And when Saturday arrived, Josh got to our party ahead of schedule, set up his truck in our yard, and immediately got to work. SpOt and Pitruco Pizza easily handled the 150 or so guests who raved about the food.  Together, they could have served 250 without a problem.  People loved the burgers and dogs.  The trucks enabled guests to get up and mix more than they would have otherwise.  Our guests had more fun becuase of the trucks.   While not black tie, this was not a casual event and there were very few children.  Our guests were in suits or jackets.  Yet SpOT and Pitruco were a perfect fit.  They were professional, courteous and skilled.  Guests (especially those from out of town) said things like: "Those people are serious about their food", "Josh is a true chef" and "This is so much better than a regular caterer".     Thanks again for helping us make Saturday a great day!  I hope that you found many new customers among our guests.  We are already thinking about another party with SpOt this summer or next year. Micah and Carrie.
We very much enjoyed the Breakfast Special.  The service was great and the food delicious!
Have you ever had fried green tomatoes?? yes, IT IS SO GOOD!!!! ALSO they make my favorite blueberry pancake!!!!

our meal was very good, though i can't say it was mind-blowing. we were seated ~20 minutes later than our reservation, which isn't that bad for 5 people on a friday night, but the table they gave us left one member sticking out into the aisle. 3 people bumped into his chair within a matter of minutes, and someone told the manager to move him. it was nice of them to do this, but i feel in a situation like this...at a restaurant like fork...something above and beyond needs to be done. at similar establishments (for example, zahav) the manager probably would comp an appetizer, and then after the meal, have talked to the table about their meal - not necessarily to apologize, but just make the table feel appreciated. this aside, do eat here, as it is one of philly's most beloved.

Love is a cafeteria Cosmo. Easy as that. Oh, and maybe some truffled Mac and cheese. That's love too. In all honesty this place is the best whether is 6 in the morning, 6 at night or some scary place In between this place has it all. Great drinks food and environment

Great place for reasonably priced takeout sushi. I've never dined in here, so I can't speak on the atmosphere but delivery is always prompt and the fish is always fresh. My favorite is definitely the sweet potato roll, delicious!!!
True authentic Mexican.  Food was great, loved the fresh guac made to order at the table.  Will definitely be back!
this place stole my heart. It reminded me of home so much..& not Miami but Israel. Everything is Kosher, the service is great and the food is to die for !

We went for brunch. Now the place was beautiful but they really pack you in. If your a New Yorker you are used to it. But I am from IL so for me it was pretty cramped.  The staff was very nice super friendly very informative and attentive. The food was so good. I had the Green Market Omelet and pomme frites. The omelet was so smooth and creamy it was nothing like I had ever had. And the pomme frites were like the best french frys in the world (Sorry fancy french people).

The pizza was merely ok, and the line was idiotic. If you must go go with 4 people, if you can't find 4 people don't go or recruit 2 extras when you get there. The old man apparently doesn't think much of parties of 2 and there ability to spend money. I would have felt the need to tip more, but our server was bad too. So if you must go, go with 4 people and be ready for ok pizza. There is better in town.
Excellent service - a rarity in nyc! Really nice decor. But best part of it all? Amazing pad thai!

I went in a few months ago and ordered the buffalo chicken on a wrap and I got it back to my office and it was on some thick bread which made it nasty.  So today hoping to give them another chance I ordered the meatball sandwich.  I asked her what bread do they have and she only gave me one option.  I got back to the office and sure enough I was told I could have gotten it on a wrap and not that disgusting thick bread again.  Last chance.  Never going back there again.  They are all brain dead there.  Also pretentious vibe there.

TRFESI BABY FRITES!!  I couldn't believe it!  Rudy's frites are almost as good as it gets, [obviously], but then I went home and read the entire Sunday Times.  That may seem odd, but I was never able to do it before.  You see, I suffer from the cruel disease, Dyslexia.  But after a day of eating their frites with various dipping sauces, I was able to finish the entire paper.  I personally attribute my recovery to the aioli-garlic and pesto-mayo.       Sure, the place, since the move, tends to be a bit too pro-Yale for my liking; but as I basically said, I wouldn't be able to write this without their frites and sauces.
Awesome pizza. Not sure if its worth the hype.

A great neighborhood bar with lots of beers on tap and great food.  The odd nautical themed decor is a bit tacky/cheesy, but who cares when everything else is great.  The place is pretty spacious so I never feel cramped and the food is soo good!  I love the mac and cheese, whch you can get made to order with a pretty sizeable selection of toppings.  I also LOVE the avocado fries.  I've never had them before but they're deliciously fried , super crispy, slices of avocado.   The staff is always friendly and the bartender was fast with drink orders.

Butterfly is my absolute favorite Chinese food in town. I love the items off the ever changing specials menu and recently they have Dim Sum specials and Chinese Broccoli. I find the food fresh and the service wonderful.  I have yet to have a bad experience at Butterfly.  I lived in China for over 2 years and spent a lot of time in Asia and Butterfly is the closest thing to being there.
Horrible place: smell bad, food disgusting and found hair in my roll I told the manager about the issue and he said it was coming from me Just avoid this place
Cheap pizza cheap ingredients!

This place is a miracle. My understanding is that most of the workers live in Staten Island or New Jersey, so tack on an extra star for commuter determination. The unfathomably good neopolitan pie provides a good starting point. Not quite crispy New Haven thin crust, not quite New York floppy, it's loaded with cheeses, including a dusting of pleasantly metallic Sysco-grade parmesan. The fresh whole basil leaves, added post-cooking so they barely begin to wilt, pull it all together. I'd rank the three other varieties thusly: 1. Artichoke (unlike its apparent spinach-and-artichoke dip inspiration in that all ingredients are discernible; shear weight of sauce slightly compromises the crust, but think of the dough as more of a sop) 2. Sicilian (top-rate sicilian, stronger tomato presence than the other pies) 3. Crab (cheese buries crab flavor; stiff on recent tasting; still OK, but only less-than-essential pie they make) Look. This is anti-effete pizza. Don't come here with your magnifying glass looking to inspect irregular air pockets. Anyone who thinks generously-topped pizza is a boorish American bastardization of an Italian dish knows nothing about Italian or American food.

I eat a variety of traditional korean meals everyday at home thanks to my  talented wife. However, the food at Seoul is simply delicious - the best I have had in New England  - sorry honey ;). The service at Seoul is excellent and friendly. I love the renovations they have made - the environment is warm and inviting. I will definitely be returning again and again. When I want a greater variety of korean food options I will head down to The City  but until then Seoul saves me a lot of traveling and sends me home smiling every time.

OUTSTANDING I have been to Amelie several times and have never been disappointed. Shout out to the staff as well who has consistently been super warm and friendly. The first time I just met a friend for a drink and after having several glasses of yummy wine expertly recommended by the bartender, I made a point to return.  Next time, I wandered over after dinner nearby for a sweet treat. We went for the Pavlova and my, that was good! The next couple of times I went on a double date and everything has always been on point. The chicken liver mousse will not disappoint,  and they will just keep bringing bread until you can finish it! The filet mignon has always been prepared perfectly and even the veggies are good. You will be asking for yet another basket of bread to sop up the last bit of sauce! Literally, you will be cleaning your plate. RE decor, the atmosphere is fun, almost whimsical. Seems like there are bubbles everywhere. Also, there is a general "red" theme going on, just FYI.
I really enjoyed the food and the service was very quaint.  I will def. go back when visiting NYC.  I would highly recommend it.

Omg the best seafood I've had in NYC. I came here on a double date during the weekday so there was no wait.  We were seated in the enclosed area with the heaters on the ceiling and be warned because those heaters are damnn hot. Ok so peasant salad and spanikopta were delicious and were just a starter for the main courses.  The four of us split the seafood mixed special which came with jumbo shrimps, 4 stuffed clams, sole, scallops and lobster tail.  They were grilled to perfection and not buttery or oily like some other seafood restaurants.  The lobster were so easy to pull off in one pull.  We also ordered the swordfish which was sooo delicious.  For the seafood platter we asked for lemon potatoes which were amazing and rice with the swordfish.  I was able to take a doggie back for lunch the next day. The waiter was really helpful and even gave us more rice for free. They have Greek beer-mythos and I enjoyed the white wine while my friend enjoyed the red wine.  For a seafood meal like this with wine I was happy with the price.  $27/per person including tip and tax.  Score!
Went there for dinner with a group of friends. Good ambiance, but the food was alright, nothing special. I would not recommend the fish and chips.

Great food, cozy and relax atmosphere, good service, what else can you ask for. Oh and there's one other thing that makes this place awesome, it's BYOB! I bring friends family and loved ones to this place everytime they visit coz I can't get enough of this place.

Great place to go at 3AM after a long night of drinking. Service is good almost everyone is nice. But there food is freezer burned. And cigarettes are nine bucks. Ehhhh just ehhh. But if you're within walking distance and your blacked out this is the place for you.

Our hotel is only like a block away from the RTM so we decided to come here for a late breakfast/early lunch.  We got there at 10 or so and sat at the counter.  Both my buddy and I ordered the roast pork sandwich with broccoli rabe and sharp provolone.  The sandwich was good...not great like I expected, but still very good.  The meat was hot and had a good pork flavor, the rabe was a little bitter and it had a great garlicky punch to it. The sharp provolone was a nice added touch.  One thing about that though....On Man vs Food etc, they show them carving off chunks of cheese from a block of provolone.  They did not do that here.  I saw them pick up sliced cheese and put it on the sandwich.  The flavor was still great but it was different than what I expected.  The bread they use was pretty good too.  It got a little soggy but still held up well.  I'm glad I got to try this place.  If I ever go back I might try something else...I'm more in the cheesesteak/hoagie clan than roast pork clan.  The lady serving us was very friendly.  My buddy liked it a little more than I did.  You cant go wrong though if you stop here and grab something to eat.  Its pretty good but there are better sandwiches in Philadelphia.

Back on track at Giorgio's for sure...went the other night and everything was amazing like I had usually expected until a few lackluster appearances the past couple visits. There was a large crowd, but that added to the atmosphere and it was fun. The food was top notch and we all loved every bite to say the least. Giorgio was walking about as usual and he's a trip...great owner who likes to invite people back again and again. Do yourself a favor and head down here anytime ya can!

One of the best lunch options in Princeton. It's a real hidden gem, since the store itself is far down on Nassau, and the outside looks like a fish market, not a place that serves cooked food. It wasn't until I randomly wandered in one day that I found out that it sold to-go at the back of the store. They prepare everything for you at your request. Lunch is fantastic. A Po-Boy or fish sandwich and fries for $10. I'd willingly shell out an extra buck or two to get something better than a Panera Bread sandwich. There's no seating, but when the weather's nice, who cares? Find a bench (there are plenty), or take your lunch somewhere else (umbrellas outside of Panera, maybe). Still the usual complaint: it's undeniably pricey for fish retail. The average cut of fish will cost at minimum $15. But the variety is incredible: swordfish, monkfish, all sorts of oysters, clams, and local goods- vegetables, fruits, and dairy, all inside. I wish I found out about this place earlier. I wouldn't have wasted so much on generic Panera food or pizza.

As a Pennsylvanian I've been to Philly countless times but I never really experienced the best cheesesteaks the city had to offer (and I've eaten a lot of them). My friend and I roll up into this sketchy area of Philly to find John's Roast Pork. The reason I call it sketchy was because we were both uncomfortable leaving the car. We were shocked that it was near closing time (3:30 on a Saturday!?) so they only had a limited selection of items. We wanted cheesesteaks but settled for getting 2 small roast beef sandwiches. The staff was very nice and they worked our order quickly, however there was confusion behind the counter because when my order was ready another customer snatched our food and started leaving the establishment! It was embarrassing having to tell the man that those weren't his sandwiches, but I feel like this could have been prevented by actually putting the food in my hands. We took the food outside to eat. The sandwiches were nice and warm but the entire bottom half of the roll was SOGGY due to the copious amounts of Au Jus. The cheese which ran along the bottom of the roll was wet and tasteless. The meat was stuffed sky high (which was great) but it had a weird bite to it. The whole time I could tell my friend was trying to quell my visible disappointment by saying "it's still pretty good." I wanted to save writing a review for this place once I tried a cheesesteak, but I won't be back in Philly for over a year. PROS: Quick, easy, filling, great staff CONS: Poor atmosphere, soggy sandwiches, rather overpriced, closes early, cash only (inconvenient)

If you're craving flakey juicy salt crusted fish, this is your jam.  So many different fish to choose from, many that I'd never heard of, cooked to Mediterranean perfection.  Was with a group of four.  Started with the grilled octopus ("the best in Philly" the waiter said -- good but wouldn't say best), and a side of hummus and warm pita.  Sides are ordered a la carte -- a thick cut fall vegetable medley and asparagus with feta crumbles.  And the fish..... ((((drooling))))  Space is large, but tables feel intimate.  Good place for a date or a bit more formal/businessy of a dinner than with friends.  Pricey place, but fortunately it was treated.  :)
Excellent pizza and good price!

Went there randomly to meet a friend of a friend's friends.  Yeah...  Anyway, it was better than expected.  A bit of a divey/diner-ish feel?  They had a magazine cover of Goldie Hawn on the wall and a bunch of Philly sports photos.  Hm?  However, the menu ended up being a touch more upscale than I thought with some veggie options for my veggie friends.  We got the hot tofu bites.  The sauce was quite nice and everyone enjoyed it!  I had pulled pork with a nice fresh side salad with tasty balsamic dressing.  People also got the fish tacos and cheese plate, it all looked good.  Plus they had Kenzinger on $3 special for the Phils game.  Had a blast.
What friendly staff and owners.  We order pizza from here for parties and events.  They rock.

The general manager at Cici's North Brunswick is STELLAR! So hospitable, warm and welcoming. Fun, fast and easy food at a terrific price. The cinnabuns are to die for (I do NOT want to know the calories). Great place for kids as well with a fun play area with video games in the back. Stay, eat, and relax as long as you like. Definitely a fun little joint in North Brunswick. Would recommend to a cash conscious person!

Decent sushi. What I really like about this place is that 1) They're open throughout the day 2) They have free delivery 3) Prices aren't ridiculous I've tried the california roll, spicy salmon, alaska, soft shell crab (not enough crab) and ocean's brother (lobser topping was kind of tasteless) rolls. The salmon quality isn't superb but you get what you pay for I guess. I'm from London, Ontario and I'm still looking for a sushi place here that can match the level of Gozen. The 3-roll special is a good value if you choose well. I will continue to order from here when I'm too busy with work/school. I also have yet to try any of the non-sushi items.

Fried calamari was good. You can tell their sauce is homemade, because even on my eggplant parm it was good. My husband and I both got half portions. Eggplant was good, but I had a couple pieces that were tough and tasted funky. He got veal piccata and liked it, but it only came with 2 very thin slices. They really skimped out. What's with restaurants not putting capers in piccata dishes anymore? Strange.

I felt that my first yelp review should be about a restaurant that I could never get sick of. Jamonera is a restaurant perfect for all occasions. I've been with a friend who was visiting, with my boyfriend, for New Years Eve dinner. Every time I'm equally impressed. The staff are extremely knowledgeable, but never pushy or annoying, and the food is impeccable. I've discovered my favorite wine, and some of my favorite dishes. The food seems familiar, but with a unique and delicious twist. The space is cozy, not too dark or too loud, and I've walked in with no reservation and sat at the bar with no problem. Some of my favorites: Crispy cana de cabra Seared sea scallops Lucio's dirty egg Gambas al ajillo Bunuelos- spanish donuts to die for In my opinion, you can't go wrong with anything at Jamonera. I will be back again and again.
One word. NO! Don't waste your time or $.
So crowed and loud. It used to be good izakaya. However their service and food are not the best anymore

I love this place!  I took some friends this past Saturday night and had my usually oysters, Yummy cheese fondue and then of course the ravioli.  My friends both had the fried chicken and was that to die for.  The only thing I would say they need to buy bigger martini glasses, those are the smallest glasses I have ever seen.  I would recommend just getting a glass of wine or a regular drink..
Great burgers, great fries, great sauces, and phenomenal service.

Yes, just yes. This place blew my mind and my boyfriend's mind. The food here is incredible. I had the tomato basil soup as an app, the bacon crusted swordfish for dinner, as well as the s'more for dessert. My boyfriend had the heirloom tomato and buffalo mozzarella salad as an app, the rib-eye steak for dinner, and the summer thyme for dessert. Every dish we had was extremely flavorful (and we each shared with one another!) and filling. We loved it and will definitely be going back next time we are in Philly! Also, I have to give a shout out to the chef's homemade salt and honey butter. Are you kidding?! That is the best butter I've ever had! One thing I wish they had, a wider selection of bubbly! The wine menu in General was extensive but unfortunately they only had one sparkling wine option. The atmosphere of the ship is amazing both inside and outside. You really feel as though you are on an extravagant ship journey! Moshulu you rock!

went to the grand opening of kickshaw today and it didnt disappoint! although the line was all the way to the door, i really enjoyed myself there. i got the Gouda:  gouda, with toasted brioche, black bean hummus, sweet guava jam, and tangy pickled jalapeños. my gf got the mozzarella and shredded cheddar sandwich. i really liked my gouda sandwich. i love the mix if the salty cheese with the sweetness of the jam. the mozz/cheddar was also great. super thick bread with gooey cheese. the one thing i didnt like all too much was the bread. it felt like it was dipped in butter. i love butter and you definitely need it on the outside of the bread so it gets nice brown and crunchy. but both of our sandwiches were transparent from all the butter. it was way too greasy. the is the ONLY thing i didnt like about our sandwiches. i am definitely a fan and plan on going back time and time again for my grilled cheese fix. i hope they lessen the use of butter just a tad bit. hopefully, they will add some savory items to the menu. i can just picture a hot grilled cheese with some pulled pork or some other tasty meat in it. that would be awesome.
Delicious brunch!  I got the farm scramble.  it was so delish.  Coffee was very strong (I like that!).  My husband got the lobster eggs benedict, he LOVED it.  Great brunch!

I had a late lunch with a friend the other day and I loved it. For New York, and Chelsea in particular, the pricing was decent and the portions were more than satisfactory. There are no reservations needed for lunch. The staff seated me and despite my friend getting lost and turning up 40 minutes later they never pressured me to order anything or bothered me much at all. I just had one drink while I waited. The staff was very friendly which is something I find is missing at a lot of places in NYC these days. You never felt ignored but you never felt smothered either. The only real downside to the place was it was a tad loud but it didn't interfere with having a conversation at normal volume at your table. Overall the place was nicely decorated and with the open doors and outdoor seating it was very light. Now, onto the food. I heard the mac and cheese was unmissable and when I realized they had three kinds (Chedder and Fontina, Smoked Gouda and Bacon and Truffle Oil) I was excited to see they had the "Mac Attack!" which was a sample of all three. There was enough to share for the two of us but I could have eaten it all myself it was so good. If you only pick one I recommend the Truffle Oil. After this I had the Watermelon Salad and my friend had the Shaved Artichoke Salad. Even though they were not an "Entree Salad" they were more than happy to size them up for an entree. They also added chicken breast to my friends with no problem and only a very small additional cost. For dessert we split the Deep Fried Oreos and Peanut Butter Cheesecake Pops. Both were great and again in fairly large portions yet not too filling. The end cost for two of us ordering an appetizer, two salads sized up to entrees and two desserts came to a little under 100 bucks. Depending on what you order I would say it's great for a quick lunch out or taking someone special someWHERE special. Will definitely go again.
As other reviewers have noted, the service can be hit or miss. The food has always been delicious though. Great burgers and the salads are worth a shot too.
His food is ALWAYS very fresh, creative, and absolutely delicious! I'm never dissappointed. This cart is definitely a must try!

Very Excited for this place to open. My Wife and I are BIG TIME pizza fanatics and Montclair has needed a place like this. I also went in on Sunday when I was on my way into elevation burger. The staff gave me a free slice of a margarita pie with supersatta and it was RIDICULOUS. I went in again today to see if they had open, and the owner told me how meticulous they were with picking their ingredients and getting the right equipment (the wood oven was imported from Naples). Seriously, I can already tell this is gonna be a huge hit!

I could get used to the service here! Amazing! We ventured over to Bleu Sushi thanks to a wonderful Groupon and brought some Pinot as it is BYOB. It had a good crowd for a Tuesday night and is on a lively block. We told our server it was our first time here and he brought us on the house kimchi fries! WHICH WERE AMAZING. Also ordered veggie dumplings, teriyaki chicken, and a variety of sushi. Everything was great, def some of the best sushi I've had in the city. The owner came to meet us during our stay, which was so nice! Such a kind person and he really seemed to enjoy the restaurant business and providing a great experience for his patrons. Thanks so much for the superstar service!!!!!! Definitely coming back here.

The food here makes this one of the better options in Manhattan for the broader Chinese genre. Malay cuisines have always been a great mix of different regions from East and Southeast Asia, and Nyonya executes this pretty well. The Hainan Chicken is always one of my favorite dishes anywhere. While this particular place doesn't have the best, it's certainly passable as good. We ordered a few other dishes, and I thought it was all fairly tasty. The prices here are great, but do note that they accept only cash or check, so carry one or the other when you visit.
The food was as bland as the decor I have had better Italian food at a pizza parlor try Mr Brunos or Turanos in lyndhurst
Nori would have to be my all time fav. If someone bad mouthed the joint there might be a street brawl. try the lunch combo... best 13 bucks youll ever spend.

Havent been here at night and im not from philly, but  the only 3 things To do in philly is get a cheesesteak from pats, the rocky steps, and get brunch here. Service is slow and a lil tude always lowers the gratuity, but the food selection and quality definitely makes up for phillys lack of amusement.   the Silk brunch salad was a little bland but last time i had the corn beef hash and that was very flavorful.   also the outside patio is nice especially hung over sunday morning!! Michelle the bartender outside is hot!
Love Love Love. Everything was amazing!!!!!!

Fantastic experience from start to finish. Best eggs benedict I have ever had, awesome service. Fairly casual atmosphere. Don't come expecting an intimate dining experience, but it's great for meeting friends for a nice meal. Definitely recommend making reservations - otherwise the wait for a table could be a bit lengthy.
Visit #1: Brisket on Rye: 5 stars Visit #2: Pastrami on Rye: 4+ stars Many visits after that: always good.  Nice people. Great sandwiches. Good price.
Fantastic concept! Delicious food & the best cappuccino in the city. The downside is the crowd of tourists that always flock to the place, best to go during off hours, lunchtime is overpacked.

I have been to this restaurant several times now and each has been with a large group. They are very accommodating, I made changes to the numbers right up to the last minute. I love the back room because it makes it feel like we were a private party even though there are several other tables near by. The food and service are outstanding. I highly recommend this restaurant, and the bar is a lot of fun too. The bartender made us a special shot that everyone loved! I will most certainly be coming back.
Im a huge fan of indian food. This is a amazing place fresh full of flavors great variety and filling.  I cime here 4 times a month.  Yes

Yes, De MOLE.  Love (love) the carne asada burrito.  Honestly, I crave it once per week.  My boyfriend would eat it everyday if I let him.  I always get the burritos with black beans.  They also have a mean strawberry shake!  Fresh and tasty!  Come for breakfast too; it's yummy!  I really need to try other things on the menu, but I can't give up that tasty burrito!

Beware high star reviews.  These folks are holding on to an idea of this place that no longer exists. When this cafeteria style restaurant opened  the food was above average.  Fast forward about 6 months and they started to slip.  They obviously changed their bread supply.  It used to be really good NY style bread for their sandwiches.  Now I think they must be going to the mid-west to get their spongey, somewhat stale and tasteless bread.  Same goes for the onion rings.  When the placed open they were these huge rings with a great batter.  The onion rings are now crap.  They are using supermarket ramen noodles.  The salad bar has often had a weird compressed fish cake thing masquerading as shrimp. My guess is there have been some cost cutting changes made.  Too bad that means sub-par food.  Now there will be loss of business from customers that were used to a higher standard. The one thing that set fork & spoon apart from the multitude of similar establishments in the neighborhood was the higher quality food.
Staff is nice.. food is decent. Has a nice beer selection.

So after having eaten here about four times with different people, its time to write a review. The food is good.  Its consistent.  Its never terrible but its never as great as it could be.  Lots of good concepts and some amazing hits, but too many misses, and normally with their more expensive dishes, which really bothers me.  The pastas are always good and I have had some great apps here, but some of the fish and chicken entrees and specials have disappointed the last two times.  That said, its still a good restaurant. BUT.....  I cannot deal with the weekend wait and on the weekend is when I have time to go out to dinner!  I don't have time to wait outside nor do I want to now that winter and the dark are here.  I also don't feel like having to go to a bar to kill time.  If I wanted to pay top dollar for drinks, would I be utilizing BYOB's?   All in all a good restaurant and would go on a Tuesday night, but there are equally good restaurants in the area without the wait on the weekends!

As a regular at the food truck I was so excited for this brick and mortar and I've been waiting for this to open for months now... and it's even better! We ordered the arepa de queso and arepa de choclo con pollo. They were both delicious (as to be expected) and dare I say that the arepa de choclo was better here than at the food truck?! They still make everything to order so it tends to take a little longer than at other takeout places, and it's still the same lady who cooks the arepas, as at the stand (and the same guy who grills the meat). She stepped out for a second and she waved at us since she knows us by now :) If you went to the food cart, you'll see familiar faces. They have bar seating and table seating, and they still serve on those tiny paper plates but they use these small baskets to serve the meal with utensils when you order to stay. I still prefer to eat with my hands! It's small but cozy, oh and BYOB. Suffice to say, I am so happy for them! They serve only the best arepas in town!

As someone who appreciates Mexican food (geez, I even enjoy a Taco Bell now and again!), I've been dying to try this restaurant.  Hubby and I visited this past weekend.  We arrived earlier than our 6:00 pm reservation, and we were promply seated in the large, empty dining room.  That changed quickly as the restaurant was filling up by 6:30 pm, so I would definitely recommend reservations!  Tables are close  together, so it's tough having any kind of an intimate conversation and it was quite noisy in the restaurant.  Actually, the bar area and surrounding tables were much more quiet!  Next time, I'll request a table in that general vicinity vs. the dining room. I had a glass of their pino grigio house wine (OK, nothing to rave over), and hubby had his standard Bombay Saphire + Gin.  (We're not tequila lovers!).  The chips + salsa that are complimentary are excellent.  You actually don't need to order an appetizer, but we did.  I don't recall the name of it, but it was a flour tortilla stuffed with chicken and cheese and covered in a red sauce.   It wasn't that good (it wasn't terrible either), but I think next time I'll go with the quacamoles!~ I had the "Camarones Rellenus" which are large shrimp stuffed with mexican cheese and wrapped in bacon.  They were done perfectly and were served piping hot with a side of rice and veggies.  The dish was very good and well-prepared, my only suggestion would be to serve a sauce with the shrimp as they needed a little extra "somethin'-somethin" that I couldn't quite put my finger on.  Hubby had a special, which was grilled shrimp, served with crab-stuffed calamari in some kind of sauce with the side of rice.  He liked the taste of the dish, but said it wasn't served hot enough. We ended the meal with dessert - the crepes with french vanilla ice cream covered in a lucious carmel sauce.  Really delicious, but it was small - too small to share.  I hate a taste and sweet-tooth-hubby ate the bulk of it.  The coffee was excellent, smooth and robust without the tart aftertaste a strong coffee often has. I liked this place, I didn't love it (and I so wanted to love it!), but I will definitely visit again.
