Needless to say, it was one of the best things I'd had in awhile despite its rather simple-sounding name. On both occasions, a friend ordered sauteed drunken noodles with chicken. One loved them, while the other was not impressed with what she believed would be "Thai spiciness," nor was she impressed with the $9 price tag. For dessert-to-go, I indulged in a $3 "Kao Neo Tad." With coconut cream, custard, salty sticky rice, and a bean topping, it was truly fabulous and very unusual to me. The rice, dense as a cheerleader, was topped with a snow white coconut paste that melted in the mouth. Right next to it, nestled in the container, was a tan-colored, coconut-y and gelatinous custard with a slight egginess that tasted even better when paired with the slightly salty rice. I must try their other desserts, and you should too! With most of them at $2.50 for ample portions, it's impossible to go wrong with their endless variety of custards, jellies, and confections. As far as the service and atmosphere are concerned, they couldn't be better. The servers can speak English and are attentive, pouring water as if their own arms were faucets. Knowledgable of what's on the menu, they're great at giving recommendations (and warnings) for those unsure of what to get. Despite the huge flat screen tv, the place has a cool, clean vibe that is spacious but never feels entirely empty. Luckily for me, I've only come when it isn't crowded, and haven't dealt with what I heard are interminable waits. I cannot wait to come back and try the plethora of desserts, as well as some of the more unusual dishes on the menu. The Cha-om omelet seems fascinating (at least the extremely helpful picture menu makes it seem so). An update as of 2/8/08: I purchased three more desserts. One was sweet sticky rice topped with a magenta-colored, garlic and parsley-zinged bushel of shredded coconut: divine and assertive. Fried onion atop a coconut cream custard proved indistinguishable, but I still enjoyed this treat warmed up for breakfast. A stick of preserved durian paste was an experience I hope never to get involved in again.

This is by far my favorite to-go pizza in an area that is inundated with pizza. The grandma's pie and the Neopolitan pie are my two favorites...my wife and I order from there just about every Friday night and we are never disappointed. Also, check out their ham and cheese calzone.... It is delicious!!!
Breakfast is best in Upper Valley!!!!!

This is my first yelp review ever as I had to create an account to rave about the King of Falafel and Shawarma cart on Broadway.  They are located a few blocks from the school I work at on the way home and the delicious smell of that cart plagues me every day. I had their beef and chicken plate (Freddy Junior) and found it tasty but it does not compare to their Chicken and Rice. That plate is money. The mix of rice (either basmati or yellow) with Chicken, salad, tomatoes, pickled turnips along with their hot sauce and white sauce it the most amazing combination. Top that off with a delicious falafel and you just can't go wrong. I've had my share of falafel carts and this is by far the best. In addition, Freddy is amazingly friendly and has a great memory. I saw him greet a customer that hadn't stopped by in a year! That's how devoted he is to his customers. Not to mention, I work for a non-profit organization and he was so excited to do community service work. So if you're looking for a place to eat, go to the King of Falafel and Shawarma. Big portions, big taste, and big hearts.
Great restaurant. Waiters are on point and steak was phenomenal as well as the whole Clove of garlic. Small but tasteful interior decor.
This place is #1 in NY and NJ for its Pizza.  NJ has #2, #3 with Pizza Vita in Summit and Godfather in East Hanover.
I will have to say VERY impressed that the owner himself got involved with my issue & offered us a refund or free pizza.  Great business sense & will deff try this place again.
Oh my god this place is why I'm getting fat. All I can really say is this: pasta, chocolate, gelato, pasta, chocolate gelato. PASTACHOCOLATEGELATO. Aaaaaaand now I'm fat.

My wife and I somehow managed to wake up on time to make it for brunch.  I called in to make a reservation at 1:30PM, but they said that the only reservation available was at 11:45AM (it was already 11:20 at the time).  We were about 15 miles away but we some how made it.  They seated us relatively quickly considering how packed the restaurant was. I ordered the prime rib benedict and my wife had the lobster benedict. Both dishes were awesome but I would have to say that the lobster benedict had the upper hand.  The strawberry butter with the bread basket was great and so was the fresh squeezed orange juice. I would return in a heart beat if I had the opportunity.  Just remember.... brunch in new york sucks before 12PM on Sunday. Alcohol can not be legally sold until this time.

The setting is pretty well described by others--hipster hip. So if you like that, you'll probably love this. If you don't, you know what you're in for! Totally fine for a morning coffee, and food was good. We were staying right next door for a few days and didn't experience any crowds, but perhaps we were hitting it on off hours. Others have commented it was pricey: sure, but you're in a hipster coffee shop in NYC! Minor comment was that it was too cold inside (this was summer, with AC blasting) for me to sit and enjoy properly. The staff were really nice. Someone else called them Brits--I think they're Aussies? I liked that you could get cortados and a couple other drinks not as common in the US.

I am from Paris(France) and i live in New York... This restaurant is one of the best where i ve been: Crepes are amazing, the crepes with cheese; potatoes; mushrooms....etc... or nutella crepes, bananas....lot of choice! Even in Paris (France) I've never tasted crepes like that. in addition the price is really cheap, the service is friendly, the decor is warm. Really if you want to try the french cooking, go there, you will be addict like me!

My husband and went to Santucci's last Sunday.  We shared a Farmer's Salad (really good), each had the spaghetti and meatballs, and finished the meal off by sharing the creme brulee for dessert (only $3!).  I enjoyed the experience so much that I chose Santucci's for my birthday dinner last night.  Unfortunately, this turned out to be a bad idea.  We got the Farmer's Salad again, but the quality of the lettuce wasn't so good this time.  My husband got a small order of Buffalo Chicken wings.  He said that the quality of the chicken was good, but that the wings tasted like fried chicken rather than Buffalo Chicken.  We both got the spaghetti and meatballs again, and those dishes were fine. What really soured me on the whole experience, though, was a service issue.  I ordered a creme brulee for dessert.  A couple who were sitting two tables away overheard me and later asked their waitress (a different one from ours) "Do you really have creme brulee?"  When their waitress told them yes, they said that they were in a hurry and asked if they could have a creme brulee to go.  Their waitress told them that, unfortunately, the creme brulee could not be made to go.  Well, my creme brulee was ready and I saw it sitting on the serving counter.  The other couple's waitress picked it up and said "Well, we just happen to have a creme brulee ready if you want it now," and she served my dessert to the other couple.   I didn't make a scene because it wasn't the other couple's fault, but I did question my waitress about what happened, and she just blew it off.  She kept telling me that my creme brulee was just about ready, but I ended up waiting 20 minutes for it -- way too long even if they hadn't hijacked my dessert to give to someone else. I'm always very patient when it comes to restaurant service, but I can't tolerate it when they serve people out of order.  This is the very definition of what I call bad service.
Hell Yeah -- 12 varieties of unlimited Sangria with Brunch.  Catch up with your girls.  Follow it up with a nap on the Great Lawn and you have a great Summer Sunday.
Unreal sandwiches , nice atmosphere
The pizza was delllllicious. And they served me even though I came in at closing time.

Love this place! Its great for groups and everything is good to share family style. The atmosphere is modern mediterranean and the place is hopping on a Saturday night. I highly recommend the octopus and hummus and the Iili Candy Bar was TO DIE FOR - one of the best desserts I've had in NYC to date.

Bobby's Burger Palace is the go-to spot for a bangin' burger and fries. I personally have gotten the topless burger (any burger put over spring mix salad rather than a bun) and the Bobby Bleu burger, crunchified. When I got the topless burger, I got the California and it was delicious and fresh - it's the perfect light meal. The Bobby Bleu is another story. It's piled high with toppings (especially when crunchified) and the bacon/bleu cheese combination is perfect. Jeff was a huge fan of the Philadelphia burger and raved about it quite a bit. He regretted getting his burger crunchified (i.e. with the standard Lay potato chip on top). Really, crunchifying isn't all that and a bag of chips (pun intended). The condiments are great. I'm a huge fan of the chipotle ketchup. The burgers aren't really that big either - you get more toppings than you get actual meat. The fries are mediocre and a la carte. So while the price of the burger seems reasonable (around $7/8 a burger) that includes ONLY the burger, so it's not really a deal. Then, an order of fries includes only a few of them, and they really aren't all that good. To me, they didn't seem fresh, neither did the buns (However, Jeff says his bun was delicious). The sauce that comes with the fries was not very flavorful at all. Overall, go for the burgers, not the fries. We also got a black and white milkshake - also not extremely impressive. It was a little too sweet and it's a pretty small milkshake for the (roughly) $5 price. In sum, we were happy when we left.

Whenever I go to this side of town, I try to plan it around when this market will be open.  It's basically just a large, indoor market where a lot of people working in this part of town will come for lunch and to grab some goodie groceries and a few knick knacks to go.  There's so much though it's easy to get distracted so if you're on a time limit, go in with a plan.  But there are a lot of fresh produce, specialty stands (everything from cheese, chocolates and meats to soaps,) and Bassets ice cream so it has everything I need in life to be happy (and clean).  I think I used to think it was kind of expensive, but after nearly 5 years in CA and shopping SF markets, I don't think so anymore.    :')

Bondurants is an absolutely lovely, charming, and chill spot to have a drink and some small bites. This place is slightly off of the beaten path (read: the cacophony of 2nd Avenue, its shenannigans, and the dreadful omnipresent subway construction), and that works to its advantage. At 5:30 on a Friday afternoon, it was already pretty full but some co-workers and I, much in need of a Friday Happy hour, were able to grab two tables in the rear near the bathrooms. The completely opened front allowed a lovely breeze and light to come through and illuminate the dark wood interior. The list of beers and whiskeys was more than impressive, with 24 rotating beers on tap. The cocktail list was small yet extremely interesting; while a drink with saffron-infused gin did sound tempting on a warm summer afternoon, I could not deny the call of the Hopped Apple from Woodchuck! (A wise choice, the the way...) The food here is great and there wasn't a single item I even thought was mediocre. Between the group, we split IPA Fries, fried pickle spears, and fried green tomatoes. The two later items came with a sriracha-infused aioli; I'm not a spicy foods lover, but it had a nice low and pleasant burn to it that complimented each item rather than burn your tastebuds off. Separately, I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich. The waiter came out and apologized that it was not plated better; one sandwich slice slipped. No matter to me! The beau, who showed up for a drink as well, jokingly commented to me, we thought out of earshot of the waiter, "How is this going to affect your Yelp review?" About thirty seconds later, the waiter came back with napkins and said, "Those are the scariest words a person working in a restaurant can here." Haha! We all had a good laugh. Clearly, the slipped slice of grilled cheese did not affect this review in any way, because it was damn delicious with its three kinds of cheese sandwiched between thick and well-buttered slices of white bread. I absolutely adore this place! It's a nice and stress-free post-work option on the Upper East Side with great food and drink. Total winner!

If You Like HYPE, then you've come to the right place. Unfortunately  the food speaks for itself and tells a different story: Overpriced, dry, lumps of meat plus bad service to boot. How it works: Line up at the counter and move down the line to get your meat then grab a seat along the other side against the wall. Decor is bare-bones so at least you don't need to dress up. Shovel the meat down and move on cause people will be waiting for yout able. Oh, and the service is less than bare bones (I guess the wait staff isn't eating at Delaney). Spoiler: on Fridays-Sunday they let the people who "supported them" in early at 6:00pm. So by the time they officially open at 6:30pm the tables are already full and you will be waiting outside in the cold. But this is Williamsburg and there's actually tastier places you can go for your meat fix. If the hype still has it's hold on you and you muuust....gooo---toooo--Deee--lllaaaa--neeey bbquuuu (in zombie voice) then I hear the Walking Dead is always looking for extras.

After countless visits, I'm fairly certain that I've tried nearly everything on the menu and worked my way through at least half of the wine list.  Although it is best to go here with a large group so you can try more dishes in one visit, don't underestimate it's value for a glass of wine and a snack after work.  Favorites are the tortilla and the cocas, but I will never leave without having the stuffed lamb chops--best thing on the menu!
Tip top service round out a decent brunch menu. The black label burger was expensive, but a meaty experience I don't regret. (I will try the lower priced option next time.) A cool place.

Not a fancy restaurant, but offer decent food. Good for quick lunch. Some dinner dishes are nice too. Some of our favorites are the beef noodle soup, pork chop noodle soup, lamp pot, and lotus root with squid.

Nice little local joint. I live in the neighborhood and it is a welcome additon. Gnocchi was very light but sauce could have used a little more flavor. Overall food was satisfying.Good for a nice low key dinner almost-at-home. Our waitress was very friendly.

Can't say enough about how wonderful Uva is. It was my first visit - but won't be my last! The service was tremendous from the get-go - The bartender, Phil, the hostess, our waitress, the entire wait staff - all so attentive and helpful. The food was delectable. My favorite dishes were the duck, scallops, and tuna tartare - and you can never go wrong with any of their homemade pastas!
Best Roti Canai in NYC! Try the fresh coconut drink as well. Awesome!

We had a taste for latin food and read the great reviews for this restaurant on yelp so we called to see if we could get in - we called at 7 pm on Saturday night. The woman said if we come over now we could get in before the reservations they had. Since we live down the street we were there in 5 minutes. When we arrived she told us it would be a half hour wait. Apparently things changed in 5 minutes?!? We mentioned the call and she made up some story of how it all of a sudden got packed and a lot of reservations were coming in. She said we can have a drink at the bar - we don't  drink so we stood in the front and waited, slightly annoyed with her. This man, who seemed to be her boss, came in and greeted us and talked to her quietly. She then seated quickly; seemed like her authority was quickly taken away. Once we were seated we were treated like kings. It's a lively place with an artsy Mexican decor, cute masks on the wall, beautiful sconces throughout, dimly lit - very attractive space that made it a comfortable place to have a meal in. We had two waiters who obviously know how to take care of their customers. I was introduced to Manuel - he was awesome! I'll always remember how he carried a bear bottle and wine bottle on his head to his tables - the balance he has is truly amazing. He made us feel like we were having a meal in his family's kitchen and it was a pleasure to serve us, what a nice change, hardly ever seen in the restaurant world anymore! The food was spectacular! We had guacamole and queso fondio con chorizo served with the best homemade chips and corn tortillas - very tasty starters! For our meal I had a chicken dish with refried beans and cheese and a green tomato sauce, superb - can't wait to have it again! My companion had the special - shorts ribs in a red sauce, twice baked potato and veggies. We split a tres leches with chocolate dessert that melted in my mouth. GREAT FOOD!   This restaurant hit a home run on the staples of Mexican cooking, so glad it's down the street so we can go as often as we want!

their brunch is the best ever...steak and eggs were cooked exactly as ordered, and the french toast melts in your mouth w/ the perfect amount of sweetness and crisp... we also went there for dinner once, and both entrees were superb...the duck confit was so good i wanted a second plate... i have ordered delivery from them twice, a chicken sandwich and a burger...both were ok...

On a cold, snowy night a few weeks before Christmas, we stumbled into Tony's, weary of the wait and expecting it to be a tourist over-priced sub par restaurant. We were pleasantly surprised. The wait was 45 minutes.. But after spending hours getting pelted with ice, it was a nice environment to be in. It is a family- style restaurant and everything was delicious. On an extremely crowded evening, the only down side is it's loud and you're sitting elbow to elbow with other tables.. but it seems to go along with the italian family style of the restaurant. I can't recall the exact dish we ordered but it is a great place for groups, families, birthdays, etc.. wonderful environment & very fun. It was just two of us so we decided on a meal, everything else was a la carte. The dish was something like chicken in a tomato bisque with shrimp.. delicious. I was surprised how affordable it was. The pitcher of sangria was also great along with the dessert. We were even more pleased with seeing the bill which was very reasonable. They haven't taken advantage of their location right off Times Square, an area obviously bustling with tourists.. even chain restaurants like TGI Friday's & Red Lobster practically double their prices due to their location. I would highly suggest to anyone looking for a pleasant experience in NYC. It even seemed as though there were plenty of locals and repeated, recognized customers which also goes to say how consistently appeasing this place must be. (I do have to mention I did not feel well after dinner but I think it was a combination of our meal and it was so good I'm hoping that's all it was.. hopefully no one else had the same experience! I will see next time as we are sure to visit again.)
I am not a big fun of Dinner , but this place is the best service is good , prices alright
I went for dinner had the best filet that I have ever had. The tavern had a good vibe and my sever joy was great. the beers on tap were all very good. I had the brownie and its not be missed.

Good food, but severely overrated.   I went there with several other friends and waited more than an hour to finally sit down to food that was nothing special in my view.  The taste of the food (which we shared) was no different from any other fairly good restaurant in the city.  I was expecting something a little different, but it fell short of being original.   Portions were small and prices were a bit high, but within the normal pricing standards of NY restaurant.  One meal that I found tasty was the duck.  It was cooked very well and had a thin crispy skin that had a wonderful texture in your mouth complimenting the moist duck itself.  I highly recommend that, if anything. If you do go, definitely order apps or a larger portioned meal to satisfy your gut.  Expect long waits for larger groups.
Good food, great staff. Our server Doug was awesome. Definitely recommend this place.

Had dinner at American Steak House this weekend.  I could not believe that how professional and accomodating the staff was especially at a resturant that is so affordable.  I have a special needs daughter and the owner actually came to our table and designed a special meal just for her.  She can not have salt thus her diet is tricky. The angus burger was exceptional and the kids got a kick out of making their own salad.   My experience was first class and the prices were simply amazing.  Thank you for an enjoyable dinner.

Excellent. I went there on a random thursday moning I happened to wake up early, and took a couple books with me. The food was awesome, the servers were very cheerful, (but not the fake, nauseating kind of cheerful), and the vibe was exquisite. It was just such a NICE, happy place. There were people with dogs, a healthy portion of bubbly couples, dads with their kids, and tattooed bikers sitting side by side with cute old ladies. And a few girls in beautiful sundresses heh heh :D Oh yeah, and the food was killer. I had the eggs benedict - awesome spices on the hollondaise, crisp, buttery english muffin... eggs poached to perfection..... ulllllgghhh. The hashbrowns and peppers were interesting too - perfectly browned outside and soft moist inside, with a myriad of delicious spices. Definitely gets 5 stars from me. Can't wait to try everything else on the menu!

This is a great little Italian spot! I was here on business & wasn't sure where to eat but then BOOM I found it! It's small but quaint, the service is very friendly and the food......YUM!!! I had the seafood    Fettuccini and it was delicious!! My coworkers also loved their dishes! One had the chicken w/spinach (special of the day) and the other had ravioli! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because its a BYOB! Never heard of it but there's a liquor store next door! They don't charge a corking service which was also great! Great food, good price and great ambiance! I'd go back!!!

Katsu-hama is a kind of restaurant you could easily walk pass if you didn't know it was there. Their curry is very good. Fresh made and it's not the kind of curry where it comes from out of a box. The HIRE KATSU is very good. The fried pork was crispy and crunchy - perfect. The CHICKEN KATSU tastes just as great! I got the SEAFOOD KATSU lunch special. it was good but I thought that the CURRY was the highlight of this place. The seafood katsu has fried salmon, Kani cream croquette (Snow crab meat cream croquette), prawn katsu and some white fish katsu. I liked the Prawn Katsu and the Kani Cream Croquette the best. OKONOMIYAKI - it was soso, nothing special. I thought it was really eggy - tasted like fried eggs with special sauce and it also had the flakes you usually find on takoyaki. I love the flakes - they add a lot of flavor to the dish. PROS: - the curry - the katsu (chicken, pork loin, prawn, and kani cream croquette) - salad dressing - our group of three almost went through 3/4s of the salad dressing bottle - it was just that Good!! SERVICE: - great. offered us seats, menu, and water immediately as we walked in. - asked us if wanted salad refills.

No excuse for a dirty restaurant.  Ate there recently  food was good however I looked up at the ceiling and saw the air vents which were loaded with dust. Just imagine all those dust mites falling down into your food. You have a great business, Raymonds, but it might be time to do a little housecleaning. Look around at your ceilings and walls. Maybe it's time for Robert Irvine to come and visit.

I love this place. Their Cuban sandwiches are great. When i use to go out this was definitely the grub spot. It is 24 hours. Their banana milk shake is to die for lol. The employees are nice. My other favorite thing here is their salchi papa ans off course their pink sauce. I make my own at home but it doesn't beat the one from banana king!!!! Looking for a quick grub after some drinks this is rhe place.

OK if you want fresh juices made to order. They scoop frozen berries from the fridge right before me and put into blender, within 10 seconds my smoothie was ready. The omelet, though, tasted like egg mix or something. Just not how a nice, fluffy real egg omelet should taste.

Pancakes Pancakes Pancakes. I discovered this place a few weeks back and I've already been back. After the first visit, my wife and I spoke about the fluffy perfectly cooked pancakes for a week, and planned our return for the following weekend. The Tater Heaven bowl is also outstanding as well as the Chocolate Chip Banana Pancakes which was a special. The refills on the coffee are plentiful, and the service is unlike most places in the area in that it's incredibly friendly and attentive. It's a small place and the wait can be long, but it's worth it. For a non-pretentious meal where the food and service are outstanding, this is the place to go. I am excited to try the other breakfast items as well as their lunch options. Pancakes Pancakes Pancakes.

Terrible service - waited over 30 minutes for brunch (we're talking eggs and bacon) - no explanation - no apology forthcoming until I complained - food not worth the wait.  Many other tables kept waiting and complaining.  Had to roam the place to find waitress to ask why the delay - looked through kitchen window - cook must have been in the weeds but guy in there chatting with sunglasses on top of his head.  Rubbish.  Can only assume favourable reviews are by staff or owner.
Good place, always try to go after a Devils game.  Food is good and not too pricey.  Sangria is very decent.  Would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Tommy DiNic's at the Reading Terminal Market in Philadelphia was one of the first place's I visited after seeing it featured on a episode of 'Man Vs. Food' on the Travel Channel this past summer on my Birthday trip to PA. I had there Pull Pork Sandwich with provolone cheese and Broccoli. Amazing sandwich. The sandwich itself can feed two people..but you won't want to share it with anyone once you take that first bite. After you have the  pull pork sandwich make sure you come back for the Beef Brisket as well.
This is a terrific local hangout.  It's the kind of place that you don't want to leave once you managed to get a table.

A few months ago, I ordered from here for the first time, for pickup. I ordered the eggplant parm for myself and the ravioli, spinach & sausage for my father.  Overall, the eggplant parmigiana was an excellent meal. I should know; I've tried this dish in a number of Bayonne pizzerias and diners. The eggplant was good (not oily as it can sometimes be). The tomato sauce that came with the eggplant parm was very fresh and delicious. The vegetables were excellent too - cooked until soft but not mushy. My father raved about his dinner and told me that we need to order from here on a regular basis. We have ordered from Goodfella's since, and everything we've tried so far has been great. It isn't the cheapest place out there, but it is one of the best! Looking forward to my next meal there.. this time I think I'll ask for delivery.

To date, this has been the best pizza I have ever tasted. Whenever my gf and I visit NY Gimaldi's in Coney it's always a must. Service is great and fast. We have gone at a time when they have been cleaning. I wouldn't complain about he wait bc it's an integral part of Gimaldi's and what makes the pizza top notch.
Meh. But a slightly above average Meh. At least it's better than the places around city center.

In the mood for tapas? Tia Pol is a small, casual place for some tapas and wine. The menu is not that extensive, but of the dishes that my friend and I ordered, the food was good. My recommendations are the patata bravas, the bread with tomato sauce and salsa, and shrimp in garlic oil. They were all hot off the stove and delicious! I'd probably pass on the octopus salad. As a someone who appreciates good octopus, the salad was disappointing as the texture lacked  freshness. The meal was enjoyable overall, but the space and seating are bit tight without hooks or chair backs to hang coats and jackets so travel lightly.

So, this place makes their menu with food from local farms, leaving out the middle man grocery stores. I'm not a person who is super into all of that, but I thought this was cool! I know a lot of people out there love these types of sustainable efforts. Anyway, I was interested to see what it'd be like. Well.... the food was SO GOOD. From the salad to the dessert, I have to say that the food tasted excellent. Seriously. Great job, Escape. I ordered from the pre-fixe menu, which really included a lot for only $15. And I believe the menu changes quite often, which is cool.
I have had their salads and smoothies and have never been dissapointed.  Great service with healthy, delicious and organic products.  So thankful for such a delicous place in Burlington!

I concur with David R. however cannot resist sharing how wonderful this place is!  Every dish I've tried has been fantastic, the beer selection is wonderful... and the view?!?  The railing just about cuts off the view of the road in front of the building... therefore giving you clear view of the dreamy view.  You'll feel like you're on vacation in your own back yard.

I went there to pick up lunch the other day. I got stew chicken with cabbage and PUMPKIN!!!!! All of it was DEEEElicious! I will be going over to pick up dinner for tonight. My mouth is watering. I have had wonderful service experiences there. The owner even greeted me on the street the other day.

Exotic yet laid back atmosphere. Add great food on top of that and you have a great Saturday night. If you are in town, definitely go...smart to get a reservation but waiting in the lounge isn't bad if you didn't.

This place used to be a well kept secret by a friend's father. He introduced me to this place and I have been going here for the past 4 years regularly. For $13 bucks, you can get enormous platters for two even three. The chicken is savory and is seasoned to perfection. The staff is extremely friendly and my experience going here has never fallen short of excellent.

Lets get this straight. They get a five for food. A one for service. I had to even it out a little. I'd have to say my small group of friends and I are Kafe Neo regulars, it's our favorite hangout. We love their coffees , smoothies , and mostly their crepes. We've been there so many times Ive had almost every crepe. Yes, we are 13 & 14 years olds-but that is no reason to be rude to us everytime we go. One time it took 45 minutes for our food to come-and the waitress gave us our check almost right after our crepes arrived-rushing us out much? Another time they  rudely told us there was a wait. But how they said it was very offending. Now what Im gping to say now was highly agravating. On Friday night we came into Kafe Neo maybe at 8:30ish once we walked in the manger (i think) started talking to us. He practually saud we are loud and rude : inside and outside of the cafe. He talked to us like he was our parents. He knows we are regulars and spend a lot of our money here and thats how you should thank us. I will go to kafe neo again because the 4-6 of us love everything about it. Except the service and servers.

My boyfriend and I just went out for drinks and snacks.  First of all they were very understaffed and had their bartenders waiting the tables which is ridiculous they were all out of the sunday special and waited until we ordered it to tell us otherwise,  we had to ask for lemons 3 times and the food wasn't that good, after we finished our first pitcher it took 15 minutes and I had to go up to the bar to get another, that was def the turning point for me and I was def dissapointed, after that I again had to go to the bar to get the check and she still seemed so bitchy, couldn't pay me to go back there again wish I got her name I would def post it so she will get FIRED!!!!! Truly, Dissapointed customer

Supper we found for a birthday dinner after reading amazing reviews.....we couldn't have been happier with our experience there!!!  Were seated at the bar----because of the crowd, but this is not a bad thing, we had the opportunity to watch the very talented chefs in action prepare our meals right in front of our eyes!  The grilled asparagus appetizer was perfection, while the lemon spaghetti so simple yet so tasty.  The special pork chop that night was mouthwatering goodness, we had to go back again for our second birthday dinner.  This time it was on a Monday night , and we ordered the special-----which we will go back for every Monday night from now on, was so succulent and right on.  Thank you to Supper for having this authentic Italian haven that is affordable with great service and even better food!!!  Buonissimo!!
slow.. but food is good.

I've been to Fork on several occasions. I would say that the food is very good but not the type of dishes that would wow me to tell my friends about. The specialness about Fork lies in their attention to detail and service. The bar area is a great place to catch a good view of things, enjoy your meal, and have a nice cocktail. Also, they shine with their seafood dishes. I realize its American bistro food, but there is something missing that in the flavor department. Again, the food is consistent and good, just missing the 'wow' factor.
Really love this restaurant! Great menu and wine selection.

So I went to the city about 2 weeks ago to catch up with my college roommates and we ventured to the original chicken and rice stand. I got the chicken and lamb combo over rice which comes with pita bread, and salad. On top I asked for the white sauce and hot sauce. Now being a brown person I love all spicy things and so I asked for some extra hot sauce. Now, my friends, I have eaten green peppers like candy and nothing happens. I think I got the tolerance from my father who also loves spicy food. BUT.......the next morning I had to use the bathroom and I legit thought an alien was going to come out of my a**. My poor, poor stomach and butt-hole will never be the same lol. Other than that, the food is great!

This dining experience was delightful. The food the staff were extremely helpful with our choices. They have an exquisite selection of wine, catered for anyone with any budget.  For food we went with the Gnocchi and Bucatini and both were decent size portions.  The ambiance is more relaxed than Babbo.  I was satisfied.

Since it ended today, I made sure to take advantage of Japanese Restaurant Week and the 20% discount from participating restaurants and had lunch at Zento. Best bang for my buck was the lunch special bento box so I chose the scallop teriyaki bento. It came with miso soup, a nice mixed greens salad, 4 pieces of California roll, and steamed rice. The bento's four medium-sized scallops were perfectly cooked, tender, and seasoned well. The salad and its spunky ginger dressing were also very good. The California rolls were just typical. The steamed rice was de-lish and intriguing to the palate with Zento's addition of fish flakes on top. Me likey! I heard that the thing to try here is the Zento signature roll so I had that as well. The Zento square sushi roll consists of eel, avocado, and plum paste on the inside, topped with tuna or salmon and spicy mayo and unagi sauce. Very good but not worth all the hype because, while it was visually appealing and tasty, it was lacking texturally...like it would've been nice if it had had some tobiko on top or a piece of shrimp tempura in the middle. All in all, I had a very enjoyable dining experience here. Service was good but a tinge over-attentive. Zento's located in the heart of Old City so parking is a bit of a hassle. Zento's also small space-wise (place only seats about 20) so don't come here squad deep. Also, don't come here if you're on a tight budget because it can get pricey. Major point score: Zento is BYOB so I also brought a bottle of sake that they gladly warmed (don't judge me...I know it was only lunch :p).

Love love loved it here! No wait on a Sunday morning! Seriously? If youre over the lines at Sabrinas and Honeys and want somewhere new try it here! Its Fabulous! Cute random lil artsy space but a lil crammed so strollers may be a lil tough.  We split the asparagus pesto plum tomato frittatas with perfect amount of potatoes, yummy grain bread and you must get the homemade hot sauce! We also split the cannoli French toast! OMG!!!! Challah French toast topped with cannoli cream bananas pistachios and chocolate chips. More like a dessert but def a MUST HAVE!! The waiter was super friendly,and sweet. The service was prompt! I can't wait to go back!!!
We've been back many, many times and love it once again.  Good music at the right volume, great food and nice folks.

I love this place I love their pasta place, their wine counter, their meat and fish sections, their gelateria and their bierria. New York has long been in need of a large food court with food of decent quality, not just a bunch of McDonalds' in a row.

A few years ago I started a tradition where I take my mom out for dinner as a Christmas gift. Just her and I and I pick the restaurant. One of the first places we went to was the Oyster House just after it had reopened. Back then I hadn't started earning a decent paycheck and I remember calculating everything in my head as we ordered tray upon tray of oysters. That's no way to dine. My mom is a huge oyster fan (as am I) and this past year has been a tough one for my fam so I wanted to go with a sure thing for dinner, back to the O H. We came the day after Christmas and with mom running a little late I was worried we wouldn't get a seat for the buck a shuck happy hour. Uber dropped us off right at 6:00 and the place was jumping but we were sat right away at the corner of the raw bar. With money less of an issue this time around I was ready to burn this mother down. Right off the bat we started with the oyster shooters. Gin / Cucumber / Dill was on special so we knocked those back, put in our beer orders, and were ready to receive our oysters. The buck a shuck oysters were Delaware Bay and we banged out 36 right out the gate. In all honesty I would have been fine getting another 36 or 72 and not worry about the other food but we had plans to go to Dandelion after wards and bar hopping with your mom with nothing but raw oysters in the belly seemed like the makings of a hilarious albeit embarrassing story. I got the roasted oysters chimichurri and mom got the fried oysters with chicken salad. Mine only came with 4 oysters but God bless were they good. The flavor was just about perfect, savory with a tiny bit of spice and I found myself desperately scraping the shell for any last morsels I could get. I didn't try mom's fried oysters but I know she loved them and the chicken salad was delicious. We also split a side of roasted brussel sprouts with bacon, boo-ya-ka! They were the perfect compliment to the meal. It was a great experience all around. The workers were fantastic, the shuckers shucked their shucking hearts out, and the other diners were really friendly as well. It was so good and so much fun we may have my mom's 60th B-day there.

Too bad you can't give 1/2 star to this place.  The pizza is bland, service is lacking and the pizza maker thinks he knows everything.  Personally I don't want an attitude when I am paying for food.  I ordered the Quattro Stagioni (which translated to 4 seasons, meaning that there are 4 toppings not 8) and it looked like the vegetable section of the supermarket threw up all over it.  I asked the server why there were only 3 olives, and I was told that olives were $3 extra!  REALLY?!?! but you pizza is suppose to come with olives! My husband had the DIAVOLA... with 3 pieces of mildly hot sopressata (I use the word :hot" loosely).  I could have gone to Domino's and gotten better quality (and service) for 1/3 the price. NEVER... EVER.. NOT IN A MILLION YEARS... AGAIN!

We actually had a hard time finding this place, didn't expect it to be in a strip mall! Extremely yummy. I loved my burger, it was so interesting and flavor was excellent! The deep fried cheesecake was so, so good. I would order it again, no question. Next time I'm in the area, I want to try out their pizza! Next time Cantore's!

We just had our daughters wedding in early July at the Park Ave Club  and the service throughout the evening was outstanding. This difference is "Character", which the Park Ave Club offers in appearance and service. The cocktail hour during the evening was fanatastic, the guests were very impressed with the presenation and selection. The food during the wedding was great. I had the Chiliean Sea Bass which was outstanding. If you're looking for a great place to have a wedding or special event the Park Ave Club offers everything top shelf from beginning to end. John B

Now that i've lived in the lower east side/chinatown neighborhood for some time and ive tried every single noodle shop in chinatown, i can confidently say that this IS the best noodle shop around. Hands down the best. Better than Tasty hand pulled noodles, better than Supertaste, better than spicy village (although they ARE good).
Food is nothing special, steaks are expensive, and staff was totally rude. Not going back here.

When in the area, stopping at La Rosa's is a MUST.  If you're a lover of garlic, this is the pizza place to frequent.  All toppings are a mouth-watering treat, most especially the sausage.  Delivery time is quick; approximately one-half hour or less. Would love to sit down to a full course Italian dinner prepared by the owners.  Best pizza east and west of Broad.  You'll never be disappointed.

Seriously do yourself a favor and get the Grilled Cheese Steak.  Placed the order over the phone for pick up and it was literally being packed up when I walked in the door.  I will be back to work my way through the menu.

This cafe offers better brunch than dinner, it is however one of the best places for pancakes that I know thanks to my friend Amelie! I consider myself a pancake connoisseur and therefor I dare say that Cafe Luluc Pancakes are perhaps the closest contender I have found to the dearly beloved Blueberry / Raspberry Mascarpone delights made in Mystic's Kitchen Little. The place is fun and worth a try!

I like Jeffrey's! I really do! Despite it's completely horrible and inconvenient location, I come back here time and time again. This place kills it on the atmosphere. I love it. Ten points. Service. Ten points. Beer selection. Ten points. Food offerings. Ehhhh I've only been at night, not for brunch or anything so take note. But luckily, I don't come here for the food. I come here with a date or a friend to chit chat and drink some drinks. There's always ample seating and it's just easy. No pressure.

The dining area has a bright, cozy atmosphere with cool artwork.  Most importantly, they have fantastic burgers!!  Both times i've eaten here, the wait staff was very knowledgeable about their extensive beer list.  The mussels were just okay, in my opinion, but the rest of their food definitely makes up for that.  One of my favorites in Fairmount.

Lucky bastards who go to NYU get to eat here everyday. I tried the artichoke and crab slices and holy mother... so rich, so creamy, so decadent... I would probably eat this everyday if I went to NYU (or lived anywhere in Manhattan for that matter). A friend and I split a slice each so we could try both. I loved the topping on the artichoke slice more though I thought the crust was too thick. On the other hand, I really liked the thin crust on the crab slice but the topping was a little too oily and heavy. Dilemma. Regardless, Artichoke is so unique and so different from any other pizza around. Open early enough for a simple and filling lunch and late enough for the drunk kids looking to sober up. Easy, grab&go deliciousness.

This place is so hip it hurts. But they let me in anyway, thankfully. Very sleek, cool atmosphere, plus a hearty, innovative menu, and usually very good service. This is a great place to bring people for a business lunch or breakfast, or to impress guests from out of town, or just to people-watch. I especially like the breakfast here, but I have also tried some of the sandwiches and salads at lunch -- all good, especially the lamb burger, the BLT, and the meatloaf. Weekdays are no problem getting a table for breakfast, but I've often seen a line here other times...

Requirements for being able to eat an entire slice of artichoke pizza: 1. If you are male, you must be large and able to least 2500+ calories in one sitting. 2. If you are a small female, you must fast the entire day in order to almost maybe finish one sort of. 3. Have the munchies. It tastes so deliciously amazing, and NOWHERE else has an artichoke slice that can even be compared to these. It's basically spinach artichoke dip with cheese and come bread/crust in a triangle shape. It's the best to eat immediately after the employee hands it to you because at that point it is the creamiest and most delicious. The long line is 100% worth it. Plus, if you're there super late and you're kind of cute you have the chance of being hooked up with some free large Styrofoam cups of delicious beer you are already too drunk to drink. Beware: If you live near this place, you will be lured into it via your sense of smell. Cross the street before it's too late.

We had decent pizza here this evening, but my issue has to do with the "pricing." On the menu it said:  FROZEN DRINKS...and then listed the prices. When I got my bill, they overcharged me by two dollars for a frozen margarita; when I questioned this, the waitress said  that I had to pay "one dollar extra for a frozen drink, another dollar extra for ice." Huh? The waitress then said she would take it up with management. I hate being taken for an idiot, because there was no way she was going to do such a thing. The drink was not worth 11 dollars. And please don't lie and tell me I have to pay for ice or a "frozen drink" fee. My problem with Ken's Pizza: they clearly don't respect the customer. No recommendation from me, and Please, Ken: tell your waitress not to badmouth me to her best friend waitress re: my questioning the prices )once she gets inside). She might not know this, but glass is see-through!!!

Affordable, delicious, vegetarian-friendly. Something for dinner, something for dessert. Coffee, or tea. It's just perfect. A total hidden gem of West Philly, and a must-try for anyone who likes to try cuisines from all over!

Yayy I love Bondurants! I've been here twice so far, and it's always really fun. The drink prices are super reasonable, the atmosphere is nice, but relaxed, and the food is tasty. The past time I was here, I couldn't find a table, but a couple was leaving and went out of their way to offer their table to my friend and me. No bro-ski's here, just a nice laid back neighborhood crowd. I can't wait to come back.

Amazing. Had the Mushroom Gravy Smothered Chicken Southern Biscuit Sandwich and the regional flight of beer -- it was incredible. The prices were reasonable, especially considering the one sandwich can definitely feed two very hungry people (or you can have leftovers). More importantly, did I mention the biscuit sandwich was incredible?? I'm dying for more. Also, I too (like other reviewers) am someone who hates pickles, but nonetheless LOVE Jacob's Pickles. Definitely do not be discouraged by the mention of "pickles" in the restaurant's name.

The Malt House is a great spot to meet up with friends, eat some good snacks, drink some good beer... and all with friendly, attentive service!  I particularly recommend the chicken dippers - although there were lots of other tempting snacks I didn't have the privilege of trying that are likely worth another trip :).

No frills - ....Certainly a whole in the wall location, just happen to drop by never expected a place like this in a semi-industrial location nevertheless the food was great....Make Sure to bring Wet Napkins.

This was my first time at a genuine tapas restaurant before, and I had no idea what I was doing. That being said, our waitress (Laurel) was so friendly and so helpful in navigating us through the menu and suggesting some of her favorites. My personal favorite was the lamb meatballs, but really all of the food was phenomenal. The wine selection was excellent, and the one suggested for us paired excellently with the plates we chose. The atmosphere of the restaurant was great, the food was great, and I cannot wait to go back and try some of the other dishes!

Getting here was a long walk.  Had to call the place to check where it is since directions was kinda off.   We wanted to try some good islander food since well we're in Brooklyn!  It is a hole in the wall.   Got the lamb and some bony dish, lol. Fall off the bone.  I know nothing about Jamaican food but this was good but needed more seasoning I think.  It just sucks that they never asked us if we wanted to eat in, they just assumed we wanted it to go.  When we asked if we can eat in, they said no coz it's too late since they put our order in a to go box already.  Service was blah.  Although one customer was really nice.  She seems to be a local, but uh one of the very few we've encountered that was really nice.  Woohoo!

My friends and I were told to go here for bunch during a girl's weekend. We called before we left our hotel, thinking the wait would be 30-45 minutes, and were told there was an hour and a half wait. We walked over and waited in the area before FINALLY getting our table. I will say if you know the system (calling in way in advance) the wait time is very accurate. I saw some groups walk right in, because they had their name on the list. Once we were seated we were extremely hungry and expecting the best brunch we've ever had. The meal started off well with their delicious challah stuffed french toast, but unfortunately our brunch entrees were not on the same level. My sister's omelet was bland (it was from the Hunger Games special menu). I myself ordered the Huevos Rancheros, which tasted nothing like Huevos Rancheros. The menu explained it was a twist on the traditional, but I did not think it tasted good at all, and was also pretty bland. My other friend's omelet was decent, and our friend who got a sandwich enjoyed her meal. This leads me to believe that their lunch options are better. Basically, the meal was decent, and we probably would have been pleased if there was not such a long wait.

I have to agree with the person who said underwhelmed. It is not as good as it was when it first opened but that's what happens when all of these chefs go off in too many directions. We like the bar, even though it's a sardine can. The sliders are wonderful and so is the chicken, though not as good as it used to be. We had a veal chop one night that was forgettable and a cod that was regrettable. I don't know.
Yeah, food may be a little overpriced but the vibe is hard to beat. Meeting for a drink in Tribeca? Odeon is still the place.

This is the best wine bar in the city! Run by Jason and Delphine, the two for sure know what they are doing! The escargot is amazing, just melts in your mouth. The Vintage Burger is awesome! Cooked to perfection! And all accompanied with a glass of wine! The staff all knows what they're talking about when it comes to either pairing wines with your food, or just matching the flavor you describe to them! This is place is A MUST!

If you want to go somewhere that makes you feel outwardly welcome but in a Mean GIrls way, you've found your place! The hostess was welcoming and friendly, but when she couldn't decide where to seat us, she just started seating other people first! And we asked if we could sit at one of the tables with the benches, she just said it was reserved for larger parties. That's fine, but we later saw her seat a party of three at one of those tables, and of course, we had a party of three! Oh, did you want to be really unaccommodating and make us feel unwelcome? Yes? Gee, thanks. The happy hour items are limited, but whatever, if you just want to grab a glass of wine, that's fine. The mac and cheese was bland. The cheese plate is very scant, and there's no bread. The rest of the service? Ehhh, lukewarm and they will rush you out in a curt manner. Overall, I say skip it. You can get a glass of wine elsewhere with better service.

Super yummy! Everyone should try it at least once. They have a really good shrimp/lemongrass soup. The pad Thai and chicken fried rice is also very good. The bar is also fun, too. Everytime family visits us from California, Maryland, or even just friends from NYC, we take them to TOB's and they've all loved it!
this place brings me back,,wayyyy back! really good PR food!

I was not expecting to love Crepes Du Nord as much as I did, but I was so floored by the savory crepe I ordered - the Crepes du Nord (smoked salmon, dill creme + scrambled eggs) - that my stomach somehow made room for a sweet crepe too.   The savory crepe's flavors were light, but flavorful at the same time and the scrambled eggs were incredibly fluffy.   For dessert, we shared the Dulce de Leche Crepe.  This is a good option if you are not a fan of chocolate as it is one of the few dessert options without chocolate.  The dulce de leche drizzle isn't overly-sweet and the crepe is the perfect thickness with melt-in-your-mouth consistency.   Prices are very good considering the amount of food you get and the quality.  Environment is very cozy and intimate with limited seating available in the front and back of the restaurant.  They also have picnic table seating on Stone Street available in the summertime, but apparently this seating is only if you order dessert (but you can't order the savory crepes here).  Easily accessilble via public transportation, friendly and helpful servers - Crepes du Nord gets my thumbs-up for sure!
Come here for business lunches at least twice per week, great place , food and service.

DO NOT EAT HERE! I figured I would support this place on its grand opening, HUGE MISTAKE! Ordered Flank Steak Pho and grilled chicken, ended up violently ill a few hours later; ended up in the the emergency room and several days off from work. If they can't get it right on its premiere, this is an indication of what's to come. As I type this I am still a hostage to my bathroom. So, if you like being violently ill. this is your place!

One of the most creative and consistently delicious restaurants in the area.  I am lucky enough to live in the same town and frequent it often.  Last night I took my 13 year old daughter for dinner and, I must say, if you are reading this and have no dinner plans this weekend, call now and make a reservation.  I had a pork dish that was stuffed with spinach, goat cheese and cranberries topped with an amazing demi-glaze and served with roasted sweet potatoes and zuchini "sticks".  My daughter enjoyed the pasta special of grilled salmon, asparagas, and a mustard dill sauce.  Both dishes were more that exceptional, as we fought to share and protect each other's choices at the same time!! Harold, our server, always brings a smile and fabulous demeanor to the table.  The atmosphere is cozy, the staff is wonderful and the kitchen staff never ceases to amaze!   If you have not taken the time to enjoy a meal at "spicy", make it a resolution to do so (often) as it is one resolution that you will be able to keep and certainly not regret!!

I've been here twice now.  Both times for desert and I have to say I love this place.  The pies are worth coming back for.  There's always a nice bunch of friendly people here.  The service is nice but a bit slow at times.
Great burger, great service. Other than that, pretty standard east village dining.

The atmosphère of this cafe restaurant is the one of an old cabaret cafe hidden in Brooklyn. Décor as in a stage of a prewar or "Jeunet & Caro" movie. Staff and service are stylish. The artists performances are so nice, especially the one i saw, Nicole Renaud with her crystal bandoneon which is awesome. Food seems to be good, though I tried only date cake, delicious. One of my favorite places in nyc.

OK, with the NYC pizza renaissance over the past couple years, there are thankfully many 5 star pizza places in NY now, and Roberta's is certainly one of them. I've only ever been here on "off" lunch-ish times, so thankfully I've never had to deal with crazy crowds or anything. First, the salads here are amazing, especially the kale salad.  Second, the crust on the pizza is near perfect.  That's all I really need to say I think, because if you have near perfect crust it's nearly impossible to screw up the pizza if you are putting quality ingredients on top. Don't be afraid to come here from Manhattan either.  It's right around the corner from the Morgan L stop, so it's super easy to get to.

Lupa's food has impressed me in the past.  But never its service.  And tonight was absolutely embarrassing.  My boyfriend made reservations for a 9pm table for two, and we were turned away at the door told that "you aren't in the system."  Of course, there is little we could do to argue with their apparently infallible "system" (and the people who use it), and the smarmy attitude of the boy at the door and the woman on the other end of the reservations line insinuated that we were trying to pull a fast one. Thank god that this city has plenty of excellent Italian, so we won't have to bother with the attitude at Lupa again.
ippudo smash!

Food is phenomenal. I recommend ordering their fajitas. This place is always packed. The only reason I gave them 4 stars rather than 5 is because of their odd management system. They do not accept reservations, nor do they let you take food to go... Strange if you ask me. On Friday and Saturday nights expect to wait an hour to two hours before being seated. Food is delicious, fresh and reasonably priced. Service is on point as it should be to turn over the tables in a timely manner. This is my one and only go to tex mex restaurant.

So -- I went to Ssam. My mussels were like mush and I couldn't get my fork through a scallop. The mussels came out lukewarm obviously having been sitting around for some time and the scallops were either cooked and reheated or previously frozen or sitting under a warming light. When I asked the waitress the big "why" she sent a manager who immediately asked me to leave and that he stands by the food 100%. I asked if he tasted my dishes, he said "no" but wont tolerate the questions - I asked 3 times with no answer.  I asked why I couldn't put a fork through the scallops and why the mussels were mush -- like couldnt even get out of the shell mush. He told me to leave and not to come back. I love the Pork buns and for the most part other things on the menu and was an early supporter but the manager is an asshole and the seafood was not hot or fresh. I hope I don't wind up in the hospital tomorrow morning. And I hope Momofuku stops taking advantage of the majority of their unassuming customers. Serve fresh food not glop. Don't believe the hype, ask questions.

My club meets there once a month. I look forward to this meeting because I go early to have dinner. I enjoy the food and service. I love the varied menu. The staff has always been friendly and courteous.  These are the reasons why I also have taken my wife there for lunch or dinner. Another group that I belong to has also met there. The staff puts on a wonderful breakfast or lunch buffet. The food was always well prepared. This is a place that I look forward to going back to month after month and year after year.

This is a kinda cute place, and it offers decent tapas for fair prices. I liked the corn cake with the mushrooms, but the ceviche we couldn't finish. It didn't taste fresh.   Still, at half prices it wasn't a big loss.   Mojitos were on the average side, but the atmosphere was lively.  Lots of free chips take the edge off.

Ate in the Bar area for Saturday lunch. Wonderful food, atmosphere and service. The smoked kielbasa was particularly good and the German chocolate cake and milk chocolate coconut ice cream were delicious.....

Let me get straight to the point. I have come here about 8 odd times in the past 2 months (yes, I eat out very frequently, almost every other day, and since this place is in the vicinity, I keep going here - I don't know why) and I've also been to their outlet in Chicago, IL. Every time I've come here, it's been a hit-or-miss, yet I keep coming back hoping that it'd be better the next time around. Pros: 1) Good sweets. 2) If you like a spot of peace and quiet, this is probably the place to go to, especially in the late afternoons/early evenings, but only on weekdays. After that, and on weekends, all hell breaks loose with all the families coming in to eat - kids running around, hassled parents trying to rein them in, you can imagine the scene. 3) Decent chaat. Not as good as a few other places (some of which are right down the road - Dimple's Bombay Talk and Rajbhog to name two), but not too shabby either. Word of caution though: Don't compare it to the chaat you get back home in India, else you'll hate it. The chaat here, especially the bhel puri, is different in taste from what you'd get at other places here and in India. They put a different twist on it, that not all people would like, but I can't put my finger on what's different (maybe it's the amchoor or something, I don't know). Cons: 1) Home to the very worst Paneer Kathi Roll I've ever had. This was today, when I kipped in for lunch and decided to order the aforementioned roll. First, they took a whole 25 minutes to bring out one roll. Next, the roll is not even worth the price, any way you look at it, quantity or quality. The "roll" was nothing but 2 halves which were barely an inch and a half in size each. The diameter would've been somewhere about an inch to an inch-and-a-quarter. OK, you'd tell me to judge the item not from how it looks, but from how it tastes. Well, coming to that, one word: bleh. What constitutes a paneer kathi roll here is (1) mashed potatoes, (2) mashed cottage cheese (paneer), (3) both the above items mixed up together, and not too well at that, (4) a sprinkling of diced onions and (5) tomato ketchup, all rolled up inside a thin roti. No spices, cilantro, lemon juice, nothing. Not even on the side, so the item ends up tasting very bland. Now, I know we Indians eat food that's sometimes a lot spicy, but this is actually so far out at the other end of the spectrum, that a Westerner not used to eating spicy food would find it tasteless as well. 2) Horrible service, unfortunately, is the only thing they are consistent in. 3) The portions in general are ridiculously small. I had ordered a samosa chaat in one of my previous trips here, and it came in a styrofoam dessert-sized bowl. Yes, no kidding, a bowl. And this wasn't just a samosa, but a samosa chaat, so you can imagine how much chaat would've been served. 4) I tried paying by credit card and was told they don't accept cards for amounts less than $15. This was after I had waited half an hour for a crappy kathi roll, which was not at all worth what they charged me, so as you can imagine, I was pretty pissed off about it. Also, the service was so crappy that I had to wait 10 minutes to get the check after I'd asked for it, and when the waitress gave me the check, I again had to wait a further 5 minutes for her to collect the check and my payment. Finally, I was so annoyed that I decided to walk up to the front counter to pay, and this is where I was told about the $15 threshold (which, by the way, is mentioned nowhere in the store or on the menu). So at this point of time, I raised a stink and she finally swiped my card and I got out of there as fast as I could. OK, this review ended up being more critical than I started out wanting it to be. I admit, I haven't tried out their CA locations or their catering so I don't know how those are, but my experience with their Chicago, IL (Devon Street) location was disappointing too. Try these guys at your own risk.

The sushi here is delicious and fresh, and the 3-roll special is perfect for dinner. But the reason I'm reviewing is because the service is excellent. Prime example - they have a $10 credit card minimum, and I was two dollars short of that the other day and didn't have enough cash. Rather than making me go get cash or buy enough to get up to $10, they said I could give them the difference next time. Not too many businesses, especially in a city, are that good to their customers. I made sure to come back the next week and give them the $2!

if you like eating in a  hipster lodge with animal heads on the wall freemans is for you. the food was very good. the artichoke dip is superb. the waitress was attentive but not overly, which was nice. no reservations (unless for group of six or more), check in and have a drink at the bar or across the street.

I really got lucky when trying this place. When we first walked in, it was so warm and the smell of zaatar was really strong- in a good way. The seating space is a little small, but luckily they had room for us. We ordered the zaatar pita, which was WAY too strong with the zaatar. The reason why I got it was because my dad used to make his own olive oil/zaatar mix as I was growing up, but this stuff was way too intense. We also had the chicken kebab, which was slammin. It was so good, the chicken was spiced well and moist and the techina was really fresh and tasty. We also had the lambajin, or lamb pizza, which was also really delicious. The entire meal was really good, and I remember it being somewhat cheap, but they lose a star for service - it was really, really hard to get our servers attention. Other than that, I'm totally going back.

Sometimes pros can be cons. Or the other way around. For example : the print is located at as far as 11 ave. But you know what ?  This is a hidden gem if you want to find a non-waiting spot for good quality brunch in midtown. Decor -4/5 Located at ink 48 hotel ( ink hotel, press lounge and print restaurant. Meaning use ink to press then print the bills. I like this cash cow idea ). Decent interior decoration. It's a place you can wear your cocktail dress to sip fancy champagne or for hands holding romantic dinners. "lovey dovey"environment. Service -3/5 You need to ask for your pre meals complementary breads but not your bill. It comes right away after you finish. Food-4/5 We ordered pan seared cod and 7 grains club sandwich. The cod was tender and juicy. Crispy skin and adequate seasoning. Love the fluffy eggs in my 7 grains club sandwiches. Bacon is a little too hard too chew though.   Over all, if you like fine dining and no patience to wait, this is a place for you.
atmosphere breath taking .. food is good.

I went last week for lunch and it was so sensational that I decided to take my family back for a birthday celebration 4 days later!  Pretty much everything we had was sublime and I don't say that often.  The lamb meatball sliders are wonderful (get 2 orders because one is not enough) as are the crostini and the fritto misto.  The highlight of the meal- or I guess one highlight- was the pasta, gigantic in size, with a duck ragout on it.  wow.  everyone also enjoyed the pasta with the wild game sauce and the penne with sausage.  the scallops on a bed of lentils are fantastic also.  We shared the garlic chicken for two, really just a plain roasted chicken au jus with garlic that is delicious but not as exciting as the other dishes.  For dessert we had the semifreddo and the maple custard; both were excellent.   I will be back.
Great food and service.  Shrimp fra diavalo is soooooo good.
really awesome pizza!!! n the wings are big....like the new look n the pool table
Cant wait to go back to this place its awesome... very exspensive but awesome... great food... great service... cute girls working... lol but yeah makes menwant it just writing about it...

Used to love Tavern on Jane - would stop by several times a year to get their grilled Chicken Sandwich with Roasted Red Pepper Mayo - it WAS fantastic.  Perfectly grilled (and fresh) chicken and the French Fries remain the best I've ever had.  Alas, they changed the menu a few years back and I've only been once since.  Too painful.   For the record every time I went with someone else they enjoyed what they got so definitely take a shot.  Dishes I recall my companions getting and liking were the crispy oysters, the burger and the hanger steak. BRING BACK THE GRILLED CHICKEN WITH RED PEPPER MAYO - PLEASE!!!!

Have enjoyed Buttermilk Channel very much on several occasions, including one scrumptious brunch.  Love the food, the look, the service. and the excellent by-the-glass wine selection. Your reviewer from Hoboken should learn how to spell 'chic.'

Call in advance for the hot pots. Here is very good for big group/social events or couples. I also order delivery to the New Haven areas on regular basis. The drivers/delivers are usually friendly. I've ordered from Formosa for all kinds of occasions. The only thing I haven't tried is their Sushi... After all, this is more of a Chinese restaurant (which is very good at it) than "fusion" or Sushi. Overall, very positive experience for all kinds of occasions--dine in (couples/big groups: hot pots or regular dishes), take out, or delivery for individuals or big caterings--here.

Excellent food and friendly owners. Jerome puts a lot of love into his dishes and it shows - every detail is paid attention to. Their chicken sandwich is the best I've ever had. Brioche buns are delicious, and the onion rings were amazing, light on breading and super crispy. Will continue to frequent this establishment and hope others follow suit, making this a gem of Rutherford.

I really wanted to love Han Dynasty. Everyone else does! So here's what I liked: - our server was my best friend by the end of the night. She was awesome. I laid down the facts as soon as we sat down (I love spicy food but I can't handle it...) and she did everything in her power to accommodate me. - Dan Dan noodles are great, and maybe even better the next day. We requested them a degree or 5 milder than how they are typically prepared. What I didn't like: - we requested the other two dishes to be fairly mild, the same degree of heat as the noodles (I think a 3 on a scale from tame to ridiculous) but... I couldn't eat them. I know what you are thinking: "go big or go home". I tried! I really did. But it was way hotter than we'd requested. My mouth was numb for over an hour after we left. Our server was really concerned because I was not eating my food, but she told us she can't control how the cooks prepare the food...  She can only pass on our request. It may not be honored. Lame! - cork fee, way too high. Come on. I'm not sure I would go back. If you love really hot food, go for it. But if to are a sensitive type like me, you might want to give it a pass. It was probably the most uncomfortable meal I've ever had and I left hungry. No good.
Best of the bestest!

To Bill  M. from Mass. Stay in Mass. You showed up on a slow night. They were problably closing early. " Food uninspired, inauthentic and Buffet quality", You don't have a clue. I've eaten at Lisiano's at least fifty times. The specials are outstanding and authentic in every aspect of dining out at a fine Italian restaurant. The owners/chef make their own sauce. Nothing compares to the unbelievable taste. The veal is the most tender I've ever had. They make thier own salad dressing that is fantastic. The bread which is made fresh daily, easy to eat a whole loaf before dinner arrives. Bill M. from Mass. Sorry you had an unfortunate experiance at Lisiano's, but you are truly missing out. Locals from Milford, Orange, New Haven, give Lisiano's a chance. I trust you will not be disappointed. Mark H.

This is the best Italian restaurant in the area. It's a small family restaurant with a bakery attatched, so all of their desserts and breads are baked on premises. The owner and his wife are always there to greet you and the food is outrageous and reasonably priced.

Last evening 16 of us gathered at Cafe Antonio for a celebration dinner. What followed was truly a feast in the Italian tradition.  The wait-staff was courteous and efficient. The chef-owner Antonio (from Carini, Sicily) and the affable manager Maurizio (from nearby Naples, Italy) were ever so accommodating to make  our visit to Cafe Antonio as pleasant as we could ever have hoped for. In addition, Italophiles  do have an opportunity to banter in Italian with Antonio and Maurizio.  Lastly, rumor has it that a Governor from a nearby State  holds business lunches , from time-to-time, at Cafe Antonio.
You can easily miss the place if you don;t know your way around! Great atmosphere:live music nearly every night. Good menu and wine list. Small but cozy. Excellent date cake. Cash only.

I treated myself to a late lunch/early dinner here last week.  I had the vegetable chips (thinly-sliced and fried eggplant and zucchini with tzatziki sauce) and a glass of white Greek wine - can't remember the name.  All was delicious, and it was so relaxing to sit in the beautiful restaurant by the window in the sun and eat yummy food.  Almost felt I was in Europe for a moment - I was facing away from the madness on 1st Avenue with the sun on my back, which helped. The staff very sweetly gave me a complimentary dessert and another glass of wine - totally unexpected and thoroughly appreciated.  The dessert blew my mind.  The custard wrapped in phyllo dough had some magical ingredient - rosewater? cardamom?  I don't know.  All I know is I almost ate the whole damn thing despite being stuffed by veggie chips.  I also got the spanakopita to go, unheated, and had it for breakfast the next morning after warming it in the oven.  It was DIVINE.   I'll definitely be back for a real meal.  Think I may have found my go-to Greek restaurant, finally.  Greek food is arguably my favorite - this is huge.  Yelp led me here - thank you to all the reviewers below!

I love the décor here; country home atmosphere with wooden furniture and animals and paintings on the walls.  The cuisine is American and I recommend the chicken and creamed spinach.  ARTICHOKE DIP.  Its crispy and cheesy on top and it is delicious! But other than that, the food was so-so.  The menu is typical farm to table type food and the prices are pretty reasonable.   The drinks are a great here though.  Red snapper!
Apps are great. Love the music during the week. A bit small with no bar area but the foods great. Mad clams are definitely worth to try.

I love this place.  I love the fact that everytime I come back, which is at least once a week, the store owners recommend a new item for me to eat. I love that when I order the food spicy, it actually gets the job done. It's cheap, relatively fast given how packed it seems to get when Penn students return to campus, and tasty. Win/win.
Loved it. Fast efficient and delish. Moist warm and cheesy. They have the hot peppers waiting outside for you to take. My mouth watered remembering how good they were. Loved it!

WOW! This place was fantastic!  Great atmosphere and awesome food.  The tables outside were full so we took a table on the "inside" which was practically the same because they had those big open doors and windows that reminded me of a European cafe.  The tequila selection was very large, however, since I am a margarita drinker I opted to pick from the extensive margarita list.  We shared some table side guacemole which I would recommend people to try.  The dinner menu had a decent amount of variety.  Everything from tappas to burgers.  I had the pulled pork entree and I was very pleased.  I would suggest that to anyone who is a bit hungry.

This place is very decent... The menu is very interesting... The staff was exceptionally friendly & i enjoyed my dinner here... I would however like to see just a few more choices on the menu in the future

Note: I really would like to give Woodbines a rating of 2.5. 2 is lower than what I think they deserve in their current state, but for the experience my wife and I had, I am unable to grant them a 3. We came by today (Saturday, September 14) at 11:30am for brunch. The door was locked. There were several people inside. We were confused, especially since their website states that they open at 11am. After a couple of moments of deciding what to do, we decided to move on and as we started to walk off, we heard someone calling us back. We asked what time they were supposed to open and the response was "11". My wife and I looked at each other and with some hesitation decided to give this restaurant a try. Our servers were very nice and attentive. However the menu does not offer any weekend brunch options, only the standard restaurant menu.  We debated and decided to stay since the staff was nice and while still under construction the space was nice (but loud, please consider adding some sound dampening.) My wife ordered curry chicken and a hot water. I had a lamb meatloaf, a bloody mary and a hot water. Lamb Meatloaf - $13 This was a good dish. I liked the meatloaf, the sauce, roasted potatoes and asparagus. For what it was and the neighborhood, this dish was appropriately priced. Curry Chicken - $12 All white meat chicken over rice. And that's it. Chicken was flavorless, very overcooked and tough. All the flavor of the dish resides in the sauce which was little more than coconut milk with curry powder.  For both presentation and consumption, this dish needs some variety. Also there was way too much sauce. And it would be nice if the rice was not already under chicken and curry, but separated on the plate. Bloody Mary - $6, refills $3 The drink was good and a good value. One is enough for me, but I appreciate that they offer the option of additional rounds at a reduced price. Hot Water - Free Each mug contained yellow water, with stuff in the bottom of the mug (coffee grounds maybe?) We decided to stick with the cold water. A person who appeared to be the owner was in the back talking to a patron later in our meal. We had hoped he would come our way so we could let him know about the rough spots. It would be in his best interest to find out what his patrons think by wandering through the restaurant and asking them about their experience. I want  to like this place and may come back in a few months for a burger and a beer once the kinks have been worked out, but for this price point I expect more and there are other establishments in LIC that are better.
