I'm hopefully this place makes some positive changes. Would be nice to have another good restaurant in the neighborhood.

I really like this place! I don't eat beef Or pork so finding a place with a good turkey burger is hard. Their burger is really juicy and flavorful. Greasiness level is definitely up there, but I didn't think it took away from the burger itself. With cheese, house sauce, LTO, it's so good. The turkey burger doesn't taste like it came out a freezer either. Their fries are on point too (def greasy too, probably leave these for 3 am trips) with their house sauce. A bit pricey, so I don't go super often. The guy at the register wasn't overly friendly, gotta be a little pushy

The pizza is always delicious and there's a great selection. But get there early because the wait can be kind of long. Paulie Gee is always there, and sometimes he's handing out small slices to those waiting for a table. It's always fun to see him and let him know how great the pizza is. There's nothing like a cool restaurant with delicious food and a friendly and appreciative owner. I like that there are vegan options so I can bring my vegan friends out for pizza.

with cheese and infused with orgasmic goodness? --check. 32 oz beer for $5 while you wait for the slice? --check One of the best places for pizza (sober or drunken) in NYC?---Check!! So, CHECK this place out and you won't be disappointed!

I have been here twice and decided to write this after my second visit. I went a couple months ago right after they opened and it was good but was not a totally functional restaurant yet. I went back in expecting a more finished product and my expectations were blown away. The food was delicious and my waitress was knowledgable and friendly. It seemed like they had been open for years. Started with a caesar salad and it was amazing. Fresh lettuce and a great dressing topped with anchovies. Best I have had in a long time. Then, I got the corn and speck pizza and it was really good, my waitress recommended it to me and she was spot on. It was salty, sweet, and had a wonderful cream sauce. They had good beers on draft, started with a Fiddlehead and then went for Veritas own long trail called the Cuatro. It was a really good beer. Also, was cool having the owner stop by at my table a couple times. He has been there both times I have gone in. He loves his pizza. I will be back for sure.
Tasty but pricey.  The slices are $5 each but you might give in and get another one.

We came for the substantial craft beer selection and unique foods.  The sweet potato strings were addictive.  The bread pudding and chocolate cake were mind-blowing.  The cheesesteak springroll was mediocre and terribly overpriced.  The beer selection included many beers we had never seen before, and we had a couple sampler sets, but only one or two were worth drinking, so we were pretty disappointed.  There is much better food and beer around the corner, but this is the place to go for dessert.
yes

I was so disappointed with Basso 56. It was one of my worst restaurant experience in NYC for the last 7 years. I've been to many good italian restaurants in NYC. I went to Basso56, based on good reviews, but there was nothing special at all, actually much worse than Diner. The food tasted like frozen food, and server was rude and snobby. I ordered Mista dela casa as appetizer. This salad was not fresh and dressing was too greasy. The Filet Mignon was overcooked and dry. My boyfrined's home-made pasta was soggy and salty. I and my boyfriend regreted going to Basso56 and we don't want other people to waste money. I would go to much nicer restaurant with the same amount of money. I can't understand how Basso 56 got these good reviews. I highly recommend not to go this restaurant.

Good place.  We didn't have a reservation, but they accommodated us anyway.  Put us up next to the window, which was a cold seat. My date wore her coat the whole night.    I liked our server. He was a young guy who grew up in Athens, so he knows his Greek very well. For appetizers, we had the beets which were very good, and the fried eggplants with yogurt dip. I particularly enjoyed that.  Their artichoke cake was pretty much all potatoes and melted, creamy feta cheese, which was reasonably tasty albeit too filling, but I didn't get a hint of artichoke. For the main course we shared a lamb shank which comes with a decent, creamy mashed potatoes.  The lamb shank was tender, and pretty tasty, but not outstanding.  The cabernet by the glass, $9, was actually excellent.  Greek too, I think, which is interesting.   I can't say I think the design of the restaurant is great; really narrow, coat hangers opposite restroom doors creating quite the conflict, and the hanging jars overhead were a bit discomfiting.   Neverthless, I will return and try again.

Oh man. I bet this slice of their signature pizza is about 9000 calories, but hell, just spend a few days on the stairmaster and you're good. The "pizza", if you can call it that, is nothing short of divine. There is a line all the time for a reason. The pizza is to die for. Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

This was my first visit to Park Central Tavern since I just moved to North Haven. They had just that day, brought out a new menu with great selections. I ordered the Salmon Burger which was really excellent.. The bread that was brought out before our meal was just as excellent and the butter is awesome! Since the menu was new, one of the sous chefs came out to check on our meal. I gladly told him it was very very good.

I grew up in LA and this is the first place in NYC that actually reminds me of the taco stands back home. The adobada tacos are slightly spicy and DELICIOUS. The steak tacos were also quite good. You get the perfect dab of guacamole on top of the typical toppings of onions and cilantro. Freshly made corn tortillas. I really couldn't ask for more.

Come when they first open (during the week) to steal a table faster. The best way to experience cha-an is probably to order their set dishes. The 15 grain porridge is okay- a tad on the sweet side but do-able. I had the chicken soboro-don and it was savory. Make sure you ask the waitress if the tea that you went for matches the meal.. sometimes you can pick the totally wrong tea (as my companion did) and the dishes are just thrown off. this is not the place to bring a grown man who is starving. the portions are small-- but you won't leave hungry. Try the desserts-- especially the black sesame creme brulee and chocolate souffle. it's heavenly.

I just walked out of Village Whiskey. I sat down and was not greeted by server or given water. Two other parties sat down after us, were greeted, etc. After waiting almost ten minutes from the time I walked in and was sat, and repeatedly walked past by the sever  I walked out. It's not a peak time or a weekend, even if it was there is still no excuse.

Last month, my friend planned a surprise birthday brunch for her boyfriend at Jane. She made advance reservations, so we didn't have to wait long for seats.  The decor at Jane is unlike any other brunch spot I've been to. Chic decor and great, cozy ambiance There's two floors of seating and both floors are spacious and cozy. For my complimentary cocktail I ordered the White Peach Bellini which was light, refreshing, a little bubbly from the sparkling wine. I enjoyed it very much. My boyfriend ordered the Benedict Jane. The Benedict Jane is poached egg covered with a rich tarragon Hollandaise sauce, sitting on top of a moist and delicious crab and crawfish cakes and home fries on the side, This was really a beautiful dish! I tried one of the Benedict Jane and it was great. I really enjoyed the meatiness of the crab and crawfish cake. It's very different from most eggs Benedict I have had. I ordered the Benedict Johnny which is similar to a regular eggs Benedict. Poached eggs topped with a rich, creamy, roasted tomato Hollandaise sauce sitting on top of a maple chicken sausage, and corn pancakes with home fries on the side, I really liked the home fries because they were crispy and crunchy and possibly the BEST home fries I've had!  Another thing I loved the most about my eggs Benedict is the yolk was oozing out and it was a runny yolk. Apparently, we all had room for dessert and had the Pumpkin Chai Profiteroles which was seriously pumpkin heaven! There was pumpkin ice cream, candied pumpkin seeds, pumpkin paper, and chai sauce. I really liked this dessert because you can taste pumpkin in different textures, shapes, and sizes. My favorite was the pumpkin ice cream - seriously delicious! The next dessert was the Seven Layer Chocolate Cake. Absolutely Chocolate heaven! The seven layer chocolate cake consists of chantilly cream, whipped gananche, and a chocolate sauce. This was amazing. It was moist, chocolatey, creamy, and just... it'll take your breath away! I really enjoyed our brunch at Jane. The staff were very friendly and nice. The food was beyond perfection. I would love to come back here in the near future. I most definitely want to try their sister restaurant: The Smith as well. Tip: If you order your entree from the brunch section, it comes with a complimentary cocktail of your choice.

Awesome Sicilian and that's spumoni...wow! Nothing beats sitting at the picnic tables on a sunny day with a crispy and well done square pie with the family and plenty of spumoni. You want the last slice........ Fugetaboutit!!!!!!!!!!!!
this is no oridinary pizza - this is art. it's worth the wait, worth standing in line - whenever i'm half a mile radius from there, i find my legs dragging me over there....

A hidden gem in the middle of Astoria.  The waiting staff do a fantastic job of serving without ever intruding on your personal space.  The food is great, very tasty without being overbearing.  The decor and layout is great.  We will definitely be back.

In love with this place! I was in Philadelphia vacationing and heard good things about it. I started my meal off with a mojito and my husband had a margarita - both were outstanding! Great flavor, not weak drinks. We're both gluten free, and they had a ton of items for us to choose from. Their salsa and chips were delicous (2 types of salsa, a hot and a mild). For our main course I ordered the Molcajete de Pollo (grilled chicken in a lava bowl with peppers and amazing seasoning, fall apart good, with tortillas, beans and rice) and my husband got the Molcajete de Carne (basically the same thing but with beef instead) and we were both blown away by the flavor, and the freshness. It was so fresh-tasting! Very highly recommend it!

Upon walking into this restaurant for the first time, I was greeted by a younger gentleman behind the counter, who not only had professionalism but also one of the best personalities I have encountered bar none! The food being fresh and affordable, the BYOB policy and atmosphere being more than accommodating, everything about this restaurant being fast; efficient and amazing! I highly recommend this restaurant if you not only enjoy quantity, but quality as well! 4 stars, in my personal opinion! Thank you Black Bamboo, I owe you one!

Deeelish. The food is great. I cannot identify ever having eaten a better Caprese salad in my life. The desserts are also scrumptious. Cute, quaint atmosphere, but I can anticipate getting loud on a busy Saturday (we were there late on a Sunday)
Went here over the summer with my husband. It was sooo good. Very friendly service. great date spot. Patio/outdoor seating in the warmer months.
Came here for a niece's graduation dinner, and it was good! My family had a great time here, and we enjoyed the food very much. The service was nice, and the atmosphere was pleasant.

I stare into the noodles as it stares back into my soul.  Upon it gorgeous, slender frame I place my eyes as I expect my mouth to soon follow suit.  The noodles begin tugging down on my utensils until I feel them grab and grip to just the right hold.  They slowly move up and down the shaft of my fork as I anticipate slurping up their delicious juices-- I can hardly contain myself.   "I need you inside" I manage to choke out.  All words lost when the noodles shimmy across my lips, wafting its hot aroma down my nostrils.  I nod in ecstatic comprehension as the explosion of flavor causes my body to come again and again back as a patron to Tasty Hand-Pulled noodles. Seating is limited, which is problematic.

Come early bc this place is legit and it fills up fast. I've heard of many people waiting over an hour for a table so I arrived at 630 on a Friday night but there was still a 20ish minute wait. They directed us to the bar next door (Von) for drinks and when our table was ready the host personally  came over to get us and seat is at our table. Bianca has a cozy, inviting atmosphere and its likely you'll be sitting 6 inches away from the table next to you. I ordered the lasagna and wow..... Delicious! It's the density of a brick (not a bad thing!) and it tastes soooo good and its sure to fill you up. For $12 it far exceeded my expectations.  In fact the entire menu is extremely reasonably priced so its very easy for me to recommend this place. Not sure if the place is good for groups of more than 6 or so as the place is small and they can't put too many tables together. Service was good overall and on the way out the host remembered us and said "done so soon? You should have had another glass of wine!" Next time, maybe we will.

Simply the best chicken around in the area. Great customer service. Chicken burger is amazing every time, food is always fresh. What else can be said? Half chicken with the sweet potato mash is amazing as well.

We had heard good things about this restaurant but had a horrible experience. After waiting for 20 minutes longer than was quoted our burger came and was cooked medium rare instead of medium well. That was the last time we saw our waitress she never came back to bus our dishes or to give us refills on drinks or even to see how we were. After complaining to the bartender our experience still does not improve. I would not return to this restaurant and I would advise against it due to the lack of service.

El Vez get's a 4 star because it was a great place for New Years Eve.  It was one of those woozy nights that I tipped way to much and my wife drank-to-sickness.  Which leads me to the reason this review is brief:  I don't remember much.  I DO remember the guacamole coming out and being fantastic, the fajita was awesome, but after that it's all a hazy blur of dancing with old strangers for giggle and dares with tequila shots magically floating in the air i.e. the waitress brought them around on a tray much to my amazement.  SO, ya....i have to give it 4 stars for not hating it and because everyone I know loves it.  (probably not going to get a 'useful' star on this review)

I cannot say enough good things about this place. Our first-ever trip there was Easter Sunday.  The guys wanted a buffet; KC was  booked solid for their brunch buffet, but i was able to get in at 4 p.m. when their buffet changed over to an evening spread. And unknowingly we made the best choice.  Because $26 a head got us an amazing spread, top notch display, great preparation, enough "made to order" stations to make us feel special, fantastic, professional service.  And oh, how i wish i could remember the name of our server!  It may have been Melissa -- but she made the day. First of all, our reservation was honored on the nose. no waiting.  the hostess ensured we got a booth just as we asked.  And those booths are perfect -- you feel like you are encased in a bubble with those high-backed, private booths.  The lights are kept low and you feel like you are alone. Our server (Melissa?) anticipated our every need.  Used plates were swept away immediately.  we never had to ask for refills on water or soda.  She was great.  For once didn't feel badly about tipping a full 20%. And the food -- a bountious salad/app station, breads of every kind, desserts you wouldn't believe, soups, quesadillas, freshly made pasta dishes and four meats at the carving station.  For sides there were incredible roasted potato dishes, all sorts of veggies -- too much to go into. We will be back for their Sunday buffet.  This place is great and made our Easter wonderful.  Thanks very much.

My husband was taking me out for a nice dinner. We mostly eat at Italian restaurants and cook Italian style meals, for the most part, so we decided to go Greek. Although the service was great, the food was not. I appreciated how great the food sounded when you ordered it, but everything was incredibly salty when it came out! We didn't even finish our food (and that is rare for us). The only good thing that came out of this dinner, was the great bottle of Riesling we bought before dinner.
Great quick lunch place and very popular in Midtown. Always has long lines... I love their gyro wrap and the platter.
The place was cool, and comfortable. Tasty pizza, trendy atmosphere. The Pizza here is very unique and is among the best in the city. A pretty bold statement, I know
Fantastic Salmon Nicoise salad!  Was super busy and yet service was flawless!  Moderately priced~  Highly recommend

Let's relax everyone. Here's what's up... The food is good. Very good. Inventive combinations, and a lot of them are well executed. They definitely know how to prepare seafood  Nice, casual atmosphere: I like how the kitchen is exposed. The negatives- some dishes were too busy and flavors were lost. Main complaint is the portion size for the price. Like i went for pizza after. But I'll probably go back for a drink and a couple of tasty snacks.

I saw this place from the outside and it looked pretty unique and nice. Once we went inside whoaa it was a pretty nice decorative place. We were seated and the waiters and waitress were nothing but kind. The menus were on the table already out of paper they were unique as well. We orded this tofu soup and it was only about $10 but the portion was great for you get full. And also the side dishes were very good as well. This place has some good food and i will surely come back and bring my friends!

Despite its Woodside location, Manhattanities make the trek over to Queens to wait on line for this Thai food mecca.  From sweet to spicy, no one does it like SriPraPhai. It's consistently considered the best Thai restaurant in all of New York City. While they are definitely good, "best" may not be the word. Perhaps "worth it" or "great bang for your buck," would be a more accurate description.
This place is fantastic! Great wine, great food, beautiful interior. I highly recommend the duck shawarma.

I'm not yet as blown away as everyone else, but then again, I didn't try the french toast. The description of the pancakes I ordered did indeed warn me of their saccharin sweet nature, but I buckled under the tremendous pressure of my rumbling tummy. I ended up scraping off most of the peach-syrup to reveal the much more subtle dessert essence of the chocolate chip pancakes. I've never been a fan of mixing fruit in pancakes or in my desserts, so I guess its just not my bag. My hubby ordered a basic eggs-over-hard dish. Can't screw that up, but I tasted his "homefries" and they did not meet my approval of what homefries should be: somewhat greasy, lightly salted, and a bit crispy in places. These were basically roasted potates sauteed with onion. Meh.

I had ahi tuna burger,no mayo but replaced it with avocado.  Tuna just seared on both side.... yum yum good. I would give it a 5 start if it wasn't for the price.  Place is clean, staffs were friendly.

Have been eagerly awaiting the opening of the Red Eye Cafe for some time now and was not disappointed. Myself and a few friends went for brunch and everything was top notch. Beautiful spacious dining area. Friendly and helpful staff. Amazing food and coffee. I had the highlander, which is a hard boiled egg fried in pork and shrimp sausage with pickled veggies and sriracha on an English muffin. Incredible. The new Orleans sludge coffee was heaven. Plus a chocolate stout cupcake with Irish cream icing was to die for. Not a single thing disappointed. I even went back a few hours later for another coffee to go. We have another winner on walnut street.

The title is pretty straight forward- and I will judge you if you do not order the meatballs.  The naked balls or the classic sub are the way to go.  So many combinations I could never get tired of this place.  And if you have any extra room get a homemade ice cream sandwich.  Just like the sub you get to pick your combo of cookie and ice cream and its heaven.

Hometown reminds me of many barbeque places I love and I heard great things, so I biked down there on a weekday afternoon to find it empty.  If course, I was happy not to wait, but I wondered if I was at an overlooked gem or an overhyped entity.  Man, did it deliver on the hype.  The ribs are texas style, but with some extra heat that I usually don't encounter.  Paired with their hot and sweet sauce and you get a unique, delicious experience.  It's up there with the best barbeque in NYC.
Amazing place, italian heaven!
long wait, the old man is amazing, pizza is unmatched!

This is a really cute, small, and romantic spot. Its very dark and mysterious, which sets the mood, but may be a little hard to eat it. Its byob and they will give you a bucket of ice and open whatever you have with you. The service was a little slow. The food wasnt up to par tho. Id say it was okay-but the flavours were off. The Tom kha soup was oily and didnt taste creamy at all. The masaman curry tasted better the next day, but that wasnt saying much. The flavour was decent, but i didnt enjoy how watery it was. Im used to this curry being a little bit thicker. They were also skimp on the jasmine rice.

Delicious food, ehhhh service. It was our first time to this restaurant and I was impressed by the decor. The ceiling was covered with clay pots, precariously suspended; the room was the typical New York restaurant, dimly lit and with strangers dangerously close to you (stranger danger! Okay, maybe I just don't like people). Apparently, there's a big table in the back where people just sit with strangers. How horrifying. We were lucky to get our own table without a reservation or a wait but, granted, it was also 10:30 at night and we still only got the second-to-last table. Now, for the service. Our waitress was not overly friendly and seemed to just cease paying attention at times. That's not so bad though because she could have been Russian or some sort of Eastern European and that's just her culture (Is ADD part of any culture?). She was clearly inattentive, except with the check. The worst part, though, was that we asked her for recommendations on the menu and she basically went through the menu and pointed out the most expensive dishes in each category. What. The. Hell. I, too, have the ability to identify which numbers are highest. It was very blatant and very annoying. We ended up tracking down and asking another server for recommendations which were, by the way, completely different and completely delicious. We started with the anginares moussaka (something involve artichoke hearts and cheese). It was decadent and delicious. My boyfriend thought it was a little too rich for his taste, but I loved it. I had the cod which was delicious but I think the real winner was the pastitso that my boyfriend got. I call it the winner because the tables on both sides of us got the same dish so it was apparently very popular. It tasted a little like lasagna (bleh) gone Greek to me, but everyone else seemed to love it so I guess it should be highly recommended. i would also suggest wine with dinner (would have been perfect but I supposed to be studious right now) and dessert because they looked fabulous -- I was just too stuffed to order any :( Overall, I gave it a 4 because the food was great; we just got stuck with a crappy server. I would go back (but request another server). Oh, and reservations are definitely recommended!

Where do you take your dope date: - if she wants to bob her dome-piece to 90's hip hop? - if she wants to spit the lyrics to every hip hop track she grew up to, being spun by the DJ? - If she wants to drink liters and liters of Sapporo beers...and then spill em in a drunken stuppor? ** Fat Muthafukin Buddha ** We got smizzzashed to bits in this fine establishment.

One of the best places in NY to have breakfast. I love the window approach and the fact that the food is delicious and the fresh squeezed orange juice is amazing too. When I go back to NY, I will definitely be going back to Brooklyn to visit this little treasure spot.

I absolutely loved this place! I was really in the mood for ramen but trying to stay away from the East Village trend. I found this spot on Yelp. *High five. It was a cool summer Saturday night and we had no reservations for dinner. They seated us right away when I asked for an outdoor table. Me and my bestie each ordered one of their specialty tea fusioned cocktails. They were awesome! I believe she ordered the classic ramen and I always go for the spicy ones, with a few extra toppings. I was also in the mood for sushi when I saw what they had to offer. I went for the premium sushi selection. My friend wasn't a sushi eater but she loved it. I had to tell her to save some for me! It was SO good.

READ THIS FIRST - RECOMMENDED FOR ANYONE TO TRY WHILE VISITING: After reading other reviews from locals and tourists alike, I figured I would add to the list. Just to be clear- I am up in Philly 2 times a month for business. I'm not a local and I find the whole "Team Geno vs. Team Pat" theater silly- so please stop. EXPERIENCE: I went with the steak and whiz. It was very busy on a Saturday afternoon so my first tip is I you are going be prepared to wait. It's a hot spot that has been touted as one of the best cheesesteak experiences in the city so people are going to come to see for themselves. The clerks and workers are somewhat rude- if they smell tourist on you and you ask questions about the menu or options, you are getting attitude. A gentleman in front of me was scolded- hurried, and embarrassed by the old woman working for asking the difference in cheese. Poor guy. FOOD : I am not going to say Pats is better or Tony Lukes is better etc, but in all honesty- it's a damn cheesesteak sandwich. Is it good? YES. Is it worth dying for? NO. Geno's was good don't get me wrong but personally I don't get the whole aura about it all. Overall, I recommend this place as a nice spot in town to get a steak and to knock it off your Philadelphia list. That's about it. Love Philly but can't get behind a place that diminishes a paying customer

I don't get the craze over this pizza.  I mean ok I get that drunk people LOVE this place, but if you're sober the pizza is just eh. I've had the artichoke, the margherita, and the meatball, and they were all so so heavy.  Def not for eating if you're still sober.

Happened to be at august the night these bad reviews were written about and witnessed the whole scene. Other than the outrageous sounds coming from the corner our meal, as usual was GREAT ! I wish other restaurant owners or managers would ask more people to quiet down. Actually, the room applauded after that table left. The food always great and service very professional.

This food was terrible! The service was decent but the main server (tall Asian man) was dismissive. The food was bland and flavorless. When we attempted to speak to the server to change our order. He assured us the 100-200 orders of pad Thai is taken everyday. He did not attempt to remedy the situation.  The only highlight of this meal was the Thai Ice tea. The ambiance was beautiful ,however, it did not help the food. Please pray for the chefs in the kitchen to the flavor Gods.

Don't be fooled by the other "Nick's Roast Beef!" Go to the one in the hood!! it is the BEST! I was fresh off a plane from California, so hungry and ready to eat some hearty South Philly food, so when my lil sis said we were going to Nick's, I was stoked!!! Best Ever Roast Beef!!! (excluding my uncle's deli, c'mon it's family!)

I came here with a group of friends a few weeks ago. The staff was very friendly and fun and even got us all up to take pictures on their "Addicted to Cheese" prison wall! The food was absolutely DELICIOUS and very good portions. I had the truffle Mac and cheese which was outrageous. I think I inhaled it. I also tasted the manchengo cheese sticks which were AMAZING. The concept is great, especially for cheese lovers. They even have a gluten free option! I would 100% go back here and highly recommend it! They are doing a great job after only just opening and I can't wait to try something (everything) else!!!

The food was not that bad but definitely it did not come close to meeting my expectations. I'm generally someone who really trusts Yelp and this place got decent reviews on here! So on a lazy Friday when I didn't have to go into work I walked from 40th and Walnut down to 14th and South Street to check it out- and it definitely wasn't worth the walk. I got the Kofta meatball wrap with veggies. The sauce was decent but very generic tomato with a little bit of a spice and a lot bit of oil. The meatballs were lame, tasteless and textured like veggie meatballs. They didn't hold together well (possibly because of the lack of egg, but I expected better!). I also got a slice of carrot cake which was actually pretty good although a bit dry and dense. In total it came out to be almost $17 for a wrap and a piece of cake! Way too expensive for a little place that looks dirty and tastes mediocre. I definitely will not be returning.
Great food in a great setting!
Good burgers , good service , clean environment , amazing french onion soup , good staff !

Visited with my wife on our 23 wedding anniversary last night and had great veal dinners. Service was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely visit again in the near future and I highly recommend it to anyone in the Woodbridge area..

This is as good as it gets.  Whenever I have friends in town, this is the place that I take them to.  Danny Meyer hits all the right notes with the conception of this restaurant.  The braised pork loin and belly is probably one of the best things I have ever tasted.  Extensive wine list for any wine connoisseur.  Went there last week with some business associates and  it being their first time, fell in love with the place.  Service is impeccable from the instant one walks in and the place runs like a well oiled machine.  Prices are up there however  you wont mind paying for the quality.   This place has been a staple of mine and will continue to be.  This is what all restaurants should strive to be.

Love the dim sum here, reminds me of back home in Hawaii. I really liked the noodles as well. This is my second time here and I tried the teriyaki chicken bun and that was not as good as the roast pork bun, it hardly had chicken in it. Kind of disappointing, but the roast pork bun was still really good. I also had the chicken she mai and that was really tasty. They would have gotten 4 stars if the Teri bao had more meat in it. I'm still gonna go back for roast pork bao hahaha. It's also a bit on the pricey side, 3 pieces of shu mai for $2.99 $1 a piece,  that's expensive.

Great center city bar that is slightly off the beaten path.  Great food...burgers are especially amazing.  Most of the sandwiches are fantastic.   Fun for a night out with friends to watch a game because you might actually be able to get a table and good service. Very good alcohol and beer selection.
This place is such a great addition to the area.  I actually have not had many of the smoothies or juices but come here frequently for salads/sandwiches which are all delicious and low in fat.

Amazing place! I walked in and everyone who worked there was very very friendly, and was sure to explain the dishes and meal options clearly. The staff working were pleasant and smiling and gave a great energy. The food was tasty, well-spiced, and well-prepared- and all very fresh considering that it had to be made ahead of time. I had the pork adobo, the lechon, and the langonica sausage (also some lumpia on the side). The portions were so amazing I almost didn't finish my plate! Rowena herself came by our table, introduced herself, and brought by some of her special lumpia with plantain inside. She talked to us for a while about her restaurant, and you can tell that she loves giving people great meals :-) I can't wait to go back!

Good sushi! The Saturday night special "Dancing Roll" was delicious, as were the Cy-Tuna and STC rolls. The wasabi was super fresh! Service was very good, and we enjoyed the cute decor. Music could be improved, but overall an enjoyable evening. So happy to see sushi near Graduate Hospital!

I am currently eating here in the 4th of July. Yelp thinks it's closed, is wrong. Super good cocktails and also cheap beer. Awesome food, not expensive. Great wood interior, good people, great food and drinks, what else do you want? I'll be back.

Hey Kids,...I grew up on this man's pizza having lived in the neighborhood all my life. You think its good NOW, you should have eaten it back in the 70's when the place was cleaner and there were no lines to get a slice. This whole hype thing is so funny to me as I have been eating this pizza for years. All I can say is that I love DiFara's  pizza and I will always have fond memories of walking up to the window on a Spring day and getting a slice. The pizza  may not be to everyone's taste, but it is a Brooklyn original just like all the other great pizza places in Brooklyn. Whatever you do, DON'T bring your car. There is no parking within 5 blocks of the place except on a Saturday.

I have eaten at Il carrettino's for many years.  They have every thing you could want in a pizzaria and restaurant.  Quick delivery,  affordable food, the best pizza in passaic county.  as well as catering
Honestly didn't even want to write this but such a gem of new haven. Weekend Brunch is just as good as Lena's or Bella's without the wait!

Leave it to NYC to set trends in food. My friend kept raving about this spot, so when I rolled into town, this was our first stop. The wait for a table can be a bear, so be prepared to grab a drink at the bar next door. Eventually, I had the chicken meatballs bathed in glorious mushroom gravy with a side of mashed potatoes and spinach. Who knew meatballs could be so deliciously creative? Must go.
The interior of that restaurant was very nice . I like it . The staff of that restaurant was very nice . The staff of that restaurant was very good.

I passed by this place a few weeks ago and finally decided to give it a try. The ambiance is very nice. They have a very limited menu with only a few drinks (It's BYOB but the Watermelon Mint drink is super refreshing!). As for the food, that too is limited and cannot be customized in any way. As a vegetarian, this was a bit of a problem. All of the ingredients seem really fresh and healthy. The fillings aren't your normal vegetables. They had a special when I went that was blue corn tortilla quesadillas with a corn fungus filling - not something I would recommend. I hope that they work on being less trendy with the food and better the taste of the actual dishes. The portions are REALLY small and you have to pay extra for salsa and guac - ridiculous right? I also had the verduras tacos and it was not good. The best part about this place and the only thing that will probably keep me going back forever are the CHURROS! They are absolutely, hands down, the best churros i've ever had in my entire lifetime. Perfectly crisp, loaded with cinnamon and sugar. This place should be called the Churro Factory and ONLY specialize in custom churros - that could be a fad, right?

I had high hopes for this place and was dissapointed. I had one of the best meals ever at Convivio and was hoping Osteria Morini would follow suit. First problem - it was overbooked and too crowded. We had reservations for 8:00 p.m. on a Thursday and were not seated until 8:40 p.m. I know this place is trendy but waiting 40 minutes when you have a reservation sucks. There was literally no place to stand while you are waiting for a table and thankfully it was nice outside so we sat on a bench out front. When we were seated we quickly realized we had to scream at each other to have a conversation. The noise level was deafening. Our food was fine - it just wasn't anything to rave about. We ordered a tuna special, pasta creste and the pork chop. We did have an excellent bottle of wine.

Breakfast here is amazing!  They offer several variations of eggs Benedict, which are amazingly delicious.  I split the Kentucky Bene with my boyfriend.  We were both full, but still fought each other for rights to the last swipe of gravy on the plate.  The Bene comes with a side of the prettiest homefries you will ever see.  They are little colored blocks of delicious.  Everything on their menu sounded fantastic.  I feel like (and have been told) that you just can't go wrong there.  They also serve mimosas to pair with whatever fabulous dish you finally decide on.  For what we got, I thought the price was completely fair.  I cannot wait to go back again to try another Bene on the list!

Great atmosphere, interior makes for a cozy, intimate setting. Owner is a great guy who filled us up with wine at the bar seeing as our reservation time was not honored until 30 minutes later to be seated. But, the food, urgh. I had the cornish hen. Go to KFC / Popeyes for what is better tasting fried chicken. Because thats what it is - flavorless, fried chicken on a bed of turgid cabbage and saliva. Oh, I had an appetizer too - fig and prosciutto flat bread - the cheese was good, the rest of it average. Some of my dining companions had the Schnitzel (Veal / Pork) - this looked and tasted like the type of TV dinner that low-income families make their 9 year old kids cook for themselves while mommy is at her 3rd job and daddy is getting drunk. Also, the food 'repeated on me' the next day. I neither have the inclination nor the constitution to try this repugnant gastronomy ever again. But, I would love to visit for a glass of wine on a night where you can stand at the bar without being in the way of the waiting staff.
My abs all time favorite pizza I cannot get enough of their squares !

Very good food! EXCELLENT SANGRIA! The only thing about this restaurant is that a large portion of their dishes are focused on seafood. This place is right up fish lovers' alleys! Maybe one day I'll try them myself :)

Glad we came here for dinner during out NY trip. Compared with all the Korean food I had in the US, this is definitely on the top of my list.  The food was delicious and authentic, and the atmosphere was very comfortable and great for any occasion. I totally recommend the seafood pancake and the cold noodles, very refreshing for the summer time.

I don't think I've ever written an actual review about a restaurant on Yelp...so to write one about a Diner means the food HAS to be great! I've been eating here since I was a kid, which is about half of my lifetime.  Despite the occasional slip-ups, the food is consistently superior in taste/quality.  The service can at times be slow (hence, the 4 out of 5 star rating) - and though I hate that there's always a wait time, it's due to the restaurant's reputation, which is undeniably good. The Smoke House burger is my favorite; also try the naked chicken tenders with hot/spicy buffalo sauce...and save room for the Tres Leches cake - which is by far, the BEST version I've ever had... in fact, I recently had it 4 times in a  week...while dieting.  And I didn't feel the slightest bit guilty about it.  Now, THAT'S good! :-)
In three words: spicy cheap yum

Dinner was good, my linguini was excellent, and my friend liked the warm lamb salad. But what is up with that dessert menu? Uninspiring choices and both desserts we got were a lumpy cloying mess of vanilla (even the chocolate bread pudding). A freezerful of ice cream sandwiches would be more interesting.
Was new to cuban food. A friend suggested Cabana and glad I listened. Food and service were great. A great change from the typical over-priced touristy NYC restaurant.

I've been there a couple of times, once for dinner and once for brunch.. I love the ambiance of the restaurant.  It has this like home-y feel to it  It was comfortable and pleasant. I was pleasantly surprised when we came to dinner on a Sunday night, of their Sunday dinners - 3 course meal for $44.  And you choose from their regular menu (some app's/entrees cost a few extra, but the menu informed you of this right off the bat) The dinner rolls were amazing.  they're warm and soft; the way they should be when you go out to dinner.  And the "chef's tastings" were really good too.  a chip and dip, and then something else, I couldn't even remember by the end of the night. For dinner, I had the quail and waffle for an appetizer.  For one, I've never had quail, so I really didn't have any idea how to break it apart to eat it correctly in a restaurant.  I might have done better with a sharper knife, but I was able to get by.  But no matter how difficult it was to eat, it was absolutely amazing!  For dinner, I had the pork, which was so perfectly cooked, and well presented.  For me, I always need a texture difference within the main course, otherwise I get tired of eating, despite being hungry.  This entree was perfect, because it came with potato puree and then some crispy things on top (I can't recall what they were...we went a few weeks ago), which was perfect for me. And of course, for dessert, I had the ice cream sandwich, which was a fudge brownie, coffee hazelnut ice cream, nutella and other things, and I loved it. My boyfriend's entire meal was absolutely amazing too.  The skirt steak was so tender and just to die for.  I forget what his appetizer was, and he had the banana souffle, which was perfect. For brunch, it was okay.  We didn't really think it was spectacular.  I mean the food was really good, don't get me wrong, but for a brunch, I would have liked a dessert (since we came in around 11:30), but they do not offer them.   We will definitely continue to go back there, but most likely only for dinner. Oh!  I almost forgot.  The best part of the Sunday dinner was meeting Marc Forgione in person!!!!  It just topped off the amazing night.

yerba buena is an AYCD brunch all star. +$12 to your entree and it's AYCD... ( i think there is technically a time limit, but that's never been a problem) the food is great. the french toast, the burger, and the arepas are of my favorites. -1 star for the loudness that comes with the crowd that comes with it...   for neighborhood locals, i recommend going "early" getting your brunch and drink on then moving on to any other of your favorite watering holes to continue to wash away the day...

this place is one of my favs.... can get crowded in the evening, but you can choose to take your order out..and problem solved!!! def recommend the "viagra" and the "cuban" empanada!!! Also don't forget to try their fresh sangria, 5 STARS

Really fun place to hang out with friends and enjoy my Guinness.  The steaks are really really good, but some of the other dishes are a bit of flop.  The staff is so friendly and really upbeat and happy to be there which makes for a really jovial atmosphere.

Continuing with the transformation of Murray Hill, this beacon of meat, cheese and beer has arrived on the scene.  But Cannibal does not have the cold cuts and bud lights of college dorm days past, rather an array of salumi and aged hams, carefully selected cheese and a selection of craft beers from brewers worldwide.  We ended our night here for some late night grub and some suds.  We sat at the bar and were served by the very friendly and helpful barkeep who pointed us in the right direction for both our food and drink orders.  So long as you don't go crazy you can get your fill on a tasty selection with out feeling the pain in your wallet.  Cannibal is a good option for a first date for sure - start with some small plates to see how things go, then move on to something bigger if all is well.  Plus you can always judge a person by what drink they order from their massive selection! @datenitenyc
I only get take out, but the fried chicken stays crispy and delicious!   The sides are tasty too, my only complaint is that their cornbread is a little too sweet.

Their pizza and food is okay, but the ice-cream is great. The place used to be better before it changed owners, the new ones aren't as good as the old owners. I think their "square" pizza is over rated, it's a mushy mess and if you ask for a single slice of a round pizza they refuse to put pepperoni on it. They said they only add pepperoni on a whole pie....but how hard is it to grab a few slices of pepperoni and add it to my slice? I thought that was pretty odd.

Ive been a vegetarian for a few years now and its been very difficult finding fast veggie food that taste delicious, until i came across Zen of course, literally the best Vegetarian food i have ever tasted so far. I love the Mango with the chicken its great and they drinks well wait till u try it. Great place overall and clean to.

I had fond memories of eating at the bar here 5 years ago, so went back last weekend (Nov 2012).  Crowded and incredibly popular, but way way too noisy.  Service is hot and cold and portions are tasty, but generally too skimpy for the price. And my biggest complaint is that we took our own bottle of wine, assuming they would graciously open it and charge us a corkage fee (like most normal restaurants).  But no.  The waiter scoffed at us and said they don't allow outside wine.  Not great customer service.  Likely will go elsewhere next time, considering NYC is chock full of decent tapas places.

if you wanna had the great quality meat GO there!!!! the best serbian food ever!!!! try mixed grilled for two!!!! smelts are amazing as well as sopska salata!!!!! bottle of vranac will make it!!!! and DO NOT forget about creoes with nutella!!!!

Having lunch with my hommie John -Tops Diner always WoW me ...been to this place several times and I don't I've ever had a really bad visit. It's a popular place so one might have to wait a little bit, but it's well worth the wait.

Penelope, Penelope! I'm an avid review reader, but never have I ever been so urged to post a review until now. I've certainly experienced better. They are NOT good with large orders. Delivery took 2 hours. The food was mediocre at best! The food was cold and stiff. The only reason I gave this restaurant two stars because I am taking into consideration that we had a large order for delivery. Therefore, I have not experienced this restaurant on a 1:1 basis. I think if I did my perception may change. Unfortunately, we will not be doing large orders from this restaurant again, but I may encourage actually going to the restaurant. Ordering for a big group? I DO NOT recommend.

Came here w my bf yday for date night after hearing great things about it--and all of it was true! I love the restaurant decor and later, had the opportunity to meet w the owners and was informed their daughter, who is an artist, created them. To start off, their menu changes all the time and its written on the wall with chalk. They also list the ingredients in the food, which is a great idea because most restaurants only list them on the menu and by the time u get the food u totally forget what ure even eating. We had the PEI mussels, broccoli salad with figs and feta cheese, pickle platter (my fav!!!! It has a variety of items like beets, apples, etc.), marbled potatoes, the chicken (forgot the fancy name) and the short ribs (forgot the fancy name as well). All of it was amazing and everything was organic!!! We had the honor of meeting the chef and he explained that he goes to the farmers market to shop for these ingredients. Lovely!! We were told that its BYOB or alcohol for the time being. They also serve brunch, which i'm going to go back for! There is plenty of parking around the neighborhood. They also sell pickled items in mason jars and jams!!! Awesome place! Cant wait to try more items from their upcoming menus!
Good consistant steaks. They late trips are the best after a night out and there open 24 hours a day.

Their mango bubble tea was delishhhh.. Loved it. The actual restaurant is a bit small and seems to be the Vietnamese version of fast food as you go up to the counter to order. Definitely somewhere I'd have to try out as I hear that their sandwiches are delicious and worth the experience.
Love Mexican, place has great authentic dishes good drinks
I'd yummy crepes and great coffee when I went. I've been wanting to go back.

This is my favorite neighborhood spot! The staff & owners are always so nice and friendly, and if you are lucky you will catch some eclectic live music there. Lots of good food (lamb burger!!!!!) and boozy drinks (cider!!!!) I'll admit sometimes during weekend brunch service is a little slow, but it's the price you must pay for awesomeness.

This place is aweseome and awful (not really aweful, as I am sure the owners read these things!)..Its awesome in that there are always people there and the food can be weird and fun (And good)...The aweful is I feel every time I go here the wait is 5 hours and I am usually a bit tired and hungover when everyone wants to go to this place..Why are there no good brunch places? I feel like you could serve anything and if its called brunch your crowded...Anyway this place actually serves good stuff..French Toast and Frittatta are my go tos.

Very slow service, the food was okay.  You can't really call it a "French" restaurant.  Just because French people work there doesn't make the food French.  Its more American, for my taste. The place is very cozy and cute though- I would like to come here to have a drink at the bar; I'm not so sure if I will be returning for dinner though.
Just go for the brunch--then order pancakes and salmon hash. It's DELICIOUS!!
great place......

We tried the Pollo Asado tacos and quesadilla. First off, the process is a little confusing. You place your order, then move along in the line and give your ticket to the cook. He then prepares the food. We weren't exactly sure how it worked and basically watched the people around us to figure it out. They gave us the food on tiny plates and there is no seating, so we had to get napkins, forks, sauce, and juggle them around Chelsea Market until we found a seat -- not an easy task on a busy day. We finally found a place and bit into the tacos. Wow! They tasted amazing! The only problem is they were messy and we only had these small plates, so we had to basically devour them quickly before the dripped over our clothes. That was the easy part because they tasted amazing. I wish there was some seating, but the food was still worth the ordeal.

I love, love, love the atmosphere in this place. You can tell they've gone above and beyond to make a wonderful addition to the neighborhood. Very quick and friendly service. Great local coffee that comes with refills. They even have a small store when you first walk in if you want to buy cheese, coffee beans, etc. The only reason I'm reluctant to give them 5 stars is because the food could really be improved. I have a few "go-to" menu items that keep me coming back to this place (like the steak and eggs with a side salad for brunch). If they fix the food, this place will be a knockout!

The food was OK but should have been better.  I also felt that we were nickel and dimed on some items, which at these prices should not happen.  Monkey Bread was good BUT with $30 plus entrees there should be some bread that you don't have to pay for (Colicchio and Sons at the same prices has the same type of fresh baked bread for free as an example).  Also, we were grossly overcharged for gin and tonics $15 per gin and then $5 EXTRA for tonic (which was cheapo Seagram's tonic) - $20 for a gin and tonic is not cool ever especially when its flat and nothing special.  The lamb I ordered as an entree was cold.  It did not say it was a cold dish.  The veggies were hot on the plate, but the lamb had obviously not been made fresh.  I told the waiter that the lamb was cold.  It came back lukewarm and the plate was burning hot, obviously they just stuck it in the oven.  It was inedible.  So while some may have a great meal here, beware that they may cut some corners and they to charge you more than they should.

Was on a ramen spree today, really liked those pork buns. If you come here, GET THE Buns - you will not regret it. ambience is really chic and nice, servers are friendly and the ramen is tasty (sample from a friend).
Good food, friendly wait staff. Decor dis drab and very masculine w all brown and booths. It's pricey too. Still I will go back.  Menu is creative and they are good peeps.

It's pretty awesome ramen. Up to par with Ippudo ramen, pretty close. If Ippudo is an A, i would give Minca an A minus. We ordered the shoyu- 10.50 pork broths with the thick noodle and the Toroniku Ramen- slow cooked pork with the cabbage and thick noodle 15.50 Broth was very tasty, pork was tender and soft. One of the better ramen places that I've eaten. Who would have expect that between ave a and b there will be a ramen eatery. Overall, it was a nice dinner with great company. There are so many ramen places in this part of town to choose from, but give Minca a shot as you might enjoy it, especially on a cold winter day.

I ordered 50 vegetable dumplings to take home and cook.  When I got home and started cooking them, they were 50 pork dumplings.  I called the #, the guy said "closed" and hung up on me.  I called again and spoke Mandarin that I had a problem, told him what the problem was and he chastised me for calling so late.  I said I just started cooking them and that I'm returning them tomorrow.  He said something I didn't understand and hung up on me.  It pissed me off to say the least. Now I gotta trudge back to Eldridge to return the dumplings and who knows if they'll even give my $$ back.
Good food, great for meetings on or large groups on the second floor. First floor is kinda packed. Food is always changing so it's definitely worth visiting.

my husband and i only recently moved here from the west coast so we haven't been to many restaurants, but we bookmarked a few that we just knew we had to try. unfortunately, some of them (ie: Amada) disappointed us, but Osteria exceeded our expectations! some of the standouts for us this evening were the Lombarda pizza, the robiola francobolli with royal trumpet mushrooms and thyme (UH-Mazing), spaghetti with olive oil poached calamari, taggiasca olives and parsley, and the pasta special of the night (forgot the name of the pasta but it looked like candy wrappers with figs and cheese). every dish, including the wine, was spot on. it's been a while since we went to a restaurant where everything was perfect and delicious. cannot wait to take my friends here when they visit!

Great menu, they have more/better options than the typical Chinese take-out joint. Dishes I can recommend: -Tofu in Black Bean Sauce -Chicken in Spicy Tea Sauce -Crab Rangoon - you can get this anywhere, but Jin's is better than average

The one thing I stop at Pietro's for is always some good old Italian cold cuts. The manager Mike is always there and is quick to take care of me. On occasion I even get to talk to Pietro who really just goes by Pete. I usually get a quick sub to go or occasional will stay for a meal. Sadly they do have a liquor license but it is for take out only and cannot be purchased to stay in. For a quick bite on the run or a simple sit down, Pietro's has my vote. My only pet peeve is the bread can be a little hard for a sandwich but then again it is an Italian roll.

Charming cafe with a hardcore edge: check Fresh sandwiches, made-to-order: check Perfectly ripened avocado on almost everything: check Awesome coffee, tea, and beverages: check Killer vegan desserts, like the raspberry white chocolate cheesecake: check and mate Must. come. back. immediately.

Traveled from the left coast and it was SO worth it... a very cool, old soupy restaurant that serves one of the best classic steak frites around. The ginormous beautiful long bar was amazing... I could have stayed for days. The bar staff was very accommodating and fun to hang with for our lunch. We walked there after shopping and witnessed an awesome post lunch happy hour with some suits (ordered a tower of oysters and martinis around)... this place made our trip. Loved it and can't wait to go back.

The environment is pleasing and earthy. Great for a date and weekend brunch. The set with 5 grain porridge is my favorite. The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is that the tea are somewhat disappointing. The japanese and chinese original tea, Dragon Well, Sencha, Oolong etc.. are somewhat overpriced in my opinion. You can get a lot better tea in Ten-Ren for almost half the cost (Ten-Ren has in house brewing so you can take one out). Overall I love this place for their food and dessert.

Noodle Pudding is one of the stronger restaurants in Brooklyn.  Its devoted cult following is a bit bizarre to me, though.  It's a neighborhood restaurant.  If you do decide to make it a destination, though, confine your order to the specials menu.  This, in fact, is a good rule of thumb for any restaurant where the specials menu is so extensive and obviously variable.  If Vinnie's Line Caught Montauk Bass is on the menu, give strong consideration to ordering it.  Other highlights include rabbit (depending on daily presentation), octopus, and the heirloom tomato appetizer (they're smart enough to know when the tomatoes are good enough to merit its inclusion on the menu).  Tuna and swordfish are also generally good. The regular menu is decent.  I have probably been to Noodle Pudding over 200 times, and therefore have no qualms about occasionally ordering the chicken with leeks and pancetta, or one of the pastas.  But whenever I have been away from Brooklyn for a long time (as, increasingly, I am these days) my return visit to Noodle Pudding finds me on the specials side. I have always regretted that the beer selection is not the menu's equal.  And the desserts aren't all terrific (notably the namesake).  Go often and you might get a fruit plate. The staff is friendly and helpful.  Bear in mind that dealing with hundreds of people of variable mood and sense of entitlement nightly is no one's idea of a picnic.  You might not be pushy, but the guy with the blazer and country club visor who keeps going outside to smoke and scream at his cellphone probably hasn't lived up to your standards of decorum.  So patience goes a long way...and is repaid amply.

My favorite restaurant of all time, this place is unbelievable! Amazing menu that always changes and is always delicious. The service is awesome, the cocktails are great.. I just went to a wedding catered by them and it was also exceptionally delicious! I love you Diner.

Holy crap, that's good ramen. Best noodles, best broth, really cool surroundings--and I think I was one of the 5 gaijin in the place on official opening day. I found myself a little sleepy 20 min after the fact, but I'd definitely go again! And again!
Very good place especially on Sunday's with the NFL ticket! Food is good and service is surprisingly good! Would come back and recommend this place for family and friends!

great food, atmosphere, and staff. hats off to the cute host in the argyle sweater today, and the other beautiful dark haired host, and to the tall, skinny latin guy in the striped sweater. while it was crazy insanity..this guy was going up and down each table making sure we had all of our utensils and had everything we need....attentive and on top of it service...i hate it when i get my food and have to ask for utensils. i was really impressed. they held it down hard core in all the craziness...it was crazy packed. we got seated within minutes of the chaos and fed the most amazing tasty bits ever. my bf got the meatballs in red sauce, i got the spicy pork in cream sauce along with the host's recommendation of the mashers...i freaking die. loved everything about this experience. such great food and great energy.

Minca rocks! Order the Minca Charshu ramen and leave satisfied.  Try the radish salad and drink iced tea, not water.  In NYC, Minca is the best ramen house I've tried.  Go for lunch or during off peak dinner hours to avoid a line and a crowd.  When I went today for lunch, it was only half full and the service and ramen was spectacular.

Stopped in for brunch: pretty good. Stopped in for pasta (alla vongole): meh. Stopped in for a Negroni after work: ooh much better. Want to go back and try a secondi or two; have a full dinner.  I feel like that might be Maialino's jam.

I've been to the Bakehouse many times because I like the food and the atmosphere. However, I invited my girlfriends for brunch yesterday and was appalled how condescending the host was and hostess were. They made us sit at the bar after we finished our meal claiming they needed our table despite the fact that the place (which is huge) was empty. This was a major turnoff!

We go to this location fairly often.  We always have a good meal.  My husband gets the shrimp gumbo and I get salmon with a salad.  I love how they make substitutions with no issues.  Love the decor, wait could be a little shorter, but they do their best.
Very good food here, good service, nice quiet downstairs or bustling upstairs. Our top choice for Indian food in the area.

I have been eating at Wazu for about ten years now and I can honestly say that I have never ate at sub shop that makes such tasty and addictive sandwiches as Wazu. Both Parsipp, and East Hanover are great, you cant go wrong.

Where to begin?? So much praise to offer Yorkside. Coming from Brooklyn, I initially hated Yorkside pizza, but I must admit it has grown on me. If you're passing through New Haven this is NOT the place to have the legendary NHV pizza (try Modern, or PePe's, or Sally's, or Bar). However, if you have more time in the area, Yorkside is a wonderfully greasy late night treat. Things to try: pizza (hot, cheesey, oozey, gooey, greasy), cheesy garlic bread (see description of pizza), milkshakes. Also their Greek salad is a hidden gem--soooo good, but be sure to ask for dressing on the side (unless you want Greek salad soup).
Rock solid beer selection and great pub food. Nice neighborhood bar.

I have been here twice with my girlfriend and we have both really enjoyed ourselves both times we came. The Filet is fantastic. I got it both times we came. Menu is a bit pricey but its BYOB so that cuts the cost of alcohol considerably. The place itself is very clean and has a very relaxed vibe to it. The owner is very nice and has come to ask how the service was both times we came. Will be going back. Hope they stay open.

I know I have already written a review in the past but I had to write another one. Every time I have come to Buttermilk Channel I continue to fall more in love. I love this place more and more every time I come... You must try the pecan french toast unbelievably good and the lamb on the brunch menu; holy cow this is amazing when I'm taking the bite I almost feel seduced by the flavors really good... lol amazing love this place... We were on our way to try another spot but found us heading over to Buttermilk Channel. Jeannette B

just okay.  The prices were high for such small portions, and the food was fine but nothing excellent.  Overall a waste of money, when you can go to Amada down the street for the same price and WAY better food.
Awesome cheap food. Long line!

This place has been our favorite restaurant since my wife and I moved to Rutherford from the west coast. It is home style and very inviting and friendly. Steve is usually behind the counter marshaling the troops and Andrea is taking orders. . charming folks. They have a hard working and friendly crew. ... Javier usually serves us and he is a really nice guy. We usually go to Steve and Andreas for breakfast and we have a blast. The omlettes are great served with toast (I like rye) and potatoes, spiced and delicious. The coffee is always fresh and just the right strength for multiple refills (and they keep em coming) and yes they have heavy cream. The pancakes are somewhere in between crepes and american pancakes.. and boy are they delicious. The pancakes do tend to burn a little so even though most of the people go for the blueberry pancakes, my wife and I prefer the short-stack. Lunch is great. Many of the items are named after customers. My favorite is the London broil sandwich.. it melts in your mouth. My wife likes the steak wrap. But they throw something together if that is what you want.. a BLT or Steak and eggs.. right up their alley. I think they're open for dinner only a few days a week and the hallmark is huge portions. It is mostly Italian fare and I love it. We haven't gone there for dinner enough but we're going to try to :)

This was my 3rd time here.  Food is consistent. Burgers are delicious!  My biggest peeve is that there is always a wait, this time 35 minutes only to see that the entire back dining room was practically empty!  This has happened every time!  My only guess is that they don't have the staff to cover, however if indeed that is the case then why bother with the space?  It is very frustrating waiting for so long looking at empty tables....

The brunch steak and eggs may be the best around. My over-easy eggs were perfect, yolks runny. The steak was bigger than you tend to get at these kind if brunch dealios. And tasted it tasted fantastic: intriguingly spiced and cooked a perfect medium rare. The garden out back is really sweet.

I was excited to go to Jamonera just 2 days after it's opening, considering how much I love Barbuzzo and all the shops on 13th Street. Unfortunately, it was Restaurant Week, and most places I've been during that week, you don't really get the best feel for a place with the limited menu and desire for quick table turnover. My friend and I got almost everything offered on the Restaurant Week menu to share. Most of it I did not like. The pumpkin croquettes tasted like fried mozzarella sticks from Cheesecake Factory. The 2 desserts - a honey cake a la mode and some sort of biscuits with sheep's milk spread - were awful. My friend and I were like, what is this stuff, and why are desserts so salty? Maybe it's just me, but I like my dessert to be sweet. The worst part was when we asked for more bread with the foie gras. They had given us 3 very thin slices of baguette to eat with the foie gras, which was not enough. When we asked for more bread, we were told that it only came with the dish, and if we wanted, he could "put in an order" for us (meaning, he could charge us for bread). Are you kidding me?? With all the money people spend at your restaurants and shops, and the fact that this place is brand new - I would think the owners wouldn't want another Bindi situation. I mean, what restaurant charges for bread? I am a major foodie and love to try all of the yummy restaurants around Philadelphia. This one will not be on my recommendation list, and I certainly won't be going back.

If ambience were all an eatery needed, Cuban Pete's would earn 4 stars. Unfortunately, good food and fast service count for something, and both of these were below par.  Rice and beans were, contrary to what another reviewer stated, quite bland the evening I was there. Plantains and meat dishes were good (not great), but the biggest disappointment was being served a non-alcoholic mojito without being made aware, either in the menu or by the waiter, that the establishment had no liquor license.  Would I go back? Yes....with friends and a flask.

Great food and great prices. $15 pitchers of margaritas plus some beer specials. For dinner we shared the nachos, which were great.  Then the carnitas tacos for the main course, perfect. Sat upstairs which is so dark you need to use your phone light to see the menu and the bill. The service was good.

Pros - Ippudo Buns - Service/Ambiance Cons - Akamaru Chasu Came here for lunch while on vacation. We came shortly after it opened so there wasn't a wait but shortly after we arrived, a line appeared. The pork buns are super awesome. I think they're a lot better than the ones at Momofuku Ssam. The Akamaru Chasu ramen was a little underwhelming. I wasn't a huge fan of the noodles and I think there was just a little too much hype. The broth wasn't as fatty or complex as other people had said but it definitely wasn't bad. My favorite is still Santouku. Tip: Come early!
GET THE MIX COMBO WITH CHICKEN AND LAMB, and don't forget the white, bbq, and hot sauce. You can thank me later.
Absolutely horrible. Ordering food was like pulling teeth and after repeating my order 4 times, when I finally got my food there was hair on it. Needless to say my appetite was ruined.

I wanted to say "Waited 2 hours to sit but it was so worth it." But I just can't. It's a good place for ramen but the wait is really long. Make sure to make a same-day reservation starting at 3 PM. Otherwise, you will be looking at 2-3 hours of wait. It's a bowl of ramen. I can't emphasize this enough. IT'S RAMEN. Street food from Japan and people sometimes stand as eating. It feels awkward to see people sitting in a 22-seat kinda upscale restaurant eating a bowl of ramen like we are dining at a star restaurant. The mu ramen is good. The broth is delicious but could be a bit too rich for someone. My boyfriend got TONKOTSU 2.0 which is less salty and it would be a better choice if you'd prefer a lighter broth. U&I is standard. The rice is a bit dry and hard for me. I don't know if it is late or we are just unlucky to have the last spoon of that pot of rice. But the rice feels a bit off. Don't get me wrong. The Mu Ramen is a good ramen place. But I still prefer a more authentic ramen place with steam, sweat, and the crowd. That feels more real to me. The waitress is great tho. The girl who's in charge of the guest list definitely knows what she's doing. She's very polite and considerate, efficient and organized. The place could be a lot worse without her.

OK, I was pleasantly surprised by this meal.  I hadn't heard much about the restaurant, but I found it to be an upbeat atmosphere.  First good surprise...happy hour that lasts all evening, and not just  on crappy house sangria.  Yay!  Then, a great meal of fried plantains, coconut rice, sauteed kale, and rice/beans.  And there were at least four other entrees I would love to have ordered.  Next time!
Great place!

Brunch at this place is OK, but nothing to write home about. You could probably get a better deal elsewhere in terms of quality and quantity. The low point of the meal was the manager. He is terribly rude. We dared to order something else after they gave us the check (which we did not even ask for, by the way) and he threw a fit.  He almost refused to serve us! I thought that the purpose of a restaurant was to sell food. Me and my friends left. The owners of this place should reconsider who they hire as their staff because it is driving away business. So in one word, this place: meh

Pumpkin waffles and Irish oatmeal, oh my - down and dirty diner-like setting with timeless features and super attentive staff.  High volume dining establishment with lines frequently and super well done fresh squuzed juice, real maple syrup, and families abounding with respect for all sorts of breakfast and brunch basics taken way beyond the usual.

Food was good as the other reviews state. However, our waitress messed up the order on multiple occasions. This included giving the wrong dishes, telling us that a dish was another thereby giving the dish to the wrong person, and giving decaf macchiato to the wrong person. The espresso was okay, nothing special, but the decaf macchiato was watered down and was bad. Altogether the service can be much much better as well as their coffee.

Seriously has to be one of the greatest drunken munchies ever. The mixed combo (chicken and lamb) is delicious with extra white sauce. The hot sauce here is SERIOUS.. don't put too much! I made the mistake of putting too much hot sauce on the first time and it was so spicy I couldn't enjoy the dish (even though it was so good). The second time I used the hot sauce in moderation and it was perfect. This is one of the dishes I will miss most from NYC :(

What a fantastic brunch. Rye benedict, Poached egg and meatloaf sandwich were awesome.  I would love to come back here.  Also the red rooster and the southside are great. it was refreshing twist from the normal drinks out there.

HM.  This was one of those reviews that I wanted to process thoroughly before writing. I had decided on The Saint Austere for my birthday dinner way in advance, just a nice and small gathering of good friends.  I contacted the business via Yelp, and immediately got a response from Jacqueline.  She was very accommodating with my party size and dietary restrictions, 3 in my party are lactose intolerant.  We worked on a menu; I pretty much chose whatever fellow Yelpers had tried and recommended in their reviews.  I had been abroad for close to a month, and when I returned, I also received a follow-up on my reservation.  I was pleased with the attention paid to my reservation. The night I arrived at the restaurant, I was a bit shocked to discover that 9 of us would end up on one table with 4 on the other, whilst sharing a table with another party.  This was a major miscommunication error.  When I was informed that there would be tables next to each other via email, I was not aware the tables would be parallel to each other, and not adjacent.  I have had other restaurants warn me of separate tables, but they would be in the same line of sight, just separated by a gap.  Because of this, a few of my guests were immediately put off and didn't feel like they were part of the celebration.  This made my night of hosting a little more difficult as I was constantly maneuvering between the tables to make sure my guests felt welcomed; it was a small restaurant, and at times, I got in the way of the serving staff. Moving on to the food, as I had mentioned, was an 'All-Stars' $40 prix fixe menu based on reviews: Broccoli Rabe Creamy Polenta Grilled Octopus Steamed Mussels Pappardelle with meat sauce Roasted Organic Chicken Tiramisu I added the meat & cheese boards for an additional $9/person.  I was thoroughly satisfied with the various cuts of meat and pate.  I disliked almost all of the cheese selection, which I was very surprised by since I am an avid fan of cheese. We also decided on 3 dozen oysters- I thought the oysters were small, but passable. Based on my own personal preferences and my guests', I found that the food was a mixed bag.  Some people liked items that I thought were poor executions, others disliked the dishes I preferred.  Only a few thought all the dishes were pretty decent.  The ones I liked included the polenta, broccoli rabe, and organic chicken.  The octopus was tender, but tiny- we had to split 2 tentacles between 4 people.  I did not like the fennel and onion sauce that accompanied the mussels, which were also small.  The pappardelle meat sauce was too subtle- I needed more of the veal & pork to come through.  The chicken was where we had issues.  The chicken I had was tender and juicy; I typically don't order chicken at restaurants because they err on the dry side.  I took a chance on it because of its rave reviews.  I was not disappointed in its texture.   I was then told by guests on the other end of my table that their chicken was still alive and "bucking away."  One of my guests was pretty disgusted by the fact that it was bleeding onto her plate.  Jacqueline took my friend's dish away.  Since I didn't see the chicken with my own eyes, I wasn't going to review it here.  However, because I don't waste food, I brought the leftover pasta and chicken home.  While I was reheating the chicken, the bones were revealed to be almost ENTIRELY red. This really got me annoyed.  I was annoyed that my guests were unable to eat it, and annoyed that the whole chicken was not removed and recooked to the proper temperature.  In this day and age of food-borne illnesses, I don't see how any restaurant can afford to serve under-cooked chicken.   Lastly was the dessert- I cannot even tell you how many tiramisus I've had in my life- from small bakeries to homemade to various Italian restaurants to places that offered a twist.  The tiramisu I had here ranked the lowest on my list.  And I will explain why.  It's made with a dulce de leche and fit into a mason jar with espresso granita sprinkled on top.  I didn't mind the mixture so much, but it did lack a balance between the cream and pastry.  The granita was poorly done; since the chef chose to make the granita more on the icy side, they really had to highlight a stronger espresso taste.  It didn't happen because it wasn't consistent; some icy bits had a slight espresso taste, while others were just comprised of plain water.  It was quite the disappointment. This was the most controversial dining experience of my life- I have never had so many people disagree on the quality of food here.  If I judged solely based on service, I would probably give it a 4.5 rating.  I never saw any of the waitstaff slacking; they worked extremely hard the whole night. And so these 3 stars are really for their effort to provide for our tables.  The rating really suffered in the food department; I can see the potential, but the food definitely needs more TLC.

The sammies are Ok. There are only 7 so there is a limited variety. The service feels very forced. The try to over explain each sandwich while they make it. They act like their lunch meat is worthy of a story..darn annoying is what it is. Forget breakfast. They have some muffen with eggs in them. I got one with sausage..it was also a show, with the little muffin thing brought out from the back like it was the star of its own little show..and it did not taste good. So here is some free advice for the U of Penn owners. Focus on making good sandwiches, add a few special ones to add variety. And for petes sake, stop the song and dance around every order. Update...they have made some positive changes and even added some salads. I find myself going there more often.

My aunt and I waited 1.5 hrs to eat here.  Was it worth it?  Um, no.  Not really.  Not even if I had to wait 15 or 30 minutes actually.  I"ll admit, the broth here is very clean and aromatic.  But really, it's chicken broth.  Chicken broth is as clean as it should be, and I'm sure some of the people who eat here are people who generally prefer poultry over its less appealing animal food friends.  The char siu isn't really that special.  It didn't melt in your mouth.  Wasn't really charred enough considering how much fat is in the pork.  And there were too many raw onions and spring onions for me to enjoy.
