These are ownership/mgmt problems. The people who work there and the service is about the best you'lll find in any college town, and the staff are super super friendly. Extra star for you!

A friend recommended this restaurant. Once we got there it was very crowded. They good our drink order and gave us bread which was very cold. The staff was very friendly and super nice.it was pretty good. Definitely would recommend for big parties.

I am such a huge fan for anything Tria....and it holds true for this new location. I stopped in to grab a drink and catch up with a friend. Had a great time sitting at the bar! I love the space and it is a serious upgrade from the previous Rum Bar. The taps behind the bar are exciting and unlabeled (at least to the customer's eye ;) ). It gives the place a casual sort of elegance. Lots of table space in the back which I am sure I will be using in the near future. I couldn't help myself and ordered two appz before going home to eat dinner. We got the mussels and the grilled asparagus with truffle vinaigrette. Both were delicious. What I thought was most impressive about Tria Taproom was the amount of attention we were given by the bartenders. GREAT service. I'll be back soon to try more!

I love this place. I go here all the time. The staff is so friendly and the food is so fresh and delicious. I usually get the bi bim bop. I love the brown rice all veggies and either chicken or tofu with teriyaki and hot sauce. Beware the spicy chicken is really spicy. If you are eating in, the stone bowl is the way to go. We also love the chicken wings for the kids and have never been disappointed.
the best steak sandwich i have had in a long time
Great atmosphere, best oysters I've had in LES. Engaging staff and nice cocktail list. Definitely coming back.

The reason Cafe Triskell receives one star is the outright disrespect I received from the manager. My friend and I were referred to Cafe Triskell from a friend and as two newbies to the restaurant we're excited to eat there! That's when things went sour. I requested a table for two and was seated right away. After looking over the menu the manager asks us to move tables to accommodate a bigger party. This is no problem. However, after moving tables the manager comes over again and says 'due to a miscommunication' we shouldn't have been seated and we need to leave our table and wait another 45 mins for the next table. Keep in mind - the manager did not apologize once for the error of his staff or even offer to make the situation right. The manager grabbed the menus out of our hands and told us to leave. That's when I didn't want to give my money to a place like this. All in all, don't go to Cafe Triskell!!!

Yes, these blueberry pancakes will probably be some of the best you'll ever have. The rest of the stuff is okay. But this place is VERY TINY and ALWAYS VERY CROWDED. The wait staff is too busy to be too friendly with you. Average wait time is between 1-2 hours. For me it's just breakfast, something you can get just about anywhere in Manhattan anyway. Good food, just not worth such a long wait.

Found the food to be pedestrian with no real special dishes. The outdoor patio at the back is a nice place for a drink on a Sunday evening. They do have a good spicy guac with chips that is pretty good.

Excellent staff and presentation.  Kafe Neo has a very friendly and upscale casual atmosphere.  The menu is quite diverse and the portions are actually quite larger than one would expect.  They offer a variety of savory crapes, which I most certainly recommend.  The owner even came to our table to ask how everything was.  Will be returning.  Cheers.

Excellent - Authentic Japanese food. It's as good as it gets in New York with  reasonable pricing. For appetizer, I ordered Yakitori which was very high quality. I had salmon and salmon roe chirashi with set. The set is additional and comes with miso soup, asazuke pickles, and chawanmushi. (Chawanmushi was very good but it will be better if it had ginkgo nuts imho) The salmon was unbelievable. It was cooked so delicately and melted in my mouth. I will be back in a heartbeat!

Fantastic time at Toast! The omelet of the day had spinach, goat cheese and Capri tomatoes--Yum! Spritzers were fab and the perfect quencher for a warm day. I also had a bowl of fresh fruit and unlike some cafés the fruit was FRESH! It hadn't been in the fridge dying an icy death but perfect strawberries, blueberries, blackberries and banana. My kids (3 x 13y + 1(24y) 1 gal pal (13y)) ate everything on their plates and want to return. Above all the service was wonderful!

If you're reading this, you probably want to know about the food. This is the only reason I'm writing this review. The place turns a huge business. The Mexican food is on the salty side, so be ready to drink a lot. I've had better salsa from a jar and the guacamole, not made at our table, was hardly chopped up (avocado chunks were too large). Golden margaritas were very good. The entree I had (chicken burro) was good, but rice and beans...salty. If you don't mind the wait for a table, the noise and getting decent Mexican food for a good price, you'll accept Jose Tejas. If you're going for great tasting Mexican food, maybe you'd want to look elsewhere. Where I come from (Orange County NY), the Mexican food is MUCH better.
Pretty good chicken fingers. I tried the "naked" aka grilled ones.

The dumplings are always great and even if there is a line, it moves fast. I am not sure why the price raise though, so I have started going to other local dumpling places instead. It's still cheap here though.

Custodi catered my wedding and they did a phenomenal job.  Very professional and very affordable for my husband and I.  We were very pleased with the outcome.  The food is fresh and delicious and the service is awesome.  I will look to them for catering in the future.

This restaurant features a wonderful open space, wood rafters, stone and a wall of shuttered windows - perhaps to protect against the Mistral wind- painted in vivd Provençal colors. Such care id decor matched an excellent meal, not traditional Provençal food, but in the spirit, wonderfully fresh ingredients, and perfectly prepared. We sampled the apricot soup, not sweet, but smokey with a delicious chutney and fried oysters that melted in one's mouth. The short ribs were amazingly tender without being dry and other dishes were equally subtlety flavored. We went on Labor Day weekend, so it was not as full, so noise was not an issue and the food came quickly and the service excellent. The dessert, often a weakness at some places was delicious (pot au creme) and the coffee often overlooked at restaurants was excellent.

Came here on a Tuesday with my sister. There was no wait and we practically sat wherever we wanted, that I like, there's a star.  From the reviews I've read, I will never go on a weekend. Our waiter was nice and casual, there's another star. I just liked the whole area and the vintage cheesy pink and blue look of the place, 3rd star. My sister ordered some sort of egg white omelet that had beets and feta cheese in it. I ordered the eggs Benedict. As for food, I'll say meh. I didn't really liked their hollandise sauce, I much preferred Green Egg's sauce. I did liked the spinach however. The potatoes were just regular tasting. Very dry unless bathed in ketchup. My sister's dish was pretty bland. The beets and feta cheese didn't really do anything for the egg white omelet. I can probably make better egg dishes at home which isn't saying much since I'm not really a cook but I am obsessed with eggs. So in conclusion, I'll go there again if I just feel like getting a quick bite and I happen to be in the area. I won't be standing in any lines for this place. The biggest draw for me though is the set up, cute little neighborhood. Love the outside seating even though we sat inside.

I just moved to New York 4 months ago and one of the first things I was introduced to was Halah food. I went to the famous one in Manhattan and was pretty impressed. Since then I have tried a couple of other halah carts in the city which were ok but not great. Yesterday I had the KIng of Falafel chicken and rice plate and it was AMAZING. By far the best I have had in Queens or Manhattan. The chicken was flavorful and not dry at all. (my biggest complaint of chicken)  The sauce was very good and the salad and rice were good as well. The guys at the cart were really friendly and they gave me a piece of Falafel while I waited in line which was really nice and unexpected. The only downside I saw was that there was a line and apparently there always is, but oh well I can see why. I cant wait to go back and try some other stuff on the menu.

Came here for the first time and everything was amazing. Very friendly staff and a great atmosphere. At our table, we had the fried chicken, catfish,  ox tails and several sides. Everything came out great. The bar was a little slow but the drinks were strong and reasonably priced. If you are in the area, it is worth a visit

Some of the best sandwiches you'll find anywhere. I know an Italian butcher who told me in Italy that there was one restaurant that he believed to serve authentic Italian food outside of Italy--without my prompting him, he named Via. If that isn't a testament to its greatness, I don't know what is! My go-to's are the perfect cappucino, the Non Ti Scordar di Me with soppressata genoa instead of speck, the lasagna and the vegetable soup. But really, you can't go wrong. Also, don't whine about waiting--it's worth it.
This Place is Fantastic if you are a ramen/soup fan.

Best place for lebanese food in the area - huge vegetarian selection, relaxed dining room. Delicious falafel, hummus, baba ganoush, tabouleh, mjeddrah...as well as amazing desserts (five different baklavas! fresh halava!).

My husband and I planned 3 weeks in advance to have our daughter's Christening reception here. We told them about 80 people. He put down a $100 deposit. The Christening was February 15. It was a really snowing and very cold. It was only 35 guests.The servers started handing out the menus and told us to put our names on the menu. Instead of calling out the names, they were calling out the orders, which started confusion with my guests. What was the point of putting the names on the menus if they were not going to call the names? Most of my guests did not receive what they ordered.  Service was very bad. They were not ready to serve for a party of 35. I could imagine a party of 80 it would be a big mess. The servers also told my guests that they have no more cups for the hot tea.  One of my guests did not even get his food after a hour. It was very cold in the party room. I requested to speak to the manager but one of servers told me they are not available and will not be coming in. They knew in advance that there was going to be a party and we were expecting 80 guests. I will not come back here.

Great food, from start to finish!  The bread, as simple as it is, is amazing!  It's warm, soft in the middle with just the right amount of crispness, and has a great flavor.  The chorizo was delicious and the yuca was pretty good.  The roast pork is very tender and tasty.  The vaca frita was very tasty but I found it to be a little dry.  I preferred the ropa vieja, which was delicious.  The pollo rincon was amazing - great flavor!  The plantains are good and the rice/bean mix was very good.  The bread pudding was also very good.  One of the best parts of my meal was the Mamey Shake - I had never heard of it before and was more than pleasantly surprised.  As great as the food is, the service is even better.  Rudy is a hilarious guy who remember us after the first time we were there (even remembered what we had ordered.)  Definitely planning another visit there sometime soon.

I fail to see the attraction of this place. I had been here about 2 years ago and had a medicore breakfast.  This year, during the Italian Market Festival a couple of friends wanted to meet there for breakfast again so I reluctantly went hoping for the best,  Again the food was mediocre.  I ordered an omelet with 3 ingredients in it.  The first problem was that it was way overcooked.  There was a brown hard skin on the outside of it.  The eggs themselves were bland and the omelet relied on the ingredients inside for all of its flavor.  The potatoes on the side were completely bland.  They tasted like there wasn't even salt in them.  The coffee had an astringent, woody flavor.  About the only thing that tasted good was the multi grain toast.  That was fine.   Even if my friends want to go back next time I'll politely refuse, eat elsewhere, then meet them after breakfast.

I had a favorite Thai restaurant in the area.  I'll never be back to it.  I've been to Topaz about five times since my first visit and every time they have served me the best Thai food I've ever eaten.  Their tofu is off the chain. I don't know what they do to it, but it's ridonkulous. Plus it's a bring your own. Thanks, Mama. See you this weekend.
Love this place!!! Great beer! Great burger!! Great knowledgable staff! Excellent beer selection, as well as wine!
I liked it, I liked the fries.
Yum.

Service was good if a little "you should be thankful to be here." Atmosphere was good. Bar setup is pretty awkward...if you were looking to have a drink at the bar, keep in mind you will constantly be jostled. Also, try to sit on the main level rather than in the basement with the restrooms. Glad they proactively offered use of coat check, as the dining room isn't ideal for bringing your parka. Food also good. The main problem is that the food doesn't live up to the prices. Take the scallops. Two scallops (delish for sure, but not something amazing), on a little bed of cheesy grits (we're talking 4 tbsp here). $18. Half the price or double the scallops, folks. Same issue goes for the rest of the seafood and meat portions of the menu. For anyone who's ever eaten legit tapas, this will seem silly.

I've never been to a restaurant that needed to have so many tables pushed together to have patrons be seated and to leave. I now know what it feels like to be a Sardine jammed in a pull top can. With it being so overly packed the noise was a bit over bearing, and these factors took away from the food, and why it was rated a three. Osso Buco  was was delicious and the little bit of marrow from the bone was dressed with some breadcrumbs when combined with the sauce was delightful. The Veal Chop parm, was very good and was a real nice treat three hours later. I was able to add the pasta trio for a $9 up charge to my entree, and it was worth it. The linguine with clams was the perfect mix of garlic and oil, but could have had more clams. The Spinach ravioli w/ butter was good, but the bow ties with tomato basil was ok. The Italian cheesecake was very good, someone ordered the dessert sampler and I wished I ordered that because it looked phenomenal and would have made the difficult decision much easier. The extensive wine list for $25 a bottle was quite impressive. If they took 10 tables out of this place and didn't rush people through the dining experience being worried about seating another 30 people it would have been a better experience.

These guys have been one of my favorites for years.....from 53rd and 6th ave to their spot now in harlem. It is authentic, and let me add fresh! Not too many Halal stands can compete! These guys have a HUGE reputation. =) I wont eat it everyday but a night after the club.... most def! Keep up the good work guys!

So glad this finally opened!  The space sat empty for too long and Fairmount needed another cafe / sandwich-y lunch place. The roasted veggie sandwich was delicious, if only a little soggy (bread could have used a toasting).  My bf's brie and fig was a tasty update to a traditional grilled cheese.  Service was friendly and efficient - seemed to have enough staff to handle the PACKED crowd on Sunday afternoon.  Tables are packed in pretty tightly (could have elbowed my neighbor's coffee) but at least we were able to snag a spot. As others have said, the space is bright, clean and open.  The garage doors are a win and let in lots of light. I think the food is reasonably priced (~$15 for 2 sandwiches).  The coffee however seems a bit pricey - $2.75 for a regular 16 oz.  I feel that no cup of coffee should cost more than $2 (unless mules are hauling the beans straight from Colombia), but thank you Starbucks for forever changing the whole coffee pricing structure. I might update to 5 stars after a few more visits, but 4 stars for now.  An egg scramble or power salad is next on my list!

4.8 stars if possible, but only because one of us has a food allergy and their burgers (which do not list ingredients and which none of their servers ever seem to know the ingredients of which is otherwise insanely delicious always causes a need for the Benadryl and occasional EpiPen.)  Alex, if you're reading this, please, inform your staff.  Thank you!  Or Lisa, please inform Alex to inform the staff!  Thank you! Excellent food. Small portions which is sad. Excellent ambiance. Downside: it gets insane crowded for brunch on weekends so YES, it is worth it to get up extra early, be the FIRST ONES waiting in line so that you and your group are GUARANTEED a table and can eat in bliss. The food is excellent. The portions, not so much. That said, THIS IS THE BEST PLACE FOR BRUNCH.  If you are reading this and have eaten at Cranky's, Cafe Henri, Le Tournesol ... three words, "I told you so."  Sorry, that was me drunk on the home made jam that accompanies the home made bread plate that made me miscount.  Four words. Trust me. You're welcome. (there's a reason why SilverCup Studios ONLY Orders their take out from here) (whispering: and they -- SC-- have a B(ig huge)UDGET for food!)

A friend and I (both who have worked in the restaurant service industry) went here for  apps and drinks at the bar, The bartender was some high strung wingnut who seemed to hate his job, he walked around the bar like it had 70 people in it,( there were only 2 other people at the bar) and after finally ordering a draft that kicked as he poured it told us it was gonna be quite a wait for him to tap another keg. We ordered a bottled beer and watched him stomp around acting like a 4 YO  making huge banging noises with the keg right in front of us. After this "show" we only had one mediocre app and not another drink. Get a bartender who likes his job guys!

Great menu and good wine list says it all. This isn't a "bar food" place, although that's something you can have. We ordered Ahi and salmon Tartare, not exactly bar food We followed with lamb and Bok Choy dumplings, not exactly bar food. This is a good thing. The prices were reasonable and the service was great. It may look like a pub, but I've been to "5 star" restaurants that weren't in the same universe as Murphy's Next time, I want to try the lobster Nicoise.......uh, not bar food, thank God.
Clam chowder not quite traditional but good.  Price was as expected for airport food... A little pricey but not unreasonably so.

Still going to Raymond's and still love the food but I must say that the attitude of the staff, specifically the hostesses, is starting to get on my nerves.  They never smile and often act like their doing you a favor.  If you request alternative seating (even when it's not busy) they seem annoyed.  For this, I am lowering my rating.  Get happy or get another job please.

Went there Saturday night, restaurant very busy almost completely full, inspite of this with our reservation,we were seated within seconds. Very efficient front end staff.  We sat down party of five, ordered the fondue with bacon (outstanding), it is served with steak fries and but we preferred the bread. The mix is very rich and flavor prevails. For Main course I ordered the Hangar steak which our waitress, who was named Amanda or Alyssa, recommended. She was so nice, she has a voice identical to and looks closely like Kourtney Kardashian, we told her that and she said she gets that alot.  She is very sweet and careful, when she was busy for a moment she sent another waitress over to check on us and refill drinks.  We felt like we were treated exceptionally.  The Hangar Steak is marinated and sliced and infused with rich flavor and tastes buttery smooth.  The NY strip excellent as well.   The pear salad was outstanding, not your typical salad, but again a careful assembly of contrasting flavors and textures.  This is clearly a member of the Max Restaurant Group, and could be its flagship, but very reasonably priced.

So I went here for an early Saturday morning brunch--9:45.  The place was maybe half full. When you walk in, you're right next to every other table there--no room and really uncomfortable.  I stood waiting for 5 minutes for someone to greet me, unsure of where I was supposed to go. The two waiters appeared, but instead of greeting me, one went to grab a table's orders, and the other wandered around aimlessly. I tried to grab their attention, but both ignored me. Figuring I should seat myself, I wiggled by way into one of the tables.  The second, aimless one, quickly came over to tell me I couldn't be seated without my full party and insisted pretty rudely I get up. I wasn't about to deal with a full hour of being ignored or yelled at, so I left. They may have delicious food, but the service was more than I could deal with.
Angry owner has a reputation for shouting at people for parking in front of his shop. It's happened to me.

Char Siu Pork with rice was amazingly delicious. Tried some of their ramen it was pretty good too. I definitely would order the rice with char siu pork as an appetizer then get a bowl of ramen. Took 1.5 hours to seated because its like a hole in the wall and is very small. Service was great though. I ate 2 hours before I got here so I was still stuffed, if i was hungry maybe I would give this place 5 stars.
Love them! If you need catering for your event, I highly recommend. Truly amazing food!

Our 4th time here and each time It's more enjoyable. 3 1/2 hour meal each course more delicious than the next. Our waiter Matt was excellent helped us pair the wines with the courses My husband did the regular tasting and I did the vegetarian. He loved the scallop best and I thought the squash and fried green tomato were equally delicious. For dessert I loved the fruit plate and he tasted 3 sorbets. After the check when we were full to capacity They brought complimentary small Irresistible chocolates! Can't wait to go back!
samurai ribs are good but i hate waiting forever to be seated

Service wasn't good. They actually were kind of rude. Food was good, but definitely not worth the price. Overall, I wouldn't say it totally sucks, but I wouldn't recommend. Considering all the places you can find in Hell's Kitchen, they should try a little harder.

i cross this cafe few times, but i even go in... until today. Each time i corss there, i talk myself that I must be try once! today, i eat breakfast with my gf. we order Euro breakfast, the savory crep with egg and smoke salmon/ Panini signature with prosciutto parma with mozzarella, tomato and basil pesto. Those taste excellence and full of stuff, also the drink is good too! Especially is the hot chocolate, not too sweet, strong coco taste and smooth. (even i m not a coffee man) I can said the Cappuccino taste better then Starbxxks a lot!! xd... Overall, thats the best cafe in Bensonhurst.

What a wonderfully historic place to eat. Sat there thinking about what it would have been like during the Revolutionary War. Washington eating there as well as a load of other extraordinary people that shape our country and world. I realize much has changes since then but this was the location of some history. When we visited they were renovating parts of the building. The menu was limited but still had ample selection. I had the roast beef sandwich which was served with pickled red onions and horseradish. I love new york bread and the bun was great, the meat was decent but the pickled red onions and just enough horseradish brought it home. Not the greatest roast beef sandwich I have ever had but very balanced that I enjoyed every bite. My wife got the chicken pot pie. She gave me a sample and I knew right away that I was missing out. It came with a salad side that would have been a meal in itself. She loved her CPP and salad leaving the table happy. The staff was pleasant and attentive without being hovery. Sat for a few minutes after they had cleared the table and we declined dessert, finally having to ask for the check. I would consider it again when I am in lower Manhattan and would recommend it to friends that were visiting the area.

This place was decent. Actually, above average really. I think it's just because I've heard soooo many great things about it, that my standards were flying sky high. The soup base was great, I wasn't used to the noodles. Wouldn't say it's the BEST ramen outside of Japan b/c everything I've had back in Vancouver was much better. Like, leaps and bounds. For the set lunch, it came to about $20. Which IMO, is hefty for ramen?
Good food,service and Desert!

I give this place an excellent rating! The chefs specials always add something new and delicious to try. The only problem is that i always stuff myself with the great appetizers and cant finish my dinner. The staff is very attentive and price is reasonable. Defineatly going back

Although,it's far away from where I live, but I went to go on a late lunch double date and the food was great. This is a must visit. Huge space with varying multicolor rooms, great festive music and atmosphere. Every single appetizer I've had is just delicious. Our dishes were flavorful and nicely plated. I assure you no one offered me services other than food or drink. Decent prices....great service...never had to ask for anything.... so if you walk in, don't worry, you're safe...it really is Calle Ocho. I'll definitely be back many more times!

New Year's Morning dining is not easy to find anywhere, so we came here. The amount of baked goods for sale was astounding--stacks and piles covering a round table in front, another stack of elephant ears at the cash register, and even more goodies in the refrigerated display case. We were seated at a center table, and couldn't remove our coats because it was freezing inside.  As the place filled up more, it warmed up a bit, but we were cold throughout the meal. Jim had eggs, hashbrowns, and bacon, I ordered a skillet with some mix.  His food was relatively hot when it was delivered, mine wasn't (I fished out the food from underneath the eggs because that was the warmest food).   It was entertaining hearing the hungover party behind us--"look!  There's kippers and eggs!  OMG, they serve scrapple!"  We weren't sure if they were attempting to make everyone at the table ill or not, but it remained humourous (I think the loudest person from the table ordered a Montecristo--yet another nausea or heart-attack-inducing entree). Friendly service, but the cold food and air turned us off.   I may stop back to try one of their elephant ears, as I haven't had once since I was a kid at a carnival.

This restaurant never fails to meet all of my picky expectations. I couldn't praise more about this restaurant! Their Grilled Octopus is one of the best dishes in NY and I recommend this restaurant to everyone I meet.

It's painfully frustrating that a place with such good food has such bad service. I don't really want to be a yelp-ranter, but we have gone multiple times and time and again, they have proven not to know the basic tenets of hosting, waiting, or general service. From waiting 45 minutes for our food after ordering, to being seated in locations where we literally could not back our chairs out without bothering other customers (when the restaurant was about 1/4th full with plenty of open space), a host telling us every aspect of the table before us and when they may be getting up rather than just giving us a wait time, bringing the incorrect food, broken baby seats (a safety hazard), any quite a few other instances. We consistently go back about twice a year because the food is so creative, but it is getting harder and harder to overcome the terrible service.

The new owners did a great job of renovating the interior of this spot. The staff was so friendly and attentive. The sushi was really fresh and the sushi chef had no problem substituting out items for us. Beers were inexpensive - we will definitely be back. Glad to see something finally work in this spot.

This was recommended by a family member. Took a while to find this place, but that's probably because we had the  wrong address. We spent an hour trying to find it but it was an hour worth the wait.  The boyfriend and I were seated immediately and was attended to pretty quickly considering the amount of people in the joint. We ordered the signature bar size pizza and the homemade gnocchi with vodka sauce and...IT WAS AMAZING!!!
seafood was excellent. service was good. pricing OK.  did not like the atmosphere....too small.

Fantastic restaurant, the staff is very friendly and knowledgable about the menu and cocktails. The drink list is amazing and very extensive. Had the pork belly sandwich which was really tasty and had a little spice to it. Great little private dining room in the basement.

This place has multiple health & safety  violations. They store prepared food in the trash can. They currently have 3 violations pending in the past 30 days. DONT EAT HERE 11D (General Violations Conditions - Documentation) 04L (Critical Violations - Food Protection) 08A (General Violations Conditions - Vermin/Garbage) 02G (Critical Violations - Food Temperature) 10G (General Violations Conditions - Facility Maintenance) 04K (Critical Violations - Food Protection) 06C (Critical Violations - Personal Hygiene & Other Food Protection) 11D (General Violations Conditions - Documentation) 04L (Critical Violations - Food Protection) 08A (General Violations Conditions - Vermin/Garbage) 02G (Critical Violations - Food Temperature) 10G (General Violations Conditions - Facility Maintenance) 04K (Critical Violations - Food Protection) 06C (Critical Violations - Personal Hygiene & Other Food Protection) 04M (Critical Violations - Food Protection) 08B (General Violations Conditions - Vermin/Garbage) 04L (Critical Violations - Food Protection) 11D (General Violations Conditions - Documentation) 08A (General Violations Conditions - Vermin/Garbage) 06C (Critical Violations - Personal Hygiene & Other Food Protection) Violation descriptions: 02G - Cold food held above 41F (smoked fish above 38F) except during necessary preparation. 04K - Appropriately scaled metal stem-type thermometer not provided or used to evaluate temperatures of potentially hazardous foods during cooking, cooling, reheating and holding. 04L - Evidence of rats or live rats present in facility's food and/or non-food areas. 04M - Evidence of mice or live mice present in facility's food and/or non-food areas. 06C - Food not protected from potential source of contamination during storage, preparation, transportation, display or service. 06E - Sanitized equipment or utensil, including in-use food dispensing utensil, improperly used or stored. 08A - Facility not vermin proof. Harborage or conditions conducive to vermin exist. 08B - Garbage receptacles not provided or inadequate. Garbage storagearea not properly constructed or maintained; grinder or compactor dirty. 08C - Pesticide use not in accordance with label or applicable laws. Prohibited chemical used/stored. Open bait station used. 10A - Toilet facility not maintained and provided with toilet paper, waste receptacle and self-closing door. 10G - Non-food contact surface improperly constructed. Unacceptable material used. Non-food contact surface or equipment improperly maintained. 10K - Immersion basket not provided, used or of incorrect size. Incorrect manual technique. Test kit and thermometer not provided or used. Improper drying practices. 10L - Single service item reused, improperly stored, dispensed; not used when required. 11D - "Choking first aid" poster not posted."Alcohol and pregnancy" warning sign not posted. "Wash hands" sign not posted at hand wash facility. Resuscitation equipment: exhaled air resuscitation masks (adult & pediatric), latex gloves, sign not posted. Inspection report sign not posted. Read more: city-data.com/ny-restaur…
The owner must of had the day off, requested table of 6 @ 2:40pm and was told "Sorry we're closed" last time I checked 2:40 isn't 3pm.

This place is fantastique! In the city, food this good would be twice this much. They haven't raised their prices in all the time that I have eaten there. Which is unusual in ny. This is the way felafel is meant to taste (for all those of you not in the know). If it tastes any other way it's due to budget set backs. All their other salads and stuff are also worth trying.

I've only been here for breakfast so that's really all I can really speak to, but this place was pretty tasty. They've got a decent eggs benedict, served with just the right amount of sauce (and one that isn't overpowering either), a huge menu full of all of the traditional American-breakfast items, and then some, and a very nice assortment of fresh fruits. Everyone at our table had something different and everyone left satisfied, which was nice. The place is huge and busy, but we were sat rather promptly and attended to rather quickly... at first. I guess my lone complaint would be the service. Our server was forgetful, slow, and tried to rip us off - took us for dumb tourists, evidently. First off, he served us the wrong number of drinks and then it took him forever to correct his mistake. Secondly, he forgot the bacon in my daughter's "Eggs and Bacon" dish. None of these mistakes really annoyed me that much. What annoyed me was all of the "mistakes" on our check. He overcharged us for two drinks, and he charged us for a side of bacon ($4.50), even though we were still charged the full price of the eggs and bacon dish. What seemed weird was that he deleted the drinks from the check, but didn't delete the side of bacon and simply gave us $5 cash. Oh well, at least the food was tasty.

Cuba was exactly what it is named! From the original Cuban paintings on the wall, to the great tasting mojitos and  the fantastic food , right down to the currency on the wall with the image of Camilo Cienfuegos, Cuba made me feel like I was in Cuba! I had the churrasco with chimi churi sauce , yuca frita and the cerviche , all of which were amazing with great taste! The ultimate mojitos , made with 8yr baccardi rum, were fantastic and made to perfection! The atmosphere was very cozy and to end my night , I was treated to a hand made cigar! What more can you ask for??

JB's has decent food and great music.  It used to be my favorite hangout, but sadly it's been overtaken by self-professing hipsters.  As a result it's become a self-parodying, touristy, meat market. I keep giving the place chances because I WANT to like it.  But I just....can't.   Do yourself a favor and go to the M Room across the street.

My favorite burger bar in brooklyn, incredibly tasty burgers, delicious buttered and toasty buns - good/varied draft selection - great service and prices are reasonable for the quality of food / drinks. Picnic tables out back are a hit in the warmer months.  I'm a fan.

Unfortunately this is my closest local pizzeria. The other one pronto pizzeria is even worse. So this is my standby in an emergency. I actually drive to Royal crown to pick up pizza when I'm hungry, because I feel they have the best pizza. Either that or to deninos. And neither deliver. Something to be said about places that don't deliver, the food is just better. The food quality here is just poor.

I always been a fan of Red Mango ever since they first started with only a single tart flavor.  Now that they have multiple flavors, it's even better.  On top of that, this one is close to my office so it's been a welcome addition over the summer!

...man these are some awesome tasting XLB (Xiao Lung Bao) that my tongue has to thank me again and again long after we left the restaurant. The place is hella noisy, crowded and minimum customer service but that's the Chinese way. 5 stars regardless as the food is what this place is famous for, and it does its food good justice.

Two years after my first review, 2 stars less. Low quality, cold dead pita, and couscous thats more plastic balls than cous. We were in the area and hungry for falafel & shwarama, so based on the Yelp review of someone I trusted (myself) we came here.  Two years has not been kind to Hummus & Pita Co. First, the ordering process.  Right up to the counter, with numerous ordering options and pricing structures, like a combination of a value menu at McDonald's and Chipotle.  Busy place, so I ordered in 5 seconds, regretting my pick quickly enough.  Still, a shwarama pita stuffed with the good stuff should still be good.  Nope. I work down the process, get everything, and watch the ordering process fall apart both in front and behind me, when someone who doesn't know what to do tries to order at checkout and is taken, then others change their order - just not a well-run machine.  The ordering process should be easier, and people who come to the register to order food shouldn't be allowed to do so.  Uy. But the worst was the food.  The meat was unflavored and dry.  Her pita was cold and chalky, not heated or alive - tasted like it had been baked a week ago and put in a box.  The couscous was reminiscent of plastic balls with as much flavor as plastic.  The hummus was okay, nothing special, not anywhere as good as I remember.  Even the soda fountain was super low on carbonation. Things were a mess at the counter and remained so during my time there.  I remember this place being great, but now, not so much.  Two years for a two star decline is no joke, but that's what's happened here.  When the street cart outside has better meat and flavors than the restaurant, two stars is the result.

Food is full of flavor and texture it's beyond belief. Went here because of their yelp reviews and their veggie pho because I'm vegetarian. It was amazing and tasteful. The only thing I would recommend is more mock meat in their soup only had literally 3 small pieces of "meat." Space is small very right but they have a high turn around because they're always busy. We had 3 couples ahead of us and got seated within 15 min, not too bad. Food came out fairly quickly and staff was friendly and refilled our waters 3 times! Great staff!

Everytime I go I get a Shake Stack with cheese fries and a large Abita Root Beer, sometimes with a concrete with strawberry puree.  The meal is super filling and yes it is a little more expensive than a normal burger but the quality is much better than Wendy's.  This is definitely the place for burgers and fries and please just try the Shake Stack, a cheeseburger with a portobello on it as well with cheese sauce, amazing.  I live in South Philly and I will make the trip up to Rittenhouse and search for parking just to get some Shake Shack.
great spot, the kitchen does it right and the staff is super attentive, pulled pork sliders w blueberry barbeque sauce crazy good, i will be back

Chef Mark Simmons of Top Chef fame and formerly of Melt Restaurant has recently opened a new place in Park Slope. Kiwiana.   Great buzz and judging from the last meal I had with Mark you won't want to miss this one! Chef Mark will personally cook and speak with this very exclusive offering.  He has created a unique five course tasting menu exclusively for the group. Priced to include tax and tip for $89.95 with great wine pairings...and with pairings like Smoked and pickled green lip mussels with Huia Gewurztraminer, how can you go wrong! Here's the catch.....To get this DEAL you have to pre-pay @ meetup.com/Eat-Me-New-Yo…

Well I like Stone street so when I like to have pizza around there I prefer Adrienne's. Is it perfect? No, actually their pizza is even a bit soggy in the middle because of the rectangular shape.  But when compared to the other Stone Street places it's good.

Currently my favorite burger joint in Philly! 1. Get the 500 Special with Milkshake. 2. Upgrade the fries to Truffle Fries. 3. Order the Black and White milkshake. 4. Ask for fry sauce. 5. Stuff yourself. 6. Thank yourself for making the decision to follow these instructions. If you've never had truffle oil on your fries, you absolutely MUST try it. What the hell are you waiting for? Go here already.

The fame of the Philly cheese steak led me into a conversation between a rivalry debate- which one is better? Pat's or Geno's?   And Pat's definitely wins. Hopped over from Genos after a disappointed experience. With the wider selection here at Pat's, I ordered the American Mushroom WIT. The beef is juicier and more tender than Genos- yet for both cases the bun was never toasted. and the bun was never toasted. never toasted. it sucked.

After hearing great reviews, I ate here for the first time. My expectations were high and the food was very good, however, we were seated upstairs and the ambiance was subpar. Lack of music, stark walls, and you could overhear everyone elses conversations. I would have preferred to sit downstairs if given a choice. I had a veal dish and it was amazing.

Absolutely delicious home cooked no frills polish fare with the sweetest staff ever. Ended up having a school girl crush on the gruff looking but kind and enigmatic owner man. Definitely say yes to the bread and slather on that butter! Servings are pretty huge and everything we tried was tasty.  Can't wait to come back for more!

I was in search of a nice brunch place that would cater to our big group and discovered Le Grainne through my ever so reliable Yelp app. Much to my delight, I found out this was located literally on the same block as our apartment rental in Chelsea. Convenient! They don't take reservations which was fine since we lived so close. I thought the wait would be terrible on a Sunday but they had a table ready for us within 20 minutes. Wonderful! Here's what I tried: Latte---Ordered a large and it was served on a bowl. Literally! It was steaming hot and was the perfect way to start the morning before the bubblies came. $4.25 Mimosa---No brunch would be complete without this. I just wish they offered an endless mimosa deal for Sunday brunches. $10 a pop is quite steep, don't you think? Escargot---Served with the shells, the platter was overflowing with garlic butter. It was a popular dip on the table after all the escargot was devoured in seconds. $9.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/le-g… Les Moules Mariniers---Huge pot of mussels. The broth was exceptional but I was surprised to see how tiny the mussels were in size. In quantity, there was plenty. I guess I'm used to the bigger ones here in the West coast. Otherwise, it was a flavorful pot that I truly enjoyed. $19 yelp.com/biz_photos/le-g… Fettucini Carbonara---It's an unlikely find on a french bistro menu but I welcomed the sight of it as I was craving something comforting. This did the trick! The pasta was cooked al dente, sauce was creamy and tasty, and the bacon and peas served their purpose for added flavor. It was really good! $19.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/le-g… La Danielle---Crepe with ham, cheese, and egg. Sounds ordinary but don't be fooled. Their crepe is just WOW! The whole thing worked together like magic. Leave it to the French to make something simple so delicious and beautiful!  Served with a side of mesclun salad. $12 yelp.com/biz_photos/le-g… Service was fantastic! We stayed there for a good hour or so and being it a Sunday, people started trickling in and the place was packed. They were busy and yet they were able to give us everything we needed without asking. They checked in on us regularly to see if everything was ok. They were awesome! French little cafe that is reminiscent of an actual cafe in Paris with a few tables outside and more inside, where you can people watch while enjoying a good meal with bubblies or perhaps a cup of coffee...I could definitely see myself being a regular here if I lived in the city. I'm a fan!
It's been awhile since I went here but I remember everything being very tasty.  A little on the expensive side but not too bad.

Enjoyed lunch at Il Vecchio Cafe. The antipasto and salads were great, but my lunch was very salty. The food was good enough for me to give this place another visit. Calandra's bakery is awesome and has the best cannoli's.

Decent quality, but tiny, tiny portions at a big price. You'd think the debu guy who runs it would put more consideration towards scale. $60 for a snack. Bozu in Williamsburg is much better in terms of food, atmosphere, and price. Debu guy can make a killing because of the location and lack of competition. This is the first time I've been compelled to write a review on yelp.

We needed a place open past 10PM for a late-night dinner. They're open until 11 so it was perfect. They were very accommodating and friendly. The spinach artichoke dip was like we've never had before. Lasagna (which was a special) will have your Italian grandmother asking for the recipe. We finished with the tiramisu, which was incredible. Very friendly people, awesome service even for the late hour.

I've been going here for 7 years.  The owners are two brothers from Naples.  They are real Italians from Naples, the birthplace of pizza, and pizzamaking is in their blood.  I've been all over Italy and all over the outerboroughs of NYC and I know pizza.  This is the best non-brick oven pizza that I've ever had in the United States, plain and simple.  It's worth the trip from anywhere.

This is a great unique place where I always seem to start my Friday night off at. Despite always being busy I have never had bad service.The drinks always come out consistent and in a timely matter. The food is also very fresh and tastey. The outdoor area is also very laid back and the bartenders are always more then friendly enough and have a smile on there face with enough time to say hey how you been? despite being busy, A rare quality to find.

This is a very busy restaurant and the front of house needs to be more efficient if they are going to manage high volumes of people. I was told a wait of 45 minutes which in fact ended up being two hours. That's fine if I had known this at the beginning however the three hostess failed to handle the complexity of booking a table for three. The food is good but take some time in your business to train the staff in organizing the queues of people waiting to be seated. We watched several people who arrived after us to be seated before us. Simple ignorance of the staff ignoring us and not even making eye contact when listening to our complaints. Prepare for the wait of the table and its by no means worth a wait of two hours.

I love National Mechanics. The food is really good (homemade hummus), the beer selection is decent (plus $2 yuengling pints everyday), and karaoke on tuesdays is always a good time. The atmosphere is awesome. The building itself is pretty sweet, and the tables may or may not be old church pews. The music is pretty good, last time i was there i remember RJD2 and the beatles. The crowd is usually minimal and the service has been spot-on lately. Overall - good food, good beer (magic hat #9 on tap?), good tunes.  if you haven't been there, make it a priority.

Review #850! 1000 here we come! Good homey space for Italian in the West Village, and a sister restaurant to Malatesta just further up Washington St. Their claim to fame is the delicious home made pasta they use at both places and it doesn't disappoint. Spaghetti carbonara and garganelli with porcini were wonderful. Service was a bit odd because we visited on halloween, and the waiters were dressed up as various figures like Jesus and Gregorian monks and whatnot. But I think it is pretty casual in general. If you want to try a large number of things and feel full without breaking the bank, figure on one pasta per person and share an entree 2 to 3 ways. You'll be nice and full and be out $25 or less per person after tax/tip.
Great local bar with good, reasonably priced food and a nice crowd!
Food was amazing, drinks were some of the best we've had in the city, and service was great!  Highly recommended!!!!

the pizza is amazing and one slice is huge and super creamy. We had the original artichoke pizza and it was amazing. The dine is area is only for entire pies if you want just a slice go next door. its a small place but has great pizza and friendly staff. They have a location in chealsea but this place is still #1.

Before I went to the Food market, I expected that I'll experience a variety of delicious food. but as soon as I arrived, I was very disappointed. You can choose a variety of food from Food vendors. but the prices are not reasonable. I ordered a "Steak Sandwich" from DORRIAN'S Winter Garden. The price was $7. It was just half a sandwich.  It was really a rip-off !! and Eating outside is terrible. It was too cold and the food was quickly cooled. I 'll never again want to experience something like today.

Went to the Highland Pavilion tonight with my wife and I really don't understand the hype.  The supposed view is of a very far away New York City covered by a lot of Jersey City.  Although I made a reservation and was called twice to confirm, when I arrived at the restaurant they did not have my reservation on file.  I had to show them the email I was sent and then told that they would try to find us a spot (which was in an awful little corner). At first I thought it was a bad start so I tried to stay positive.  Then the seafood appetizer arrived with an assortment of frozen, not fresh, seafood.  Honestly, I've tasted better seafood from Walmart.  The entree was the only saving grace.  The diver scallops were great.   Lastly, do not waste your time on the raspberry "napoleon."  Someone needs to explain to the chef what a Napoleon is because that's not what I had.  This is a lazy wafer and cream dessert with no thought put into it.   Overall, completely overpriced and a waste of time.  I was really looking forward to a nice dinner, unfortunately this wasn't the place to go!
Love this place!!!! Food is awesome. Waiters and waitresses are very nice and attentive :) go eat here! You will not be let down.
I was not impressed. The service was good but my Rocky Hill Inn burger was bland and underdone. The chicken was dry and not very good. I won't be going back.

One word... outstanding.  Look Little Italy is a tourist trap.  Plain and simple.  It is really hit or miss there with restaurants.  Some are good... some, you might as well go to Olive Garden for their fake Italian food, because it is about as good. I trusted the Yelp reviews for this restaurant and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT.  The service was stellar, the food was outstanding.  Portion size was small, but probably what a portion is really suppose to be anyway.   All in all, let the tourists get roped into the other places on Mulberry.  Bee-line right to Pellegrino's.

This is a food heaven, and you could easily get food coma here.  This place is just as good as the farmer's market by the SF pier, the Quincy Market in Boston, and/or the farmer's market nearby the Grove in LA.  Yet, the feel is unique and different from all the markets mentioned above. This place is extremely busy when we ate lunch here on a Tuesday.   There's a convention center nearby.  Needless to say, there were a lot of people from the convention center.  Luckily, they put a lot more seating than last time I came (in April 2011).  Still, it took me a while to look for a table, and while I was waiting for my husband to buy food, I was asked way too many times if they could sit at my table.  If you decide to eat here during the week, be prepare to wait online for food and to wait for a table for your party. Also, since it's right in the middle of Philadelphia, it's very difficult to find parking outside of the market during the work week.  And the traffic is terrible like any other city.
Crowded around dinner time so prepare and arrive early. Food is always delicious.

I love the cantina for the chips and salsa and drink menu. The service has really improved over the past couple of years and the new outdoor seating area is great if not a little dark at night time. I will say that the food is pricey for what you get, and the vegan appetizer with the amaranth should be avoided. yuck.
Great food and atmosphere. I hope more restaurants ban Google Glass.
SOOOO good... delicious borsht, and try the veal meatballs in dill sauce. Super tasty, super cheap, super super great.

I can't believe I am just finding this place! My friend had her birthday dinner here and it was amazing. I had the homemade ricotta to start and it was so good, they should sell jars of it to go, I would buy it once a week.  I ordered the chicken entree...it was the best chicken I have ever had. I got to taste a little bit of everyones entrees and I seriously can't say enough about this food, it's delicious. We were all very impressed. The cocktails were also very well done. The service was ok but the food was so good it deserves 5 stars.  I'll be coming back soon!
Went there for Restaurant Week. Good food and service.
Roberta's Pizza and their stupid Heritage Radio Network needs to die.  We almost threw up being forced to listen to this dumb girl talk about wine.  So pretentious and utterly, boring.

Whole table got incredibly sick after eating here. Bacterial infection in the throat. Not coming back here anytime soon. Had congee, bbq pork and roasted duck over rice, wonton noodles, and tea. Not sure which was the culprit.

Loved the small alley approach and speakeasy-style entrance where upon crossing the threshold you feel as though you've entered a secret club gathering in someone's home. We were welcomed warmly and seated on soft embroidered cushions. After given rosewater and towels to rinse our hands, our drink orders were taken and our 7 course meal began! My absolute favorite was the b'stella - it was part Greek, parts African, all delicious. I don't remember the last time I licked my fingers! The lamb and chicken courses were fall off the bone preparation and the grain course was divine - the raisins were just right. The first salad plate and the last fruit plate were both forgettable but understandable bookends to an otherwise unbelievable meal, all for just $25 each without beverages. The bellydancer was also sweet and not over the top but I could have done with just one show, or none at all. I'll be back and would highly recommend to anyone who's in PHL.

In 1996 I was trucking in an 18 Wheeler and was at a warehouse just down the street from R.H. I ask the guy at the ware house while I was waiting to get loaded if I could find something to eat nearby. He recommended Rutt's Hutt. He said (The best burgers and Dogs you'll ever eat.) Now my wife had taken a week off to ride with me so we walked down a couple of blocks and there before my eyes was a parking lot full of Street Rods, Old Cars and a D.J. playing 50's music. I was in immediate Car heaven! So we went into the back side and a man behind the counter was yelling out (Hotdogs, Hamburgers Pepsi) so we ordered two burgers some Fry's and a couple of Pepsi's. The guy behind the counter said (Do you want gravy on those burgers) Now I had never had gravy on a burger so I thought what the heck, (sure I said.) That was the best burger I'd ever eaten and my wife agreed. We went out sat on the ground and ate with a smile on our faces. Then we strolled the entire parking lot checking out the cars. There were a lot of great people there, and it took me back to a time when I was a kid at the local A&W drive in back home, except the burgers were far better. I was so impressed I bought an R.H. T shirt.  A year later a friend was going to New York on business and I told him if he had some time to kill drive your rental car out to Clifton N.J. and find Rutt's Hutt. I told him the story, so he did and he called me on the phone and his words were ( Dude you were right about that place great burgers and dogs) Now I have not been back since, but in my younger days I was a touring Rock-N Roll musician and I have eaten in every kind of Restaurant and roadhouse you can think of. But Rutt's left me with a smile on my face and a place I would recommend for one of the best burgers or dogs on the planet. I hope the place is still the same. I hope to get back there one day. I would love to buy another medium sized T. Shirt   J.D. flint-n-quick@hotmail.com

I come here with friends for quick sushi and I like the conveyor belt idea. It's great for times when you want something convenient but not so much when you want a slow and relaxing dinner. The sushi itself is just about the same as supermarket and the plates are color-coded according to price. I've noticed that they've raised the prices a few times. I remember when the green plate (cheapest) was $1.50 and then they raised it to $1.75, and when I went last week, the price was now at $1.95. I was kind of shocked at this but I guess they want/need to make more $$. For the green plate, one of the selections I pick out often is the salmon roll, which is just six small pieces of sushi with seaweed on the outside and rice and a small cube of salmon in the center. I like to ask for spicy mayo on the side for dipping sauce. As far as the other plates go, they are average at best, nothing very spectacular, very 'staying on the safe side'. I also notice they have a lot of imitation crab meat and chicken meat in their sushi rolls. Not much sashimi or other raw fish options. If you want a wider selection try Sushi House in Rocky Hill. And here is my opinion on their service: pretty awful. They seemed to be understaffed sometimes and I know the restaurant is basically serve yourself from the belt, but when it comes to drink refills, requests for miscellaneous stuff, and the bill--the servers are nowhere to be found. The bartenders are usually on their phones and the sushi 'chefs' ignore everyone else. When I glance into the kitchen I see a couple of kitchen staff but the waitstaff are lacking in quality. One server basically rushed my friend and I out of the restaurant when it was empty in the afternoon and waited for us right next to our table as we got out our money to pay the bill....then he proceeded to swipe the tip I left on the table and put it in his pocket-- just as I had put it down for about 2 seconds. Very appalling and I hope to see better service from waitstaff. One other time I was here, the waitress was very impatient and gave me attitude when I reminded her I asked for my bill 20 minutes ago. The only reason why this place still has business is because it's a 'conveyor belt' sushi place and people love anything 'exotic' and Blue Back is a sure place to earn money.

Doesn't even deserve a star. We literally did not have a waiter so the manager had to sort of take care of us.  Absolutely no service like didn't even take an order or welcome us, but our waiter had time to drop a check... Food was awful they handed us two crayons for a three year old (yellow and gray) and so not kid friendly with hot chicken tenders that were huge and mashed potatoes.  Not good from start to finish. We were in there for an hour and a half for a couple of sandwiches... Took us a half hour to get milk for the kid.  Doesn't take much to at least acknowledge a table or something.  Better off at Friendly's.

Honestly? LOVE this place. I love the space. Every time I'm here, I wish I had a reason to throw a party there and rent the whole place out. I love the decor for the holidays, and I love the place without it. The food is yummy and affordable bar food, and the service is generally pretty decent. The servers are always nice, but when it gets crowded things can get a little crazy. Beer selection is good. Etc etc. I particularly love National Mechanics as an escape from the typical bar scene in Old City.  It's a haven of sorts from. well. yeah. It also helps that the first time I came here was to see Peekaboo Revue... a little t&a will help warm any establishment to my heart.
We came here around midday and waited for about 45min for a table. The ramen was very delicious and it was great to get 2nds once you finish the first serving!
Great happy hour; great prices. Modern, edgy decor. Open kitchen which can be a plus or minus. Food is amazing...great place to unwind.
Yes. It is that good. Really.

The food and atmosphere are great! On the other hand, the staff is quite RUDE! I work in a super busy restaurant myself but these people aren't just busy quick rude(which happens in busy places) but they are "I don't want to talk to you or serve you rude"especially the people who answer the phone. I keep going back because the pizza is amazing but the service never fails to be cold.

Talk about being embarrassed.  My husband and I took a very important client out to dinner on 11/5/11 and the client ordered the monk fish.  What came out was a serving the size of a scallop. How I regret not having my camera or phone with me to share this with you.  I asked the waiter what it was, thinking there was some confusion with the order, but there was no confusion at all.  This was intentional on the part of the chef.  The client was 6 feet 2 inches.  Marc: Do you think this filled his big toe?  I don't know what you can possibly be thinking with respect to portion sizes. We took our client for a pizza after spending a ton of money.  Shame on you.

Have you ever wanted to find a restaurant that completely satisfied your appetite with something spectacular I'm talking about send your taste buds out of this world well then you need to pay Terre' a Terre a visit , I'm telling you you won't be disappointed the food is amazing. Chef Todd Villani you are awesome. you can tell your a man that is completely dedicated to your work and it shows in each and every one of your dishes i have not come across a plate of your food that i wasn't satisfied with yet.  i was in the restaurant recently and i was completely satisfied with my experience your staff where all very nice but one person stood out to me and that was your manager crystal, Talk about being out going sweet and greeting every customer with a smile she has the whole package she made me feel welcomed and i loved that the most . keep up the good work at Terre a Terre this place rocks.

Been going here for years now. Went there last week with my boyfriend and found a fly in the noodle soup. Made the complaint and all I want is a new one and they refused. They said the noodle is almost finished and it flew in the bowl after they send out to us....... They just lost a regular customer over a fly.....
fantastic

You should have seen my 14 year old, gluten intolerant nephew's face when he looked at the menu: "I CAN HAVE PASTA!!!" He had not just one choice of gluten free pasta, he had **several** choices. The kid was in heaven! And the rest of us made out pretty well, too: The calamari appetizer was perfect, the seafood pasta my husband had was nicely done and the gnocchi with pesto was devoured by my picky niece. All in all, a grand success! Definitely worth going!

Stopped. In. Late. At end of day.  Place was. Not. Clean ordered. Mussels marinara. Sauce.  Was.   Excellent;  but. Mussels were. Rubbery. Tough. I was. So. Disappointed. Eaten. Here. Before. Had. Great. Dinners.  Well.  Ordered. Ravioli.  They. Were . Good.   Best. Thing. The. Sauce. And. The cold. Antipasto.  End. Of. Night.  Too. Noisy.   Staff. In hurry.  To get. Out.  We're. Cleainig.  Around. Me.  best. Inthe. Day ;or. Just.  For. Take. Out.

Their buns are to die for! The wait gets crazy at night so go during the off hours. They have such delicious ramen and I wish I got out of work earlier so I could go more often. I had the chicken buns and they were really crispy but saucy and moist on the inside. I also had the hakata classic and it was great. The broth wasn't super salty. If I hadn't ordered chicken buns before, I would have had the second round of noodles.

The staff was very friendly and anxious to answer our questions. What I really loved was the sampling of all menu items. I am somewhat fussy, however everything was truly outstanding. The Front St area is also a very exciting area for Hartford and will only get better. Congratulations to Nixs and welcome to Hartford!

I just had to write this review to not only say how great the food is, but also to discount the rediculous review by Jay N. I am not an owner(I will happily post my full name) but a very satisfied customer who knows his food. I can enjoy a business lunch at Per Se and still appreciate the quality and value at a place such as Mamagyro. I have been there over 5 times and have never found the service to be anything but super friendy. The Gyros and Souvlaki are top notch and surprisingly, the cheesburger I ordered for my son last night was FANTASTIC (and the best fries in the neighborhood....traveled very well). My wife was very happy with her veggie burger, hummus and salad. Did I mention how CHEAP it is? This is why the review by Jay N. is SO OFF!!!!!!! This will be the beginning of many Mamagyro restaurants.....trust me....give it a try....i'm pretty sure you'll agree with me.
This thai food is what they call "thai" at malls across America. Bland and unoriginal. No need to eat like this when in NYC.

Brickyard! What a great find! My friend and I stopped in to have brunch one afternoon a month or two ago after a trip to the park. The food was phenomenal and I absolutely loved the space. The decor is lovely and I immediately thought that the back room would be an amazing spot for a party. We spoke to the owner, Pat, and he could not be more gracious. About 2 days later I got the ball rolling and scheduled a halloween costume party for the night of October 30, 2010. 3 hours, open bar (craft beers, wine, well liquor) as well as some great appetizers (we chose: sliders, chicken satay, and veggie potstickers) for $45 a head. Each guest paid at the door and received a bracelet. They have many other options for planning private parties and really help you along the way deciding exactly what will work for you. The staff was very kind and helpful making the party a complete success! They reorganized the furniture in the room, took some out, and made the space exactly how we wanted it. We brought baked goods and party favors that they gladly stored for us and brought out toward the end of the evening. Service was seamless and followed a timeline that we laid out. In all aspects, I would recommend Brickyard whether you are stopping in to enjoy a bloody mary and a delicious brunch or are interested in planning a party. Many thanks to the Pat and the rest of the staff! We had a wonderful time this weekend!
Great little sushi place in LES. It's pretty small but has a great atmosphere. The Lovely role is incredible. Amazing prices on beer and the service was great. Definitely plan on going back.
5 stars for the pizza minus one star for not answering the phones ever and being an overall zoo!

I highly recommend Fernando's to all my friends and relatives. The food Is excellent and the service is always good. Between the menu and the days specials there is always something great to choose from. (BYOB) and the atmosphere is open and pleasant.

The staff was very attentive to my daughter's peanut allergy last night. They were very willing to create a dish for her that met her allergy and vegetarian needs.  The food was delicious and the service wonderful.  My entire family enjoyed the food, staff, and atmosphere.

Heavenly!  I know that Philly is known the world over for their cheesesteaks, but Hoagie Haven truly cannot be beat. This place is a MUST for anyone visiting the Lawrenceville/Princeton area!  The sandwiches are to die for from the regular cheesesteak to one of their hot or cold signature sandwiches. I've been eating here for the past 20+ years.  Every time I am in the area I have to make my pilgrimage here and have a cheesesteak...no ifs, ands, or buts about it. Very affordable...but get there either a little bit before lunch or a little after lunch because the line gets LONG (and often out the door).

Don't plan on getting your food right away here. The guy takes his time cutting up the meat. There's another place a couple of steps down and the guy there chops away like a madman so a lot of people go there instead to get their food quickly. But the food here was worth the wait! The roast pig and roast pork are SUPER good!!!! There's no seating, but my friends and I just took our food to the park nearby and ate there. No biggie. Also, don't be fooled by the word "small"--the portions are huge! I had to share mine with a friend.

a relatively small joint in the village with amazing food and attentive service - kudos to you if you can get a table on a friday night! we were able to :)  anyways, there's a great selection of wines and liquors but everything (food and especially beverage) was more on the pricey side. plan accordingly. you can drink and eat at the bar which makes the space a little uncomfortably crowded yet friendly at the same time. when we got seated at the table i was able to enjoy the patee special for appetizer and the ever-so-often recommended black label burger (lettuce and tomato served on the side).. DELICIOUS!!! fries were great too, thin and fresh and crisp. spicy pickle, not necessarily my thing but i indulged anyways obviously. the wait staff is always walking around refilling your water and checking up, a little too much if you ask me but i'm not one to complain about getting too much attention. this is a place i wouldn't have found by myself so i am very happy i was introduced to it because you should absolutely hit it up if you can!

Wow! Everything we ordered was beyond expectation.  We had the sliders and feta to start and the Bronzino and roasted chicken as entrees. It was all fantastic and good portions. We were feeing full after the apps. I add the cucumber cocktail and it was so refreshing. Our entrée took a few minutes to come out so they brought us a bulgar wheat salad in the mean time, delicious. Great staff, can't wait to try other items on the menu.

One of my friends could not stop raving about the Cuban sandwich at Cafe Habana....as a recent transplant to New York, I decided to check it out.  Unfortunately, with all the subway construction, my train was rerouted and I had to get off somewhere random.  Totally starving, I navigated my way to Cafe Habana thanks to my trusty blackberry plus googlemaps.   And yes, I think the Cuban was worth the journey.  I have to admit that I was skeptical due to a bad experience with a cuban sandwich in my past.  But this was delicious pulled pork goodness surrounded by ham and slathered with some sort of chipotle mayonaisse. Delicious. I also had the corn, thanks to the suggestions of other yelpers and it was sweet and covered in a delicious buttery sauce.  Note that I got food from the To Go counter and it was fast although very cramped waiting.  I am looking forward to returning and trying other things on the menu!
the spicy beef noodle soup is a damn fine soup. It makes my nose run, my eyes water, and my skin turn bright red. Its the most fun you can have in nyc for $4.

Awesome! Great menu, food was top notch quality. Presentation was unique and artistic, waitstaff was attentive. On my first visit I decided to come back. The specialty rolls were flavorful and fairly priced. The atmosphere is wonderful, clean, and warm. I highly recommend this place to any sushi lover

Terrible customer service. You're supposed to email for information and reservations, but we emailed 3x and got no response. Tried calling, no answer.  Maybe the food is good, maybe it's not. Never plan to find out.

My one piece of advice when it comes to this place: If you want prime rib, arrive early.  It's apparently their most popular item, and their selection runs out fast. For my first stop here, I dined alone at the bar and ordered the 10oz prime rib.  I normally enjoy my steaks mooing, but was informed that the best they could do was medium; I went for it anyway.  The steak came out closer to medium well and was a little tougher than I would like (for which I will absolutely not ding the restaurant; I knew what I was getting into), but it was very flavorful.  Their mashed potatoes were excellent.  Their mixed veggies of summer squash and zucchini were served swimming in butter and also delicious.  I capped the meal off with a snifter of Woodford Reserve for an all-around pleasant experience. My second visit was with my brother who was in town on business.  After our first choice for dinner didn't pan out, we came here.  I again ordered the prime rib, but was informed that the best they could do was well done, which was simply out of the question (to quote my brother: "The cow already died for us once; why kill it again?") .  My brother and I each went for the T-Bone, which was amazing.  Perfectly seasoned and a true-rare preparation (harder to find than one would imagine).  One could have cut the filet side of the steak with a butter knife.  Service at the bar was a little spotty, with the bartender disappearing for long periods at a time.  Still, it was Brewfest Friday, so I'm sure he was swamped.  Regardless, he was very friendly and knew his stuff. All-in-all, an excellent steak place.  Very good service and a fantastic beer selection.
Geno's is where it's at... awesome hot sauce

Exactly what I was looking for down here.  I good menu with a ploughmans lunch finally and reasonably priced good..  Happy hour $1 oysters are a bargain.  From a good beer selection to specialty cocktails the downstairs bar and upstairs lounge are great.  Its a relatively small place but well worth the visit.

Delicious Surprise!  I live in the neighborhood's was hoping, praying for Anella to be good, and it was great!  I can't wait to go back with friends.  Loved the fresh food, and inquired, and found out a lot of it was locally grown.  My only issue was the portions were HUGE, and the restaurant was not crowded hopefully if word gets out it will be a little bit more happening...ambiance-wise.

This place is incredible! Staff are very warm and friendly and the food is on point! Very flavorful and never over cooked. Anything you order I will attest to it going to satisfy your every taste bud. If your looking for a good drink the bartenders here are cool and can make a cocktail.

Excellent food!  Found this restaurant on yelp.  Went on a Monday night and the place was empty.  Ordered a Guinness and this was the best Guinness since my last trip to the UK.  Ordered a burger that the server recommended.  The Truffle Burger was excellent!  Burger was cooked exactly as I ordered it, was large and tasted fantastic.  Went back on Thursday and was lucky to get inside.  The restaurant was packed.  When this restaurant is busy it is hard to hear a conversation as the noise level is very high.
Good service and delicious!

Had the margherita with pepperoni and it was classic.  Pepperoni were perfect little crispy curls of goodness and the crust was airy, chewy and  delicious.   Was stuffed after dinner, but my wife insisted on a brookie bridge, which turned out to be the surprise icing on the cake because it was ridiculous... two brownie/cookies that were a chocolate dream with a scoop of vanilla ice cream in the middle.. out of control!! There was a little wait, but that should probably be expected for Patsi Grimaldi's pizza...   We'll be back...

Ate here during a weekend trip to NYC, this place was recommended to me by a traveling friend. Ended up sharing a meal with my Mom, ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger and a side of Mac n' Cheese. The cheeseburger was standard fare, HUGE, and the mac n' cheese was fabulous. Ordered a slice of raspberry cheesecake to go, it was a large slice and was pretty delicious. Service was okay, they were busy and our waiter clearly had no time for pleasantries. All in all, I would eat here again.

Yum yum yum yum yum! This place rocks! The yakitori was delicious and so is the ramen! My friend and I ordered skewers of glizzards, a bowl of ramen and a bowl of yakitori chicken don. The skewers were beautiful seasoned and grilled. Even though they look simple, the way they served it on the bowl of rice was mouth-watering. The colors of the grilled chicken were so, so beautiful! The ramen was also good. I actually like the ramen here more than Ippudo. The soup wasn't as rich, but for some reason, it was more flavorful. Oh yes, the portion was just right.
Tried this place out ....and the panini's were so good and prices are reasonable.... the wifi was convienient to get work done... the people are very friendly....definitely will be back there often
Decent Italian place, and recommend it if you're in the area.  I always know the quality is decent. Loved the spicy mussel pasta that other Yelpers mentioned. I found the staff friendly.

was in NY and was taken to this spot and when I got there I just said "OK",...Oh my goodness, this was a great find, I really enjoyed my burger, which taste like a grade "A" steak, very impressed...Loved it, good Job. 4-stars because you can only get about 15-seated guest.

Always walked by wondering what the draw was. Last night, took my moms out for an evening dinner. The place was smaller than expected and I assume smaller than they would like it to be because the place was PACKED. Every seat and space used allowing one to get friendly with their neighbor especially if you want to be noisy and look at what someone else is eating. Doing it sly is hard to buck up and ask what their eating cause I did and found out about the MAC ATTACK. Three medium servings of different styles that were gooey and intense in flavor. Personally favored the Buffalo Style and Smoked Gouda with Bacon. And not the bits type either. Priced perfect for sharing for 2 but be warned. This serving with the bread and a glass of one of their signature cocktails is enough for a meal which means my dinner went into a doggy bag and didn't even get chance to get to the dessert menu. Entree choice was the Butternut Squash Ravioli which consisted of 6 huge BS. raviolis with roasted butternut squash squares scattered around. Toasted pine nuts and sauteed sage in a Meyer Lemon butter sauce surrounded the yummy confection. Now, one may not think this is anything new, common ingredients but I enjoyed the addition of arugula, garlic slices, stuffing croutons, and large shavings of Parmesan cheese. The bites I had there were really good and hearty and having it for breakfast the next day tasted even better. Definitely going back. The waiter was very nice and did a great job considering the amount of tables he was handling. The missing star is for the fact that I think the restaurant knows how good it is and piles a lot of people in there plus, by serving if I must say, large portions, people can sit there and eat that much so they take the food to go making a normal 1-11/2 hour dinner sit down into 30-40 mins. Can we say turnover? When it gets warmer, I'll go there again and get a nice table outside away from the crowd inside.
