The pie itself is going to be the best you have ever tasted. Better than Frank Pepe's, better than Roberta's, better than Grimaldi's and better than anything in Old Forge. The pizza is served in a commercial baking sheet. The shape is not round nor square. More of an oval shape, but some of the edges bleed into the square corner. The crust is ashen and leaves your fingers black. The sauce is thin and spread evenly throughout but packs a punch. The cheese is oily, but layered to perfection, not too heavy, not too light. The pies are sliced up in a kind of obscure pattern, but the slices can kind of be eaten in two to three bites, and each pie usually has 16-20 slices. The taste is going to wreck your pallete, in a good way. The slices kind of melt in your mouth. The sauce is kind of watery and it coats the entire top layer of the slice. The crust has the perfect consistency and the bottom is charred from the brick oven. Well worth the wait.
got to say ill give it 3 starts the pizza was gr8 but but the lines r all ways long

This place packs customers in like sardines. We had someone from the next table sitting halfway at our table. The manager apologized at the beginning of the meal for the overcrowding, but never did anything about it. The waiters were constantly banging into our chairs and our table. The food was fine, but this restaurant is poorly managed. Better to find somewhere else in the neighborhood.

I must say , i have been there before, i only went there because of the decore , the food was very bad before, but now it seams like a different place now .I can see it's improving. the lady that used to be at nanking was extreemly nice to us. I  won't mind taking my family there now.  I am sure they will have a good time Sal

Love this place... Great pizza, lives up to the rep, great dishes, too.  Associated bar (and Roberta's Tiki) also kick more than sufficient ass.  Not too much annoying hipsteriness, all-around good food and times.  Count yourself lucky if you score Paris as a bartender, as she's the real deal, genuine, sweet and attentive.  Hope to encounter her here myself again one day, as she'll make you want to come back, too..   if it's on your radar, don't hesitate, go visit!

I took my wife there for the first time. The service was excellent. We had the five course meal which I highly recommend otherwise you may come away hungry. The portions are small which makes this place on the pricey side but the food is excellent. I may need to try their rooms next

I had dinner at Scarpetta last night and the food was amazing. The creamy polenta was to die for and the burrata was great too. I had the duck and my boyfriend had the short ribs. Both were very tasty. The service was very good and the overall experience was great. Scarpetta is a perfect place to get great food and good service.
Great please to eat. For the best cookies anywhere go to the PA General Store.

In town for the first time, I relied on Yelp reviews as I usually do and they rarely disappoint. I ended up at Salute at 8 on a Friday night and rocked up to the bar for dinner. After reading reviews, I asked the bartender which of three choices I should go with, he immediately responded Rose Pasta. It. Was. Decadent. After polishing off about half, I asked for a dessert menu before letting them take my plate. Seasonal creme brûlée: Apple Spice. What?!? Sold. It was so amazing that I would definitely consider going back for another because I was only able to finish half. The ambiance is great, with marble (maybe granite?) stacked walls and great, home-y decor. All of those things would elicit 4 stars usually. The hospitality made it 5. Chris, the bartender, was so great. Incredibly personable and attentive, and not just to me. This place has regulars for a reason, and they become family. I enjoyed even watching customers come in and everyone from the bartender to the servers to the owners warmly greet them with a handshake or hug and genuinely wondering how they are doing. I loved this place, and it would be hard to find somewhere I feel so comfortable sitting and having dinner by myself anywhere.
chicken and waffles

The boyf and I went here for University City's Dining Days tonight ($15/person for an appetizer, entree, and a dessert?! STFU!). I'd been before, but my first experience was kinda... ok? But I like second chances. And I freaking love cilantro. So, Vietnam Cafe was our choice for dinner! A few days ago, I left a question on Vietnam Cafe's facebook wall asking if any desserts were vegan (I'm one of THOSE people), and I was informed that they all contain dairy. Oh well. No dessert for me, but I could at least still have a cheap dinner! Upon arriving, our waiter informed me that the 3 pudding desserts were, in fact, vegan. I took the risk! But first, let's start with appetizers. I got the fried tofu (ask for vegan dipping sauce!), and it was pretty good. I mean, the tofu was fried perfectly and the sauce was great, but the tofu tasted like... just that. Tofu. For my entree, I got the vermicilli rice noodle dish topped with fried spring rolls and crushed peanuts. It was a LOT of food. The spring rolls were pretty good... but still, some flavour was missing. Some umph! Some salt! Some peppers! Some soy sauce! Something... I'd eat it again, sure. I have the left overs downstairs. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't AWESOME. Of course, since our waiter told us there are vegan dessert options, I go the taro pudding (taro + rice + coconut milk, served hot). So simple, SO GOOD. SOOOO GOOD. I didn't think the service was slow at all, but we went at a 4 o'clock on a Sunday. Our waiter was super nice! And 100+ bonus points for the prettyfullness of the restaurant.

I went for brunch on a Saturday and despite the lines outside walked right in and was given a seat - probably because I was dining alone and it was easier to seat one person rather than 4 or 5 people at 1030am. Or they just felt sorry for me! The service was fantastic and the staff were genuinely friendly - instead of just when it's time to tip them. I ordered the signature dish - Benedict Jane - which unfortunately came before the coffee did, which made me think that it was pre-cooked as the crawfish cakes were not hot and even a bit soggy. That said I will give them another go because the service was good and the atmosphere great - even if the music was a bit too loud and rock-like for that hour.

Another day of rock climbing. BKB was nearly empty, so I pushed myself. Hard. Three hours later, I was craving food. As it is so often said, with great ascension comes great responsibility. I got in the car and was instantly drawn to Boerum Hill. It was as if a voice was quietly whispering directions to the burger promised land. I then realized that Sean M. was with me, and wondered why he was whispering. We walked in. Amongst the ~20 tables, only a party of five was eating, while a brunette with impossibly blue pants was sitting alone at the bar. We looked at the menu, which used a lot of words to essentially ask, "burger or hot dog?" We both ordered the Breakfast Burger. 10 minutes later, I was presented with a buttery brioche bun, on which rested the most perfect patty, bacon and fried egg I had ever laid eyes on. I picked up my cholesterol vessel and took a bite. The giant liquid explosion that ruptured forth from the egg could not have been a better metaphor. This burger is the reason people laugh at the Shake Shack lines. This burger is the reason that America won the Cold War. This was the best burger I can ever remember having in this fine city. Why not five stars? The fries were average, they need to offer more sides, and since the restaurant decor is nicer than the menu suggests, it was odd that the waiter appeared to be wearing his "laundry day" t-shirt. But 4 out of 5 cardiologists agree that you shouldn't be dissuaded from coming here.

A friend of mine recommended this restaurant to me while I was in Linden. I was extremely pleased. The food was just great, the service was great, and the overall experience was very relaxing. I ordered the beef short rib. The meat was very tender, very juicy. My sister ordered the spicy tiger shrimp. She enjoyed that as well. :) But the dessert was, by far, my favorite. We ordered the dragonfly desert sampler.       It was delicious. Just delicious. The only critique I have is on the fish tank. It needs more fish. For those of you who haven't gone, I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Simply perfect. The best pizza (tomato pie) anywhere hands down. This crispy thin crust style is very unique to our area and DeLorenzos does it to perfection. In addition to the pizza, the salads are excellent. You can split a salad at least two ways, but they are big enough for more to enjoy.

I liked this place! Nice atmosphere, good service and the food was tasty. Although I chose not to share a meal, that is definitely at option for the larger meals (just ask your server).  Some of the meals are a little pricier but I think generally the food is good.   They have a bar upstairs and some tables. There is a downstairs also where most of the tables for dining are located. We ordered a carafe of red sangria. It was good! For dinner I ordered lomo saltado. It was a little salty (I think due to the soy sauce) but I was satisfied with it and left some to take home. Friends of mine had he roasted chicken and loved it as well (garlic sauce-amazing)! I would definitely go back.

This is like my New Haven version of Cheers. It's a bit of an older crowd, but it's still fun. The bar has decent beer, and very inventive drinks. The food is always good quality, made fresh, and the servers are great. I have eaten on both sides, the bar and restaurant, and they are equally good. The restaurant menu changes every now and again, but it's all locally grown stuff where it can be. The State Street Sirloin, and the rack of lamb are my two favorites on the restaurant side. Always good to perfection, and the ONE TIME I had to send the lamp back because it was overcooked, there was no issue, and they were super nice about it. On the bar side, I usually get a CM's burger, though the Open Face Steak Sandwich is by far one of the best I've ever had. They have curly, sweet potato, and steak fries, and give you extra pickles at no charge. The pear salad is pretty awesome, but even the regular salad is delicious too. Their dressing is delicious, and I think it's house made. I consider much of the wait staff friends, since they remember my name, my orders, and my preferences for fries. Great people, nice place, and I love it there.

Having spent most of my childhood in Chennai, I have very high expectations from any place that claims to "capture the taste of Chennai." While the food here doesn't quite match up to "kovil" food, it's still a good place for authentic tamil food. We went here for a weekend lunch buffet, which at 12(ish) bucks, is a great deal. This is the only place that I know of in the tri-state area that actually serves idiyappam and that itself is worth 4 stars in my  book. The chutneys were excellent, and the urandai kuzhambu was perfect. The idli and vadai were delicious.  The sambar, rasam and dosas were good, but I've had/make better. I'm so glad that there's finally a south Indian restaurant that offers more than the standard idli/vada/dosa. Will definitely return.

We have been here one time with friends and enjoyed it very much. Today we returned with family. We have three vegetarian grandchildren,a vegan daughter and a son in law who will eat almost anything. Sometimes it gets a little tricky going out for dinner with the fam trying to find a place where we can all enjoy a variety of options. We left Memphis Grill and Everyone was full and happy. The selections were great!
Great food; great atmosphere.
This is an Italian heaven in Manhattan. There is such an amazing array of Italian foods that are so fresh you feel like you are in Italy! I can't wait to go back!

i went the day before their opening day... so i went again just to try it. (it's conveniently located next to the asian food center.) hmmm first impression from the menu. the food is pricey. most things are $10 and up. i should have known this just by looking at the fancy decor. we ordered moo-na-rok (hell's pork) and duck curry. the server is clearly not thai because he asked whether i wanted my moo-na-rok with pork or chicken. it's like asking "would you like your chicken sandwich with chicken or beef?"... but anyways the food came. moo-na-rok was actually very delicious. the pork was flavorful and very tender. loved it! but the duck curry was so-so. the duck wasn't roasted right. the skin was not dry enough... good stuff. but it's too pricey for what it is..
Awesome place. We come here all the time. The cost is great and the ambiance is cool.

My friend and I decided to give this place a try last night, not too busy but not empty we grabbed seats at the bar for some cocktails and a snack. We ended up trying more drinks than food but that's never an issue in my book. The bar is beautiful, I love the new décor, a little dark, but wood bar, somewhat romantic. Reminded me of a classier English pub. I wanted to love the food but can only give it a B+ the Rueben spring rolls were very good but somewhat greasy (like others have said) and the French onion soup dip while tasty was only a tad better than the French onion dip you mix up at home with a package (I expected it to be warm and have cheese for some reason but no such luck...) not super inventive. The chips were good. I definitely want o come back and try the wings, some of the other dips and the sam'ies. The drinks were all awesome! Strong, not too sweet but different and tasty! Loved how inventive and fun they were (the names are fun to order too)!

Kefi and I got off to a rocky start when the hostess told me she didn't have my reservation due to computer problems.  She believed I made a reservation but kind of looked at me like what do you want me to do about it.  The place was a complete zoo, as if the entire UWS was waiting to be seated.  After politely stalking the waitress we were seated in about 30 minutes.  Wait staff was pretty crazed too and brought us the wrong entree but quickly swapped it for the correct dish. I was disappointed that the new location isn't nearly as charming as the old location.  The place was enormous but we still sat so close to the couple next to us that I could smell the garlic on their breath.  Unlike the old location there was a huge sign outside and the wait staff boasted the Kefi brand on their matching t-shirts. That said, I'm willing to give Kefi another chance because the food is still pretty delicious - especially for the price.  So please try Kefi but go on a night when you are feeling patient.

Excellent food and drinks! I would've given this five but the waitress focus was not up to par. She kept forgetting the corn bread for the table and taking to long to refill the mimosa at my table. However the chilled atmosphere, music and the food will definitely see me again.

Really delicious Bahn Mi. If only I could fit my stroller in the door I would give them 5 stars! I really enjoy the shredded chicken- healthier than the pork and just as tasty. One thing- I like my carrot and daikon pickle cut a little thicker but that's just me.

Most Terrible restaurant  management and OWNER. Don't ever book them for a party they are THIEVES. they literally stole my cousins money. My cousin booked and PAID for a christening party at this restaurant weeks in advance. Sent out invites and so forth. The night before the owner called and canceled the party with no valid emergency or reason and just said I'M SORRY. HE refused to refund my cousin and left her with over a 50 guests to entertain. Luckily Mr Bruno's Italian restaurant saved the day which the food was much better than Bella Roma's , and the service was amazing especially it was less than 24hr. Notice. DONT CATER OR HAVE A PARTY THERE OWNERS ARE THIEVES.

Best in the area. Order from the "Chinese" menu! Pepper steak is wonderful, as is the shrimp with walnuts. I have dined in and done take out. I find the dine-in experience much better than take out, if you have the time.
One of the best halal cart food in NYC!

We had greatly anticpated our evening at Scarpetta, but left disappointed.  Once seated we were met with a waiter (Russel) who didn't seem like he had the time of day for us.  In our party of 2, one of us wanted the Chef's tasting menu, we were told, with some degree of gruff, absolutely not, it's for the entire table or not at all.  Since I personally was the one not having it, I said, "I am completely fine with enjoying my wine while he is served", we were still told NO!  So, what I want you to take away from this is that we were told we could not order what we wanted!  UMMMM.  This, just by the way, is not our first experience in an upscale place, but unlike this place, other places we have enjoyed made us fill like we were their special guests for the evening, not here, we were made to fill uncomfortable.  There are too many options out there for great Italian, with great atmosphere and enjoyable service, so my recommendation would be to try another place, not Scarpetta!

We went here for my husband's birthday on a weekday evening, and everything about our meal and experience was amazing. The wait staff was extremely helpful in suggesting wines to pair with our entrées as well as the best desserts to try (Apple Fritters and the Pear Cobbler). Our entrees and appetizers were delicious and very memorable. Thanks for a great night Rosewater; we cannot wait to return soon!

All you can drink sangria is why you come here!  Came here for brunch and ordered the Frita Cubana.  It was literally dripping with oil and tasted just OK.  The Chimichurri fries were very greasy as well and didn't really seem like there was chimichurri sauce on them.  They basically looked like they just had parsley sprinkled on them.  Tried several different sangrias and they were all delicious.  They give you quite a generous pour as well!

I came here on a Wednesday evening after 9. I was hungry, and I wanted some good food in my tummy that wasn't too expensive and that I wouldn't feel too out of place eating alone. After surveying several restaurants, Supper made the cut. I was seated at the bar, and I pretty much got to see the chefs work their magic the entire time. It's pretty amazing. Anyhow, I got myself their Wednesday risotto special, which is mushroom and pancetta. It was quite delicious. It has a very homey taste and appearance, and significant chunks of mushrooms that broke up the monotony of the creamy risotto. Also had lots of parsley in it - apparently some people really hate the stuff, so just a warning here. The servers were also incredibly friendly. Also, the complimentary bread comes up with this amazing white beans dressed in herby olive oil thing.

This Is the Owner of H.K. Wonton Garden, Thank you to all our awesome customers for letting everyone know our address is in fact 79 Mulberry Street New York, NY 10013 212.349.1495 We hope to rectify this asap. Sincerely, H.K. Wonton Garden

I am so lucky that I live close enough this incredible restaurant to be able to come here for anything from breakfast to drinks and I absolutely do! The food, the service... Everything is really top notch. Go, try it for yourself and enjoy living in NY where we can have such amazing restaurants!

i used to come here all the time w/ a friend before i found Shanghai Cafe. its ok tho i prefer my soup dumplings to be a little thicker so they dont break so easily and spill on my shirt, yes its happened here before. i forgot what else i've eaten here but it was nothing special since i dont remember it. also sharing a table here sucks

The staff wasn't very attentive, they were out of two things that I wanted, and when the chicken orzo soup that I finally settled on arrived it was bland. I hear people talk about this place fairly often so I might have went on an off day.

Absolutely delightful.  High quality food and great atmosphere. Farm to table. Fresh! Reminds me of Italy's Agritorismo where everything served is fresh from the property you are dining. From the loaded artichoke heart appetizer to the nicolosi pork tenderloin, to the Jersey corn gelato, that's right corn gelato... Don't knock it till you try it. Chef Todd, you have out done yourself. Congratulations.
Fish tacos really good worth the wait, guacamole over priced
The wait is slightly crowded but the food was worth it! Especially since they provide refill of the noodles with a price for your leftover broth. Decor was quite pretty.

Visited the place twice on two separate visits to Philly. Both times were great. Great beer selection and the food was good as well. The people working there are super cool and laid back. ( even with foggy head hangovers )
Just came back from this place..It was pretty good,,the california roll is awesome and I really liked their salad starter dish

This place definitely hits the spot if you're looking for a laid back neighborhood bar. The beer list wasn't overwhelming, but it was seasonal and the servers are great with recommendations. Spacious tables with a back room that has a pool table. Food was tasty pub fare. The mussels were very good. The brie and blue cheese mushroom fondue came with a mountain of crusty bread and was really quite delicious. The Tuscan chicken sandwich was good, but I wish it had less spinach! Fries were clearly from frozen, but crispy nonetheless. Tends to get a bit loud in here (it was a Saturday, however), but it's a good spot if you're in the area.
I usually go with the modern version. and almost always end up at the west side location rather than the one near astor. Best time to go is for brunch, opening time

Really wanted to love this place after tons of hype from my gf. Walked in around 6 on a Friday and asked if they could get us a table for 7:30. Maitre d' called us and let us know ten minutes in advance it was ready. We wandered over to Bleeker for some wine meanwhile. So that was great :) Mains: the skate was delicious but I was a bit disappointed by the lamb shank which was gigantic but almost horrifically so. After having good wine before the meal, when we ordered the wine by the glass at the top of the list here, we were also a bit disappointed by its lack of any interesting character. My favorite part of the meal was dessert. The chocolate souffle w/ gelato was simply to die for.
My bf made reservations at Balthazar for my birthday, but I convinced him to take me to V-Nam instead. :D

Ohhhhhh this place is amazing! I love their diverse combinations of fresh ingredients bursting on my palate! The paninis and crostinis are to die for! They serve up large portions that are affordable and delicious! I love eating there especially for brunch when an ambrosia salad is a healthy choice, yet I still feel guilty because it taste so good. I go there frequently with my kids as well, and they have they now have their favorites. As for me, I still can not decide on a favorite yet!

Really great food -- just not really into the whole stuffy atmosphere (although, it quite possibly could have been the people I went with). It was neat experience and you definitely didn't leave hungry. We didn't get to choose our meal as we were there to celebrate a birthday and had a planned menu. To be honest, it's been about a year since I have been there, so, I don't quite remember what we had! Yikes!! But I would love to try it again. Perhaps being with different people with make it more enjoyable. :)

Arrived around 6pm on Wednesday, the dining room and bar were empty so decided to sit at corner spot at bar. Intended on having a full meal and a a few drinks however the lack of service made this impossible. We ordered our first round with the semi-friendly bartender and a few starter snacks. This was our last interaction with anyone! Had to practically beg for a second drink and after requesting the food menu again we were NEVER spoken to again. Not a check-in, how were the brussel sprouts, NOTHING. Our check was $125 for three apps and 5 beverages, had the service been better maybe this would be acceptable. Brussels sprouts were drenched in a gross creamy sauce, octopus was rubbery, and the zucchini bread left no lasting impression on myself or any of my guests. Time to either revamp the place or get out so another restaurant can make use of you special location and space. Will not be back Alta!!!
Great authentic food! Love this place!

just got back from this place... here we go... food= better than mediocre. not by any stretch excellent, but definitely passable. service= prompt.  we thought they were friendly enough. ambiance=we liked it. dim pendant lighting, colorful murals and small but cozy table not TOO close together. casual and low key, not pretentious but not a dive at all. pricing = WAY TO F'ING EXPENSIVE for what you're getting. like a $14 burrito. are they freaking kidding? a $12 taco salad???!!!! WTF?! 3 fish tacos for $14 is muy loco!!! and what is with the businesses like this one that don't accept plastic? it's 2008 and a new millennium. the berlin wall came down, we have an international space station and a black man is about to become president of the united states, andt these jackasses won't take credit cards. i'm not buying into the whole "things are more expensive in princeton, so we have to charge more to make our profit target" bullshit on this one AT ALL ( i never do ). for what they charge for a meal, they can absolutely afford to extend that convenience to their clientele. they do take checks, which is cool when you don't have cash, but who the hell carries a check book anymore? byo is cool but it's getting so that you can byo when you grab a sandwich at the wawa, so no big deal. bottom line is- the prices are double what they should beat tortugas mexican village. at harry's burritos in nyc (71st at columbus) the atmosphere is comparable, the service excellent, they have a bar, and it's friggin manhattan!!! and an enormous burrito will set you back a scant $8 and they take plastic. hey tortugas-- wake up and smell the cafe con leche!!!
Excellent burgers and brunch and drinks. Welcoming atmosphere.
Anchor is just KOOL.....good peeps ,good time ,good food ..the best boss
really good open air vibes for after work drinks with friends.. I'm also a complete chicken and waffles convert, usually not my thing but I tried it out on a rainy day and I'm sold
The food was cold and the pizza had no seasoning.
Two words; Yum & Fun. Great service, with an awesome food. It was a little hard to find parking there. We will definitely be back!

Believe the hype! It was my first crawfish experience and definitely won't be my last. We ordered  Combo A (crawfish+shrimp) with theboil sauce (A MUST), clams with butter garlic, oyster sliders and soft shell crab basket.  The clams were a little overcooked but still yummy (can't go wrong with garlic butter), oyster sliders decent but probably won't order again @ 3/$12 (for value sake), skip the soft shell crab and just go ahead and get a full order of fries. Next time I will double up on the crawfish order. You know it's good when you're already prepping for a next time. PS- would be icing on the cake if they served garlic bread. Nom on!

My husband & I had dinner here today....1st time here, wanted to try something new. It was the worst decision. The food was nasty, the worst Peruvian food I've ever had. We ordered the anticucho & papa rellena for appetizers, jalea & lomo saltado for entrees. The meat in both the anticucho  & lomo saltado were overcooked & very salty. The seafood in the Jalea was not fresh at all & it tasted like they use frozen seafood & old oil to fry the seafood. The papa rellena's filling did not have any taste to it & the outer texture was hard like it was heated up in the microwave. The service was just as bad. Not once did they come to our table to ask if we needed anything or the usual: "how's everything"? And we were ready to go we had to get their attention because they were busy on their cell phones. I'm Peruvian so I know about Peruvian cuisine & this was by far the nastiest food I've ever tasted!!!! We will never go back to this restaurant again. If you love great authentic Peruvian food you will stay away from this place. I had to click on at least one star because it wouldn't let me post without choosing a star but in reality I wouldn't give them a star at all!!!

This was a doomed location until Sushi Koshi arrived. The staff and chefs are terrifically welcoming and pleasant. While that is a great bonus it is the fresh food ,  artful preparation, and  good prices that have us coming back again and again. Just got back from Vancouver and thought I ate the best sashimi of my life with some white tuna. Walked into Sushi Koshi and got the same feeling.

Still my first choice near the Montgomery Movie theater but on my most recent two visits my usual favorite dish was not as good as before. The Thai Basil Chow Fun was missing the fire and the strong Thai basil flavor. Seems more like regular chow fun with some red pepper flakes and a few thai basil leaves. No longer worth a special trip. Perhaps they lost a chef who took his recipe with him or the chef was off. I hope I'll have better luck next time. If so, I'll write a new update.
Love the decor. Good place to study. Great tea and the coffee isn't that bad either.

Classic Burlington restaurant - all show and no go.  I am glad they use good local ingredients and incorporate lots of the ethics that lots of us around Burlington demand in food products.  But, just using local ingredients alone does not make your food anything special.  The food at El Cortijo was disappointing at best.  Skimpy portions with terrible quality (store bought) tortillas that are some sort of in between soft and hard shell..kinda like soft corn shells that have sat on the shelf for a couple weeks too long.  I didnt have a margarita but they looked pretty good. I am not sure what it is about Mexican food that mystifies Burlington restaurant entrepreneurs so much.  If you were like me and hoping finally for quality authentic mexican in town...unfortunately this aint it.  Now, it is still early in the game for El Cortijo so they have plenty of time to get their act together and change my mind.
I can only echo the others. This place is boring and serves mediocre food. It is also expensive. Three major negatives.
The food is actually great , but service especially bartender were really nasty ..Been going to this place for years, wont come back ever again! Thanks to the service staff :(

This cafe is awesome!!! They did the whole place over it looks amazing!! The crepes and Yalo's toast are what my group and I had, they were absolutely delicious.  They crew was kind and attentive.  We finished our visit with some lattes and coffee and that too was soooo good.  This is definitely a neighborhood keeper.

For those of you indigenous to the greatest city in the West Coast: Dim Sum Garden is to Philadelphia as Shanghai Dumpling King is to San Francisco. For those of you who are unfortunate to not be from the OTHER city of brotherly love, Dim Sum Garden serves authentic Northern/Shanghai style "Dim Sum." It's actually ironic, but their authenticity is probably the only thing that's preventing them from being even more successful -- Dim Sum Garden rewrites the definition of a Mom and Pop's restaurant in that unlike most sensible restaurants that portion out each dish and follow some sort of a set recipe in consideration of profits, labor costs and etc., Dim Sum Garden seems to play everything by ear, as no two dishes seem to be absolutely alike here. Whereas most restaurants would streamline labor and ingredients by being more formulaic with the portions/method, it seems that Dim Sum Garden still insists on making absolutely everything by hand and from scratch. (there have been multiple witnesses claiming that they've seen Dim Sum Garden workers prep their dumplings at night after close of business) Nosy meddling aside, the Xiao Long Bao here are absolutely fantastic and full of scalding soup with each bite; I wasn't digging their "dumpling sauce" and would have preferred plain old soy sauce and vinegar instead, but the soup filling was satisfying enough that the lack of adequate sauce was negligible. Their Har Gow and Siu Mai offerings were somewhat mediocre: the har gow uses many little shrimp instead of one giant prawn, and the siu mai is about 80% grain and 20% ground pork. Their Ma Po tofu was oily, but unlike most Northern renditions of the dish, carried some kick and tons of flavor. If you want Siu Mai and Har Gow, I suggest you keep on walking down to Joy Tsin Lau/Ocean Harbor, but if you have a XLB itch that needs to be scratched, Dim Sum Garden is your best Philadelphia friend.

I agree with the "Asian Chipotle" tag.   I walked by this place a number of times meaning to stop.  When I finally did, took a veggie burger back to work and bit into it I instantly asked out loud, "What took me so long?"  By bite number 4 I was almost scared that I discovered how wonderful this place is -- how will I get through a day without it?   De.  Lish.  Us. Totally worth the money.  Chill atmosphere.  Speedy in just the right way -- not too fast like the food's been sitting there, not too slow like you start to get annoyed and consider Chipotle. I'm going back today for the Panko Crusted Sweet Potato Fries!

Tried calling in an order, was asked to hold and then I was hung up on.  Happened 3x and didn't want to risk actually ordering from them for delivery.  Inside dining may be wonderful, but place an order over the phone for delivery.
Im having this for lunch at my desk right now. OMG this is wonderful for street food. Like all the posters say, you cant add more to the reviews,

Tender Lovin' Grill, more like Tender Lovin' Bowels! My first experience with this restaurant turned out to be a very regrettable one! I normally enjoy these small family owned restaurants for their hidden delights and friendly atmospheres, but boy i was not ready for this. I ordered the Teriyaki Salmon Platter, which at first glance looked like the dinner I was hoping for. However, judging by the time i spent on the toilet the next day you bet I'm more than regretting it! The meal itself was fairly average, the glaze tasted like something from a bottle of Kraft. However I'm less than worried about the meal after the day I spent home purging it from my body. This has to say something about the storage regulations of this restaurant, or maybe the kitchen is filled with out of work college graduates that don't realize the repercussions their poor working habits have on the business of the owner. The only thing that would make me come back is the funnel cake, which to my surprise was the highlight of my trip to Tender Lovin' Grill.

Went to the Brindel Room for the first time Friday for our daughters birthday. Awesome experience. Even though she was running late , we were able to order apps and drinks.  The duck confit was off the charts . Salmon amazing. Want very much to go back for brunch. Nice touch meeting the owner. Very nice man who shook our hand thanking us for coming in . Can not wait to go back !

Great find by a friend on the Upper East Side. It's a tiny restaurant, so we were lucky to snag a table for Sunday brunch. First off, you know it's authentic when almost every other patron in the restaurant is speaking to the staff in French. Second, it's not often that you find a completely new "kind" of food that is pretty hard to find elsewhere. In this case, it's the Alsatian tartes, which are basically super-thin crust pizzas with creme fraiche and other toppings. The savory ones were addictive, and I probably ate one a half whole tartes myself before realizing it. I would really recommend the traditional one and the mushroom one with goat cheese. The dessert one we got with apples and the flaming brandy was fun, but I vastly preferred the savory ones we got. They have an interesting deal where you can get all you can eat savory tartes for ~$22 per person...I'm not sure if I would go for this, because at that price you could basically get two whole tartes to yourself, which is more than enough food.
Nice staff, worn-down brand, mediocre food, unhappy atmosphere.

So delicious every.single.time. It's small and gets packed quick but the host's are good about staying on top of filling the empty spots. Don't think twice about the wait. Beware, the spiciest margarita is no joke.

I have been to Vietnamese restaurants all around the world, from San Francisco to London, Miami to New York and most of the Pho places on the other side of town in Philadelphia... As for Stock, this is by far the best experience I have had at any of them. The Pho is way better than The Slanted Door in San Fran which is supposed to be among the best in the world. The green mango salad is something I crave, which only gets satisfied by Stock's rendition of the dish. My mouth is seriously watering just thinking about it. When I'm in town I always make a point to stop by. The dishes are very reasonably priced, we've ordered the whole menu every time we've been, and made it out for super cheap. The love put into the dishes reflects the chef's interest in keeping the original Saigon flare, offering the volume restaurant style speed of service but superior, fine dining precision on the raw dishes of beef and fish. I actually started my yelp profile here to speak highly of the restaurant, because my experience has been amazing every time, and that's 4 times since the restaurant opened just several months ago. The service was great, love the simplicity of the decor and it's so refreshing to see a non-ethnic cook behind the dishes. The only complaint is that I had a short wait the last two times, but luckily, the neighborhood (Fishtown) has a few bars and other spots to check out, Johnny Brenda's and some Steven Starr locations around the corner. I'll be back for sure!!!' Just waiting for them to open up locations in Miami and New York... Please hurry!!

I was in the area for work and a friend recommended this restaurant to me, to  take coworkers. We were nothing but impressed. The food was excellent, the waiter was great and the atmosphere very enjoyable!! We all ordered the Goodfella Cupcake... to die for!!!! We all will defiantly be returning! I highly recommend this restaurant!

Food here is absolutely fantastic. I had the sea bass and chicken chimichuros- so great! Sea bass was on par with much much more expensive restaurants I've been to in the city. My friend ordered the paella, that kind of looked like it sucked though, but who orders paella at a Cuban restaurant? Cocktails were very good as well. Then there is a dude rolling cigars in the place- this guy rules. Excellent touch. Prices are very reasonable for the quality you are getting.

Charlie may have been a sinner, but his drinks and food are spot on. I live down the street from this lively place and went in for the first time a few days ago. I asked the bartender, Joe, which drink he would recommend and he provided me with a delicious drink that was not on the menu called the Martinez. If you like bourbon, I highly suggest asking for this. My friend and I also ordered the chickpea fries, charred caesar salad and the ricotta dip with bread and everything was delicious. Service was also great. I'll definitely be going back.

I'd go here any given Saturday morning for its SUPERB brunch.  It is a tight space - if you want /need to be seated inside that is.  Otherwise, I personally adore sitting outside if the weather is nice and having the value brunch (only about $15 per person with a cup of freshly squeezed OJ and tea/coffee included) and read the papers or just chat up with an old friend.  Located in the beautiful W. Village, it's a great place to people-watch, also. All dishes are solid.  Not too crazy about their dessert, but then you can't beat the BYOW.   Also, don't be surprised if you see a celeb strolling down the street as you savor away...

I've eaten here a couple of times,  the food is ok, if you don't know how to cook for your self..... BUT THE SERVICE IS HORRIBLE, VERY UN~FREINDLY it seems that they are pissed off that you are in there restaurant... well never go again I'LL NEVER GO BACK, So if you like average food, and like being treated like Shit, this might be your place......

My favorite tapas bar in the city! The service and food is always consistent when I go there and the sangria is amazing. They also have specials of the day that aren't on the menu. Although the place is tiny, the turnover of customers is usually pretty quick, so if it's packed I usually take a seat at the bar and have a sangria.

we've been resisting it because of CH gentrification yadda yadda, but wow. What a place. The food, first, is as good as everyone says. The steak tartare was fantastic, kale salad i'm obsessed with now. Wine list is fine. Our server was congenial and attentive. she (plus the bathroom decor) made it a really down to earth, neighborhood experience.

I had been to Koji about a year ago for cocktails and bar snacks and it was fantastic.  I was so pleased that it was included on our CT Forum membership discount card.  I told my husband to prepare himself for a lovely meal. Sadly, the meal we had was earnestly offered by the lovely bartender/waitress, but sorely lacking. The restaurant was virtually empty on a Saturday night.  We ordered Sake and starters---the Sake was standard (should have chosen a cocktail) but the Gyoza and Spring Rolls were tasty, if unexceptional.  We had been warned that no Yakitori was available but when we tried to order sushi---from a sushi restaurant---we were told that something was wrong with the rice and sushi was not available.  Super disappointing. Sorry to say, the chicken slider and stir fry were okay---pretty unexceptional.  On the upside, the meal was very reasonable and the server was truly trying hard to please against considerable odds.

I'm in love with Lupa. Went there recently with a party of 6 and no reservations on a busy evening. Sat down in literally in 15 min. Wait staff was impeccable in terms of knowledge of both wine and foods on the menu.  I had the paperdelle special and sweetbreads, both were fantastic. So was the pasta with the oxtail ragu. Will go back soon

The first time  ive heard of this place, i already liked it so you could Just imagine my excitement the moment i actually came in to eat. The name just speaks for itself. Its very comforting especially the food. You just have to go there and try their own version of French toast, it's really good. I also tried pulled pork and grits, but you have to be early for this goes fast.  The first time I went there, it wasn't available anymore. Also, the burrito is not bad as well. Long story short, everything is good. Only thing is, the menu changes from time to time.

A perfect example to "don't judge a book by its cover." Don't judge this restaurant by its cover, or in this case by its appearance. We were a bit skeptical when we first entered the place. The seats weren't in the best condition, and the overall looks were not very convenient or pretty. But you know what? The ramen was great and that was the most important thing for me. Ordered a Yasai Ramen (veggie ramen) and it was actually delicious. I went before to Ise Ramen in midtown and Jinya Ramen in the West Village (which sadly closed) and this was the best ramen I had in the city thus far. It also cost $12 which is pretty fair for what you get. In summary: great ramen, bad looks. I liked it, just hope they will change / improve the interior design. Although you enter a restaurant to eat, what you see around you maybe isn't equally important as the food, but it is important nonetheless.

Love the Chicken Bahn Mi! I had it with a side salad with the pear champagne vinaigrette and it was amazing! Our server was a really nice, friendly guy from Philly! He shared some stories with us and we talked about our trip. The drink menu is pretty extensive. He suggested a Cosmo with pineapple infused vodka but I have a little troublemaker brewing so I opted for an O Douhl's instead. :) Ambiance is romantic and they play 90's tunes from Pandora. Just loved that station and hope I can get it in Canada! :) we will definitely come back if we ever end up in NYC again.

The restaurant is by far the worst that Manhattan has to offer! Terrible service. Food was average at best. The manager was very unhelpful. The seating situation was terrible and we were not able to enjoy the dinner. Waste of time and money. Expensive for the quality of service and food. If you want real Italian, there are so many better options. For the money I spent I would prefer Da silvano!! Will never go back!

Highlights: Manchego/mango/almond salad Potato Croquettes (special)- these were the best croquettes my girlfriend and I have ever had.   Bone in rib-eye for two (special)- was amazing! Chocolate Soufle- have to order before dessert, well worth it. Banana upside cake- I'm a chocoholic (See above), but this was amazing as well. Could improve: Service was a little slow- our first cocktails took a very long time to arrive, though things sped up after that. Duck meatballs were good- but not out of this world. The food was all in all, outstanding.  We had wanted to try Perilla since watching season one of Top Chef- am glad we did.  Will definitely go back!

My wife and I agree this was one of the best dining experiences we have had in recent memory. It also cemented my appreciation for the crowd-sourcing ability of social media and Yelp. We had just arrived in Philadelphia after a pleasant day of travel, checked into the hotel, and I jumped on Yelp to look for a dinner spot. Barbuzzo met my filters and we went without a reservation. That might not have turned out well since they were packed. The host offered us seats at the dinner bar (think sushi bar, but facing the cook chefs) which we gladly accepted, but then he looked at an empty 4-top and said "You know what. We had a no-show. I think we have room. Take this table." How generous was that? Our friendly waitress developed immediate rapport with my wife and 14 year-old son -- which delighted me. She explained that most people order about 2 plates per person and share, and that the plates come out one at a time as they are cooked. Thom chose 2 items (pan-seared gnochi, coniglio pizza), Amy chose 2 items (buffalo mozzarella salad, grilled bistro steak), and I added a dish of oriental noodles with shellfish. Each item was extraordinary. The best ingredients, each selected to compliment or contrast with the other, and cooked perfectly. We'll go again.

I went here on a Friday night with a group of friends and they were able to seat us right away which was nice since we had just come from trying to get a seat at Cafe Magador where the wait time was forty minutes. The food was alright. I got a lamb sandwich. It was pretty tasteless. This place didn't really have anything special or memorable about it. The service was pretty slow too. Overall it was just ok; I don't think I would come back here.

My sister, who lives out of town, wanted to go to Little Italy to a great Italian restaurant. Well, I typically dont go that far downtown & had heard that Little Italy, what's left of it, is full of tourists & not really worth the trek. Man, was I wrong! So thanks to Yelp reviews, we chose this place which did not disappoint! We were there on a Sunday around 7pm and were seated immediately. Wow! Talk about feeling like a star!! Everybody is very, very friendly! The staff is all men dressed in suits who were the sweetest, most kind, most attentive servers! The service alone is worth the trip! I had a great fish dish which was perfectly prepared that came with the tastiest asparagus. My sister had the home made ravioli with spicy sauce and she ate every bit of it.  We ended the dinner with chocolate cake.  Dinner, desert, and a bottle of wine was about $70 with tip. It's kind of pricey but the service impeccable and well worth the money. This is a great place to take mom and dad or family members.

Nauna's is one of Montclair's better Italian restaurants. They have two different dining areas. One of the dining rooms is formal, with a full dinner menu including entree's, pasta, salads, etc. The front dining room, where they serve Pizza is much more casual, and there are usually many families in this room. It makes for a nice mix of family friendly and formal dinner service in the same restaurant. The place is always packed, the dinner side has nice pastas, entrees, salads, and soups. The service was friendly, but not great, but at least it was friendly.  The pizza crust is a little thicker than I prefer, but it is still good.  One of the best features of Nauna's is the private parking lot, which is a rarity in Montclair.

This place is great.  It's about a half mile walk from Red Bull Arena, over the river, into the Ironbound.  The black bean veggie burger may be the best veggie burger I've ever eaten in my life.  That being said, it's deep fried and filled with cheese, so while it's vegetarian, and absolutely delicious, it's certainly not what I would consider "healthy".  The turkey burger is decent, but mine was fairly small, and not super memorable.  The cobb salad is top notch.  It was HUGE and fresh and cut neatly into bite size pieces.  I highly recommend it.  The head chef / owner went to culinary school in Portugal with a focus on pastries, and boy you can tell.  I had a piece of cheese cake there that rivals Junior's in BK any day.  If you live in Newark or Harrison, or happen to be visiting either, you must go to Burger Bound.  The restaurant is about a 3/4 mile walk from either the Harrison PATH Station or Newark Penn.  They have booze too.....
wow, the brunch here is amazing. definitely try the chicken sausage with gravy, biscuits, eggs. SO GOOD!

Went here last night with the bf and we tried the popular dishes. Service was pretty bad but food was pretty good. A little pricey overall for small portions, but the food was good. Octopus bean salad app: delicious and octopus was seriously so tender. Spread app: very good, pretty small portions. Sheeps milk sausage dumplings: very good, smaller portion. Hanger steak: very good! Baklava: standard. a little too sweet and a bit hard.
Great noodle. Little bit pricey but I don't mind. I think it pay off for the ambience.
Yay I am a fan. The onions rings are fantastic. I love real onion rings the kind with the onions inside. The portions is good and the place looks really trendy and nice.

After one visit I'm a huge fan & see many more trips to Agno in my future. I try to eat healthy foods, but draw the line at tasteless bland offerings. What's the point of eating low fat, low cal options if they taste blah? Luckily Agno piles on the flavor while peeling back the fat. As a vegetarian I often freeze like a deer in the headlights when presented with more than 3 menu choices. It took awhile to decide but I eventually went with a black rice bowl with baked falafel, pickled beets, quinoa tabbouleh, and feta. Unsure of my dressing choices the friendly gals behind the counter came to my rescue by suggesting the harissa (tomato based and packed with heat) & lemon tahini. All that food only set me back $8. Seriously a steal. In the future I'll order the dressings on the side. While I loved the flavors I could have done with a little less sauce. The falafel was very mild, but went well with the rest of my toppings. I loved how the beets were shredded, much preferred over getting one big ball of beet. My beau also loved his meal - getting the daily special lamb meatballs. So glad to find an inexpensive spot where we can grab healthy food.

the atmosphere is fun but the food was just ok and the prices are much too high for what's on offer. i had the bandeja paisa and was not impressed with anything aside from the portion, and perhaps the cabbage salad. wife had the snapper which was fine, but the coconut rice was far too sweet. one very positive thing - nicest waitstaff in brooklyn. maybe in all of NYC. these people are so friendly and fun I may go there again despite the mediocre food.
Delicious calamari, and $1 oyster!!!! will come again!
Great guacamole and excellent margaritas! Avoid the crowds, go late night or pre-dinner, get a margarita and share some chips with guacamole. You will not be disappointed!
Mushroom soup is absolutely delish, I get it every time! Turkey burger & fries were also good. A little bit of a wait for our food today, but the service was attentive.
Very good, fun atmosphere. LOVED the sangria, must order. Food was good and prices were very reasonable! Everyone in our group left full and happy. Make reservations though.

I ordered a couple of the brick oven pizzas... was not impressed at all. They really had no flavor. I mean the broccoli rabe and sausage was just blah, and the olive pie was made with differant olives, more like a silician or calamita olive did not like that they never told you it was that type of olive and not a regular olive it made the whole pie taste bitter. The cheese pie was fair, all pies could  have been cooked more and definitly needed more flavor ex..garlic... I may give this place another try to sit in and see whats on the menu besides the pizza.. Not really impressed, the restaurant itself looks great....

i have ordered about 100 burritos from here and 6 or 7 of them have unmistakably had detergent in them.  the last one i had caused me to spend the entire night in the bathroom.  not worth the risk anymore.

Normally I would give this place 4 stars, but because of the coupon deal monday - wednesdays 50% off it bumped it up to 5.  First of all, the only thing worth buying are the rolls, they are small, innovative and inexpensive, which allows you to buy 3-4 rolls instead of sticking with 2 and hope they are good. The space is small and it takes a while to get your meal, but if you can get there in off hours it is worth the trip. They love spice, so beware, but it does add a bit of flair since most asian places in the area serve most of their food mild, even when they say it is spicy

This is a place that should be judged on it's food alone and for that it gets four stars. Seriously delicious! Service was unexceptional but passable and the backyard and interior was typical Park Slope decent but nothing to write home about. I will eat here many more times.

The only reason I am giving this place one star is because the site does not allow a grade of zero.  I have been to many Famous Dave's, but the service here is the worst.  My wife and I came for lunch.  The place was fairly empty with only a few tables occupied.  We waited a while without any server coming to our table.  Another couple came in well after us and were seated at the next booth.  The server finally came to the area, and went directly to the other table and ignored us.  He then went to the back of the restaurant to place their order.  We waited for him to come back, even though he should have waited on us first because we were seated well before the other party.  Finally, we see him come with the drinks for the other table.  He served their drinks and walked away again without coming to us.  At this point, after being ignored for so long we left. Given the experience, we will never go back to this Famous Dave's location.  There is no excuse for this lack of service.  Also, I have to wonder ... if the manager cannot even have the servers accomplish the simple task of waiting on tables in the order they are seated, or waiting on tables at all, that gives me great pause as to how the rest of the restaurant is being managed.  There are enough good restaurants in the area to visit that will happily provide excellent food and service. We will be eating at those instead.

This place is awesome, good place for cheap eats, the only sandwich i can eat is the sardine sandwich which is delicious, also had the avocado shake and it was rich and tasty also, good place to go to if you are lazy and want to pack a cheap lunch. becareful how you put the sandwich in your bag because it can get soggy due to the sauce, will come back here again and again...
buen sitio nice para que vallas fam

Holy moly!  This place is amazing!!  Very busy but able to sit at the bar quickly.  Had margaritas, chili (amazing!), gumbo (out of this world), and a chicken entree that was perfect.  The cornbread was sooo good too.  If you're in the area, this is the best food you'll find around.

The food (especially the Red Onion sandwich) is delicious, if a little overpriced. However, the employees are rude, unkempt/unshowered, snotty hipsters who never smile and are often so high as to need the order repeated. Seriously, fire them, and you'd get better ratings (I'm clearly not the only person who thinks this) and much more business.

Didn't have much time here so we couldn't try any of the crostini or the antipasti that many people seem to rave about. However, if those are anywhere near as good as the paninis we had, they are very well deserving of the hype. Had the Italian meatloaf and sweet sausage paninis and both were excellent. I feel the meatloaf could be sold on its own; it's that good. It has just the right amount of kick, too. The sweet sausage was also very good, but I could have used more sausage. While the paninis aren't as big or packed as the ones from Press 195, they use more interesting combinations and flavors than Press does. Fiancee and I will definitely be back again to try more of the menu
Great bagel place. Their egg sandwich to-go is the best- so gooey!
I've come here a few times, have yet to have anything less than an outstanding experience. Service and food are both excellent. Recommend it to anyone.

Great value for your hard earned dollars! Food was tasty, portions were generous and service was excellent!  If you are looking for a fancy French restaruant, Le Parisein may not be your choice. But if you are looking for real French food, unintimidating and real down to earth atmosphere, you must come here. We enjoyed all the 3 apeptizers that the owner recommended, escargot was served with real shells, duck confit was chunky and done well. I wasn't feeling too well, so I only had a French onion soup, the best onion soup I ever tasted, not salty at all, infact you can taste the sweetness  that came through with tons of sweet onion condensed in the base. My husband had the steak tartar. He said it tasted like what he had in France when he went there on business but bigger portion. My daughter had the Marseilles mussels, she loved it so much that she took the left over brooth home with her. Even the French flies were done to perfection, not greasy, serve up in an aluminum can to keep them warm (brilliant ) and you can taste real hand picked potatoes! For dessert, we absolutely loved the creme brûlée, very creamy and not too sweet at all. A must try! Service was excellent with just the right amount of attentiveness. We will definitely return again to try all the other dishes on the menu.

Nauna's has always held a special spot in my heart. For the majority of my life it has been the local pizzeria and restaurant. The food is always delicious and the staff is always courteous and helpful. The owner, Tommy runs a great business and the expansion is a testament to this success. But beyond putting out a great product he makes sure to give back to the community as much as he can.  All of this is why I will be a customer for life.

Arrived shortly after 12 PM and there was no wait for Saturday brunch.  The interior is earthy and comfortable and they have a great garden in the back.  All the guests in my party very much enjoyed their dishes.  We tried the french toast (great flavors of apple cinnamon, although a bit mushy for my taste), the cheese grits (flavorful, but a lil runny), and the house-made sausage (great).  Agree that the home-fries are good, but they should put more on the plate.  Service was great, food arrived quickly.  This place is not cheap, but not too pricey.  We saved money by not buying booze.  If you want your taste buds to burst, then this is a good spot for brunch, but if you care more about mimosas and bloody ms, I'd go elsewhere.

Very Meh.  Pretty bland if you ask me.  Seems more like a tourist trap than a revered NY landmark.  There's a lot better out there.  A coal oven isn't everything.  Totonno's does it the same way.  DiFara, as greasy as it is, is at least something different, involving different cheeses in his pizza and a lot of love. I respect the history and tradition but would you buy a 1920 Model T Ford to go to work just because it was made that way back in the day?  No, cars evolved and so did pizza.
Great Value. I've been eating here for years! This is one of the best eating deals in Burlington. It is also run by a wonderful family.

I have been here many times and mostly it is good. But I would say that around 20 precent of the time my order has been messed up. In the past month when I unwrapped my burrito all of the food inside fell apart. Another time the cheese was almost frozen. It was cold and 3/4 of burrito was chesse. Also I came and the rice was stale. I have always really liked boloco but this might be the last straw. Next time my burrito is bad I might never come here again. I cant afford to spend this type of money just to throw my lunch away. I suggest that you spend more time to make sure you make the burrito is good. I hope that you take consideration of this!
The Sicilian was delicious. the famous artichoke pizza was just OK. It was basically artichoke dip smothered on pizza dough and cooked. Be prepared for lines regardless of the time of day.

Best diner -- and it's more than typical diner food.  Seafood is fresh and delicious.  Specials can't be beat for value.  Steaks are great.  Yes, there does always seem to be a wait but even if crowded, it's rarely more than 15 min.  They get meals out to you quickly, but never rush you.  Anyone rating the food as mediocre doesn't know what good food is.  Service is always good.  They can accommodate just about any request.

Overall, avoid this place. At least avoid until a month or two goes by so the guys can get trained in their jobs. The restaurant was in chaos. Seconds after ordering I heard something that made me know I had made a big mistake. Talking to a table behind where I was standing, the man at the counter said, "Sorry for the long wait." After sitting down to wait for order, I heard mumbling from all other tables about the very long waits they had, and some tables were still missing food items and gave up and left. As for my meal, my hamburger came out, but was missing chips and my drink. I told the man what I was missing and he said it would be right up. It wasn't. After waiting for awhile, then eating my burger, I went to wash up and the asked for the remaining items. The man again said that they would be right up, and started to prepare them right then (a good 20 minutes after ordering). I now had to have them to go as I needed to get back to the office. Mind you, there were only 2 orders up when I originally ordered. I asked one of the men working there what was up and if this was normal. He explained there was a new guy starting today, and he had only been there a month. So I asked him if I should return, and he said yes. I told him I am only in the area for a month, so it would be no.

Rudy's has been our go to bar food location for years. I have searched far and wide and have yet to taste better fries (sorry, Duckfat, Portland). The beer selection is eclectic, with a bit more European influence than other craft beer bars in the area. The other food on the menu is usually a hit, with the occasional misstep as they keep the menu seasonal (ask for advice, the staff will be candid). For those looking for a bar atmosphere, but not wanting fried food, there are decent salads & entrees that haven't come close to the deep fryer (beet salad and Caesar are both well done). Go to Rudy's - get fries, be very happy :)

Really good, fresh tasting food, a few pleasant surprises on the menu that you don't always find everywhere, a very clean and tidy kitchen.  Hassle free on street parking, there always seems to be a space available.  They accommodate special requests regarding preparation.  The young dude who I deal with here always makes sure to point out the coupons and deals on their menu that I would normally carelessly ignore.  As a result, I seem to always get some extra thing for free or a discount of some kind.  I know that that shows that they really care about their customers.  Most places, if you don't make sure to have that coupon in hand and shove it in someone's face you ain't getting your deal.  Also, when you call ahead to place your order, his phone etiquette is definitely on point.  He takes your order slowly and deliberately and even goes back over it with you to make sure there are no mistakes and usually has a total immediately ready too.  FIVE STARS, not because I'm some dullard who thinks this is world class cuisine, it's a "hole in the wall" Chinese place that for most of my life I would have completely ignored having grown up near an awesome, fancy, sit-down Chinese restaurant in another county that we were loyal to exclusively.  Here in Bergen however it seems that a lot of the holes in the walls are a lot better than the fancier establishments and Ruyi Kitchen is a standout.  They have a decent sized sitting area and I might even give that a try sometime just for fun even though I live around the corner.  I give them FIVE STARS because I can tell they are doing their very best given the size of their spot and they make every effort to make their customers happy.  In my humble opinion there isn't a single thing they could do to improve their offerings or services that wouldn't affect their very fair prices so next time you're craving Chinese food make sure to give them a try and if you notice the same things that I've noticed and you enjoy the experience go back next time too and support these folks!  They're doing it right!

I am always looking for good Filipino food. I did some research and was left only with a few options for Filipino cuisine. Well, I decided to go with this joint after viewing their extensive menu. On a busy schedule, I was only able to make it for their lunch menu. This SISIG is the best I've ever had, and believe me, I've had my share of sisig over here in the Bay Area where I used to live. I really loved the fact that their Tocilog isn't artificially RED and gross like other places. I usually NEVER eat more than a bite of tocilog because I dislike the color and taste. However, the waiter persuaded me and I'm glad he did because it was delicious enough for me to eat the plate spotless. Forgot the waiters name, but he was absolutely friendly and gave great tips as to what to order.

Love the gran crudo/charcuterie plate--5 cheeses, 5 meats for $22.   As mentioned elsewhere, get here early--as close to 11 am as you can. yes, it's big, noisy and less than perfectly organized (and I agree with Au G that the signature orange crocs for sale straddle the line between fun and offensive kitsch), but pretty yummy, nonetheless. Dean and Deluca on steroids.

Stumbled across this place accidentally while surfing on Yelp. I am always looking for new restaurants to try, so I did a little research on it. After some digging around, I discovered that both co-owners worked for Batali restaurants and then branched out. After taking a glance over the menu, I figured it wouldn't be that bad. That Bad? There's a reason this place has as high of a rating as it does on here, it was truly remarkable. The place itself is pretty awesome .. dimly lit, open kitchen, long bar, with a nice vibe that I guess goes hand in hand with the West Village setting. You can sit at the bar or at a table, we chose the bar. I really liked the atmosphere of the place, very swank but it is appropriate for a date or group. Started out with beef carpaccio, bread and olive oil. The carpaccio was great, very fresh and with the bread, it made for a real treat. My gf loves the stuff, I was never the biggest fan .. but this was good, real good. We then both had the roasted quail. Let me tell you a little something about this quail dish ... the best I've ever had. It wasn't just tasty (doesn't do it justice) ... this was succulent. At one point, my girlfriend and I looked at each other and thought out loud .. "This is blowing our minds." For a side, we split the special which was polenta coated with Parmesan cheese. Nothing mind blowing about this, but definitely above average if you're a polenta fan (not for everybody). Simple, but a nice touch on a chilly fall night in the city. Espresso to top it off ... and a more than reasonable bill for NYC. Not one bad thing ordered here, and in fact all was stellar. That quail was something special, it has to be repeated. Service at the bar was attentive, informative and we had a great conversation with our bartender. Will definitely be going back to try more. Think I need to have a few more items before I put it at 5 star. FYI .. We left Osteria Morini to come here ... and as a huge Michael White fan, I'm not ashamed to say that ... I think we may have made the right choice on this night (Sorry Michael!)

Love this place! The food is authentic and the Sangria is amazing..of course you have to BYOB. But this is one place I don't miss getting to when I go home, which is about 3 times a year. The service is good..only 2 complaints...it's small and they don't take reservations so if you get there between 6 and 8 pm on a weekend, you can expect a line up the stairs and out into the back parking lot. Second complaint is it is NOISY! Very hard to have a conversation..the atmosphere is loud and festive and the birthdays are over the top with bongos and all so don't expect a quiet intimate discussion here! but just not something anyone should miss!!

We tried Trattoria Trecolori after reading some great reviews on Yelp, and were not disappointed. We went with a group on 6 before a show, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. From the risotto to the fresh pastas, everything was delicious! The service was a little slow, especially towards the end, but that's because it got VERY busy. The homemade deserts were a big hit also!
Amazing Thai food!
Nice food for lunch. If not halal food i cant even get any lunch during break between classes.  I love to see that outside have so good place to take food.

I was in Philly on vacation and I was incredibly excited to eat my first real Philly Cheesesteak at the famous Geno's.  I must say that I was disappointed.  I was expecting a greasy cheez-whiz covered artery clogger (all meant to be good adjectives I assure you), but it was just too greasy, not enough cheese, and the meat was too gristly.  I guess I should have gotten provolone, but I wanted the "true" experience.  I wouldn't have skipped it-- it is the Philly experience-- but I don't think I'd go back.

I am a long time customer of Procaccini's due to the pizza.  I moved out of town, but still drive the extra miles for the thick, soft crust pie.  For all those other shops that put on the mozzarella  then add the toppings......Wrong!  The amount of cheese on this pizza is like double cheese anywhere else, and it covers the meat or veggies to the edges where it is crispy and golden.  It't the best pizza!!

We love the food here. We have catered food for our parties and every time we have had guests raving about the food. Paneer Khati rolls, cutlets, dal makhani, sukhi aloo, paneer Makhni are few favorites.

Apparently my review for this place has been filtered. I'm not sure why...because it was too positive? Anyway, my original review stands and this place has been a fixture of my commute to work on most days. I have seen another review regarding how friendly or rude the employees are. I have not found anyone to be rude, I CAN see why someone might think so. Some of the girls clearly do not speak english as a first language, and they have developed good english skills, but the tone can be misconstrued. Sarcasm and humor doesnt always translate. It does not seem to be the norm. All in all, the bagels are some of the best I've had in the area.

Twice-fried Belgian fries paired with your very own choice of sauce or sauces. 26 sauces to choose from. *you can sample any of the sauces for free* I've had/sampled so far: honey mustard mayo pomegranate teriyaki mayo parmesan peppercorn canadian cured cheddar cheese and chix gravy sweet mango chutney mayo wasabi mayo Most definitely late night NOMZ material.   Cash or Credit.

Amazing! Delishes! Home cooked italian food in little Italy!  Cute little authentic Italian restaurant!  The owner came out to greet us and we told him to bring us whatever the specials were... best decision ever!  Everything was to die for!  Super fresh! The owner really cared about us and cared that  we had an amazing experience! Love it!  I would deff bring family and friends next time I come to nyc!

Picture "Cheers", but the breakfast version.  Walking in here, everybody knows your name and John the Greek plays the role of Ted Danson.  His menu is consistent but also has an excellent selection of daily specials.  Coffee is as good as it gets and my girlfriend loves the orange juice here.  While I order the same thing all the time, I guess it's just THAT good not to order anything else.  The Taylor Ham Hangover is by far the best breakfast sandwich in the United States.  How Adam Richman or Guy Fieri do not know about this place boggles my mind.  This sandwich is called the Hangover for two reasons: 1. They cook the home fries in the egg so it "hangs over" the edges of the bread but never falls off and 2. If you can't remember what you did last night, you will certainly remember this sandwich the next morning.  This place is second generation and will definitely pass on for many more years to come.

I have been here for brunch and for late night drinks and food.  Both times had nice service and the food has always been better than I had expected.  I would recommend this place to just about anyone.
I don't recomened this place to anyone my pizza was cold not so tastey definatly needs to step it up a couple of notches

I was there with my wife and sister. It was not a good experience. They left the water on the table and did not pour into the glass. There were only two servers. It was very busy. We had to always raise hand to get server's attention when we were out of water or food. Still we had to wait several minutes to be served. Servers never approached to our table and check if everything is ok.  At the end, they gave me check and at the bottom of check there was 18% and 20% Tip guidelines. A server circled it many times around Tip guidelines forcing to leave at least 18% tip. Tip supposed to be optional and it should start with 15% or even less based on service. Such a poor service and forcing to Tip more than they deserve would not attract me go back there again.

This restaurant was in walking distance of the Best Western Hanbee Bowery and it was such a warm, lovely place to find. The owner was our waiter and he was charming and engaging. We enjoyed salad and pizza and were intrigued to find everything locally sourced and organic. This drove the prices up a little but it was worth the atmosphere. Piacere means Pleasure. And it was.

When it comes to Mexican food I'm starting to realize that I may have already experienced the best of the best. South Beach Bar & Grille in San Diego has the best fish tacos in the universe (not including Mexico) and Taqueria Cancun in San Francisco makes burritos that have been known to elicit an orgasm...or two.  It's very, very sad to think it may all be downhill from here.  So I guess I can't completely blame El Camino Real for not meeting my high Mexican food standards, but I still think they could have been a little more unique and savory with their food.  My chorizo burrito with pineapple salsa was just that: a tortilla, chorizo, and pineapple chunks.  Or at least that is the way it tasted.  I ended up loading on the sweet sauce they have at the table to add more flavor to the burrito.  The third star, however, is for the great margaritas.  Very yummy yummy in my tummy.
Nice variety of Tex Mex cuisine. Parking lot plus street parking.

Sure, the food and drinks can be cheap and decent, but employees can make or break the business. One of the bouncer here is an incompetent douche-bag who is the biggest asshole you can ever meet. He is a fat, bearded man who stands in front of the bathroom and stalks his customers to make sure that they don't go in together (even if you are only going in to help a friend). I went here on a Friday night. The bouncer banged on the door and screamed at me that there was a "one person per bathroom policy." Afterwards, he proceeded to follow us all the way to the front of the bar where we were sitting, stuck his fingers into our newly bought beers (that I spent $20 for), completely ignored my attempt to reason with him and said we couldn't be there anymore. Why? Because we were in the bathroom together... Outside, we got into a dispute and in my fury, when I said I was going to punch him for doing the idiotic thing he did, he threatened to hit me back saying, "I'm not afraid to hit you back" (Mind you, I'm a girl...) Honestly, I would go back and try to get this fool fired but figured it's better to put this on blast. Fat Buddha, get your employees in their place- threatening customers and throwing away their purchases without their consent is an absolute atrocity.
Delicious sandwiches here and a very warm environment.

By far my favorite go to restaurant for take out and good Thai food any day of the week.  I probably eat here twice a week at least.  Wednesdays you can bring your own bottle of wine with no corkage fee!   The only downsides are that if you order takeout you seem to get a little less food than if you eat in.  Also, the lunch special is about half the food for 2/3 the price if you do take out..so I always get the dinner size if ordering out.  If you eat in, like I said, they give you a good bit.

I do not care how good a pizza is, waiting 2 hrs for it is ridiculous. We were the 6th ppl in line for when they opened at 630 and got our pizza at 839. I wanted to throw it at them. If u have small children do NOT go here. It will not end well for you.

I had heard several people rave about how good the food was, so I thought that i would give it a try... The hostess asked if my party of two would be eating- I said yes and by saying yes she did not mention that there was a minimum of how much one must eat to sit at one of the 4 open tables at 11 PM on a Tuesday night. After ordering wine for both, I ordered a salad- a moderately priced salad ($15). The waiter came back to the table and said he could not put my order in because the kitchen required two plates PER PERSON and said that we would have to go to the bar next door if we were not going to order more food and said we could speak with the manager and she had said that we could not be served.
