He then sent over the "manager" (who was  also the hostess) asked us what we needed- she clearly did not know the situation like he had said and she agreed that we could not be served. They handed us the bill and took our drinks next door for us to enjoy them there, where the server was completely charming and hospitable. I have never been treated so terribly in a restaurant. I love the atmosphere and the feel but not the staff. I explained the situation with my friend who had recommended Casa Mono and she said that is totally not true, last week her and another each ordered A salad....

I don't only love their name, I love their hot chicken tenders, too. Hey, nothing special here. It's just plain, fried, breaded chicken tenders (or wings, if you'd prefer) with lots and lots of hot sauce.  But, it's something quick and brainless. We call for take-out every time.

I've been here twice over the years - pre-renovation and post-renovation. The food is great. We had some mishaps with the service the second time. The sangria is great, and the atmosphere is very fun, young, and exotic. You really feel like you're somewhere interesting when you eat here. The plantains I had at Pete's live on in my memory as among the best I've had. Oh, they were perfect, caramelized on the outside, sweet on the inside, pure of flavor. Yes. And the beans! Slow-cooked to soft, rich, thick perfection. That day - years ago, and I still remember all this! - I got a whole fried fish. Yes, I ordered snapper, and they gave me a whole snapper on my plate, with the eyes. It was delicious. I was so happy. I didn't know what to do about the head, so I ate it like a cartoon cat, leaving the tails and the head but stripping the middle to its bare bones. The second time I ate here, it was a beautiful spring day. We got in just as the crowd was starting and ate in the courtyard under a blue sky. It was a perfect evening. Unfortunately, this was post-renovation, so the tables were very small. We did not have room for our two dinner plates plus our Sangria pitcher. It was so crowded with tables that a waiter bumped into my husband's chair and spilled soda on the back of his shirt. Yikes. I don't remember the food as well from that visit, though I remember being satisfied. I will return here, but I would take someone for lunch on a day that is not crowded.

I'm a southern girl and I can cook if should say so myself:-) the rave reviews of the fried chicken had me curious and definitely the desserts..the chicken was ok..good but not my best...the dessert slices were very small for the price...the mac n cheese and collard greens was nothing to spread the news about.Pies n Thighs is overrated for the prices.hey its NY so what do u expect.
Love the food here! Almost all the tapas are delicous! The atmosphere is really nice here too. It gets really loud at night, but it's fun. The food is well priced too. Breakfast is delicious too!

This place is like a hidden gem. We found it after finding that Raymond's and toast in montclair had a 45 minute wait time. This place is tiny and has charm. We had to wait about 5 minutes for our table, ordered, and the food came out within 10 minutes. The eggs Benedict are awesome, the rosemary potatoes are delish, and the quick service and ambiance has us coming back every week.

The wait can be a drag so get a group of 5 and make a reservation. This place is yummy & cozy! The slow roasted pork sandwich for brunch is out of control yummy. Did someone say pickled green tomatoes?

As a member of the Newark night life for quite some time now I welcomed a fresh breath of air when Catas opened...but that didn't last long. Now mind you, im a late 20s professional adult - Catas is more nursing home than lounge/bar/nightclub - truly a Baile das Bellas, you are required to present your Medicare card instead of ur license as form of ID.  Besides the much much older crowd there a bigger problem now is the lack of service that you receive when you go there - the bartenders/waitresses are more concerned about talking to their girlfriends or some dude hitting on them than someone who actually wishes to buy some drinks and spend some money.  Don't get me wrong, the food is absolutely to die for - they have a great Chef, whether you choose a small sampling of tapas or a full blown meal you will most certainly be pleased...but good luck in getting anything to drink since you may have to revert back to smoke signals.  My final judgement is go there for the food and not the crowd....be prepared for lackluster service....you have been warned.

We happened to be in NYC for the Argentina-Brazil soccer game this past weekend. After reading some reviews at yelp, we decided to head down to Porteno on Friday night. After being welcomed by Jorge, the owner, we were given the table next to the bookcase where you can fully appreciate what's going on at the restaurant.  The food was great, it was Matambrito with vegetables with scalloped potatoes. We decided to come back on Saturday after the game, and set foot at the same corner table, but this time Jorge (a native Argentinian like us) approached us, taught us a lot more about wines and what foods should be accompanied to. After that, He took us on a food roller-coaster that started with a perfectly cooked octopus and ended with a filet mignon out of this world. If you happen to be around this neighborhood, or even if you live in New York, this is the place for you, it will not disappoint you. Kudos to the staff,  Martin, Juana, Natalia, Josue and Brent for made us feel like at home. Porteno, we will be there soon!!!

Fantastic restaurant! Definitely a winner. They were so flexible with me; I changed the the reservation three times and half of our party was 45 minutes late, yet they patiently waited for us. My friends and I couldn't stop commenting on the simple but stylish decor. We settled on the Karma mix platter, rack of lamb, chicken marsala, chicken madras, chicken wings, and shrimp appetizer. Everything was delicious and colorful (the spices made the food red or even green!). Oh and don't forget about the buttery naan. Once the food came out, there was barely any talking as we chowed down murmuring "This is soo good..." Whatever we needed - more water, more dipping sauce, olive oil (which they didn't have lol) - they made sure they took care of it. We expected them to slap on a 20% gratuity to our bill since there was 8 of us but they didn't, which was a pleasant surprise since most Olde City restaurants do. Definitely a place where you can get a great meal for a decent price along with courteous service and even though its a nice place, you be relaxed. Love it!

I stopped by with a few of my friends the first week Sweet Science opened and boy did we have an awesome time! James, the owner, was super welcoming and just so excited, it was infectious.  The drinks were great, try a Brooklyn Ting or a supercharged dark n' stormy. Food-wise, the kale salad was a great starter and my friend was literally waxing lyrical about the Joe Louis burger the entire weekend. Oh and don't forget Grandma's fried chicken...juicy and delicious!!! Overall, a great addition to a neighborhood that is seriously lacking in cool joints. Completely, as James called it,  "sessionable."

Love this place. It's an interesting location, right in the middle of some homes Iin Princeton off the main street.  We had amazing tortillas with home made salsa that's so fresh. We had the tortuga wings and they are super spicy and very flavorful. For entrees we had carne asada and the California burrito. Amazing food great atmosphere and wonderful staff. Sometimes it's hard to get in because of long lines. But it's worth the wait.
what is not to love? delicious, not expensive comfort food with asian flares that pack real heat; the cutest decor, funky music, service staff that you want as friends/dates. high-five, martha.

Very cool local bar that is a nice alternative to Chickie's if you're way down South Philly.  Nice menu and prices, plenty of TV's and juke box.   I prefer to come here if I'm going to a game and have a lot of time to kill.

Another great meal at Park Central Tavern.  One of the nicest things about this restaurant is their staff - friendly, knowledgable, helpful, and they genuinely seem to love their jobs, making for a pleasant experience all around.  Brunch was amazing.  If you haven't been here yet, you're missing out.

i'm so mad at this place right now. i would give them a better review because my first experience was pretty good (spring roll vermicelli), but i just ordered delivery on this extremely stormy night and ordered the chicken bahn mi (my bf got it when we first went there and it was good), but they sent me the wrong sandwich...pork, layered with two kinds of ham! or something i couldn't recognize. don't get me wrong, normally i would suck it up and eat it, but i don't normally eat pork and there was just so much of it. so i called to complain and they said they would fix it (poor delivery guy). when he brought the chicken sandwich, he asked for the wrong one to take back...which i dug out of the garbage for him...then he lingered in the hallway as if he was waiting for a tip. i told him, i'm sorry...i would tip you, but i gave you all my cash the first time. he said he was sorry for the mistake and off he went. i opened up my sandwich and, yes, there was chicken...and HAM! and pate and some other meat. grrrrrr! i don't remember sliced meat when my bf got it and i checked the menu and the ingredients don't say anything about pate or ham or anything other than grilled chicken. look, i'm normally not picky, but this is just frustrating. this place is lucky they're the only ones that take CC and the only ones with spring roll vermicelli, otherwise i wouldn't come back. oh - and the first time i went, my friend got the beef pho and said it was super bland. she refuses to go back. best bahn me = bahn mi zon. next time, i'll pull out cash.
Great food. Great atmosphere.

Located in between a 24 hour bodega and a fried chicken joint, Gandhi Fine Indian might escape your eye when passing by, but they really deliver some great Indian food. My girlfriend and I started off with the Kachoori (which seemed pretty close to Samosa Chaat to me) and some vegetable samosas, which were excellent both in flavor, texture, and spice.  The thing that really makes this place stand out though, is their attention to detail.  Many Indian restaurants are happy to throw out any old Mint Chutney and Tamarind sauce, but this tiny detail can also tell so much about how  a restaurant cares about its process.  When I first sampled the mint chutney, I knew that I was in for a really great meal.  From the spices to the outer dough of the samosas, all of the extra details that make a restaurant truly stand out, were there.  I'm not sure if they make their samosa crust from scratch, but it certainly tastes like it. For dinner I had the Chicken Bhuna and my girlfriend had the Navrattan Korma.  The Chicken was a clear winner for me, a nice blend of curried spices, onions and just enough hotness to make it enjoyable.  The Korma was a little too sweet for my tastes, but might be a great eat for someone looking for that coconut/pineapple vegetable flavor. In addition, the raita and pickled Mango were delicious - the latter being a little more subdued than most places, therefore probably more approachable for a larger audience.  Although, I will warn, it is a strange (yet awesome) taste. I was most excited at the end of the meal when the owner gave me the take out menu, and pointed me to the chef's specials, many of which made me want to keep coming back.

How many places can you get a Jasmine-flavored beer?  Craft beers are a love of mine, and the selection of drafts at this place is insane.  Unfortunately I only stuck around long enough for one, but choosing a brew was half the fun. Our bartender was extremely friendly and helpful, though it probably didn't hurt that my friend is a regular and knows all the staff. I love good beer -- I loved Rattle N Hum

After finding Nan Zhou via Yelp while researching Philly for a quick get away with the wife we knew we'd have to make the trek down to try this place. First impressions:  place was clean and staff was friendly. Food: I had the bbq pork and pork wonton soup and the wife had the duck and wonton soup, both with hand drawn noodles. The soups we ok, good, decent broth and the $6.95 price makes them a bit more appealing then they would be otherwise. My pork was dry and the wife complained about the quality/quantity of duck in her soup. So why 5 stars? The pan fried dumplings. Ordered some with our meal, and we must say they are amazing. Crispy on one side, soft on the other and tasty and juicy in the middle. In fact I had to make a last minute trek down for a second order the day our flight left because the wife was craving them. Happy wife, happy life. To quote her "best shit ever" and I agree. We'll definitely be back next time we are in town.

What used to be a great restaurant has declined catastrophically.  The food used to be tangy and well prepared, the drinks generous and the service was prompt and friendly.  Now the food is just edible, the drinks meager and poorly prepared and the service peremptory at best.  I mourn the loss of what used to be a great place. Regretfully, Pat O"C.
Best prime rib, time after time. The quality of the food is impeccable. I have never had a bad meal here. The beer selection changes weekly and is always a treat. Service is usually good as well.

Since I'm a pescatarian the selection here is light for me, but the vegetable ramen is the BEST I've had outside of Japan. The noodles are perfect. Come hungry and order noodle refills for $2. It gets packed for dinner, so lunch or early dinner is suggested. Worth the wait!!!

Went to Paulie Gees to try the best pizza in NYC and we did! loved the quality of their food. Had a nice night there. The environment is casual and you will have a nice time there. Will definitely go back and try more of their great selection of Pizza and Desserts!

I LOVE THIS place !! the Empanadas are NEVER over seasoned and always GREAT ! service is EHHH but whatever I order by phone , drive by and pick up . prices are good too THE HOMEMADE ICE CREAM IS GREAT  ! I LOVE IT A+ Plus!

Tom's keeps it original. I used to live next door, every time I fly in from LA, my first stop is always Tom's. Service is more authentic and friendlier than you will find anywhere. During the long waits on Saturday, they have a steady stream of complimentary oranges, cookies and coffee flowing to those waiting to get in. Gus is the man and nicest guy you will ever meet. Urban legend has it that the Dodgers would go there after games to enjoy cherry lime rickey's and egg creams. The other urban legend is that people in the neighborhood formed a human chain around the restaurant to protect it from rioting in the 60s. True or not, Tom's is a must visit for good traditional breakfast.

Although I recently discovered that the staff and owners are Chinese, not Vietnamese, I still love these sandwiches. 6 Bucks for delicious meats, veggies and condiments on a crispy, fresh rice/wheat baguette. Cant beat that.

Solid burger place. The food is good, the beer is better, it is best when both are combined. We sat at the bar and the bartender seemed as though he didn't even care that we were there. Kinda strange but I wasn't there to make a friend.

I got a full rack of ribs that took me 3 days to eat! There was so much food with those ribs!! Next time I will get the half rack. Everything was delicious and very glad my wife and I went here. The beers were perfect along with the menu for food. Great place to watch sporting events as well. It's mostly a mature crowd here and tables are not plenty so be prepared to wait a bit if you want a table to get some incredible food in my opinion. Every plate that passed me looked amazing. I can't wait to get back here and bring some friends. The staff was very pleasant and helped with the menu and different kind of draft beers and bar drinks that I asked about. Very relaxed place and an enjoyable time.
The Cabot clothbound cheddar and Effie's Oat cakes is fantastic. Andrew gave us a great intro. The 'Taste of New Haven' tour took us here and it was indescribably perfect.
Great friendly service, quality food and portions.  Reasonable prices, and as authentic as it gets.  Never disappoints! SUBSTANTIAL

Very cool little joint. Awesome concept in the kitchen, they bring in different Italian "nonnas" every week I believe. The atmosphere has a city vibe, subway tiles, industrial lighting, cool music. The owner knows his wines and is constantly helping people make selections and indulging in some himself. A very fun place and the food, well, I keep going back!

Just came finished having brunch at Joseph leonard and I have to say I was extremely disappointed, not by the food but by the service and the waitstaff. Not only did they open 15min late but they were rude and treated everyone like they were doing you a favor for letting them eat there. I am over paying to be treated badly. Not only that but my entire meal I had to listen to 2 bitchy queens (I can say that cause I am gay) make fun of the customers as well as the people passing by it was really an uncomfortable experience. Longer I stayed the more annoyed I got and notice the people around me trying to get some service but the waitstaff were too busy gossiping and making fun. Very disappointing considering I love Jeffrey's and part of the same ownership. This place was amateur at best

The burrito was tasty, but at the end of the day it is simply a Chipotle or Qdoba with Yardley borough pricing.  $9.50 for a burrito (no drink, just the burrito)? Sheesh. The day I went, my only protein option was three types of chicken (chipotle, grilled, and what looked like tinga).  No pork, no beef. No large menu on the wall, had to look at the paper one on the counter, and even then had to have the various toppings and salsas described/explained. tl;dr: OK food but they will price themselves out of existence.
Mediocre, expensive, bad service. Just a waste of time and money.

Although it is always super crowded, they do their best to make you comfortable while you wait.  the food is consistently very good if a little expensive.  and the bartenders know how to make good, classic cocktails.  Its my neighborhood go-to besides DSK

Beautiful place with great food and perfect service. We walked in on a rainy night when they were crowded with people trying to get to a show. Without missing a beat they gave us a friendly greeting and a seat at the bar counter where we got to gaze at delicious veggie dishes and watch the staff in action while we ate a delicious meal, plus they treated us to dessert.

Really enjoyed this place, came for a cocktail on the street side outdoor patio and ended up staying for a few starters.  I had cucumber mojito and my friend had a classic mojito. Both were perfect for a hot day, not to sweet and made with quality ingredients. After sipping on our cocktails we decided to check out the menu, and it really appears creative, with some American-fusion, and alot of fresh ingredients you wouldn't find just anywhere. We shared 2 appetizers, the sweet beet salad and the rock shimp and sweet potato fritters. Both were EXCELLENT. The sweet beet salad was honestly outstanding, It was cubed layers of local sweet beets that mimicked a great tuna tartar in appearance, with a generous layer of goat cheese and spicy arugula. The fritters were creative, tasty and super crispy. I'm not one to order fried food but these were worth it.  I would totally come back here! Great spot for a date night. Jeans are ok, but don't dress to "down", it's a nice classy place. A blouse or dress shirt is totally acceptable. Can't wait to try out dinner here on our next visit! 2 thumbs up!

Visited 7 to 8 times in the past 2 years to North Brunswick Branch,  never got disappointed. I have sensitive stomach, never faced any issue with Arusuvai. My Kid and wife love this place very much. Plenty of tables. not much waiting time.

Great setting, food was pretty good but the service was super slow. I would only recommend it to people who like a very leisurely lunch. My dish the roasted chicken was wonderful but my sister was very disappointed by her leek tart. Weak three stars, the setting and ambiance boost it.

Most reviews that talk about how great this place is are really written by the staff and management. The wait staff at Temple Grill are notorious for being rude. They don't really care.  if you don't want to have a bad service do not frequent there.

So many pluses. Casual country decor complete with picnic tables. Pretty, alterna staff. Pretty, alterna customers. Local. Love their cheese plate, which I feel a sin that I'm usually unable to finish even with dining companion... Their lamb is tender, the yogurt fresh and tart. Their salads, usually relegated as uninspired side fare, not so here. Their pizzas, their appetizers, all very good. Their coffee, prepared fairly well, so says my coffee snob friend who only fully enjoys coffee at Ace. A bit too sweaty in peak summer heat, even with the constant water refilling, which is why I can never fully commit to the hippie hipster lifestyle, replete with ceiling fans but no central air : ( But overall such a gem.

These boys work hard all year long and they make the best sandwiches and soup.  I usually order my usual 1/2 salami paninis sandwich and country tomato soup.  The spicy tomato mayo on the sandwich is AMAZING!!!  I can eat hugh spoonfuls of it if giving to me.   No frills just great lunch stop.
Excellent, smokey, tender brisket. Moist, smokey chicken. Tangy sauces. Good value.
Very good dumplings!! But I did not enjoy the fried rice because it was very bland.  The service was pleasant and decor is nice. Will be back

I would prefer to just use a pro/con chart for this review. Pros +Great Sandwhiches, look and taste great +For an airport restaurant in NY, pretty reasonably priced +I got the correct amount of change back Cons -This is ONLY place in the the airport terminal that actually sells "food" like food you would eat for a full meal.  So if you haven't lunch or dinner yet and you're not up for waiting another 30 minutes again through security, expect to be eating some of Earl of Sandwhiches. -That being said, the place is packed, and the restaurant doesn't plan accordingly. So expect at least a 20 minute wait on your food. -As some others reviews said, the music is BLARING, factor that in with mass conversation around you, and you will be able to sufficiently not hear a word your cashier is saying. -Speaking of cashier, the service was mediocre at best. My order was completely torn apart from what I asked for.  Not sure if it was from their lack of attention to detail or that they couldn't hear a word I was saying either. -If you feel like waiting another 15 minutes, then you will have the wonderful oppurtunity of actually being able to eat in the resaturant.  Otherwise, you will get kicked out for trying to eat in the restaraunt and you get the option of finding other great eating areas in the terminal (the floor!) In summary, if you're heading to terminal A in Newark, I would highly recommend eating beforehand.  If you're willing to put all the cons into consideration for a good sandwhich, then go to Earl of Sandwhich.
Didnt love the 'best sandwich in NYC' maybe they're better for brunch but dinner was not so good for the price and reputation of the restaurant. Slow and un attentive service also

Awesome place to get huge authentic Italian sandwiches. I have been here numerous times now and have never been disappointed. I also have never finished one of there sandwiches in one sitting either. All the meats and cheeses are imported from Italy and the bread is baked fresh every day in Brooklyn. The most recent sandwich I had was the Pisillo panini. Prosciutto, porchetta, bufala mozzarella, arugula, roasted peppers and balsamic. Absolute perfection! I can't recommend this place highly enough.

hands down, one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The food is always expertly paired and plated, even the most simple dishes like the cheese and charcuterie.  This is one of my neighborhood faves.  Can't wait for Village Whiskey to open next door as I hear they will have shared kitchens.  Hopefully, the increased volume won't take away from the quality at Tinto though.  If you haven't been - go!

This place is ridiculously good for a cheap place to drink that isn't necessarily a dive. Its spacious, has a pool table, a back patio, and some other miscellaneous space to park and drink at. The bartenders are always very cordial and timely in their responsiveness. And they've free cheese balls.

Four of us went to The Tavern to have two of the best dishes we have had.  The lobster mac and cheese and the meatloaf.  We arrived this afternoon only to be told that their menu had changed and they had neither of those dishes!!  The menu now is more bar food and no one was in the restaurant.  We immediately left and went to another restaurant.
Decent Italian food, pasta lacked a lot of seasoning but it wasn't too bad.

Not your typical Korean restaurant. Actually more of a place to knock back some Soju and munch on Korean bar bites. Tried the Seafood Hotpot (had to try it after seeing it on No Reservations), Thin Sliced Pork Belly and the Seafood Pancake. Nothing memorable about the food but the atmosphere is pretty unique. Would recommend just to experience it.

I tried the three big meats here: char siew, roast duck and soy sauce chicken. All three were disappointing -- especially the char siew. Service was poor, and the meats and white rice we received were cold. Our waitress spoke very little English, which made communication such as "We would like [insert food here]" difficult. One lesson I wish someone would have mentioned on Yelp is that the meats in the Appetizer area come in 2 sizes: full and half.  For four people, the full order is too large.  Get the half order for a group of four if you order all three meats and you will be fine. The group I was with also tried the Beef Chow Fun noodles, which tasted marginally better on a flavor scale, but I won't be returning to Big Wong King any time soon for a repeat dine-in.

To be fair I tried this not only once, but twice to make sure I hadn't gotten a dud meal. The rice and lo mein are terribly bland. I ordered light onions and it came with chunks of onions. Boneless spare ribs were dry and the chicken wings I ordered hadn't seen a fryer since yesterday. My brother pointed out that I was the 5th order of the day so it only leaves me to believe that they were reheated. Egg roll was ok. Worse part customer service is terrible barely greeted me when I came and picked the food. Asked me what I ordered and charged my card and left it on the counter and walked away. I had to wave him down for a pen to sign the receipt. Never again will I go here. Ming moon has faired well in the Wethersfield area, but definitely no one will replace Black Bamboo in West Hartford....
Good coffee and food.  Great breakfast.  My favorite is the waffles with fruit.  Get the real maple syrup.  Costs a bit more but worth it.

Well, we stop at this place with a party of 5 people and were a bit concerned with the previous reviews. We each were first shocked with decor and ambiance at first ( it is like you are in a different world). Then, we were escorted to our table. We each order a different appetizer to try everything. Waw the Hummus is to die for and that med. platter what a great combination. Then, we had the Mediterranean salad very fresh and juicy. Then we had dinner my Talapia was special it was a great piece of fish and a lot of food. Later, for desert we tried that middle eastern dessert kinnafa and baklava "Homemade" Ohh my god this is my best dessert ever. Any way we all have agreed this place is not just good but great and authentic. I guess all these reviews are from kids about hookah well how can you taste food when you are puffing that dust and smoke. This is definitely my next stop for good food and great place nearby.

I love ilili and am a frequent customer. It's a huge place so there's never an issue getting a table. It has kind of a nightclub/lounge feel to it so it's not as intimate as most smaller places in the city but it's actually pretty versatile--it's great for groups and can also be a good date spot. I'm in love with the duck schwarma but I do have to add the asterisk that it's not always consistent. Usually it's amazing but sometimes it's not AS good because the duck can be dry. The bone marrow is also delicious and another fav. Definitely get it if you're adventurous and like fatty/decadent things. I think this place is great for brunch. They have an amazing prex fixe deal. $28 for: 1) Coffee or juice 2) Cava, mimosa, or bellini 3) Entre 4) Side It's pretty much a no-brrainer and is hard to find a brunch deal at this caliber for the price. I had the awarma eggs (lamb confit with 3 poached eggs) for brunch today. I thought the lamb was a bit salty and it had a hard texture but maybe that's how confit is supposed to be? I've never had confit before so I don't have a basis for comparison. The eggs are always cooked beautifully, a great texture inside where it's not overly runny but not overcooked. I prefer their eggs benedicts to the awarma. The beets sides are tasty and go really well on top of the salad that comes with the eggs.

Home-made ginger sauce over organic chicken and perfectly seasoned jasmine rice -- Yes, please! This husband and wife duo know what they are doing -- they make two or three dishes -- and they make them right. It is simple, delicious and hearty fare. I am a repeat customer and always hungry for more! They also have a stall in the Falchi Building in Long Island City, behind the "M" bldg of LaGuardia Community College on weekdays from about 11:00am-3:00pm.

Okay, so the food here is great. The plantain chips are crunchy and the empanadas are hot, with a crispy crust and juicy stuffings. HOWEVER... There's a reason this place is open 24/7 and that's because it's so busy. Makes sense: cheap food=more people. Getting a table to sit down and eat takes forever, and not nearly enough waitstaff to cover everyone... Even at like 10pm on a tuesday... Not really their fault but it bugged my friend and I enough.

Such a great and amazing place!  Phil Gilmore, Chef Isamel Alvarez are the coolest people to hang with! Chef Isamel Alvarez way of cooking is extremely passionate, beautiful and like him handsome!  Master Sushi Chef William is a Sushi Veteran, like the guys knife skill looks like It's coming outta a samurai flick fighting giant tuna making their way to Bushwick and he's there to protect the civilians. Their veriety of beer, sake and fresh sushi is unbeatable. My favorite of course the Momo Salad, Agedashi Eggplant, Fried Chicken,  Shrimp Tempura, with a nice Pork Chop and washing all that down with Orions, Marlboro Lights and a nice vibe. . Sometimes don't want to leave because the veriety of music, people and its always a party... Even on a Tuesday
I am a prisoner when it comes to italian dishes. .. one of the good italian joints in NY. Must try.

This is a great little place on Church St, about a block off Bloomfield Avenue.  I've stopped here several times over the years to grab a quick falafel for lunch.  It's a tiny little joint with no seating, (maybe just enough room for two other people besides yourself to stand inside and order your food) so everything on the menu is prepared to-go.  Beyond Pita specializes in Israeli cuisine and offers menu items such as: falafel, shawarma, baba ganush, hummus, kabobs, and giros.  If you're not into their fabulous Israeli selections, they also offer traditional salads (Greek, Garden, Ceasar, Chef) and sandwiches (ham, turkey, roast beef, chicken cutlet, grilled chicken, etc).  And lastly, for all of us vegetarians out there - Hala offers some options with an Italian flair - the St. John, St. Christopher, St. Patrick, and St. Nick. Check it out - everything is fresh, prepared to order, and fairly priced.

The restaurant is fairly new so I think they still need more time for the food to be where it could be! The service was great. The waiter knew a lot about beers which they had a nice selection 25 if I recall.

When this place first arrived in the neighbourhood, I was so sure that it was going to be a hipster-infested nightmare. However... I have to give credit where credit is due. They're fantastic... in every way, drinks, food, service. Everything I've had there has been delicious. The food always tastes fresh, the drinks are always perfectly concocted and the waiters/waitresses are friendly and attentive. My personal recommendations... their hangar steak has never disappointed for an entree, as well as their burger. Their cheese plate is a fantastic starter and can easily fill you up for the night, if that's what you're looking for. Their truffle fries are also heavenly (even if they make the fat rolls on your stomach budge right out). Get their gelato as a finishing touch to the meal. The flavours change daily, but they've always been quite tasty. Just be warned: Unless you go super early or super late, you will likely be waiting for a table. Avoid on the weekends, because you can be waiting for an hour or two if you come in the middle of the afternoon. They seem to have everything working for them.

Horrible service at the bar area. Waitress Brin was terrible, very slow, messed up drinks and was rude as well.  They have this happy hourmenu but make the experience very unpleasant!  We will not be returning.

Small old-school restaurant. Good food great prices! A nice place to eat if you are really hungry and on a budget or if you have leisure time to enjoy their graet cafe con leche mmm, best thing on the menu.

First off, to get the negatives out of the way - the restaurant is small, can feel a bit cramped at times, and it is hard to get a reservation when the sun isnt still up. Looking past that, it was one of the best dining experiences ive had in the city. The tagliatelle appetizer is sublime as were the gravy meatball sliders. The pork chop was the best ive ever had and my husband loved the arctic char. Finished it off with root beer float and some light spooning for the perfect evening.

I came for the food, I stayed for the beer.  I had heard about a burger special featuring pulled pork and was immediately interested in trying out the food at Tilt.  The wings were maybe a little small, but the sauces were well put-together and creative.   The special burger (topped with pulled pork) was perfectly cooked to medium rare and featured a housemade apple chutney and fresh vegetables.  It was recommended to me that I add a duck fat egg to the burger and I couldn't be happier that I followed that recommendation.  Phenomenal.   The beer selection is impressive and expansive.   Many local beers and other selections from across the country.  The staff was knowledgeable and helpful in selecting a beer to fit my taste.       I didn't dabble in the arcade aspect of Tilt, but could see some classic games that made me feel nostalgic for the games I played on SNES and Genesis.  Not a single complaint about this place.

It's like walking into a circa-1970's Italian persons home kitchen.  In a totally good way. The staff, all family, are the greatest people. The best chicken cutlet grinders around!  Simply amazing!  (I prefer extra sauce and cheese on mine)... enough for 2 meals - they are BIG and THICK! All the other grinders are great too. I've never tried the pizza. Trust me - you're better off spending the money here for the service and quality as opposed to Subway, Quiznos or some lame chain.

I've been here a number of times for the past few years and can no longer recommend this place to my friends. The food is not bad but really not great. I have been to Thailand multiple times and, although it may seem harsh to compare the food, I believe they can definitely improve the quality of the dishes easily. Pad Thai- I've had this multiple times and would suggest you go down the road to Penang. The pad thai is okay... too many noodles and the flavor is quite bland to what I've grown accustomed to. However, if you're super hungry it will probably taste good nonetheless. Tom Yum- Does not look at all appetizing and comes in a TINY bowl. Seriously, this was an entree in an appetizer bowl! The soup did not look at all like Tom Yum and the ingredients did not look appetizing Curry Noodles- I ordered this expecting Kao Soi but got a nice size bowl with egg noodles and chicken. The soup did not look delicious though it was tasty enough to eat. Egg noodles: why would you ever serve thick egg noodles? The hard boiled egg in the soup also tasted like it's been in the refrigerator for a while and wasn't completely heated when they put it in the soup. Overall after about 5 visits I'll say the place has a good atmosphere and friendly staff with mediocre food. It's worth a shot for quick Thai food and the other dishes I haven't reviewed might be better, but so far I've been unimpressed each time I go.
Nice place with very good service. The food is really good, I liked the special big burger the most. Give it a try, you won't regret.

After four trips here, I've concluded that this is the best Chinese restaurant for vegetarians in the Princeton area. The ingredients are consistently fresh, and there is a decent selection on the menu. The wait staff will also make veg versions of things on request (such as hot and sour soup for two, which is highly recommended). The place looks a little shabby, but don't let that put you off. It's pretty inexpensive, and the food will not disappoint.

Crowded atmosphere and long wait. But once seated you know why. Great food and selection along with fun decor. I ordered the mahi mahi which was awesome. The appetizer we ordered was nacho mama which is a vegetarian nacho. I love protein in my dishes, but the flavors in the nacho made me forget my need for chicken or steak. The hot sauce on top of the nachos is actually spicy!

Delicious. We bring everyone here when they're visiting and it's always solid. Pork bone ramen and the kale salad are our go-to choices.  Also the panda sake that comes in a cute glass is great for sharing.

Love this place!!! Used to frequent the one in Key West and was so glad to see one opened in NYC! Cheap as hell for good AND DRINK...must try the meatball montaditos!!! Only complaint- The one guy in the kitchen (which is open to the public) was eating non stop and kept doing so as making orders! As well he then was chewing gun- Mouth open-looked like Bessie the cow chewing Quite unsanitary Let's hope more open in the area-it's awesome

The meatballs and spaghetti dish were quite tasty.My only complaint is that the amount of pasta they give amounts to a side dish.For the price they should give a bigger portion.I left the place starving.Perhaps they could add a whole wheat option?

Always warm attentative staff, has the most amazing Manager I have experienced. Great food, great seasonal choices. I have had an ocassionally under cooked steak but never a problem with a send back. I recommend getting one level of prefered cooking up from usual. Love this location and frequently eat there at least twice a month.

I rate this solely on the beverages as I feel like it would unfair for me to rate this together  with the food as I was looking forward to the drinks more then the actual food. The whiskey and bourbon selection is top notch and the fact that you can get a flight of whiskey is a plus. I had a taste of a 25 year old aged woodford reserve and the taste was very rich and I would have to say one of the best bourbons I have had. I also had their selection of knob creek, jack daniels, bookers bourbon 20 year aged and also the breakfast julep cocktail. They were a great selection for myself and I found no problems with the service and the experience of the drinks. Overall if you are in town for some good bourbon I would recommend coming here

Thank god for the small parking lot in the back!! Tried their pizza and it was ok, a bit too much cheese for me. But the Italian Hot Dog is out of this world!!!!!!!! Can't wait to go back for another one! Oh, and the people here are very friendly...

This place doesn't even deserve a star. Worst service I have ever had in my entire life. I would send someone I hate there. Hopefully they read this and fix it. Let's start from when I walk in..... They greet me and tell me to sit anywhere.-perfect I order drinks for me and my girl- seems to be going well 10 mins pass and I don't have a drink -FYI fishmarket owner this is important. Drinks are to come way before the meal. The girl asks me if I want the lobster because there was one left I say yes. -Not bad I then order some oysters and my meal. -(still no drinks?) The girl then comes over and asked me "how mad would I be if She said we don't have anymore lobster?"- (WTF?) this is where a smart business owner would come to the table and say sorry and offer something else at a discount or do something for the customer. It's called customer service. So I just suck it up because I'm thinking maybe the service will pick up and we will get everything fast. I order the ribs instead Finally I get my drink but no oysters. -Now I don't have a degree in resteruant managent but I think the oysters and the drinks come way before the meal right? My meal comes out with no sign of any oysters coming out. At this point I'm so hungry I didn't even care. Me and my gf finally finshed our meals which was ok but still no sign of oysters coming out.- at this point I want to tell the world this place sucks. I asked for the check and found that they charged me for the oysters.? -Was the sever on something? The sever did take the oysters and one drink off the bill but it was not enough. Btw it was not busy at all. There were a hand full of people there and most of the people was sitting at the bar. One would think the service would be amazing but as you can see it SUCKED I will never come to this place again and I will tell my friends, family members and my customers to never ever come here. Hopefully people will read this and do the same.

First of all let me tell you that I had plenty of Lebanese food, good food. This place didn't do it for me. I took my husband there so he could try Lebanese Food. I wish i hadn't done that. The place was way too small to be called a restaurant, a take out place maybe. The food was not good and overly priced for no good reason. The tables were a joke when it came to size. literately, each table was no more than 18 inches wide.  We ordered an appetizer and half way through it, the waiter came out with the main dish. There was no place to put the plates so we had to get rid of the appetizer so the food can fit on the tiny table. That says so much about service. Normally even at an average restaurant, the waiter would wait for you to finish your appetizer before they dump on you the main course. And the worst of my experience was the waiter who reeked with cigarette smell. Really? What happened to a non smoking restaurant?
This place is delicious! Nothing else to say. Order the Gnocchi with the vodka sauce and the meatballs (they are the size of baseballs)!

I really miss walking into Mamoun's Falafel on my way... oh, just about anywhere. I used to live on Carmine Street, so it was a frequent stop. The falafel is done just right here, plus it's fast and cheap. There are a few tables, but don't plan on dining in unless you happen to get there right as someone is leaving. The space is really small, so don't plan on getting too comfortable either! I also used to get something similar to baklava here that I thought they were calling "konafe" but I've never been able to find it anywhere else. It was incredible. I'm pretty sure they brought it in from a bakery elsewhere because the kitchen will barely fit an extra sheet pan. Ask for that desert if they still sell it and you'll end your meal in bliss.

Just what the neighborhood needed.  Fantastic food at reasonable prices.  The staff was friendly and extremely helpful.  The atmosophere is trendy but still really cozy.  Had the Junk Salad first time and it was fresh and delicious, second time back I went with the Gnocchi Lasagna which could very well be their signature dish as far as I am concerned.  Portions were pertfect.  Overall a great experience and a welcome addition to the area. Can't wait to try everything The QUICK FIXX has to offer!!!

Had the New Delhi (curry chicken salad on raisin bread). I know it seems like a weird combo, and it's probably not for everyone, but I loved it and I'm not even a huge fan of raisin bread. There was a considerable line during lunch, but it moved quite fast - in and out in under 10 minutes. Giving it five for now because I can't think of a reason not to.

Good for pint...the brunch was 'not so much.' I'm a fan of the controlled randomness of the decor. It's what Friday's and Applenuts go for, but fail miserably. Interesting and original art festoon the whole of the establishment. There are a few winners on the menu...the tuna burger springs to mind. It's real tuna, so one can order it as rare as one likes. In my case, I'd be happy to hit the filet with a hair dryer and call it done. It's served on brioche and accompanied by a genuinly hip aioli. Spot on. The brunch was mediocre at best. The mixed drinks are pricey, and food was a cut below expectation. I once tried using this (brunch) as a platform for a business meeting.  The mistake was mine, but certainly won't be repeated. The staff is a bit too...'free spirit, modern, hippy, urban' for any sort of professional engagement, and restaurant gets incredibly loud when it's full.  Brunch was a fail. Have a pint and a bite if you're in the neighborhood. Do your business and drink your cocktails elsewhere.

Don't expect anything above and beyond when it comes to "late night" service. We arrived at 11:20, we were told the kitchen was closing immediately. Being waiters ourselves we ordered immediately. The food was on point. When we tried to order another round at 11:45 we were discouraged. After paying early (before midnight) and tipping nearly 30%, we were treated with all the lights being turned on, the music stopped, and the wait staff hovering. Before we could finish we were asked to take our things to go. Nothing makes you want to retract a healthy tip like being booted out of a seat you paid for at 12:10. Lesson learned: when they say they close at 12, that means they stop practicing customer service at exactly that moment and you might as well be an inconvenient vagabond who's wander in asking for tap water and spare change.
everything good except the mac & cheese. Service is slow and stood there waiting 30  min before getting seated
Good, solid Chinese food, which is lacking on the East Coast.  I especially like the jade fish fillets and the stir-fried string (green) beans.

Amazing BBQ and sides at a good price point.  Everything on the menu is good, especially love the spare ribs and baked beans.  Also make sure to get all the pickled veggies on the side, this place won't disappoint.
Best thai in Manhattan. Delicious curries.

I had such a great time at Ippudo. Came after work, didn't have a long wait long, maybe 5 minutes, though the place was PACKED. Such a scene. And I'm sure it didn't hurt that that Sarah Jessica Parker was with her family in the booth next to us. I had the Akamura Modern. It was really good, salty but not too salty, and completely filling. What was really special though was the cucumber app I had before it. My goodness that was so tasty and... refreshing? However, it's pricey and there are so many other more affordable places to try, so I may only visit Ippudo again on a very special occassion (ie. someone else's dime).

This place is GREAT! Such a classic. I was there last week. Who did I bump into (I mean literally, it gets body to body packed at the bar)... Steven Spielberg - the one and only! He was dining at a large table of 10 in the back. No one bothered him. Terrific bar. In fact, while I have eaten here, I have never eaten at a table. The mixologists know their stuff! They can make any drink and they pour a stiff one. No one is using a jigger here! If you are reading Yelp to decide if you should go... let me help you.... go! It's a great place. And if I find myself in the village, I normally stop in for a drink. You never know who you are going to bump into :)

A MUST VISIT FOR GLUTEN FREE PEEPS.  Our first dinner with Maria and her family was on our anniversary was like we were their special guests was so nice not to have to worry about my meal and leave a restaurant without a stomach ache.  Although I was SO full from the AMAZING FOOD.  I had to do all I could not to just lick the plate....thank you Papa Chef for the special artichoke dish. It was such a great experience we made reservations for Valentine Day. The food was AMAZING again, Best Monk Fish.  One of my favorite meals ever and my hubbies too.  Loved the violinist entertainment.  This time we had the pleasure of meeting Mama Danica ....thank you for taking our picture...you really completed the experience and we just loved you.  Can't wait to attend the special gluten free event night. THANK YOU...SEE YOU SOON, Kimberly and Ken German

I've been going here for years, however, after my most recent visit I wont be anymore. I walked in and asked for a table for two. The host said she could seat me at a table in front of the door, It being cold I said " Okay, unless you have something else?" She told me she would look. She came back a minute later and told me she just had to clean it off, I said okay and waited. In the mean time the people that were behind us in line were given the first table we were offered. Then a second hostess comes up to us and ask for our name and say it's a 20 minute wait. I explained to her that the first hostess was cleaning a table for us now, to which she rudely replied, "no, I said its a 20 minute wait" I explained to her the situation and asked why the first table was given away if there was no other table for us and she gave me an attitude and said that the first hostess never said she was cleaning off a table. I work in the industry and I know what poor customer service is and they certainly have it!

This is everything all the other reviewers were clamoring about.  A neighbor told us we needed to order from here as it was good and they were the only pizza place in our neighborhood that delivers...so his plea was to order from here to keep them delivering.  Well, there will not be a problem with that!  The Sicilian pizza is huge (still huge because there is a sh#t ton of it still left), and it was terrific!  The price was right, they were friendly on the phone,  and the delivery was really fast.  Maybe I am just lucky so far because all of the places we have tried have been really good. At this rate it could be a  while before I get to bust out a real ball buster.

Went on a Tuesday night for a belated Father's Day dinner. Everything we had was very good, nice size portions, you leave satisfied, but not stuffed. We had the pâté with cornichons (did wish it was more than 2 tiny cornichons) as appetizer, then the red snapper (special), and steak tartar. The wine was also very good, only drawback was that since they don't have a full liquor license, my Dad was left wanting for after-dinner cognac... The profiteroles and coffee made up for it nicely though. The place/tables are quite small, but it's quaint if you don't end up between two other tables, and we were lucky to get a table against a divider. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised, and would definitely recommend it.

Martini and lime ricky were perfect. Each plate was lick the plate clean except for the onion soup dumplings...a little odd/salty.  Recommend calamari salad and korean tacos.  Desserts of s'mores and the chocolate brownie with mint ice cream were just the right size and good. Nice atmosphere, crowded with 20/30 year olds. Fun tourist destination.
I've never thought this place was as wonderful as everyone raves about it.

Ventured in to the city from Queens the other night for dinner with the girls, and was not disappointed. Typically unimpressed with Spanish food of any kind, but of course I trusted my company. First impression of Cafe Habana: super small. Plus a 40 min. wait + empty stomach = not amused. Luckily we were seated in about half the time. We got a super-squished table in the back but hey, we were seated. My friend ordered for the table: 3 orders of the famous corn (don't judge, it is really that good), an order of the roast pork with moros y cristianos, and a cuban sandwich. One word, CORN. Cheesy, spicy, tangy roasted corn goodness. And side note, no need to be embarrassed by the combination of cheese kernels and mayo all over your face. The table to the left of you, right of you, and front of you will most likely have ordered the exact same. Pork was pretty good, not a fan of veggies in my rice though (mini turn-off). The flan was a little thicker than I like but hey, it was still delicous. On that note people keep in mind one thing during your visit to Habana's: CORN.
Can't say anything about the food but good happy hour drinks nice atmosphere awesome bartender

Great food, Great drinks, Great atmosphere and Great prices. This casual restaurant is a great local joint where you can just go and relax watching sports on their many TV's having really good food. Their outdoor patio is also great for smokers. I highly recommend this place to everyone.

Came here on a Friday night for dinner.  Not expecting much but food was good! I had the grilled chicken with korean sauce, very tasty and juicy. We had 10 mins left before happy hour was finished so I got two drinks, tried their lychee and mango sour martini and I was a happy girl!  Staff are very friendly, dj was playing good music, not so loud that you couldn't make any conversation. I really like this place, will def. be back.

I really enjoyed this place. I went for brunch today. I am new to Philly and I really enjoyed the feel and location. It felt like I was really getting a feel for something very Philly. The food here was really fresh and the portion size of my salad was huge! Which i loved! The decor is quaint and the staff are dedicated and fun. Despite the wait...which it was well worth it...I will be returning...that is if I can get a seat!

Very good food and friendly service.  I am only giving them 4 stars because they do not accept credit cards.  This has caused us to go elsewhere on a few occasions because we didn't have the cash on us.  I think if they accepted credit cards they would have an influx of business almost immediately. 5/24/13 - When I wrote this review they did not accept credit cards.  I think they do now.

Great brunch. Whenever friends are in town I take them here and hands down they ask to go again.  Bloody Mary's are unique and delish--have candied bacon on them!  I usually get the eggs florentine---I've tried pancakes and also appetizer and everything has been delicious.  You can spend about $15-$20 and have a fantastic meal for yourself.  I highly suggest you try!
The best thing about this place was the byob. and obviously that has little to do with the food. Everything our group had was bland including the chips and salsa.

I really like this place, especially their fried wontons with sweet and sour sauce as a starter while waiting for my noodles. My boyfriend and I come here whenever I have time before I go to work since my workplace is literally around the corner lol Their fired wontons are actually only fried wonton skin, but it's still really good. I love their curry squid and pig skin noodle soup. The curry squid and pig skin come in a smaller bowl while your noodles come in a bigger bowl. It's not the best noodle place, but it's quite decent, may take longer on busy hours, but it's worth the wait!

Did not eat here.  I visited the bar one night so my review is based on my experience at the bar.  Drinks are very reasonably priced.  However I did not stay long because the later it got the more college kids poured in.  The bar is small and in the back rear entrance.

So I have been going to Burrito box for years, and has changed quite a bit.  It used to be very consistent - I knew what I was getting when I went there. These days the food is very inconsistent - it's never bad- just some days much more rice then meat or different size burritos one day nice and big and one day much smaller. I can agree with Lucy about the counter guy Mauricio- as he acts like he is doing you a favor and not very hospitable. My main issue is the prices with no substitutions- very expensive and they will not let you substitute anything unless they charge you- example : I order a Burrito which comes with cheese, sour cream, beans rice pico lettuce- I ask for no beans, no cheese, no sour cream but jalapeños instead - and I got up charged.  What is that about?

Two thumbs up for the steak sandwich here.  The line for this place is incredible even when it was pouring rain there.  I haven't tried Geno's which is it's competitor but maybe next time when I'm in town.
Good, affordable mexican food.  But be prepared for a wait, it's always crowded!

This is my go-to spot for fish lunch in this hood. It's really super fresh and delicious. My fav dish is the fish cooked with herbs and olive oil with a salad..I usually get the tuna or bass. The fried calamari is awesome.

Im going to break this down nice and simple Ambiance- So incredibly amazing. The floor to ceiling windows, brick walls, WOOD walls, perfect mood lighting, mason jars, metal baskets. They really did their homework and paid attention to detail here. I wish this was my home. Service- Everyone here is so friendly. The servers are attentive and the guy who kept bringing out our food actually stopped to look at us in the eye and ask if there was anything he could get us. They have a 5 star restaurant staff and I was so pleased that we tipped well over 20%. Food- Im beyond obsessed with pickles and I guess I was just a little disappointed in this area. The fried pickles are not worth getting. I wasn't a fan of the batter at all..The boyfriend enjoyed it however, so I guess to each his own. I got the chicken BLT, he the pickle burger. They really know what they're doing when it comes to fried chicken. So flavorful and juicy. The biscuit was fluffy and sweet. The coleslaw!! I hate coleslaw but I could eat this by the bowl full. The pickle burger comes piled high with pickles. An almost overwhelming amount that was taken off immediately.  The cheese was good but for me a little too over powering and the burger didn't have much flavor. The fries were out of this world. Overall- I'm in love with this place and I wish I lived next door to come have a drink and chat with friends here. The food was good but not much to write home about. I'd say if I had a bowl of those fries, some fried chicken, and lemonade; I could sit there all night.

I have eaten in some of the best sushi restaurants in the US and I can say unequivocally that this restaurant is in the top five. The sushi chefs at Peony Pavilion are from one of the 5 Star sushi restaurants in Manhattan and it shows. Their care and attention to detail is tremendous. They truly bring passion to everything they do, they care about their craft and create masterpieces. If you are a sushi fan, you MUST go to Peony. You will not be disappointed.

You really have to be an idiot to open a wine bar in Pennsylvania.  The PA LCB seems determined to kill good wine, just spend an afternoon in any state store and you will know what I mean. That being said there are only about five places I can think of in Philadelphia and as a serious Oenophile I spend a lot of time in all of them and will review them all. Panorama is by far the best.  Tria is third best.  Tria gets a lot of points for being hip and a clever menu.  Tria loses a lot of points for serving stale wine because they lack a proper wine preservation system.  Tria also loses because it does not have any dinner entrees, it's just a before or after dinner kind of place. The staff can be stand offish but insist they open a fresh bottle of wine for your glass or send it back until they do, the wines sit open for days . The cheeses are your best bet for something good and fun to eat and the white wines are the best to try since they do not spoil as fast at the lower serving temperature.

I love the fact that Di Fara takes his time snipping basil with his scissors, shaving the cheese, and drizzling olive oil on each one as if he was making pizza for the first time.  The expression on his face when he looks in the oven to check on the pies reminds me of the one my Dad had when he would make us lunch.  He took more time to cook than my Mom, but things were always delicious. They take a while to take your order here, but Di Fara's daughter is very pleasant and there are plenty of neighborhood characters to entertain you.  But I also got a laugh watching the pained expressions of the Blackberried classes eager to just get their slice and check this place off their to do list. I was incredibly hungry myself, but a nice guy shared some zucchini flowers with me, which were quite tatsy and can tide you over while waiting for pizza.  As the wait went on, one regular joked about two pictures of Dominick Di Fara hanging on the wall, one of a younger Dom from the 50's, and another from the 80s.  "That first one's of Dom when he opened the restaurant, and the other one is when he finished his first pie!"  Even Dom's daughter laughed heartily.  Minutes later a little girl from the neighborhood brought in a crayon drawing of dom holding a big wood peel pizza turner, and presented it to a smiling Dom.  I was glad I had the time to see it all. After an hour of "theater", my mushroom slice was ready and it was the most delicious slice I had ever eaten, until I started eating my plain cheese square, which had just a bit more of Di Fara's delicious cheese and sauce, and a bit more charred flavor from the oven.   I hope Di Fara passes on his skills, so this place will be here for years to come, but I suspect that even though he doesn't allow his kids to touch the pies, they have seen his painstaking process so many times that they could do it in their sleep. In fact I have no doubt that they have dreams of their Father making his pies.

get the tips from my swedish friend tog to rubys and eat the famous bronte burger. but i was stupid and order the regular burger so i have to go there at least one more time. the regular burger was good but i want to try the bronte!! the also have good pasta. and $2 beers wich is a really nice thing :)

Star rating: 4 stars Lombardi's Pizza is said to be one of the first American Pizzeria and I was very fortunate to enjoy this restaurant without a wait during prime dinner hours.  This is NY style pizza at it's finest.  I had ordered the Magherita w/ sausage and it tasted as good as to Gramaldi's.  A small pizza comes with 6 slices and is enough to feed 2 people with a healthy appetite (NY style pizza are big).  The main differences between Lombardi's and Gramaldi's are 1) location (manhattan vs brooklyn), 2) atmosphere, 3) the service, and 4) delivery to Manhattan area.

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses. Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees. I have had many meals here...and the food has always been very good.  On 6/14/12 we (4) had lunch; I paid with a debit card and left a CASH tip of $20.00 ( 20%) When at home I checked online only to find  an extra $20.00 had been added to my account. I called Cook Shop and was told "oh, the credit card company does that...it will come off your bill in a day or two!!!!"  I, of course, was incensed to be told such a bald faced  lie. The 'manager' not only lied but was obnoxious. Such a response makes me very wary about the integrity of the wait staff, or the management, if in fact, it is their policy to add a 20% tip on cc's without informing the customer ? Del Flynn NYC

Between our parking spot and the entrance of Lao Sze Chuan, we passed at least three different Asians smoking cigarettes like they were on the clock.  This was going to be a good dinner. The restaurant was very casual with big tables set up for family style dining.  The service was matter-of-fact but not unfriendly.  We did have problems getting water because all the cups were being washed for something like twenty minutes.  Here's a free tip for those in the restaurant business - if you want to feed Szechuan food to Americans, have plenty of cups.  That said, neither the atmosphere nor the service were worse than anticipated. I came with a big group of friends and most of us opted in for family style.  The food ranged from mediocre to truly delicious, with enough good dishes to warrant a return trip. On the whole, the appetizers were stronger than the mains.  The ox tongue and tripe with hot sauce was one of the best dishes of the night.  It was, sadly, the only thing that was truly spicy, with chili oil that really coated and numbed the tongue.  It wasn't just hot, though, it was delicious.  This may have been the best tripe I've ever had, with just the right amount of chew, and the tongue was thinly sliced and lean.  The stuffed tofu crepe with black mushrooms and bamboo shoots was another winner, fall-apart purses of tofu skin with mellow, well-textured insides.  I would also recommend the Szechuan dumplings in red chili sauce.  They boasted nice thin skins and lovely porky fillings, and the sauce was a balanced mix of sweet and spicy.  The only appetizer I wouldn't order again were the scallion pancakes.  These were very deep-fried and not that flavorful.  The texture was good, with a little bit of pull, but the soy sauce on the side was far from optional. The best main dish by far was the house special duck with beer sauce in casserole.  This was a sort of soupy goopy stew, fragrant with beer.  It was hearty and tangy and just kind of incredible.  The duck meat was tender and falling off the bones.  There were also some delicious mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and pieces of sliced garlic mixed in, and every bite was awesome. Also good was the sauteed fillet mignon in peppercorn sauce with onions and broccoli.  It came with nice tender chunks of beef and plenty of tasty broccoli, and I liked the kicky sauce.  The dried and sauteed asparagus with minced pork was another winner, with giant stalks of asparagus coupled with a little bit of minced meat.  The asparagus could have been a touch more tender at points, but overall this was a great vegetable dish.  Lao Sze Chuan's tofu with crabmeat, prawns, scallops, and bok choy was a tasty soupy dish with very mild but good flavors.  The crabmeat was imitation, but imitation crab is tasty, and the tofu was super soft and sweet.  The dish was loaded with seafood and vegetables, and all the components were well-balanced with soothing, lip-smacking results.  I also enjoyed the breaded sole fillets with Thai sauce, although at $19 it was one of the most expensive dishes and didn't taste particularly inventive.  The sauce was nice, though, and the breading was thin and crispy. While most of the food was good, there were a couple dishes I didn't like.  I didn't care for the sauteed shredded beef with Szechuan jalapeno.  It was less hot than it sounds, and the shreds of beef were tough and yielded very little in the way of good meaty flavor.  The weakest dish of the night, though, was the shredded pork with five spiced tofu, green and red peppers, and celery.  The pork was far too shredded to yield good texture or flavor, and the tofu was weird and rubbery. After many rotations of the lazy Susan, our meal was done, and we were happily full.  We received fortune cookies and mints to round out the feast.  One of the fortunes was the best I've ever seen, and I'll leave you with its ominous message: "First they ignore you, then they attack you, then you win."

I took my family here for mother's day and everyone enjoyed dinner. The food was right on and the service was friendly. We didn't get to sit outside but they have a great outdoor space. The paella was amazing!

THE best Italian restaurant! One of my favorites restaurants in Midtown, especially before catching a broadway show.  Service is impeccable and food is delicious.  Since it's family portions I always stick with choosing a salad, pasta, and meat.  Caesar is out of this world! Last time I had the scarpariello wings and they were excellent as well.  Can't go wrong with Tiramisu for dessert (if you even have room for it)..
this place just gets better as the days go on. Drinks GREAT Food GREAT Service GREAT
the food is alright they need too use better spices

Excellent Indian buffet as well as a la carte. Biryani n drums of heaven are fantastic. My son ordered gobi Manchuria. Better than most indo Chinese. Don't miss it..enjoyed great food with family n friends.  Love this place
This place is the BEST. I am always running down here to get food and coffee between work assignments. I send my colleagues and business partners here when they need a good cup of joe.
Just another quality NYC neighborhood restaurant. Very attentive and knowledgeable wait staff and the food was stellar.

The order: We've usually had good experiences with them, today though was bad enough that I don't even want to deal with them again. When we ordered we were told an hour and 15 minutes, which was long, but we could accept it. In reality it took an hour and 45 minutes. The delivery: When the driver arrived our total was just short of $22.00, we gave him $40, he started going through his cash and stopped and got nasty saying "I have to go through all this!" like it was an inconvenience. Found a few singles for him and just gave him $23 instead. (After 30 minutes late and the attitude, honestly he's lucky he got the dollar.) The food: Lukewarm at best, probably related to it being 30 minutes late and just stored in the standard paper bag in a plastic bag. Hard to judge the food quality when it's this condition. Overall? Not worth it, we're just going to avoid them going forward.

I was really looking forward to coming here, and the place has alot of potential to be AWESOME. HOWEVER---- the service was TERRIBLE the waitress literally barely came to our table even after i asked for a drink menu i waited for a good 15 minutes before i had to ask her for a drink. When we got our food mine was COLD.. i'm not talking a little bit on the warm side i mean literally cold- the bottom inside of the mashed potatoes was slightly warm. i could NOT get out of there fast enough and we ended up having to go somewhere else for food. I spent $20 at a nearby restaurant the night before and the food was exceptional compared to the $40 dollar freezing cold meal i had here. i will not be going back ever.

Saturday, December 12, 2009 I took my boyfriend to the Standard Tap for brunch, partly to check it out because I'd never been there before, and partly to see the arts & crafts sale that was taking place upstairs. It took us a while to notice the billion signs that said to "Order at the bar"... He got the chili and I got the prosciutto panini; I think the chili was a bit too meaty for his taste but good nonetheless. The panini was amazing, as were the fries that came with it. It's a cute place with a nice, chill vibe. Lots of families (read: kids) that day, but not sure if that's typical. I'll be back... once I figure out how to get myself there by public transportation.

awesome restaurant! intresting blend of flavors! reccomend everybody to come! casual and good for kids. i reccomend the lamb shank and the filet mignon. the  food comes out quickly and the escargot and octupus salad is divine! desserts are delicious!

I think I found this place 4 years too late.  Seriously, this was so good, my friend wondered how long they have been around, we were thinking perhaps they were this new phenomenon, but wow, 4 years, why didn't we know about you?   Ridiculuously good, even more ridiculously cheap, this delicious pancakes are so huge and amazing, and its only a freakin' 2 bucks.   Gosh, I wish I could advertise this place more.  Perhaps, I wish the next time you see a commercial for KFC or McD's advertising their dollar menu, Vanessa's would jump into their ad, and be like, "No, how about this for a buck?" The rudimentary pork dumplings are simple and taste precisely as they should, which is to say of pork, dumpling and a hint of chive. Yeah, take your time with this thing... enjoy it.

Stopped by Friday night and the place was JAM packed (we thought we'd never get a table!) but the two guys working were so great that they pulled down a chair and moved a table from nowhere and created a table for the three of us! It had been a while since I was here but the service remained top notch. On top of that, they had a ton of special items that were so delicious. Started off with two flights of oysters from Canada and the West coast. I usually just let them pick my wine and it always works out great. Again, I was not let down. Had some wonderful popcorn rock shrimp and sardines, and enjoyed more wine and oysters until I was ready to burst. It's a no brainer that this is one of my go to places.

Great pizza and worth the wait.  However, it's not too bad of a wait if you go during off-peak time and you come with a party of 2.  The pizza came in freshly made and packed with toppings.  It was a burst of mouth-watering flavor on a crispy thin crust.  The only thing lacking was the service.  The servers were friendly but absent-minded.  It took a while to get our waters as well as our bill.  But other than that, it was a great place to get NYC style pizza and steps away from a skyline view of Manhattan. [TIP]  Cash only.

Fantastic!!  As a former tribeca native, I often swung by.  But the new ownership has transformed the inside and the menu.  food was inventive, service attentive and the decor is a huge upgrade.  If you haven't been in a while, get a look now.  It may be your new go to.
Best thin crust Pizza EVER! Try the mushroom pizza. And the atmosphere is great too.

YUM YUM YUM. I'd like to say that I've never heard of this place until the day before I went. Which probably will not happen to you because the reservations for brunch on the weekends literally takes two months. I came here with 5 others on a triple date, so maybe smaller tables will have faster reservations. But in any case, PLAN AHEAD! +1 Atmosphere and decor: very nice place here! not too loud, but loud enough for small groups to get together and have comfortable conversations. For a place with unlimited alcohol, I was surprised there weren't any obnoxious drunk people here. The lighting was good and the place was spacious. Decorations gave it a somewhat upscale feel, which surprises you when you take a look at the prices. I also love the colorfulness of everything they had, from wall decorations to the plates on your table. Bathroom was clean also! Great place to have fun without burning your wallet. +1 Service: I know some people mentioned that service can get a little crappy or slow if it's packed, but I went on a Saturday afternoon for brunch and my experience was great. The waiter was timely and took our orders with no confusion or mistakes. We ordered at least three rounds of drinks and even an additional bread basket. He was always very friendly and accommodating. No complaints here! +1 Food: UNLIMITED SANGRIA! Ahem. UNLIMITED FREE SANGRIA! They serve these in 20 oz glasses one at the time and they are SO GOOD. Such a refreshing and fruity taste to them. They had 8 choices when I went, 4 White and 4 Red. I didn't get to try all of them of course, but the three that I had were awesome. Definitely try the Havana Banana. It comes with lychee and coconut slices. I also had the Tropical (?) and the Blanca (?), which I recommend as well. The bread was delicious (I love bread) and came with strawberry butter. I ended up eating this most of the brunch cause my entree wasn't awesome, which I didn't mind cause the bread was just that good. For the entree, I got salmon crepes, but the egg taste was overwhelming and I didn't taste salmon at all. I'd recommend you NOT to get this if you do go to brunch. I tried some of my neighbors dishes, and they were actually really delicious. i.e. the steak entree was really good, and also the fries that came with the cuban sandwich were also delectable. The desserts we ordered (dark chocolate cake and flan) were also pretty good, and worth a try if you're not stuffed already. +1 Price: For what you get, the prices are great. At first, I thought the sangrias would be free refills, but it is in fact ALL free. Entrees came out to 15-20 a dish, which may be expensive for brunch, but it's definitely worth it if you think about all the drinks you are not paying for. Our bills came out to around 25 a person, which is not bad at all. Great stuff for the price. +1 Overall: I had a great experience here! My brunch was at 2:00 so it wasn't extremely packed, since they close at 3PM to prepare for dinner customers. But the service and food were still great and I was amongst good company. In fact, we already made another reservation and planning to meet again two months later.

I order delivery from here regularly. The food is good, the staff is friendly over the phone, they always get the order right and they take CC payment over the phone. I usually call early evening and delivery takes about 40 mins and I should note they are just outside my town so not bad. I just ordered again yesterday and got the shrimp w/black bean sauce for the first time from them. It was excellent; the shrimp were good-sized and I could taste the freshness. I'd recommend it along w/ their sesame chicken, lo mein, chicken n broccoli mei fun, BBQ spare ribs or pepper steak. These are items we get often and they're reliably good.

We ordered food delivery for an event of 500+ people Food came hot despite cold weather. Great quality of service and professional staff. Delicious  biryani and  curry . The Arusuvai halwa is a killer. All the guests loved the food and asked for the vendor. Great food. Recommended vendor for parties and events
We ordered from NO 1 Wok for lunch at the office, The portions were large and the price very fare.  The Szechuan Chicken was spicy and had a good balance of veggies, chicken and sauce.

We went to edo sushi for the first time about 15 years ago and it was fantastic. We were regulars and went at least twice per week. About 3years ago, I requested no MSG as I'm allergic. I hate to think that a joke was played on me but I got so sick, I couldn't lift my head off the pillow for 3days. I would understand if I were an obnoxious American, but I truly respect all walks of life. I haven't been back ever since and have also kept my family away as we sometimes went together.
